revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Pasta recipes|4||2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Pasta Recipes|Pasta Recipes]] There are a number of differnet recipes for egg noodles, below are two of the most commonly used ones.
=Recipe 1= ==Ingredients== *3 [[Cookbook:egg yolk|egg yolk]]s *1 whole [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] *1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *dash of [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] *80ml (1/4 cup) [[Cookbook:Water|water]] *580ml (2 cups) [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *1-2 teaspoon of [[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive oil]]
==Procedure==
*In a bowl beat together egg yolks, egg, salt, and pepper. *Stir in water. *Stir in flour. *Knead into ball. *Roll out on a floured surface until 2 mm to 4 mm (1/16" to 1/8") thick. *Cut into noodles 6 mm (1/4") wide. *Bring water to a boil in a pot, add oil. *Add noodles to a boiling water, and cook until done.
=Recipe 2= ==Ingredients== *4 large [[Cookbook:egg|egg]]s *400g [[Cookbook:flour|plain flour]] *Extra flour for kneading
==Procedure==
*Sift the flour onto a large work surface, and create a well in the centre *Break the eggs into the well *Slowly draw the flour into the eggs either using a spoon or your hands *Knead into a smoooth, elastic dough *Roll to desired thickness, using extra flour and cut to desired shape *Bring a large pot of salted water to the boil *Add the noodles to the water and cook until [[al dente]]
N.B: *While this recipe says that 400 grams of flour should be sufficient for creating the dough more may be necessary depending upon the size of the eggs *This recipe usually makes enough noodles for four people, however depending on the shape of pasta more may be needed. A good rule of thumb is one large egg per person. ==Notes==
The homemade noodles made using either recipe can be served with a variety of pasta sauces, such as [[Cookbook:Pesto|pesto]] sauce.
[[Category:Egg recipes|Egg noodles]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Egg noodles]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|Egg noodles]] [[Category:Noodle recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[it:Libro di cucina/Ricette/Pasta all'uovo]]

{{recipesummary|Breakfast recipes|2||2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast|Breakfast]] | [[Cookbook:Omelet Recipes|Omelet Recipes]]
An [[Cookbook:Omelet Recipes|omelet]] with a [[Cookbook:Potato|potato]] filling.
==Ingredients== *5 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]]s *1 teaspoon of [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *1/4 teaspoon of [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *1/4 teaspoon of [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] *1/2 cup of [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] *1-2 tablespoons of [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] or [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] (optional)
Filling: *1 [[Cookbook:Potato|potato]], chopped into 1/4" - 1/2" cubes *1 small [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], minced or chopped *1/2 cup [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]], shredded
Makes 2 omelettes.
==Procedure== #In a bowl beat together eggs, sugar, salt and pepper. #Mix in milk. #Heat up two [[Cookbook:Frying pan|frying pan]]s to a medium temperature. #Use butter, margarine, or cooking spray on each pan. #Add chopped potatoes to one pan. #Cook potatoes until light brown, then add onions. #Add half of egg mixture to the other pan. #Cook omelet mixture until it starts to set (about 1 minute). #Add onions, potatoes, and cheese on top of partially set omelet. #Fold plain side of omelet over the filling and cook for an additional 30 seconds
The goal is to get the filling cooked at about the same time the omelette is ready to be folded.
== See Also == * [[Cookbook:Spanish Omelet|Spanish Omelet]]
[[Category:Breakfast recipes|Potato Omelet]] [[Category:Egg recipes|Potato Omelet]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Potato Omelet]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|Potato Omelet]] [[Category:Omelette recipes|Potato Omelet]] [[Category:Potato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

__NOTOC__{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|4|3 ½ hours|3}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Albania|Cuisine of Albania]]
'''Bean Jahni soup''', '''''Jani me fasule''''', is an [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Albania|Albania]]n dish of bean soup.
==Ingredients== * 2 cups of dry [[Cookbook:white beans|white beans]] * 1/2 cup chopped [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]]s * 1/2 cup [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Tomato Sauce|tomato sauce]] * 1 tablespoon chopped [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]] * 1 tablespoon chopped [[Cookbook:mint|mint]] * [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]]
==Preparation== # [[Cookbook:Boil|Boil]] beans in hot water in an uncovered pot for 5 minutes. Rinse and boil for another 15 minutes in a covered [[Cookbook:stock pot|stock pot]] in 3 cups hot water. # [[Cookbook:Sauté|Sauté]] onion in olive oil until it turns yellow. Add 2 tablespoons bean stock from the pot along with tomato sauce, parsley, salt and chili powder for taste. Cook for 10 minutes or until a thick sauce is formed, then pour everything into the pot. # Add chopped mint, cover tightly and cool for 2 hours over low heat, or for 30 minutes in a [[Cookbook:pressure cooker|pressure cooker]]. This should produce a thick juice, covering beans by ½inch. Serve hot.
==References== ''This article contains information from [http://www.frosina.org Frosina.org] and it is used with [[w:User:Dori/www.frosina.org permission|permission]].''
[[Category:Soup recipes|Bean Jahni soup|]] [[Category:Vegan recipes|Bean Jahni soup]] [[Category:Albanian recipes|Bean Jahni soup]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

page.title: Cookbook:Elli's veal or chicken with walnuts

revision.text:
{{recipe}}
'''Elli's veal or chicken with walnuts''', '''''Gjellë me arra të Ellit''''', is an [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albanian Albanian] dish.
==Ingredients== *2 tablespoons flour *15 finely crushed shelled walnuts *2 beaten egg yolks *1 minced garlic clove *1/4 lb. (one stick) butter *2-3 lbs of veal or chicken meat cut into 1" cubes
==Procedure== Place the meat or chicken in a saucepan and cook over medium heat until tender. Remove the meat and set it aside in a dish while leaving the remaining juices in the saucepan. In another saucepan, add the flour and stir over heat until it becomes light brown in color (do not overcook!) and add half the butter. Add the walnuts, garlic, and egg yolks, stirring constantly. Add the juices from the other saucepan and stir until all the ingredients thicken. Immediately remove from the heat to avoid solidifying the egg yolks. Fold in the meat. Pan fry the remaining half stick of butter until brown and pour over the servings.
Serves 4.
==See also== *[[w:Cuisine of Albania|Cuisine of Albania]] *[[w:Culture of Albania|Culture of Albania]]
==References== ''This article contains information from [http://www.frosina.org Frosina.org] and it is used with [[w:User:Dori/www.frosina.org permission|permission]].''
[[Category:Albanian recipes|E]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|E]] [[Category:Walnut recipes|E]] [[Category:Veal recipes|E]]

{{cookwork|Page should be split}}
{{recipe}}
These are three '''garlic dressings''' recipes.
==Garlic-lemon dressing==
===Ingredients=== *1 sm. garlic clove *1 sprig rosemary *1 strip lemon peel (1" x 1/2") *3/4 cup olive oil *1/4 cup lemon juice
===Procedure=== Place the garlic and rosemary on a cutting board and lightly crush with the flat side of a heavy knife. Put the rosemary, garlic and lemon peel in a clean bottle with a tight-fitting cap. Pour in the oil and lemon juice. Cap the bottle and shake well. Rerfrigerate and use within one week. Shake before serving. Drizzle on steamed vegetables, or seafood, pasta, potato salad, or other salads.
==Garlic and tarragon dressing==
===Ingredients=== *1/4 cup vinegar *2 T. olive oil *2 t. garlic salt *2 t. sugar (optional) *1/2 t. dried tarragon
===Procedure=== In a small bowl or jar with a tight-fitting lid, combine vinegar, oil, garlic salt, sugar and tarragon. Pour it on lettuce or cabbage salads.
==Garlic-Black Pepper-Parsley Dressing==
===Ingredients=== *1/4 cup vinegar *2. T. olive oil *2 t. garlic powder *1/2 t. black pepper parsley
===Procedure=== Combine all ingredients and pour the dressing on boiled broccoli or cauliflower salad.
==See also== *[[w:Cuisine of Albania|Cuisine of Albania]] *[[w:Culture of Albania|Culture of Albania]]
==References== ''This article contains information from [http://www.frosina.org Frosina.org] and it is used with [[w:User:Dori/www.frosina.org permission|permission]].'' Submitted by Irena Panduku.
[[Category:Albanian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Salad Dressing recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Garlic recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Taragon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Parsley recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Albania|Cuisine of Albania]]
Several different dishes are called "'''mixed vegetables'''"; they all consist primarily of different kinds of [[Cookbook:Vegetables|vegetables]] cut into pieces and mixed together, then either served as-is or else cooked, typically by [[Cookbook:saute|sauteing]].
The [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Albania|Albanian]] mixed vegetables dish '''''Turli perimesh''''' has the following recipe:
==Ingredients== *2 lbs of various vegetables ([[Cookbook:Bell Peppers|peppers]], [[Cookbook:Eggplant|eggplant]], [[Cookbook:Okra|okra]], [[Cookbook:Zucchini|zucchini]], [[Cookbook:Potato|potato]]es, etc.) *1/2 cup [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]], divided *1 cup chopped [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] *1 cup peeled chopped [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] *1 tablespoon chopped [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]] *[[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *[[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]]
==Procedure== After cutting off inedible tips of vegetables, wash and slice them into 1-inch squares. Saute vegetables in half the oil and remove them from the [[Cookbook:Frying Pan|frying pan]]. [[Saute]] onion and tomatoes in the remaining oil, and season with parsley, salt, and pepper. Put everything in a [[Cookbook:Stock pot|stock pot]] with a cup of water, cover tightly, and simmer until almost all moisture has cooked away. Serve hot, accompanied by [[Cookbook:Steak|steak]], [[Cookbook:Meatball|meatball]]s, or any other main dish. Serves 4 people.
==See also== *[[w:Culture of Albania|Culture of Albania]]
==Reference== ''This article contains information from [http://www.frosina.org Frosina.org] and it is used with [[w:User:Dori/www.frosina.org permission|permission]].''
[[Category:Albanian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Okra recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Eggplant recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|4|15 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}}
'''Stewed dry figs dessert''' ('''''Hoshaf me fiq të thatë''''') is an [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Albania|Albania]]n.
==Ingredients== *1 cup (240g) [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *4 cups (900ml) [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] *1 cup (240g) finely-grated [[Cookbook:Fig|figs]] *[[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]]
==Procedure== Stir sugar into milk, bring to a boil and remove from heat. Add figs slowly, stirring continuously. Pour into earthenware serving bowls and bake in moderate oven (350F, 180c) for 10 minutes. Chill and sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve cold. Serves 4.
==References== ''This article contains information from [http://www.frosina.org Frosina.org] and it is used with [[w:User:Dori/www.frosina.org permission|permission]].''
[[Category:Albanian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fig recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Soup|Soups]]
'''Tuscan Soup''' or '''Stracciatella'''
==Ingredients==
* stock * [[Cookbook:Eggs|eggs]]
==Procedure== Whip up three or four eggs, gradually add good stock to them, and keep on whisking them up until they begin to curdle. Keep the soup hot in a [[Cookbook:Bain-marie|bain-marie]].
{{Decameron}}
[[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Italian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients== *4-5 large portabello mushrooms *3 [[Cookbook:Eggs|eggs]] *[[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *[[Cookbook:Peeper|pepper]] *[[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive oil]] *shredded [[Cookbook:Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]] ==Procedure==
# Preheat oven to 350 degrees. # Wipe mushrooms clean with a damp cloth, then brush outsides with olive oil. # Remove stems and discard. # Beat eggs with salt and pepper. # Set mushrooms on a cookie sheet or baking pan and fill each with egg. # Top with parmesan cheese and bake until eggs are fully cooked (about 10 minutes).
[[Category:Egg recipes|Portabello Eggs]] [[Category:Mushroom recipes|Mushroom recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
== Ingredients ==
*750[[Cookbook:g|g]] [[Cookbook:Banana|banana]] (slightly unripe) *½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] seeds *½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Turmeric|turmeric]] powder *½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Garam Masala|garam masala]] or good [[Cookbook:Curry Powder|curry powder]] *2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] *half a glass of [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] *4 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]]s [[Cookbook:Cream|double cream]] *½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|red pepper]] (chili) *30g [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] *some [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
== Procedure == #Cut banana in 2[[Cookbook:cm|cm]] slices. #Add to bananas: milk, cream, garam masala (or curry) powder, chili, lemon (add some salt). #Melt butter, add cumin seeds and turmeric, cook at medium low for a couple of minutes, until a fragrant smell develops. #Add bananas and their sauce. #Cook on a gentle flame until ready (depends on banana's ripeness) — do not overcook.
Makes 4 servings.
[[Category:Banana recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Curry recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
'''Baked leeks''' (''Tavë me presh'') is an [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Albania|Albanian]] recipe.
== Ingredients == * 2 lbs [[Cookbook:leek|leek]]s * 1/2 cup [[Cookbook:oil|oil]] * 3/4 cup chopped [[Cookbook:onion|onion]] * 1/2 lb ground [[Cookbook:meat|meat]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] * mild [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|red pepper]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]]
== Procedure == # Cut off the green leaves from leeks. Wash and cut leeks diagonally into 1-inch thick slices. # Saute in a little oil and place in a baking pan. # Saute onion and ground meat in remaining oil. # Add beef stock, tomato sauce, red pepper, salt and pepper, and bring to a boil. # Pour meat mixture over the sauteed leeks. # Bake for 1 hour at 375 °F. # Serve hot.
Serves 4.
==References== ''This article contains information from [http://www.frosina.org Frosina.org] and it is used with [[w:User:Dori/www.frosina.org permission|permission]].''
[[Category:Albanian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Leek recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Sweden|Swedish recipes]]
'''Sockerdricka''' (Swedish for "sugar drink") is a soft drink from the 19th century. It is traditionally a [[Cookbook:Fermentation|fermented]] drink that contains ginger, but modern commercial versions consist of carbonated water, some sugar, and citric acid.
== Ingredients == * 20 litres of [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * the peel of one [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemon]] * 1 kg [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 60 g [[Cookbook:Yeast|yeast]] * 25 g [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] * [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisins]]
== Procedure == # Boil the sugar, water, lemon and crushed ginger for 15 minutes. # Strain the mixture and let it cool. # Mix in the yeast and let the mixture ferment for two days. # Put the drink in bottles and add a raisin to each bottle.
After five days the sockerdricka is ready for drinking.
== Notes, tips and variations == * The recipe above has '''lots''' of yeast, and not much ginger. It would work well with just 10g yeast. More ginger would be good, e.g. 100g of fresh ginger for 20 litres.
==See also== * [[Cookbook:Ginger beer|Ginger beer]] * [[Cookbook:Sima|Sima]]
[[Category:Beverage recipes|Sockerdricka]] [[Category:Fermented food recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Ginger recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Swedish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[sv:Sockerdricka]]

revision.comment: copy edit, added a few links
revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Sweden|Swedish Cuisine]]
'''Kroppkakor''' is a traditional Swedish dish: potato [[Cookbook:dumpling|dumplings]] with a filling of pork or bacon. They are cooked and served with butter and [[Cookbook:Lingonberry|lingonberry]] jam. There are some regional variations to the recipe.
== Ingredients == * 1 kg cooked potatoes * 2 egg yolks * 1 1/4 cup [[Cookbook:flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1 onion * 100 g smoked [[Cookbook:ham|ham]] * 100 g bacon * salt, pepper * optional [[Cookbook:allspice|allspice]]
== Preparation == # Mash the potatoes. Put this on a breadboard and make a small pit in the middle. # Put eggs, flour and salt in the pit and work the potato dough fast together. Too much kneading will make the potato tough. # Chop the onion finely, cut the bacon and ham into small pieces and fry it until it gets coloured. Flavour it with white pepper. # Form the dough into a thick roll. Cut it in thick slices and put a pile of bacon mix in a pit in a slice, then put another slice on top of it, press the edges together and roll it into a ball. # Lower the balls into boiling salted water and boil them approx. 10-12 minutes or until they float to the surface. Pick them up with a perforated ladle and put them on a hot serving plate. Don’t boil too many at a time, they will then have some difficulty floating to the surface. # Serve hot with melted butter and red whortleberry (lingonberry) jam or cranberry jam.
[[Category:Swedish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dumpling recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Potato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bacon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Breakfast|Breakfast]] | [[Cookbook:Sauces|Sauces]]
'''Vegetarian "Bacon" Gravy over Biscuits'''.
[[Cookbook:Sausage|Sausage]] or [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]] [[Cookbook:Gravy|gravy]] over [[Cookbook:Biscuits|biscuits]] is popular regional [[Cookbook:Breakfast|breakfast]] cuisine in the [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|southern United States]]. This is a [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|vegetarian]] version of that dish.
== Ingredients ==
*4 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Canola Oil|canola oil]] *4 tablespoons all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] *2 tablespoons imitation [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]] bits (Bacos are [[Cookbook:Soy|soy]] based) *1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] (or seasoning salt) and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste
== Procedure ==
#Place oil in frying pan over medium heat. #Add flour, stirring constantly, allow to cook until slightly browned. (this creates a [[Cookbook:Roux|roux]]) #Slowly add milk, stir constantly with [[Cookbook:Whisk|whisk]] to remove any lumps. #Add imitation bacon bits and continue to cook until gravy thickens. #When thickened, remove from heat and stir in butter and add salt (or seasoning salt) and pepper to taste. #Serve over [[Cookbook:Biscuits|biscuits]].
Makes about 2-Cups of gravy.
[[Category:Breakfast recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sauce recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Rice|Rice]]
'''Rice Pilaf'''. Pilaf can be served as a side-dish or main dish.
==Ingredients==
*6 Tablespoons Butter or margarine *1/2 cup uncooked Orzo pasta or uncooked Vermicelli pasta broken into small pieces *2 cups Uncooked long grain Rice *4 cups boiling hot Chicken Broth *1/4 Teaspoon Salt 4 cloves of garlic 4 cloves of girofle 1 big oignon finely cut 2 carrots in fine cubes
==Procedure==
# Melt butter or margarine in heavy deep pan or Dutch oven over medium heat. add vegetables and let them be lightly cooked without coloring, using the vegies would mean you omit the Orzo pasta
# Add Orzo pasta (or small broken pieces of Vermicelli pasta) and cook, stirring constantly until pasta is golden brown. # Add rice and stir until rice is well coated with butter. Allow rice to simmer in butter for a minute or two. # Add boiling Chicken broth and salt. # Lower heat to a simmer, cover pan and cook 25-minutes over low heat until liquid is absorbed. # Gently fluff with a fork. Let stand for 15 to 20 minutes before serving.
Makes 8 servings.
==Notes, tips and variations==
* Substitute an equal amount of Vegetable Broth for the Chicken Broth to create a Vegetarian version of this recipe. * Subsitute orzo with pine nuts if desired; this is traditionally done in Lebanon. [[Category:Rice recipes|Rice Pilaf]]

{{recipesummary|Salad Dressing recipes|6 (1/4 cup each)|10 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Salad Recipes|Salad Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Appetizers|Appetizers]] | [[Cookbook:California cuisine|California cuisine]]
'''Thousand Island''' is a salad dressing commonly used with green salads. It can also be used as a sandwich spread, or many other uses.
==Ingredients== *1 cup (235 ml) [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|Mayonnaise]] *1/4 cup (60 ml) [[Cookbook:Ketchup|Ketchup]] *2 tablespoons (30 ml) white vinegar *1 tablespoon (15 ml) granulated sugar *1 tablespoon (15 ml) sweet pickle relish *2 tesapoons (10 ml) finely minced onions *1/4 teaspoon (1 ml) salt dash of pepper
Makes 1 1/2 cups of dressing.
==Procedure== #Combine all ingredients in a [[Cookbook:Blender|blender]], and process till smooth. The goal is to have a pink smooth sauce. #Pour the sauce into a bowl and chill covered in the refregerator for at least 30 minutes prior to use.
==Notes, tips and variations==
#Instead of using the blender, wisk the ingredients in a bowl.
==Warnings== * Keep refregerated * This recipe uses Mayonnaise. See the module ''[[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|Mayonnaise]]'' for possible health risks.
[[Category:Californian recipes|Thousand Island]] [[Category:Salad Dressing recipes|Thousand Island]] [[Category:Mayonnaise recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary |Category = Indian recipes |Servings = 7 |Rating = 3 |Image = [[Image:Jelebi close.jpg|300px]] }} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of India|Indian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Jalebi''' is a syrupy sweet that is shaped like a slightly large, chaotic pretzel and is traditionally prepared in [[Cookbook:Cuisine of India|India]] and [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Pakistan|Pakistan]]. Well-made jalebi has a tart element with a sweet taste.
==Ingredients== ===Jalebi batter=== * 3 cups all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Rice Flour|rice flour]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * 2 cups water
===Syrup=== * 4 cups [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 3 cups water * ⅛ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cream of Tartar|cream of tartar]] * red and yellow food coloring * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Rosewater|rosewater]]
3 cups of vegetable [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] for deep frying
==Procedure== # Mix up the batter ingredients until smooth. # Let the batter sit unrefrigerated and uncovered overnight (about 12 hours). # Mix the sugar, water, and cream of tartar for the syrup. # Stir the syrup over moderate heat until the sugar is dissolved. # Put on high heat and boil for 5 minutes. # Let the syrup cool, and stir in the rosewater and food coloring (color it to light orange). # Put the vegetable oil in a wide [[Cookbook:Wok|wok]]-like dish, and heat to about 350°F (175°C). # Put the batter into a pastry bag with about a ¼ inch opening. If it is too dry to squeeze out, mix in a bit of water. # Squeeze the batter into the oil, making a couple of figure 8s and loops on top of each other. The shape should be about 3 inches on its longest side. # Fry each jalebi until golden brown. Remove, let the oil drain off, then soak in syrup for a minute.
Serves 7.
[[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Indian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pakistani recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of France|French Cuisine]]
'''Choucroute Garnie''' Sauerkraut with sausages, salt pork and potatoes.
Being a little picky about your ingredients (especially the sauerkraut) with this recipe makes all the difference.
==Ingredients== *1 or so [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] of [[Cookbook:Duck|duck]] [[Cookbook:Fat|fat]] *1 medium [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], finely chopped *2 or 3 small [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]] *5 [[Cookbook:Juniper Berry|juniper berries]] *1 [[Cookbook:Clove|clove]] *1 or 2 [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] cloves *1 or so tablespoons of [[Cookbook:Coriander|coriander seed]] *1/2 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Mustard|black mustard seed]] *2 strips of [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]], sliced (or the same amount of salted [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]] belly) into rough squares *1 pound of [[Cookbook:Sauerkraut|sauerkraut]] *4 pork [[Cookbook:Sausage|sausages]] *3 smoked pork slices, bone in *1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240ml) or so of [[Cookbook:White Wine|white wine]] (dry)
==Procedure== #In a [[Cookbook:Pots and Pans|pot]] large enough to in the end hold everything, melt the duck fat over medium heat. #When hot, add the onions and [[Cookbook:Sautéing|sauté]] until translucent (about five minutes or so). #Then, add the sauerkraut, white wine, juniper berries, clove, coriander seed, mustard seed, and garlic. #Add the smoked pork and bacon. #Cover, and then [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] for about two hours. #In other pot, simmer two peeled potatoes and your sausages (not a boil, or your sausages will split open). #Simmer until potatoes are done (and by then the sausage will be, too). #Serve in a heap-- sauerkraut at the bottom, various [[Cookbook:Pork|pig]] and potato parts on top. This is delicious.
[[Category:French recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pork recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sausage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Potato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sauerkraut recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: clean up and re-categorisation to alpha, Replaced: recipes]] → recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] (3) ([[Project:AWB|AWB]])
revision.text:
{{recipe}}
==Ingredients== ===Chicken=== *1 lb [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] (boneless), [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] *1 lb [[Cookbook:Kidney Beans|kidney beans]] *1/2 tsp [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *1 tsp [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]] ===Salad=== *1 medium [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] *3 medium [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]], diced *1 lb [[Cookbook:Lettuce|lettuce]], chopped (about half of a large head) *1/4 lb cheddar [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]], grated *1 cup [[Cookbook:Thousand Island Dressing|thousand island dressing]] *1/4 cup [[Cookbook:Picante Sauce|picante sauce]] (or more or less, to, taste) *1 large [[Cookbook:Avocado|avocado]], sliced *3/4 lb corn [[Cookbook:Tortilla Chips|tortilla chips]]
==Procedure== ===Chicken=== #Bone and dice the chicken. #Heat a small amount of vegetable oil in a large frying pan until it starts to smoke. #Add the chicken cubes and fry over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until they are browned (2 or 3 minutes). #To the chicken, add the drained kidney beans, salt and chili powder. #Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. ===Salad=== #Chop the tomatoes, onion and lettuce. #Grate the cheese. #Toss them together in a salad bowl with the salad dressing and picante sauce. # Slice the avocado and add to the salad. #Break the tortilla chips into flakes and add to the salad. #Mix the cooked chicken and beans into the cold salad. #Decorate with extra chips and slices of avocado and tomato. #Serve immediately.
[[Category:Salad recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bean recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Albania|Albanian Cuisine]]
'''Albanian vegetable pie''', '''''Byrek Shqipëtar me perime''''', is an [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Albania|Albania]]n recipe for cooking pies. Albanian pies are generally made of thin pastry leaves which can be rolled out at home or bought as [[Cookbook:Filo Dough|filo dough]] at a supermarket. Most of the pies prepared by Albanian cooks are not sweet; instead, pie fillings are almost always savory. Thus, a piece of such a pie may well serve as the main dish of a meal.
== Ingredients == *1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240 [[Cookbook:mL|mL]]) [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]], preferably [[Cookbook:Olive_Oil|olive oil]] *1½ packets (or about 30) pastry leaves (filo dough) *1½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] (680 [[Cookbook:g|g]]) spinach, chopped *1 cup (240 mL) diced [[Cookbook:Feta Cheese|feta cheese]] *½ cup (120 mL) chopped green [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]] *2-3 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] *1½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|t]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
== Procedure == A medium-sized, round baking pan is recommended because it's more authentic, but any medium-sized baking pan will do.
Brush the baking pan with some of the oil, and start laying the pastry leaves inside. First, lay two leaves, sprinkle or brush with oil, then lay two more leaves, and repeat the procedure until half of the leaves are in place. Make sure that they cover the pan by hanging them about one inch over the edges of the pan.
Sprinkle spinach with salt, then mix well by hand. Add the feta cheese, oil, onions, eggs and salt, and spread this mixture over the already laid pastry leaves. Finish by covering the spinach with the rest of the pastry leaves, repeating the first-half procedure and then roll the hanging edges of the bottom leaves over the pie (think of a [[Cookbook:Pizza|pizza]] crust), sprinkle top with oil and bake moderately at [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|350°F (175°C)]] for about 45 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve hot, accompanied with [[Cookbook:Buttermilk|buttermilk]], or beaten [[Cookbook:Yogurt|yogurt]], thinned down in cold water or with chilled [[Cookbook:Stewed Prunes|stewed prunes]]. Sometimes a green [[Cookbook:Salad|salad]] adds to the meal!
Serves 4-6.
==References== ''This article contains information from [http://www.frosina.org Frosina.org] and it is used with [[w:User:Dori/www.frosina.org permission|permission]].''
[[Category:Albanian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pie recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]

{{recipe}}
'''Potato and cabbage soup''' (Albanian: '''Supë borsh me patate e lakër''') is an [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Albania|Albania]]n [[Cookbook:Soup|soup]].
==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], grated * 3 tablespoons oil or [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrot]]s, finely chopped * 3 [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]] stalks, finely chopped * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]] sauce * 5 cups meat [[Cookbook:Stock|stock]] * 1 pound [[Cookbook:Cabbage|cabbage]], finely chopped * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbok:Vinegar|vinegar]] * 1 pound [[Cookbook:Potato|potato]]es, diced * 2 [[Cookbook:Beet|beet]] roots, diced * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 4 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Cream|cream]]
== Procedure == # [[Wiktionary:sauté|Sauté]] onion lightly in oil. # Add carrots and celery and continue to sauté. # Add flour and continue to sauté. # Add tomato sauce and a few tablespoons of stock slowly, stirring continuously. Cook over low heat until the sauce is ready. # Boil the remaining stock and add cabbage. # Add vinegar and cook for 15 minutes, then add potatoes and beet roots and cook for another 5 minutes. # Season with salt and pepper and serve hot, covered with a tablespoon of cream for each dish.
Serves 4 people.
==References== ''This article contains information from [http://www.frosina.org Frosina.org] and it is used with [[Wikipedia:User:Dori/www.frosina.org permission|permission]].''
[[Category:Albanian recipes|Potato and cabbage soup]] [[Category:Soup recipes|Potato and cabbage soup]] [[Category:Potato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cabbage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: Revert to revision 890395 dated 2007-06-07 13:58:26 by Webaware using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegan cuisine|Vegan Cuisine]]
== Ingredients == ===Cake=== *1½ C Unbleached white [[Cookbook:flour|flour]] *⅓ C Unsweetened baking [[Cookbook:cocoa|cocoa]] powder *1 t [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] *1 C Unrefined [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]] *1¼ C [[Cookbook:water|water]] *¼ C [[Cookbook:vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] *2 t [[Cookbook:vanilla|vanilla extract]] *2 T [[Cookbook:vinegar|vinegar]] (Plain red, plain white or rice vinegar) *a pinch of shredded [[Cookbook:coconut|coconut]]
===Chocolate tofu filling=== *6 oz [[Cookbook:chocolate|chocolate]] chips *6 oz [[Cookbook:tofu|tofu]] *½ T [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla extract]]
== Procedure == #Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). #In bowl combine flour, cocoa, baking soda, salt and sugar. #In another bowl combine water, oil and the 2 teaspoons of vanilla. #Pour liquid into dry ingredients, whisk with fork. #Add vinegar and stir. You'll see bubbles when the acidic vinegar reacts with the basic baking soda! #Pour into baking dishes, bake for 25-30 minutes. #While cake is baking melt the chocolate chips. #For chocolate tofu filling add the tofu, ½ T vanilla extract and melted chocolate chips to blender. Blend until creamy. #Pull cake out of oven, let cool. Cut the top of the cake off and set the top aside. Pour the chocolate tofu mousse on the bottom half of the cake. Replace the top half. #Refrigerate until mousse thickens.
== Chocolate Walnut Sauce Topping (Optional) ==
=== Ingredients === *¼ C [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] *¼ C [[Cookbook:Cocoa|cocoa]] powder or [[Cookbook:carob|carob]] powder *4 T [[Cookbook:Soy|soy]] milk *5/6 C [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] (preferably unrefined) *⅓ C (packed) unrefined [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *1 t [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla extract]] *½ C [[Cookbook:Walnut|walnuts]] (optional)
=== Procedure === #In a saucepan combine everything but vanilla extract #Bring to boil, stirring constantly. Boil 1 minute, stir to cool then add vanilla extract #Pour over the tops of the chocolate mousse cake from step 2. #Garnish with coconut (optional)
[[Category:Vegan recipes]] [[Category:Cake recipes]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes]] [[Category:Tofu recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Lebanon|Cuisine of Lebanon]]
== Ingredients ==
* For the Chicken ** 4 x Skin-on, boned [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] breasts ** 2 [[Cookbook:Lemon|Lemons]] completely juiced (use fresh lemons!) ** 6 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] ** 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] ** 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Pepper|Pepper]] ** 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Basil|Basil]] ** ¼ tsp [[Cookbook:Cayenne pepper|Cayenne Pepper]] ** 6 large [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]] sliced in ¼" slices
* For the '[[Cookbook:Toum|toom]]' (Arabic for garlic) ** 4 cloves of garlic ** ½ cup [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] ** ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] ** ¼ tsp salt ** a dash of cayenne.
== Instructions == # Blend the lemon juice, garlic, salt, pepper, basil and cayenne pepper to make the marinade. # Put the chicken breasts in a deep pan and pour the marinade over it # Cover and sit all night. In the morning, flip the chicken to the other side. # At noon drain the liquid from the pan and cook in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 10-15 minutes (not to cook, only to brown) # Once finished, pour the marinade over the browned chicken, tightly cover the pan with tin foil (don't burn your fingers) and put back in the oven. Set the oven to 250°F (120°C) # Baste at 1pm, 2pm and 3pm. # At 4pm, add the sliced potatoes to the pot, baste everything, and recover with tin foil. # Put back in the oven for another hour. # Once the above step is finished, blend all of the ingredients for the toom together.
At 5pm, dinner's ready.
The trick is not in complicated ingredients - it is the slow cooking and lemon/garlic marinade.
Use the toom as a condiment for the chicken and potatoes.
Serve with warm pita bread.
[[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Featured recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Lebanese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Garlic recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Lemon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Cake recipes|12 slices|2 hours|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cake|Cake]]
'''Apple Bundt Cake''' - This very easy to make cake requires no fancy frosting or filling and is delicious for serving at breakfast, tea time or even as a birthday cake with a chocolate or fruit glaze covering.
==Ingredients== *2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *Rind of 1 [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemon]] *4 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] *1 cup [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] *1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] *2 cups [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *½ tsp [[Cookbook:Allspice|allspice]] *½ tsp [[Cookbook:Nutmeg|nutmeg]] *2 tsp [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] *2 tsp [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] *1 tsp [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *1 tsp [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] *3 large tart [[Cookbook:Apple|apple]]s, grated *½ cup [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisin]]s
Serves 12
==Procedure== #Mix quickly in the food processor the sugar and lemon rind. #Add eggs and blend until it becomes a nice cream. #Continue blending while slowly adding the oil. #Blend until well mixed and add vanilla. #In a separate bowl sift the dry ingredients all together (flour, allspice, nutmeg, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon). #Mix the dry ingredients slowly into the batter blending until it becomes a nice thick cream. #Add grated apples and blend quickly into batter just to mix. Be sure not to overblend and shred the apples too much. #Add raisins and pulse the processor as to just mix them in and not shred them. #Bake for 55 minutes at approximately [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|320°F (160°C)]] or until sticking a knife into center comes out clean.
[[Category:Cake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Apple recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Beverages|Beverages]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Greece|Greek Cuisine]]
'''Frappé coffee''' is a refreshing drink of Greek origin, perfect on a summer's day.
== Ingredients == *1-2 spoons of instant coffee *Tall Glass of Cold Water *1-3 spoons of sugar (optional) *3-5 ice cubes (optional) *Milk (optional; condensed/evaporated milk works best)
== Procedure == Put coffee and sugar in a shaker or tall glass and add cold water as high as it covers the mixture. Shake or stir with mixer until the mixture becomes foamy. Add cold water to fill the glass, ice cubes and as much milk (preferably evaporated or condensed milk) as you like. Drink with a straw.
== Types ==
* Ratio Sugar:Coffee >2:1 Frappé ''glykos'' (Sweet Frappé) * Ratio Sugar:Coffee 1:1 Frappé ''metrios'' (Medium or Moderate Frappé) * No sugar Frappé ''sketos''
Either of the above with milk added ''me gala'' (with milk), e.g. ''Frappé glykos me gala'' or ''Frapogalo''
== Notes, tips and variations == * You can also add Baileys or a ball of ice cream. * Once I was in Greece I was told that the right order of mixing Frappe after making foam is ICE, MILK and than fill up the glass with cold WATER. * By including the ICE when shaking or stirring the coffee, it allows the foam to become more aerated and frothier. Once this has been done, you can then top up with water and/or milk.
[[Category:Beverage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Greek recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Coffee recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Pasta Recipes|Pasta recipes]] {{recipesummary |Category = Italian recipes |Time = 1½ hours |Rating = 2 |Image = [[Image:Melanzane alla Parmigiana.jpg|300px]] }}
'''Melanzane Parmigiana''' is generally an oven baked dish consisting of aubergine, Parmesan cheese, mozzarella and tomato sauce.
==Ingredients==
* 3 or 4 big [[Cookbook:Eggplant|eggplants]] (aubergines) * [[Cookbook:Tomato Sauce|tomato sauce]] * about 200 or 300 [[Cookbook:gram|grams]] of [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|mozzarella cheese]], sliced * grated [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|Parmesan cheese]] * [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] to [[Cookbook:Frying|fry]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
;Optional: * fresh [[Cookbook:Basil|basil]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Hard Boiled Eggs|boiled eggs]]
==Procedure==
#Wash eggplants and cut them in slices about 1-1.5 [[Cookbook:Centimetre (cm)|cm]] thick. Eggplant has a bitter taste and it should be prepared in the following way to remove this: ##Salt each slice on both sides and put them on a big plate. ##When all the slices are covered with salt, cover them with another plate, pressing a bit. ##Let them rest for 20-30 minutes or more, time permitting (up to 2 hours). ##Then wash the slices under running water and let them dry a while. ##Alternatively, place salted eggplant slices in a large strainer and place a weight (e.g. a smaller pot of water) on top to help squeeze out the water. #Dust the slices with flour and/or bread crumbs and fry them. Do not overcook, as they will spend some time in the oven later. #Take a pan for the oven and make a layer with eggplants slices, then one with the tomato sauce, then one with some slices of mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. Some cooks add fresh basil leaves and cooked egg slices. #Make as many layers as you wish, but 3 or 4 should be enough. Be sure the last one to be completely full of Parmesan cheese, that will make a nice crust when cooked. #Now everything is finished, put the pan in the oven at [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|180°C (350°F)]] for about 20-30 minutes.
[[Category:Italian recipes]] [[Category:Eggplant recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Sandwich recipes|1 or more|5 minutes|1|[[Image:Poboy.jpg|300px]]}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Sandwiches|Sandwich]]
A ''''po' boy'''' (from the name "poor boy," as the sandwiches were traditionally given to the poor street boys by the nuns in New Orleans) is a New Orleans sandwich similar to a "sub" sandwich. They can be made with anything, but are typically made with a type of meat and "dressing" (lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, and sauce). Mother's Restaurant in New Orleans is well-known for their debris po' boy, made with the "debris" from a roast that falls into gravy when a roast is cut.
==Ingredients== * [[Cookbook:Bread|French bread]] * Thinly sliced meat ([[Cookbook:Ham|ham]], [[Cookbook:Turkey|turkey]], [[Cookbook:Beef|roast beef]], etc.), fried seafood ([[Cookbook:Shrimp|shrimp]], [[Cookbook:Oyster|oysters]], [[Cookbook:Fish|fish]], etc.), etc. * [[Cookbook:Lettuce|Lettuce]], [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]], pickles, etc. * Sliced [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]] * [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|Mayonnaise]], [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]], [[Cookbook:Sauces|gravy]], etc.
==Procedure== # Slice the bread along one side so that it folds open like a book. # Open the bread and add the cheese, shredded lettuce, and meat. # Add condiments to your liking. # Close the bread (as you would a book) and mash it down.
[[Category:Sandwich recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Louisiana recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|1||3||419 Cal}}
{{recipe}}
This recipe for the deep fried Mars bar illustrates a typical procedure. The ingredients in the dish's variations may vary indefinitely, but the procedure will remain more or less the same. For authentic flavor, fry the treat in [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] drippings rather than vegetable oil (it is worth warning of the high saturated fat content this method of cooking produces).
==Ingredients==
*1 UK or Canadian [[w:Mars_Bar|Mars Bar]] or 1 US [[w:Milky_Way%20(confectionery)|Milky Way Bar]] (same thing, w/ caramel but no nuts) *1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] *1 cup [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] *1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Oil|oil or fat]] (use [[Cookbook:Suet|suet]] for authenticity)
==Procedure==
[[Cookbook:Chill|Chill]], but do not [[Cookbook:Freeze|freeze]], the Mars bar by leaving it in a fridge, or freezer, for a short while. Mix the milk, flour and egg in a bowl. [[Cookbook:Whisk|Whisk]] together to create a creamy [[Cookbook:Batter|batter]]. Heat the oil. Coat the Mars bar completely in batter. Lower into hot oil and fry until batter is golden brown. Serve.
[[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|several|5 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]]
The sort of hot fudge appropriate for putting on ice cream sundaes.
==Ingredients== *1/2 cup (120ml) [[Cookbook:Milk|Milk]] *1 1/2 cups (350g) [[Cookbook:Sugar|Sugar]] *1 1/2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Cocoa|Cocoa]] *dash [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] *3/4 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Butter|Butter]] *1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Vanilla|Vanilla]]
==Procedure== # Mix milk, sugar, cocoa and salt in a saucepan and bring to a full rolling boil. # Turn off heat and add butter and vanilla. # Let cool for a couple minutes, until butter is melted, then beat with a spoon and serve.
[[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sauce recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Middle Eastern cuisines|Middle Eastern cuisines]] | [[Cookbook:Palestinian Cuisine|Palestinian Cuisine]]
== Ingredients ==
*1/2 pound ground [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] *1/2 [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], chopped *[[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive oil]] *1 cup [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]] *1 1/2 cups [[Cookbook:Water|water]] *[[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *[[Cookbook:Black pepper|black pepper]] *[[Cookbook:Allspice|allspice]] *plain [[Cookbook:Yogurt|yogurt]]
== Instructions ==
#In a saucepan, brown ground beef and onion with salt, pepper and allspice in a little olive oil (use more allspice than pepper). Remove from heat. #Add the rice and water. Bring to a boil on medium heat. #Turn down to medium low, and cover with the lid tilted to let some steam escape. #When most of the water has evaporated and the surface of the rice becomes "pitted," put the lid on tight. Cook on low heat for 15 minutes. #Remove from heat and leave covered for 2 or 3 minutes. Serve with yogurt.
[[Category:Palestinian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Beef recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rice recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
== Ingredients == *one [[Cookbook:Apple|apple]], grated *one [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], chopped *2 [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]], sliced *2 oz. (55g) [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] *1 tsp. (5ml) [[Cookbook:Curry powder|curry powder]] *[[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] *[[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *[[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]] *boiled [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]]
== Procedure == #Fry apple and onion in the butter until blended. #Mix curry powder in a little milk, and stir in. #Season with salt and pepper. #Fry tomatoes in a separate pan. #Cover them with the mixture, and serve within a wall of boiled rice.
''Adapted from '''Grand Union Cookbook''', compiled by Margaret Compton (Grand Union Tea Co., 1902).''
[[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Apple recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Curry recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rice recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Breakfast|Breakfast]]
== Ingredients == *[[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]] strips (very thin and lean) *one [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] *3 drops [[Cookbook:Tabasco sauce|Tabasco sauce]] *[[Cookbook:cracker|cracker]] dust *[[Cookbook:Butter|butter]]
== Procedure == #Beat the egg with the Tabasco sauce. #Dip bacon in the egg mixture, and roll in cracker dust. #Put butter in a frying pan over medium heat. When pan is well heated, put in the bacon. Fry until golden brown. #Flip bacon over, cook other side, and serve on a napkin.
''Adapted from '''Grand Union Cookbook''', compiled by Margaret Compton (Grand Union Tea Co., 1902).''
[[Category:Bacon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{mergeto|Cookbook:Miso Soup}} {{recipe}}
==Ingredients== * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp.]] of [[Cookbook:Sesame_Oil|sesame oil]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] of water * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbl.]] of [[Cookbook:Miso|miso]]. * 2 green [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], finely minced (optional) * 1/2 cake [[Cookbook:Tofu|tofu]], cut into 1/2 inch cubes (optional) * 2-3 fresh [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushrooms]], thinly sliced (optional) * 5-6 shrimps, cubed or shredded (optional) * Some pieces of seaweed (optional)
==Procedure== # Heat oil in the bottom of a small pot # Add green onion (if using) # Cook for a few minutes while stirring frequently # Add 2 1/2 cups of water # Dissolve miso in 1/2 cup of water and add to pot # Bring to a boil # Lower heat and add mushrooms, seaweed & tofu if desired Enjoy!
[[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Japanese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tofu recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Duplicate recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]]
==Ingredients==
*10 oz - Plain white flour; *6 oz - Wholemeal flour; *1 3/4 lvl tsp - Bread soda; *2 heaped dessert spoons - Wheat germ; *1 lvl tsp - Salt; *7/8 pint - Buttermilk.
==Method==
# Grease and flour an 8 inch round baking tin. # Sift the white flour into a large mixing bowl. # Add the other dry ingredients and mix thoroughly. ''A simple tip: Sift the flour and baking soda five times through a sieve. This ensures even mixing of the ingredients and gives a better result.'' # Make a well in the centre of the bowl, pour in some of the buttermilk and, with a wooden spoon, gradually mix the flour into the buttermilk. Alternatively, make a volcano shape on a marble slab with the dry ingredients, add the buttermilk and mix with a knife. # Add more buttermilk and mix in more flour. Continue until the flour is completely absorbed into the mix. The mix should not be over saturated, but have a slightly stretchy look. ''Handle it as little as possible. You can also ball it up into one or two balls, place them on a flat baking tray, and cut a cross in the top.'' # Turn the mix into the baking tin and place in a medium hot oven (180 degrees Centigrade, 350 degrees F) for 35 to 45 minutes, or until golden brown. # Leave to cool on a wire tray.
[[Category:Bread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: moved sugar to notes, tips, variations - can't imagine it myself, must be some horrible American version
revision.text:
{{recipe}}
Mayonnaise is a smooth savoury [[Cookbook:Sauce|sauce]] made from [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] and the yolk of [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]]. It is an emulsion in which the oil is dispersed in tiny droplets. Egg yolk contains lecithin which prevents the oil and water from separating out. [[Cookbook:Mustard|Mustard]] is also a good emulsifier and is frequently added. [[Cookbook:Vinegar|Vinegar]], usually wine vinegar, or [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemon]] juice are added for flavour and because acidity is necessary for the emulsion to properly form. [[Cookbook:Garlic|Garlic]] is a frequent addition. The [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] used is normally a flavourless type such as [[Cookbook:Sunflower Oil|sunflower oil]] or [[Cookbook:Corn Oil|corn oil]], but you can substitute some for a stronger tasting oil such as [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]].
Mayonnaise is notoriously difficult for the beginner, as it often curdles, but easy once you have the knack.
==Ingredients== *1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] yolk *2 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] (12.5 [[Cookbook:mL|mL]]) [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] and/or [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]] *1/2 teaspoons (2.5 mL) Dijon [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]] *1/4 teaspoons (1 mL) [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *3/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (180mL) [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]]
==Procedure== # In a large bowl, beat the egg yolk with a wire [[Cookbook:Whisk|whisk]] for about a minute. # Then add the mustard, sugar, salt, and half the lemon juice. Whisk for another minute - the mixture should thicken very slightly. # Then, very slowly, add half the oil with one hand whilst whisking with the other. # Start drop by drop, incorporating each drop before adding the next, and build up to a trickle. # Keep going until the oil is whisked in. # Add the rest of the lemon juice, whisk to combine. # Add the rest of the oil in the same manner as before. # Keep going until all the oil is whisked in.
You can now stir flavourings such as crushed garlic into the finished mayonnaise, or use the mayonnaise as a base for other sauces.
==Notes, tips and variations== * One can make the whisking process easier by using a kitchen towel. Wet a kitchen towel, or any small towel, until it is very wet and heavy, but not dripping. Coil the towel on top of a flat surface, such as the kitchen countertop or a table. Place the bowl onto the circle. This will provide a steady base for the bowl and allow you to whisk with one hand while adding ingredients with the other.
* If the mayonnaise should curdle, it can be recovered by slowly dripping the curdled mayonnaise into another egg yolk while whisking vigorously all the time.
* ½ teaspoons [[Cookbook:White sugar|white sugar]] can be added for those with a sweet tooth.
[[Category:Sauce recipes]] [[Category:Egg recipes]] [[nl:Kookboek/Mayonaise]]

{{cookwork}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] | [[Cookbook:Cake|Cake]]
This low-fat cake recipe is very common with unique variations. The cake is simple to make and does not require you to start from scratch. All the ingredients can be found at your local grocery stores.
==Cake== * One box of yellow cake mix (approximately 1 lb. & 2.25 ounces or 517 grams) * One 11 ounce (312 grams) can of mandarin oranges * Three medium size eggs
Preheat oven to 350 degree Fahrenheit. If using non-stick baking pans, still need to grease sides and bottom with shortening and cover surface lightly with flour. Pour yellow cake mix into mixing bowl. Add eggs and mandarin oranges (including its juice). Do not need to add oil, margarine, or butter. Blend until moistened and beat for approximately 2 minutes at medium speed. Pour mix evenly into baking pans. Bake approximately 30 minutes or per cake mix instruction (inserted toothpick into center comes out clean). Remove from oven and let the cakes cool.
==Icing== * One box of '''instant''' vanilla pudding mix (5.1 ounces or 144 grams) * One 20 ounce (567 grams) can of crushed pineapples * One 12 ounce (340 grams) container of CoolWhip, found in the frozen section
Scoop CoolWhip into a clean mixing bowl. Add the instant vanilla pudding mix. Drain all the pineapple juice from the can of crushed pineapples and fold into CoolWhip. Mix all the ingredients evenly, do not use a blender. For better results, chill icing for about 30 minutes.
After the cake cools, frost each layer with your icing. Each serving is approximately 275 calories with about 4 to 5 grams of fat. Like everything else, moderation is always best.
[[Category:Cake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Frosting and Icing recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Orange recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pineapple recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
This is an [[w:Eurasian|Eurasian]] dish, not the campfire marshmallows S'more.
==Ingredients== * 300g [[Cookbook:beef|beef]] shank * 3 [[Cookbook:onion|onion]]s * 5 cloves [[Cookbook:garlic|garlic]] * 1 thumb-sized piece [[Cookbook:ginger|ginger]] * 10-cm piece [[Cookbook:cinnamon|cinnamon]] * 100g small [[Cookbook:carrot|carrot]]s * 3 [[Cookbook:potato|potato]]es * 1 [[Cookbook:tomato|tomato]] * 1 spring [[Cookbook:Cilantro|coriander]] leaves * 2 [[Cookbook:soda biscuit|soda biscuit]]s
=== Marinade === * 1/4 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|bicarbonate of soda]] * 2 tablespoons ground [[Cookbook:pepper|pepper]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:vinegar|vinegar]] * 4 tablespoons dark [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soya sauce]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:oil|oil]] * 420ml water
== Procedure == === Beef Preparation === # Wash and cut beef into 2.5 cm chunks. # Drain in colander. # Marinate with bicarbonate of soda, pepper, salt, sugar, vinegar and dark soya sauce. # Leave for 30 minutes.
=== Other Ingredients === # Grind onions and garlic together. # Slice and julienne ginger. # Wash cinnamon. # Peel carrots. Wash and cut diagonally. Soak in water. # Peel potatoes. Wash and cut into quarters. Soak with carrots. # Cut tomato into quarters. # Remove leaves from coriander. # Crush and grind soda biscuits.
=== Cooking === # Heat oil in a pot. When hot, fry ground onion and garlic, shredded ginger and cinnamon till onions are brown and fragrant. # Add marinated beef. Fry till meat changes color. # Add water and simmer till meat is tender. Stir occasionally to prevent meat from sticking to pot. Add more water if gravy is too thick and season accordingly. # Add carrots and cook for 5 minutes. # Add potatoes and cook till soft. # Add tomato and biscuit crumbs. If you like, you may add a tin of Spam luncheon meat, cut into thick slices or chicken franks at this step. # Garnish with coriander leaves.
[[Category:Malaysian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Beef recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|6-8|10 - 15 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
'''Vegetable Soup''' is a [[Cookbook:soup|soup]] made from [[Cookbook:vegetable|vegetable]]s. Many different recipes and variations are possible.
==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:onion|onion]] * 1 [[Cookbook:turnip|turnip]] * 1 [[Cookbook:potato|potato]]es, pared * 1 [[Cookbook:carrot|carrot]] * 1 head of [[Cookbook:celery|celery]] * 3 [[Cookbook:pint|pint]]s water * 1 slice of [[Cookbook:bread|bread]], toasted and buttered
==Method== #Take the onion, turnip, potatoes, carrot, and celery. Boil them in the water until the vegetables are cooked. #Insert the bread into a bowl. Pour the soup over it.
==Variations== * [[Cookbook:Tomato|Tomato]]s also make a welcome addition to the soup.
{{1881}}
[[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary |Category = Dutch recipes |Servings = 50 donuts |Rating = 3 |Image = [[Image:Oliebollen.jpg|300px]] }} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Desserts|Desserts]]
'''Oil-dumpling''' (in Dutch: Oliebol, oliebollen)
Oliebollen are oftentimes called Dutch apple fritters, and are served at Dutch festivals in the United States, such as Oak Harbor, Washington's Holland Happening Festival.
Makes: 50 doughnuts, or 1 roaster pan full
== Ingredients == * 2 tbsp [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 2 pkg [[Cookbook:Yeast|yeast]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 5 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 2 cups [[Cookbook:Scalding|scalded]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]], softened * 10 cups [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1½ tsp [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 3 diced Granny Smith [[Cookbook:Apple|apples]] * 3 cups [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisins]] (optional) * [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|ground cinnamon]] to taste * [[Cookbook:Canola Oil|canola oil]] for frying
== Instructions == # Dissolve 2 tbsp sugar in 1 cup warm water. Sprinkle yeast on top. Let stand while preparing dough. # In a LARGE mixing bowl, beat eggs until mixed. Add scalded milk, 1½ cups warm water, yeast mixture and margarine and beat well. Add flour, 1 cup sugar and salt, mix well. Add diced apple. # Let dough rise in a warm place until doubled in size. (I use a lobster pot for this) # In a separate bowl, mix 3 C. sugar and cinnamon to taste. (I like a LOT) # Fill a fryer pot 4 inches with canola oil or melted Crisco. Heat to 375°F (190°C) and scoop large spoonfuls of dough into the pot, turning them to ensure even browning. (Golden brown is the goal) Play the shape game while you're at it. Dipping the spoons in the hot oil before scooping the dough keeps the spoons from getting too sticky. # Drain on paper towels on paper bags, roll in cinnamon sugar mixture and serve warm.
{{wikipedia|Dutch doughnut}}
[[Category:Dumpling recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dutch recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[nl:Kookboek/Oliebollen]]

{{recipe}}
'''Spritzgebäck''' is a type of [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Germany|German]] [[Cookbook:Cookie|cookie]].
==Ingredients== * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 2/3 cup [[Cookbook:confectioners' sugar |confectioner's sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]], large * 1 egg yolk, large * 1 teaspoon almond or lemon extract * 2 1/4 cups flour, unbleached, unsifted * 1/4 teaspoon salt * 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
== Procedure == # Beat butter and sugar until light. # Beat in egg, egg yolk and extract. # Sift flour, salt, and baking powder; gradually add flour mixture to eggs. # Chill dough 1/2 hour. # Press 1/4 of the dough into a cookie press. # Keep remaining dough chilled. # Shape cookies onto a greased baking sheet. # Bake in 400 degrees F. oven for 7 to 10 minutes or until done. # Cool on wire racks and store in airtight tins.
Makes 4 to 6 dozen cookies.
[[Category:Dessert recipes|Spritzgeback]] [[Category:German recipes|Spritzgeback]] [[Category:Cookie recipes|Spritzgeback]]

{{recipesummary|Stew recipes|6 (1 cup each)|60 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}}
'''Texas Easy Chili''' is a [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]] and [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]] juice based [[Cookbook:Sauce|sauce]] combined with cubed or ground [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]]. [[Cookbook:Chili|Chili]] originated in Texas in the 1800s. There are many variations of chili. This version does not contain [[Cookbook:Bean|beans]].
==Ingredients==
*3 [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] chuck roast or ground beef, cubed or formed into small meatballs *2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] *2 cloves of [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], minced *6 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]] *5 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *1 tablespoon dried [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]] *1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] ground [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] *3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] tomato juice or V8 *3 beef bullion cubes *[[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|black pepper]] to taste
*Garnish - [[Cookbook:Lime|lime]] wedges and [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]]
Makes 6 cups of chili.
==Procedure== #Cut chuck roast into bite-size pieces or form ground beef into small meatballs (1 inch - 25mm in size). #[[Cookbook:Frying|Fry]] beef in cooking oil until outside is browned. #Add minced garlic and cook for two minutes. #Combine chili powder, flour, oregano and cumin in bowl and mix well. Sprinkle mixture over cooking beef and stir until beef is well coated with spice mixture. Cook for 1 minute. #Add tomato juice and bullion cubes. Stir for about 15 seconds. #[[Cookbook:Simmering|Simmer]] for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally. #Remove from heat and add salt and black pepper to taste.
==Notes, tips and variations==
#Cool and refrigerate overnight to develop flavors. (If you can wait, if not, enjoy.) #Heat and serve in bowls with 1 tablespoon of lime juice and 1 tablespoon of sour cream added to top. #Serve with [[Cookbook:Corn Bread|cornbread]] or [[Cookbook:Sourdough Bread|sourdough bread]]. #For a cool treat, spoon a tablespoon of Ranch Dressing on top of your chili, along with some cheese!
==Warnings== * Keep refrigerated.
==See also== * [[Cookbook:Chilli Pepper|chili pepper]]
[[Category:American recipes|Texas Easy Chili]] [[Category:Beef recipes|Texas Easy Chili]] [[Category:Southwestern recipes|Texas Easy Chili]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chili recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Stew recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] | [[Cookbook:Cake|Cake]]
==Ingredients==
*1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] finely ground pure [[Cookbook:Marijuana|marijuana]] *1 cup [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *1 cup [[Cookbook:Water|water]] *1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] *1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbsp]] [[Cookbook:Cocoa|cocoa]] powder *5 tbsp [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] or [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] *1 cup [[Cookbook:Granulated Sugar|sugar]]
==Instructions==
#Preheat oven to 300º Celsius (~550º F). #Grease a non-stick baking tray or use non-stick wax paper to cover base. #Place butter and sugar in a bowl and combine till you have a thick batter. #Add flour, baking powder, marijuana and cocoa powder and combine with small amounts of water at a time till smooth. If adding any of the additional ingredients, add now. #Using a table spoon place a scoopful of batter on tray, 0.5" apart from each other and sides of the tray. #Place tray in oven and allow to bake for 10 to 20 minutes, until centre is cooked. (Pricking a toothpick in the centre will let you know, if the batter sticks to the pick, it's not ready yet). #Remove from oven, '''allow to cool down'''....
==Optional Suggestions== Add one or more of the following to the dry ingredients, before adding the water: *1 capful [[Cookbook:Mint|mint]] essence. *1/2 cup [[Cookbook:Chocolate Chip|chocolate chip]]s (goes well with the mint). *1/2 cup [[Cookbook:Coconut|coconut]] flakes. (an additional 2 tbsp of butter and 1/4 cup water may be needed) *1 [[Cookbook:Tot|tot]] of [[Cookbook:Kaluha|Kaluha]], [[Cookbook:Rum|rum]] or sweet [[Cookbook:Brandy|brandy]]. You may also wish to replace the standard butter or margarine with [[Cookbook:Puna butter|THC butter]]. The cocoa powder may be omitted from the recipe if you prefer a chocolate-free version.
==Feedback==
'''If''' you are <u>inexperienced</u> with cannabis and use a CUP as in this recipe then expect to consider ringing an ambulance at some point; you probably won't ring one but you will think about it, and possibly consider whether, in retrospect, maybe you should have.
At the very least you will experience what is known as a "whitey" in certain parts, referring of course to the skin pallour assumed by the protagonist...accompanied by heart racing, sweats and general "oh god I feel weird, no.. ''really'' weird, maybe I should ring an ambulance.." type-comments.
I would suggest a teaspoon for a novice and certainly not a cup, if you can handle it then work your way 'up' from gentle not 'down' from psychotic.
Another plan might be to just forget the whole thing and have a nice cup of tea and an early night instead.
----
[[Category:Marijuana recipes|Space Cake]] [[Category:Cookie recipes|Space Cake]]

{{recipesummary|Side Dish recipes|2-4|15-20 minutes|1|Image=[[Image:Poutine.jpg|300px]]}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Canada|Canadian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine_of_Quebec|Quebequois Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Side dishes| Side Dishes]]
'''Poutine''' is common dish throughout the Ontario, Quebec and Atlantic regions of Canada which is made up of three items: beef [[Cookbook:Gravy|gravy]], [[Cookbook:French Fries|French fries]] and [[Cookbook:Cheese Curds|cheese curds]].
==Deep fried poutine== This recipe uses pre-canned gravy and fries the potatoes from scratch.
===Ingredients=== *1 [[Cookbook:L|L]] of vegetable oil for [[Cookbook:Deep Fat Frying|deep frying]] *1 (290 [[Cookbook:g|g]]) can of beef gravy *5 medium [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]] *2 cups (500 [[Cookbook:ML|mL]]) of [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar]] cheese curds
===Equipment=== *1 Deep fat fryer or large stove pot to fry the potatoes *1 saucepan or cup suitable for warming gravy *1 Serving dish
===Procedure=== # Slice potatoes into finger-width wedges and rinse them well to remove any dirt # Begin warming gravy, keep the temperature low enough for a slow heating # Heat oil to 185°C (365°F) # Cook wedges in the oil, this should take about 5 minutes # Remove the fries from the oil and place them on a paper towel mat, to absorb excess oil # Mix the wedges and cheese curds # Pour the gravy over the top and wait until the cheese starts to melt * Et Voila! Vous avez une poutine.
==Notes, tips, and variations== * Changing the cheese and gravy used in poutine completely changes the dynamic of the dish, a popular variant is to use a chicken or turkey based gravy with [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|mozzarella cheese]] instead of curds.
* Replacing gravy with [[Cookbook:Salsa | salsa]], the cheese curds with [[Cookbook:Sour Cream | sour cream]], adding diced onions and tomatoes turns poutine into mexipoutine, an item also carried by the likes of Taco Bell under the name "Fries Supreme".
* Replacing the gravy with [[Cookbook:Marinara Sauce | marinara sauce]], adding either loose lean ground beef or crumbled sausage and replacing the cheese curds with [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|mozzarella cheese]] changes the dish to poutine Italiano, not as popular as the mexipoutine alternative, but used in several fast food restaurants in Toronto, Ontario.
==Warnings== This dish is considered rather unhealthy; don't eat it on a regular basis.
[[Category:Sauce recipes]] [[Category:Canadian recipes]] [[Category:Side Dish recipes]] [[Category:Potato recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meat Recipes]]
==Ingredients==
* ground or finely chopped [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] * [[Cookbook:Tortilla|corn tortillas]] or ready-made taco shells * [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]]. ''about 1 to 4 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] per [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] of beef (perhaps 11 to 44 [[Cookbook:mL|mL]]/[[Cookbook:kg|kg]])'' * [[Cookbook:Black Olive|black olives]] * shredded mild [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar cheese]] * fresh [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]]
Optional ingredients include: * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]. ''helpful if spices need to be ground'' * [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]]. ''to be added to the beef'' * [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]]. ''raw, lightly cooked, or well-cooked'' * [[Cookbook:Alfalfa|alfalfa]] sprouts * fresh [[Cookbook:Spinach|spinach]] * inflammatory agents. ''[[Cookbook:Habanero|habaneros]], [[Cookbook:Jalapeño|jalapeños]], etc.'' * [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushrooms]]
==Procedure== #Chop the black olives. #Slice the fresh tomatoes, optionally discarding the gooey parts. #Place the olives, tomatoes, and cheese in the eating area. These toppings will need to be ready to use when the taco shells are hot. #Place the beef in a wide pan on a large burner. Ground beef will need to be broken up as it cooks; chopped beef needs to be stir-fried and may require oil. When using high-fat ground beef you may wish to: add water to float the fat, cool to solidify the fat, remove the fat, drain the water, and reheat. #Add lots of cumin to the beef. Cumin is the magic ingredient that makes a taco taste like a taco. You may also add cilantro, celery, or mushrooms. #Prepare the shells. Pre-made shells should be proped up on each other and/or on cardboard, then heated in the oven. Do not brown them. Plain corn tortilias need to be fried. You may use a [[Cookbook:Deep Fat Frying|deep-fat]] process, going one at a time and using a large spoon to form the shells into the normal U shape. Pan frying in 1/4 inch to 1/2 inch of oil will also work; be sure not to let the tortilias stiffen prior to being bent into the normal U shape. #Place hot beef into a taco. To avoid cracks, it is important to do this first when using pre-made shells. The heat and moisture of the beef will soften up the bottom of the taco just enough to prevent cracking. #Place cheese onto the beef. The heat of the beef should slightly melt the cheese. You may wish to microwave the taco a bit, especially if the cheese is cold or if you are using low-fat cheese. #Place chopped olives, tomatoes, and any other vegatables onto the cheese.
==Variation== The beef and taco shell may be cooked together in a deep fat fryer. For this, you will need to use plain uncooked corn tortilas and finely shredded or shaved beef. Wrap the beef in the tortilla, making a tube shape with enough air space to let hot oil get in. You must ensure that the beef gets properly cooked. You may wish to start from partially cooked and hot beef for safety. With the beef, you may include any vegetables that are tolerant of high heat. Serve these rolled tacos side-by-side on a plate with the heat-sensitive ingredients simply placed on top. Consider pre-melting the cheese.
==Variation== Tacos, [[Cookbook:Egg Roll|egg rolls]], and [[Cookbook:Tamale|tamales]] have similar construction. The fillings and shells can be interchanged as desired.
[[Category:Beef recipes|Taco]] [[Category:Southwestern recipes|Taco]] [[Category:Mexican recipes|Taco]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|United States]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] '''Apple Crisp''' is a [[Cookbook:Dessert|dessert]] made up of a [[Cookbook:Baking|baked]] [[Cookbook:Apple|apple]] filling and a crispy crumb topping. It is similar to '''[[Cookbook:Cobbler|cobbler]]''', which has a [[Cookbook:Biscuit|biscuit]]-like ([[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|USA]] biscuit that is) or [[Cookbook:Cake|cake]]-like topping. Cool room temperature is required to create a nice crisp topping. To serve '''Apple Crisp''', spoon it into a bowl and, optionally, add [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] [[Cookbook:Vanilla Ice Cream|ice cream]]. '''Apple Crisp''' also goes well with a glass of [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]]. ==Ingredients== *6 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] sliced and cored [[Cookbook:Apple|baking apples]] (for example, Granny Smith) *1/2 cup (100g) all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *1/2 cup (100g) [[Cookbook:rolled oats|rolled oats]] *3/4 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] (3g) [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] *1/3 cup (75g) cold [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] or cold [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] *2/3 to 3/4 cup (120-150g) [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] ==Procedure== #In a medium bowl stir together flour, brown sugar, and oatmeal. If the room temperature is a bit warm, you should cool this mixture. #Prepare the apples. This should be completed before mixing butter into the topping. It is helpful to choose apples that do not brown quickly; Granny Smith apples are a good choice. Do not use Red Delicious apples; they turn to mush. Place the apples into a 9-inch square baking dish; glass is best. #Add the butter or margarine to the topping. Mix it via a slicing action, so that the butter or margarine forms tiny little chunks and does not melt or smear. A pair of butter knives, used like scissors, is good for this. You must work quickly once you start this step. #Sprinkle the filling onto the apples. You may pat it down just a bit. #Bake for about 30 minutes in a [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|375°F]] oven. Do not remove the crisp before the top is dark brown. Black spots indicate burning. It is better to burn a few small spots, which you can then remove, than to risk undercooking the topping. == Alternate Recipe == * 4 cups apples, sliced * 1 Tablespoon lemon juice * 1/3 cup flour * 1/2 cup brown sugar * 1 cup rolled oats * 1/2 teaspoon salt * 1 teaspoon cinnamon * 1/4 cup melted margarine or butter Put apples in shallow 8 inch pan. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Combine all dry ingredients with butter and mix until crumbly. Sprinkle all this over apples and bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes. Serves: 8 ==Other Alternate Recipe== * 5 cups of apples
* 3/4 cup brown sugar
* 3/4 cup oats
* 1/2 cup flour
* 1/4 pound butter
* 1 tsp cinnamon
* 1/2 tsp salt
* lemon to taste
* 1/3 cup water
* 1/4 tsp nutmeg
Preheat a conventional oven to 350° Fahrenheit / 180° Celsius. Thinly slice the apples and place them in a buttered pan, and sprinkle them with lemon for flavor and to prevent them from turning brown. Peeling the apples is traditional, but not required. Add 1/3 cup of water and cinnamon to taste.
Meanwhile, to make the topping combine the butter, sugar, oats, flour, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg, and crumble the ingredients in a bowl with your fingers to create a uniform mixture. Cover the apples with the topping and bake for 30-45 minutes or until the apples are soft and the topping is crisped. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream. Loose oats can be sprinkled sparingly on the surface of the topping before baking for added texture. ==Notes, tips, and variations== *Any type of apple may be used, baking or sweet, or a mixture of types. *Cooked apple dishes are a good use for substandard apples, eg damaged, wrinkled & windfall. *Crisps can be made with most any sort of fruit. [[Cookbook:Pineapple|Pineapple]] is a good choice. *Some fruits, especially peaches, go better in a [[Cookbook:Cobbler|cobbler]]. *Raisins can be added to the apples at the beginning, and 1/2 teaspoon of powdered ginger, or a sprinkling of nutmeg can also be put in. *'Mixed spice' (cinnamon, coriander, clove & other spices) is a perfect addition to apple dishes. This is more popular in Britain than the US. [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Apple recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Germany|German Cuisine]]
'''Strudel''' - I learnt this version from my exchange hosts in Germany. Serve warm with ice cream.
==Ingredients== *4 fresh apples, preferably red. *1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon *1/2 cup sultanas and raisin mix *2 tablespoons white sugar *1/2 cup melted butter *filo pastry sheets
==Procedure== #Preheat oven to 200 degrees Celsius. #Peel, core and cube apples. #Combine apples, sultanas, raisins, cinnamon and sugar. Mix well. #Generously brush filo pastry sheets with butter. #Spread apple mixture over pastry sheet. #Alternate with two layers of filo pastry for every layer of apple mixture. #Brush with melted butter. #Bake for 30 minutes or until pastry is golden brown.
==Notes, tips and variations== *For more tartness, substitute for 3 red apples and 1 green apple. *If you are unable to obtain ground cinnamon, substitute for cinnamon powder.
[[Category:German recipes|Strudel]] [[Category:Pastry recipes|Strudel]] [[Category:Apple recipes|Strudel]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|Strudel]]
