revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Breakfast|Breakfast]] | [[Cookbook:Omelet Recipes|Omelet recipes]]
The Spanish tortilla is one of the best-known Spanish dishes, and it would be very rare to find a tapas bar that does not offer the Spanish tortilla. This tapa is versatile, and other ingredients such as mushrooms, tomatoes, and peppers can be added to create variety. The Spanish tortilla can be served warm or cold, and is often topped with mayonnaise or tomato sauce.
==Ingredients== *1[[Cookbook:Pound|lb]]/450[[Cookbook:g|g]] waxy [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]] *1 large white/Spanish [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] (optional) *About 1 [[Cookbook:L|liter]] of [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] - ''Olive oil is best'' *6 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] *pinch [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
== Recipe == #Peel and slice potatoes. The slices should be quite thin. #Meanwhile, heat the oil on a low heat in a large [[Cookbook:Sauté Pan|sauté pan]] #Add the potatoes to the sauté pan, and fry until soft and cooked through, but '''not browned'''. This can take quite a while - don't rush it. It is a good idea to keep the pan covered - that way the steam from the potatoes at the bottom of the pan helps cook the ones at the top. #Slice the onion thinly. [[Cookbook:Frying|Fry]] it lightly in [[Cookbook:Frying Pan|frying pan]], stirring frequently for a few minutes or until sweet. Or you can simply add them to the potatoes for the last five minutes of cooking. #Beat the eggs in a large bowl and add salt #Add the hot cooked potatoes and onion to the egg in the bowl, gently mix the potatoes and onion into the egg and leave it for five minutes. This starts the egg cooking and helps cover the potato slices in egg so it all sticks together nicely. #Drain oil, and reserve oil for another time. #Pour the potatoes, onion and egg mix back into the pan, and cook for about 5 minutes on a low heat. Keep the pan moving so the mix doesn't stick to the pan. A non-stick pan makes this much easier. #When the edge of the tortilla looks cooked place a large, flat plate over the pan (like a lid), put one hand on the plate to hold it in place and turn the whole thing over (the first few times you do this it is best do this over the sink - can be very messy) # You should now have an up-side-down omelette on your plate - cooked on top - raw underneath. Check the pan is clean and scrape any bits that have stuck in the pan off and add a bit of oil if it is looking dry. Now slide the omelette back into the pan to cook the bottom. #Cook for another few minutes, #Repeat the turning trick a couple of times (practice makes perfect) to make sure it is cooked evenly. #Then serve onto large plate, cut into wedges, and serve with more [[Cookbook:Tapa|tapas]]. Sliced tomatoes, fresh bread and mayo make it into a great meal.
{{Wikipedia|Spanish tortilla}}
[[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Potato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Omelette recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Spanish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|Cuisine of the United States]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
These cookies can be considered '''gingerbread cookies''', and originally were named as such. They resemble the '''molasses cookies''' made by Archway; they use relatively little [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] and are thus not as spicy hot as gingerbread cookies from many other recipes. They are usually somewhat soft and not at all gooey, being halfway between crumbly and chewy. They are generally not crisp, but can be slightly crisp if thoroughly cooked. The recipe works for both drop cookies and rolled cookies, with a bit of adjustment to the amount of flour.
The known history of this recipe starts from [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eavesdropping eavesdropping] on a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Party_line party-line] telephone during the early 1900s. The age of this recipe appears to explain many odd features. At the time, [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] did not exist. Thus this recipe uses [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]], with [[Cookbook:Sour Milk|sour milk]] (now created via [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]], so don't panic) as the acid. Ginger would have been expensive. The recipe originally called for an undefined amount of [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] that turned out to be around 8 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (1/2 [[Cookbook:Gallon|gallon]]), which would feed a family of a dozen or so. The recipe has been cut in half for the benefit of less-productive parents.
==Ingredients==
[[Image:Molasses-Cookies-2006March09.JPG|thumb|right|200px|Molasses cookies made from this recipe.]]
*1/2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|T]] [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]] *1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|c]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] (minus 1/2 T for the vinegar) *1/2 c [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *1/2 c [[Cookbook:Shortening|shortening]] (see ''variation'' below if substitution is desired) *1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] *1 c [[Cookbook:Molasses|molasses]] *4 c [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] (approximate upper limit; see instructions below) *2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|t]] [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] *1/4 t [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] *1/4 t [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] *toppings: [[Cookbook:Walnut|walnuts]], [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisins]], etc.
==Procedure==
[[Image:Molasses-Cookies-In-Progress-2006March09.JPG|thumb|right|200px|In progress: the drop variety, with about 3c flour total, being pressed with a sugar-covered clay stamp.]]
#Grease some [[Cookbook:Cookie Sheet|cookie sheets]]. #Prepare 3 mixtures: #*the vinegar, plus enough milk to make 1/2 c (alternately, use real sour milk) #*the baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, and 2.5 c (not all 4 c) of flour #*the sugar and shortening creamed together, then also adding in the egg and molasses (use a large bowl) #To the sugar+shortening+egg+molasses mixture, alternately mix in small amounts of the other two mixtures until everything is in one bowl. Mix this well. #Bit by bit, mix in more flour as needed. For drop cookies, you might not add any more. For rolled cookies produced without refrigeration, you are likely to need an extra 1.5 c for a total of 4 c. Refrigeration can reduce this slightly. #Form the cookies #*If making drop cookies, plop some batter onto a cookie sheet. Using a bit of sugar to prevent sticking, squish the cookie with a glass. Push some walnut pieces into the top of the cookie. #*If making rolled cookies, you may wish to refrigerate the batter. Plop a [[Cookbook:Pint|pint]]-sized blob of batter onto a flour-dusted surface. Dust the top of the dough with flour as you squish it down, then roll it out. A cold marble [[Cookbook:Rolling Pin|rolling pin]] is suggested. Cut out shapes, then place them on the cookie sheet. The unused dough may be put back into the mix; note that this increases the proportion of flour. #Cook for 8 to 10 minutes at [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|375°F]]
==Variation== [[Cookbook:Butter|Butter]] seems to work OK in place of the [[Cookbook:Shortening|shortening]], with a bit of heating to soften it up. In a 1-[[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] package with 4 sticks, 1 stick is about 1/2 c. [[Cookbook:Lard|Lard]] should be an even better substitute.
[[Category:Cookie recipes|Molasses Cookies]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|Molasses Cookies]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Ginger recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Molasses recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Featured recipe candidate|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|3-4|prep: 15 minutes
cooking: 1 hour}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat|Meat]] '''Crispy chicken''' is [[Cookbook:Marinating|marinated]] and breaded [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]]. ==Ingredients== *4 bone-in [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] thighs *1/3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Italian Dressing|Italian dressing]] *1 1/2 to 2 cups [[Cookbook:bread crumbs|bread crumbs]] ==Directions== #Remove the skin and fat from 4 large chicken thighs (bone-in) with kitchen shears. #Place thighs in a container with a sealing lid with 1/3 cup Italian dressing. Shake. #If you have the time, allow this to marinate for extra flavor. #While chicken marinates, put 1 cup (Italian) bread crumbs in a medium bowl. #Put marinated chicken thighs (one at a time) in the bowl and coat the them with crumbs, adding extra bread crumbs as needed. #Place breaded chicken on a cookie sheet or other baking pan and cook (on the center rack) at [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. for 45 to 55 minutes (until bread crumbs are browned). ==Tip== For easy clean-up, put parchment paper between the chicken and the pan. [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|4 persons|15-20 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Soup|Soup]]
'''Hot and Sour Soup''' is a popular soup served at Chinese restaurants in the United States. This version tastes exactly like that served at various Chinese restaurants in California.
==Ingredients== For the soup: * 4 cups of [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Stock|stock or broth]] (or 4 cups water and 4 chicken bouillon cubes) * 3 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] cooked shredded chicken or [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]] * 1/2 cup [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushrooms]], diced * 1/2 tablespoon garlic chili sauce * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] ground white [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 1/4 cup white [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]] * 1/3 cup canned [[Cookbook:Bamboo Shoots|bamboo shoots]], [[Cookbook:Julienne|julienned]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Ounce|oz]] block of [[Cookbook:Tofu|tofu]], cut into 1/4 inch dice * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Cornstarch|cornstarch]] and 2 tablespoons cold water * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]], beaten * 2 [[Cookbook:Scallion|green onion]] stalks, diced (including tops) * 1/2 teaspoon toasted [[Cookbook:Sesame Oil|sesame oil]]
==Procedure==
# Bring chicken broth to a simmer in a 2-quart saucepan. # Add soy sauce, shredded meat, mushrooms and garlic chili sauce. # Simmer for five minutes. # Add white pepper, white vinegar, bamboo shoots, tofu. # Simmer for five minutes. # Combine two tablespoons of cornstarch with two tablespoons of cold water in a cup. Stir until mixture is smooth. Add cornstarch mixture to soup and stir well. # Simmer for five minutes until soup is thickened. # Beat egg in a cup until yolk and white are combined. Pour beaten egg slowly, in a fine stream into soup. Stir soup several times. # Wait 30 seconds. # Add green onions and sesame oil to soup. Stir well. Remove from heat. # Serve hot.
Makes 4 servings.
==Notes, tips, and variations== * Adjust vinegar, ground white pepper, garlic chili sauce and soy sauce to taste. American vinegar is much more acidic than its Chinese counterpart, so start with very little and add slowly. * Add or remove mushrooms, bamboo shoots, or tofu as needed. These three ingrediants don't add much to the taste, mostly they add to the texture of the soup.
[[Category:Soup recipes|Hot and Sour Soup]] [[Category:Chinese recipes|Hot and Sour Soup]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|Hot and Sour Soup]]

revision.comment: /* Notes, tips and variations */ corrected misspelling of "whisk"
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Salad Dressing recipes|6 (1/4 cup each)|10 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Salad Recipes|Salad Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Appetizers|Appetizers]] | [[Cookbook:California cuisine|California cuisine]]
'''French Dressing''' is a salad dressing commonly used with green salads. It can also be used as a sandwich spread, or many other uses. A commercial version is also called "Catalina Dressing".
==Ingredients== *2/3 cup Ketchup *3/4 cup granulated sugar *1/2 cup white wine vinegar *1/2 cup vegetable oil *1/4 cup minced onion *2 teaspoons Paprika *2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Worcestershire Sauce|Worcestershire sauce]]
Makes about 1 1/2 cups of dressing.
==Procedure== #Combine all ingredients in a food processor or blender, and process until smooth. The goal is to have a redish-orange smooth sauce. #Pour the sauce into a bowl and chill covered in the refregerator for at least 30 minutes prior to use.
==Notes, tips and variations== * Instead of using the blender, whisk the ingredients in a bowl.
==Warnings== * Keep refregerated
[[Category:Californian recipes|French Dressing]] [[Category:Salad Dressing recipes|French Dressing]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Breakfast|Breakfast]]
'''Chipped beef on toast''' is slivers of meat in a creamy [[Cookbook:Sauce|sauce]], served on [[Cookbook:Toast|toasted bread]]. In military slang it is commonly referred to as "Shit On a Shingle" (SOS). [[Cookbook:Chipped Beef|Chipped beef]] is a dried, smoked, and salted meat product, generally sold wadded up in jars or flat in plastic packets.
The 1910 edition of the ''Manual for Army Cooks'' provides the following recipe, for a quantity sufficient for 60 men.
This recipe left out an important step---soaking the beef to reduce the salt content. Later recipes were creamier. See http://www.seabeecook.com/cookery/cooking/cooking_sos.htm
==Ingredients==
*15 [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] (6.8[[Cookbook:Kg|kg]]) [[Cookbook:Chipped Beef|chipped beef]] *1 pound (450[[Cookbook:Gram|g]]) of [[Cookbook:Fat|fat]], [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] preferred *1¼ [[Cookbook:Pound|lbs]] (560g) of [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *2 12-oz cans of [[Cookbook:Condensed milk|evaporated milk]] *1 bunch [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]] *¼ [[Cookbook:Ounce|oz]] (7g) [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] *6 [[Cookbook:Quart|quarts]] (6[[Cookbook:Liter|l]]) [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] [[Cookbook:Stock|stock]]
==Procedure==
# Brown the flour in the melted fat. # Dissolve the milk in the beef stock, and then add that to the pot. # Stir this together slowly to prevent lumping, and then add the beef. # Cook for a few minutes, add the parsley, and serve over toast.
[[Category:Beef recipes]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Beverage recipes|one 16 ounce drink|< 30 minutes|1|Image=[[Image:Pearl Milktea.jpg|300px]]}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisines|Cuisines]] | [[Cookbook:East Asian cuisines|East Asian cuisines]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine_of_Taiwan|Cuisine of Taiwan]]
'''Bubble Tea''' - a tea beverage with tapioca pearl (dark black balls) mixed in.
==Ingredients== *½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] cooked bubble tea ([[Cookbook:Tapioca Pearls|tapioca]]) pearls: cook pearls according to the instruction on the package *1 cup crushed [[Cookbook:ice|ice]] *1 cup very strong chilled black [[Cookbook:Tea|tea]] *1 cup homogenized [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]], or to taste *[[Cookbook:Honey|honey]] or [[Cookbook:Granulated_Sugar|granulated sugar]], to taste
==Procedure== #Place pearls in a large parfait glass, #Combine all remaining ingredients in a cocktail shaker, #Shake vigorously until mixture is frothy #Pour into glass and serve with large-diameter straws. You can just combine all the ingredients together without shaking it vigorously if you don't want it frothy or bubble.
Makes a 16 [[Cookbook:Fluid Ounce|ounce]] (473 [[Cookbook:mL|mL]]) drink. Note however, that the ingredients total up to at least 28 ounces (828 mL).
[[Category:Beverage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tapioca recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Taiwanese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Taiwanese recipes|3|<30 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisines|Cuisines]] | [[Cookbook:East Asian cuisines|East Asian cuisines]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine_of_Taiwan|Cuisine of Taiwan]]
'''Tea Eggs'''
==Ingredients== *6 chicken eggs *4 cups of water *3 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbl.]] of Jasmine green tea *1/4 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbl.]] of dark soy sauce *1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp.]] chopped ginger *1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp.]] of chopped garlic
==Procedure== #Bring water and spices to a boil #Drop eggs and boil for 3 minutes #Reduce to simmer and simmer for 1 hour #Reduce to low heat and allow eggs to sit in brine until served.
[[Category:Tea recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Taiwanese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Egg recipes||20 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Estonia|Estonian Cuisine]]
==Ingredients== *3 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] *4 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], softened *[[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]]
==Procedure== [[Image:Chopped-egg-butter.jpg|thumb|Eggs and butter before mixing]] #Hard-boil the eggs (about 10 minutes). #Chop the eggs into small pieces (larger pieces of egg white often fail to mix with butter). #Mix chopped eggs with butter. #Add salt and pepper.
Use as sandwich spread.
[[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Estonian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meat]]
'''Chicken Parmesan''' is a classic Italian dish, which is wonderful served over [[Cookbook:pasta|pasta]] or on a [[Cookbook:Sandwiches|sandwich]]. This is a fairly simple recipe made mostly with ingredients already on hand.
Serves 4.
==Ingredients==
* 6 [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken breast halves]] flattened to ½" thickness * ½ cup [[Cookbook:All-purpose flour|all purpose flour]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 1½ cups Italian seasoned [[Cookbook:Bread Crumb|bread crumbs]] * ½ cup grated [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|Parmesan cheese]], divided * ½ tsp [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ½ tsp [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]], fresh ground if possible * [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 1 16 oz jar [[Cookbook:Spaghetti Sauce|spaghetti sauce]] (or make it fresh) * 1 package sliced [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|mozzarella cheese]]
==Procedure== # Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). # Mix the breadcrumbs, salt, black pepper, and half the Parmesan cheese in a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. # [[Cookbook:Beat|Beat]] the eggs in a small bowl. # On the stove, heat olive oil in a large [[Cookbook:Frying Pan|frying pan]] over medium-high heat # Take each chicken breast and dip it into the flour, then into the eggs, then into the breadcrumb mixture. Make sure to coat it thoroughly. # [[Cookbook:Pan fry|Pan fry]] the chicken breasts lightly in the olive oil until brown on both sides. You do not need to cook them through, just [[Cookbook:brown|brown]] them. Once brown, the breadcrumbs should stick to the outside. # Pour half a jar of pasta sauce into a shallow [[Cookbook:baking dish|baking dish]], then lay the chicken out in the pan. Pour the rest of the sauce on top. # Dust the remaining grated Parmesan cheese over the chicken. # Place the dish in the oven and cook for 30 minutes at 350°F (175°C). # Remove and add a slice of mozzarella cheese to each chicken breast. # Return to the oven for 10 more minutes to melt the mozzarella. # Serve with [[Cookbook:pasta|pasta]].
[[Category:Chicken recipes|Chicken Parmesan]] [[Category:Italian recipes|Chicken Parmesan]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] flour * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] baking powder * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] baking soda * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] salt * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] sugar * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] milk * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] oil * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] vanilla * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] apple cider vinegar
==Procedure== {| style="float: right; margin-left: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; width: 242px; border: #99B3FF solid 1px" | {{Vegetarian recipe (milk)}} |} # Preheat oven to 232° Celsius (450° Fahrenheit) and oil an eight-inch oven-safe skillet. # Combine dry ingredients: flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar. # Add the milk, oil, and vanilla; stir well. # Stir in the apple cider vinegar, mix well, and pour immmediately into the skillet. # Bake at 232° Celsius (450° Fahrenheit) for 18 to 20 minutes, and serve.
==Notes== When a toothpick is inserted into the completed product, it should come out clean.
==External links== '''Wikipedia:''' [[Wikipedia:Pancake|pancake]]
[[Category:Breakfast recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pancake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Salad|Salad]]
==Ingredients==
=== Salad ===
* 6 Tomatoes, chopped and diced * 1 Red onion, diced * 1 White onion, diced * Spring onion, chopped finely * Sliced black olives * Lebanese cucumber, peeled and diced
=== Dressing ===
* 1 tsp vinegar * Squirt lemon juice * Ground black pepper to taste * Sea salt to taste
== Procedure ==
# Mix all salad ingredients together. # In a separate bowl, mix dressing ingredients. # Stir dressing into salad.
Serve with flat bread and [[Cookbook:Feta Cheese|feta cheese]].
[[Category:Salad recipes|Tomato and Onion Salad]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|Tomato and Onion Salad]] [[Category:Onion recipes|Tomato and Onion Salad]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Greece|Greek Cuisine]]
'''Spanakopita''' is a [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Greece|Greek]] ''spinach pie''. This recipe serves 8. [[Image:Spanokopita_cropped.jpg|right|thumb|250 px|a slice of Spanakopita.]]
==Ingredients== *2 [[Cookbook:Pound|lbs.]] fresh [[Cookbook:Spinach|spinach]] (or equivalent amount frozen, thawed, and drained) *1 large [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], finely chopped *¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|C]] extra virgin [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] *1 C [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Green onion|scallions]] *½ C [[Cookbook:Mincing|minced]] fresh [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]] *1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|T]] minced fresh [[Cookbook:Dill|dill]] *¼ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|t]] freshly ground [[Cookbook:Nutmeg|nutmeg]] *1 T [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] *¾ C crumbled [[Cookbook:Feta Cheese|feta cheese]] *¾ C small curd [[Cookbook:Cottage Cheese|cottage cheese]] *¼ C freshly grated [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|parmesan cheese]] *4 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]], beaten *12-20 sheets [[filo|phyllo pastry]] *⅔ C [[Cookbook:Ghee|clarified butter]]
==Procedure== *Remove large stems from spinach, wash, chop, lightly steam, drain, pressing out any liquid with the back of a spoon. *Place onions and oil in large skillet. Cook over medium heat until slightly tender. Add scallions and cook until limp. Remove from heat and stir in parsley, dill, and nutmeg. *To the skillet, add the cheeses, spinach, and lemon juice. Mix and add eggs. Mix again gently. *To assemble the Spanakopita, brush a shallow 9x12 inch baking dish with some of the clarified butter. Layer about 5 sheets of phyllo, one at a time, covering bottom of dish, sides, and draping over edges. Brush butter in between layers. Fill with half of spinach filling. Add 3-5 more phyllo sheets, brushing butter in between layers. Add remaining spinach filling and top with all remaining phyllo sheets, brushing butter between sheets. Roll up and create a lip with all overhanging phyllo sheets. crumble any broken sheet bits on top. Drizzle any remaining clarified butter over top. Bake for 45 min. at 350°F or 180°C. Spanakopita is done when puffed and golden. Let sit for 10 minutes before cutting and serving. *I usually double or triple this recipe and make 2 huge baking dishes. This is just as fabulous as a leftover. *Instead of phyllo pastry, my Greek mother-in-law taught me to use pizza dough purchased from the supermarket dairy section as a quick and delicious alternative.
[[Category:Greek recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pie recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Spinach recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Sandwich recipes|1|10-15 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Sandwiches|Sandwiches]]
The '''b'''acon, '''l'''ettuce and '''t'''omato sandwich, commonly referred to as the '''BLT''', is a classic sandwich that can be found almost everywhere.
==Ingredients== *[[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]], sliced in rashers *[[Cookbook:Lettuce|lettuce]], washed and shredded, torn, or in whole leaves *ripe [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]], sliced into thin disks *two slices of any type of [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]] *sandwich spread or condiments (e.g., [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]], [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]], [[Cookbook:cream cheese|cream cheese]], or [[Cookbook:mustard|mustard]], although mayonnaise is traditional) *ground [[Cookbook:black pepper|black pepper]], if desired
==Procedures== #[[Cookbook:Toasting|Toast]] the two slices of bread. #While the bread is toasting [[Cookbook:Broiling|broil]] or [[Cookbook:Frying|fry]] the bacon until crisp, taking care not to burn it. #Once the toasted bread is ready, spread with desired condiments. #Layer one slice of toast with the lettuce, tomato slices, and bacon. Add black pepper as desired. Top with other slice of toast. #Cut into triangles or halves as preferred. Serve immediately.
==Notes, tips, and variations== *The lettuce, if shredded, may be mixed with the mayonnaise before layering the toast. *The lettuce may be omitted, or another green substituted. [[Cookbook:watercress|Watercress]] is a nice addition. *You may add slivers of ripe [[Cookbook:avocado|avocado]] or raw or cooked red [[Cookbook:onion|onion]] to the sandwich, or may substitute them for the lettuce or tomato. *You may top the hot bacon in the sandwich with a slice of [[Cookbook:cheese|cheese]], such as [[Cookbook:muenster|muenster]] or [[Cookbook:pepper jack|pepper jack]]. *You may place a fried [[Cookbook:egg|egg]] in the sandwich. If the egg is fried over-easy or sunny-side-up, the egg's [[Cookbook:yolk|yolk]] may be broken just before serving so that it dresses the contents of the sandwich. *The slices of bread do not need to be toasted, although toast adds a nice texture. *You may spread the bread with [[Cookbook:peanut_butter|peanut butter]] for an interesting variation. *You may top the sandwich or its contents with [[Cookbook:Hollandaise_Sauce|hollandaise sauce]]. *Add [[Cookbook:ham|ham]], [[Cookbook:turkey|turkey]] and [[Cookbook:swiss cheese|swiss cheese]] for a BLT [[Cookbook:club_sandwich|club sandwich]]. *For a [[Cookbook:vegan|vegan]] variation on the BLT, use marinated and fried or grilled strips of [[Cookbook:tempeh|tempeh]] to substitute for the bacon. Vegetable protein-based false bacon products are also available in some grocery freezers. Use Nayonaise, a vegan mayonnaise substitute, in place of the mayo.
==Warnings== Take care when frying the bacon to avoid a grease fire. (Should one occur, '''do not''' douse the flames with water; instead, cover the pan tightly or heap with baking soda to smother the flames, and remove from the heat.)
==External links== *[http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/14574021/ Secrets to a perfect BLT sandwich: MSNBC.com] (contains photo of BLT)
[[Category:Bacon recipes|BLT Sandwich]] [[Category:Sandwich recipes|BLT Sandwich]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|BLT Sandwich]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Brazil|Brazilian Cuisine]]
==Ingredients==
* 3 [[Cookbook:Pound|lbs]] medium size [[Cookbook:Shrimp|shrimp]] * 3 lb [[Cookbook:Cassava|yuca root]] (cassava, manioc) * 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], chopped * 3 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], chopped * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 6 medium [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]], peeled and seeded (or a large can of whole tomatoes) * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]], chopped * 2 cups [[Cookbook:Coconut Milk|coconut milk]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Palm Oil|palm oil]] (also known as dendê) * add [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste
==Preparation==
#Peel and cut the manioc and put in a pan with cold water and salt. #Cook until tender, drain and reserve both the cooked manioc and the liquid. #Discard any manioc fiber. #Using a fork, mash the manioc while still hot. Use some of the liquid to help in the process. Do not use a blender or food processor. #Peel and de-vein the shrimp. #[[Cookbook:Sauté|Sauté]] the onion and garlic in the olive oil until wilted. #Add 1/2 of the chopped cilantro and the tomatoes, stirring well. #Add the 2½ lb. shrimp and cook it (about 15 minutes). #Add the [[Cookbook:Purée|puréed]] manioc. #Check the amount of liquid and add more of the reserved manioc liquid to thin the mixture, if necessary. #Add the coconut milk, the remaining cilantro and the palm oil. #Check for salt and pepper. #Serve over Brazilian white rice.
[[Category:Brazilian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Shrimp recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|Cuisine of the United States]]
==Ingredients== *6 [[Cookbook:Yam|yam]]s *1/2 cup [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] *1 cup [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] *2 tbs. [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla extract]] *1/4 cup water
==Instructions== #Preheat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|350 °F]] (175 °C). #[[Cookbook:Boil|Boil]] yams in skins until about half done. #Drain water from yams, remove skins, and cut in cubes. #Place cubes in a greased baking dish and dot with margarine. #Make a [[Cookbook:Syrup|syrup]] by boiling brown sugar, water, and vanilla together. Pour over the yams. #[[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] for 45 to 50 minutes, [[Cookbook:Basting|basting]] frequently with syrup. Cook until yams are tender.
==External links== * [[w:Candied yams|Original Wikipedia article]]
[[Category:Thanksgiving recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sweet potato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegan cuisine|Vegan Cuisine]]
This is a hearty vegetarian dish that can be eaten hot or cold and served as an entire meal. The recipe will feed four with leftovers and keeps for a week refrigerated.
== Ingredients ==
*1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] *1/4 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Mustard Seed|mustard seeds]] *1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Tumeric|tumeric]] *1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] dry brown [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]] *1 cup [[Cookbook:Mung Bean|mung beans]] (dry) *5-1/2 cups water *1-1/2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] *1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Curry Powder|curry powder]] *1/4 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] *1/4 teaspoon powdered [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] *1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
*1 cup finely chopped [[Cookbook:Cabbage|cabbage]] *1 cup chopped [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|green pepper]] *1 cup finely shredded [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrots]]
=== Marinade ===
*1-1/2 cups oil *1/3 cup [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] *1/2 teaspoon salt *1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] *1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Honey|honey]] *1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Basil|basil]] *1/4 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]] (ground)
== Preparation ==
#Heat the oil in a large pan. #Add the mustard seeds. #When they begin to pop add the turmeric and fold in the rice and beans until coated with oil. #Add the rest of the spices and water. #Simmer about 45 minutes, most of the water will be absorbed. #Remove from heat and add vegetables. #Make the marinade and pour mix in.
[[Category:Vegan recipes|Mung Beans and Brown Rice]] [[Category:Bean recipes|Mung Beans and Brown Rice]] [[Category:Rice recipes|Mung Beans and Brown Rice]] [[Category:Salad recipes|Mung Beans and Brown Rice]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of South Africa|South Africa]] | [[Cookbook:Sausage|Sausage]]
Atchar is a spicy condiment, often eaten with a curry. It comes from the Indian cuisine in South Africa. In India, it is spelled Achar, and the word means pickle in Hindi. Usually the atchar made in South Africa is made with unripe green mangoes and chillies. The whole mango is used for making atchar.
This traditional mango atchar is easily made at home. Adjust the amount of chillies to your liking and serve with a vegetable curry, or on a slice of white bread.
== Ingredients ==
* 1.5 kg unripe mangoes, chopped * 4 tsp garlic and herb salt * 3 Tbs chilli powder * 2 Tbs cumin powder * 1 Tbs ground coriander * 3 Tbs curry powder * 1.5 cups (360ml) raw honey or fructose * 2 cups (480ml) balsamic vinegar * 0.5 cup (120g) corn or potato flour * 2 Tbs mustard seeds * handful curry leaves * 1.5 cups (360ml) virgin olive oil or cold pressed sunflower oil
==Procedure== Simmer all the ingredients except the mangoes and the oil, until it thickens. Pour over the mangoes, add the oil, mix well, cool and refrigerate for at least 12 hours.
[[Category:Sauce recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Mango recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:South African recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
'''Simple Egg Noodles'''
==Ingredients== *1 whole [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] *1 cups [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *2 to 6 tablespoons of [[Cookbook:Water|water]] *1-2 teaspoon of [[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive oil]] (optional)
==Procedure==
On a smooth surface, heap flour. Push a hole in the center of the flour (it should look like a volcano). Break egg into flour (add oil now if you choose to do so - it will change the flavor and texture). Either knead with hands or mix with a fork. Slowly add water one teaspoon at a time while kneading the dough. You probably will not need all six tablespoons of water (though you may possibly need more). Knead dough until it has a consistant texture.
===Manually=== Divide dough into manageable sections. Select one section at a time and keep the rest covered. Roll each section to desired thickness and cut into noodles with a knife.
===Pasta Machine=== Divide dough into manageable sections. Select one section at a time and keep the rest covered. Roll dough through smooth rollers repeatedly at progressively thinner settings. When the dough reaches desired thickness, cut with grooved rollers.
==Use== These noodles can be laid out to dry for later use or dropped immediatly into a boiling pot of water. Cook to taste. They are good with a variety of sauces.
==Notes== I would recommend using a pasta machine as it drastically speeds up the process. Ingredients can be multiplied without changing the instructions. One tip for success, the drier you can keep the dough, the better it will come out. If the dough gets too wet it will stick to itself and cook down to one blob.
[[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Noodle recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{cookwork}} {{Recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Cuisine of Italy]]
'''Soup alla Lombarda''' ==Ingredients== * [[Cookbook:Soup|Clear soup]] * fowl [[Cookbook:Forcemeat|forcemeat]] * [[Cookbook:Bechamel|Bechamel]] (No. 3) * [[Cookbook:Peas|peas]] * [[Cookbook:Lobster butter|lobster butter]] * [[Cookbook:Eggs|eggs]] * [[Cookbook:Asparagus|asparagus]]
==Procedure== # Make a firm forcemeat of fowl and divide it into three parts. # To the first, add two spoonsful of cream Bechamel; to the second, four spoonfuls of [[Cookbook:Pureeing|puree]] of green peas; to the third, two spoonsful of lobster butter and the yolk of an egg. Thus you will have the Italian colours, red, white, and green. # [[Cookbook:Butter|Butter]] a pie dish and make little [[Cookbook:Quenelle|quenelle]]s of the forcemeat. # Just before serving, [[Cookbook:Boiling|boil]] them for four minutes in boiling stock, take them out carefully and put them in a warm soup tureen with two spoonfuls of cooked green peas and pour a very fresh clear soup over them.
Hand little [[Cookbook:Croutons|crouton]]s [[Cookbook:frying|fried]] in lobster butter separately.
{{decameron}}
[[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] | [[Cookbook:Cake|Cake]]
==Ingredients== === Frosting === *100g [[Cookbook:Powdered Sugar|icing sugar]] *50g [[Cookbook:Cream Cheese|cream cheese]] or creamy [[Cookbook:Cottage Cheese|cottage cheese]] *25g [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] or [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] *2.5ml [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla essence]]
=== Cake === *225g [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *225g grated [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrot]] *150g [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] or [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] *250g [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] *2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] *1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] *1.5 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] *1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] *some [[Cookbook:Raisins|raisins]] *nuts can also be added.
==Procedure== === Frosting === # Mix all ingredients together
=== Cake === # Melt the Butter and Sugar together, and mix with the dry ingredients. # Beat the egg and add it. # Stir until everything is well combined. # Cook at 180°C (355°F) for about 50 minutes in a greased tin with greaseproof paper on the bottom. # When cake has cooled, add Cream Cheese Icing
[[Category:Carrot recipes]] [[Category:Cake recipes]]

revision.comment: Undo revision 963164 by [[Special:Contributions/219.89.30.179|219.89.30.179]] ([[User talk:219.89.30.179|Talk]]) undid vandelism
revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italian Cuisine]]
'''Focaccia''' is a type of flat bread popular in Italy, but probably adopted from [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Greece|Greece]]. The basic bread is often topped with any of the following: [[Cookbook:Herbs|herbs]], [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]], [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]], [[Cookbook:Meat|meats]], and [[Cookbook:Vegetable|vegetables]], and can be seen as a precursor to pizza. Focaccia is commonly used for [[Cookbook:Sandwiches|sandwiches]].
Makes 1 loaf.
==Ingredients== [[Image:Focaccia.png|thumb|right|Focaccia bread]] * 3 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:White Sugar|white sugar]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] active dry [[Cookbook:Yeast|yeast]] * 1 cup water * 2 tablespoons vegetable [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 3 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 1 teaspoon dried [[Cookbook:Rosemary|rosemary]], crushed
==Procedure==
# Combine 1 cup flour, sugar, salt, and yeast. Mix well. # Heat water and vegetable oil until warm, and add to yeast mixture along with the egg. # Blend with an electric [[Cookbook:Mixer|mixer]] at low speed until moistened. [[Cookbook:Beating|Beat]] for 2 additional minutes. # Stir in 1 3/4 cup flour ('''note: half of total''') while beating, until dough pulls away from side of bowl. # Knead in 3/4 cup flour on floured surface. Cover dough with a bowl, and let sit for 5 minutes. # Place dough on a greased [[Cookbook:Baking Sheet|baking sheet]]. Roll out to 12-[[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] circle. Cover with greased plastic wrap and a cloth towel. Place in a warm place for 30 minutes. # Uncover dough, and poke holes in it with a spoon handle at 1 inch intervals. Drizzle olive oil on dough, and sprinkle with crushed rosemary. # Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven Temperatures|400°F (205°C)]] for 17 to 27 minutes, until just golden. Remove from baking sheet, and cool on rack.
[[Category:Bread recipes|Focaccia Bread]] [[Category:Italian recipes|Focaccia Bread]] [[Category:Featured recipes|Focaccia Bread]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Beverages|Beverages]]
[[Image:Milk clouds in tea.jpeg|thumb|right]] '''A nice cup of tea''' is the usual answer in [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United Kingdom|Britain]] and [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Ireland|Ireland]] to any everyday problem. Nothing is so bad that a nice cup of [[Cookbook:Tea|tea]] with a friend or family member can't make it better.
Here's a traditionalist view on how to make it, which shares much with an essay of the same name by George Orwell.
Use freshly drawn water and bring it to a boil in a kettle. Meanwhile, prepare your teapot. A stainless steel pot may be used, but earthenware is preferred. The pot should be warmed: add some hot water and let the warmth pervade the pot. Drain off the hot water, then add the tea. Remember to take the pot to the water, never the water to the pot. Whatever tea you use (and for proper emotional rescue you should use a strong Indian or Kenyan-based blend), do not use teabags. You need to let the tea leaves swim free and with teabags there will inevitably be a papery tinge to the taste. This rule is, however, widely broken.
[[Image:Tea bags.jpg|thumb|left|Use teabags for convenience...]] Measure tea according to the size of the teapot and the strength of tea you prefer. In a large teapot (serving four cups), two [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] will give a fairly weak tea, perhaps enough to console one for a lost umbrella on a rainy day, and four should be strong enough for being stood up on a Friday night. A broken heart may need six. Add the water as soon as it boils, and leave it to stand for five minutes (and no longer) before serving. Use a mug if you must, but a cup with a saucer is far more civilised.
[[Image:Lipton Earl Grey in tin.jpg|thumb|right|...Or the traditional loose leaves for best flavor.]] Traditionally you should add full-cream milk, but semi-skimmed will do. If you are familiar with the strength of tea you make and the size of the cups, you can follow the 'milk in first' technique. Otherwise, add milk to the tea, to ensure you get the right colour. Add sugar according to taste and the extent of the emotional crisis you are trying to overcome.
Serve with a biscuit or two, and prepare to feel much better.
[[Category:Irish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:English recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Beverage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
[[Image:Agedashi.jpg|right|frame|Agedashi tofu]]
'''Agedashi tofu''' (or '''''agedashi dofu''''') 揚げ出し豆腐 is a simple [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Japan|Japanese]] way to serve hot tofu. Silken (''kinugoshi'') firm tofu, cut into cubes, is lightly dusted with potato starch or cornstarch and then [[deep frying|deep fried]] until golden brown. It's then served in a hot tentsuyu broth made of dashi, mirin, and shoyu (Japanese soy sauce), and topped with finely chopped green onions or grated daikon. It is eaten with chopsticks.
==Ingredients== * 4-6 oz. soft [[Cookbook:Tofu|tofu]] * [[Cookbook:Cornstarch|cornstarch]] * [[Cookbook:Oil|Oil]] for [[Cookbook:Deep frying|deep frying]]
;Sauce: * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Dashi|dashi]] * 2 Tbs. [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] * 1½ Tbs. [[Cookbook:Mirin|mirin]]
;Condiments: * [[Cookbook:Green onion|green onion]]s, thinly sliced * Grated [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] * Grated [[Cookbook:Daikon|daikon]] (white radish)
==Procedure==
# Cut the soft tofu into rectangular pieces about 1" thick. # Arrange the layers on paper towels and leave for 10-15 minutes to drain. Change the paper and turn over the slices. # Mix sauce ingredients, heat in a pan until boiling. # Sprinkle cornstarch on a plate. Arrange the tofu slices on it. Sprinkle more cornstarch over the tofu. A powdered sugar shaker does a good job here. # Heat the oil to 355°F (180°C) for deep frying. # Pat any excess cornstarch off the tofu slices and slide them into the hot oil, one by one. Don't add too many slices at once, because tofu lowers the oil temperature. Fry until golden, turning once. # Remove and drain on paper towels. # Arrange in a compote-type dish, pour the sauce. Top with a mound of grated daikon, a bit of grated ginger, and sliced green onions.
==External links== {{wikipedia|Agedashi tofu}}
[[Category:Tofu recipes|Agedashi tofu]] [[Category:Japanese recipes|Agedashi tofu]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
'''Portobello mushrooms''' are large mushrooms that can be prepared as a vegetarian entrée. They can substitute for [[Cookbook:hamburger|hamburger]] patties, or be eaten alone.
==Ingredients== * One large [[Cookbook:Mushroom|Portobello mushroom]] per person * [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|Olive oil]]
==Simple Grilling Preparation== * Remove stems from the mushrooms, wash and dry. * Brush with olive oil. * [[Cookbook:Grilling|Grill]] for about 10 minutes, alternating sides, until both sides are grill-marked.
* When cooking on a barbecue mixing the oil with a water based liquid (e.g. balsamic vinegar) will cause the fire to flare more and give the food more flavour, baste them as they cook. Adding other flavours such as garlic and chilli works well. If you are in a hurry, just use vinaigrette dressing.
==External Links== * [http://www.gourmetsleuth.com/portobellosportabellas.htm GourmetSleuth article]
[[Category:Mushroom recipes]] [[Category:Vegan recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Salad recipes|4|40 minutes|4}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Indonesia|Indonesian Cuisine]]
'''Gado-gado''' is a [[Cookbook:Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Cookbook:Salad|salad]] with a [[Cookbook:Peanut Sauce|peanut sauce]] [[Cookbook:Dressing|dressing]].
== Ingredients ==
* For the salad: ** mixed vegetables ([[Cookbook:Cabbage|cabbage]], [[Cookbook:Bean Sprout|bean sprouts]], [[Cookbook:Cucumber|cucumber]], [[Cookbook:Chayote|chayote]], [[Cookbook:Water spinach|water spinach]], yardlong bean, [[Cookbook:Spinach|spinach]]). [[Cookbook:Cauliflower|Cauliflower]], [[Cookbook:Green Bean|green beans]], [[Cookbook:Watercress|watercress]], [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrots]], [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]]es, or [[Cookbook:Pea|peas]] are sometimes included but less common. ** [[Cookbook:Potato|potato]]es ** [[Cookbook:Deep frying|deep fried]] [[Cookbook:Tofu|soybean cake]] ** deep fried [[Cookbook:Tempeh|tempeh]] ** boiled [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]]s ** deep fried [[Cookbook:Kerupuk|kerupuk]] (fish or prawn crackers) ** deep fried [[Cookbook:Shallot|shallot]]
* For the [[Cookbook:Peanut Sauce|peanut sauce]] (4 servings): ** 300 gr [[Cookbook:Peanut|peanut]]s ** 1 clove [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] ** 4 [[Cookbook:Shallot|shallot]] ** 1 gr [[Cookbook:Terasi|terasi]] (fermented prawn paste) ** 125 gr [[Cookbook:Gula Jawa|Gula Jawa]] (Indonesian Palm Sugar) ** [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] ** fresh or dried [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chili pepper]] ** fresh [[Cookbook:Lime|lime]] juice, or [[Cookbook:Rice vinegar|rice vinegar]]
== Procedure == For the [[Cookbook:Peanut_Sauce|peanut sauce]] #[[Cookbook:Frying|Fry]] prawn paste with cooking oil until fragrant #[[Cookbook:Frying|Fry]] the peanuts until golden brown, remove from the pan and leave to cool, and drain off all but a little of the excess oil #[[Cookbook:Grinding|Grind]] the peanuts to make paste # Add [[Cookbook:Grinding|ground]] fresh chili pepper, garlic, salt, brown sugar and prawn paste to the peanut paste, grind to mix # Put peanut paste in a pan, add some water to dissolve (use [[Cookbook:Coconut Milk|coconut milk]] for richer taste) # Add some sugar into the peanut sauce to taste and bring to the boil # [[Cookbook:Simmering|Simmer]] peanut sauce until thick and season with the lemon or lime juice.
For the salad # [[Cookbook:Boiling|Hard-boil]] the eggs and [[Cookbook:Slicing|slice]] # [[Cookbook:Steam|Steam]] or [[Cookbook:Boiling|boil]] the potatoes then remove the skin # Deep fry the boiled potatoes until golden brown, then slice # Wash, shred or [[Cookbook:Chop|chop]] cabbage, spinach and water spinach # Boil water in a pan, put cabbage in boiling water until cooked, strain # Use strained boiling water, boil spinach and water spinach, one after another, strain # [[Cookbook:Blanching|Blanche]] bean sprout for about 30 seconds, strain # Peel chayote, wash, slice, and boil until tender # Wash then slice cucumber # Place the salad, sliced potatoes, fried tofu, fried tempeh, and eggs in a large plate, either randomly or in layers # Pour the peanut sauce over the salad # Spread deep fried shallots on top and serve with kerupuk.
== Notes, tips, and variations == * Prawn crackers are non-vegetarian. You can substitute them with ''kerupuk sayur'' or ''emping'' if you wish this dish to be completely vegetarian. * Put some ''kecap manis'' (Malay/Indonesian sweet [[Cookbook:Soy sauce|soy sauce]]) to taste. * You may substitute the [[Cookbook:Peanut Sauce|peanut sauce]] recipe for the procedure here. * [[Cookbook:Cashew nuts|cashew nuts]] is secret ingredient to make peanut sauce tastes richer. * Some cooks like to [[Cookbook:Blanching|blanche]] or [[Cookbook:Steaming|steam]] the cabbage, cauliflower, and carrots rather than serve them raw. * Use chunky [[Cookbook:Peanut_Butter|peanut butter]] as substitute for ground peanuts. * Use [[Cookbook:Chili Sauce|chili sauce]] to subsitute fresh or dried [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chili pepper]].
{{wikipedia|gado-gado}}
[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Gado-gado]] [[Category:Peanut recipes|Gado-gado]] [[Category:Salad recipes|Gado-gado]] [[Category:Indonesian recipes|Gado-gado]]
[[id:Resep:Gado Gado]]

{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|2|30 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|US Cuisine]]
'''Chicken Parmigiana''' is a popular [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italian]]-[[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American]] dish served in a variety of ways. The same basic recipe works for a number of dishes. The components usually consists of a breaded, tenderized piece of [[Cookbook:Meat|meat]] (or slice of [[Cookbook:Eggplant|eggplant]]), a simple [[Cookbook:Marinara Sauce|marinara sauce]], and [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]] (usually [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|mozzarella]]). A thicker [[Cookbook:Pasta|pasta]], such as linguini, a toasted loaf of Italian [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]], and a light red wine such as Chianti compliment this dish well.
This recipe is typical of the parmigiana recipes from New York and New Jersey.
==Ingredients== * 2 [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] breasts * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] of [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 teaspoon of [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] powder * 1/2 a teaspoon of dried [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]] * 1/4 teaspoon of dried [[Cookbook:Basil|basil]] * 1/4 teaspoon of finely crushed [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|black pepper]] * 1/2 a [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] of All-Purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1/2 a cup of [[Cookbook:Tomato Puree|tomato puree]] * 1/4 cup of [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Stock|stock]] * 1/2 a cup of [[Cookbook:Canola Oil|canola oil]] (see below if you wish to use [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]]) * 1/2 a cup of shredded [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|mozzarella cheese]] * 1/4 a cup of grated [[Cookbook:Parmigiana Cheese|parmigiana cheese]]
==Preparation== #In a heavy [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] (preferrably cast iron), heat the oil on medium heat. #While the oil is heating, use a [[Cookbook:Tenderizing Mallet|tenderizing mallet]] (or the ball of your hand) to pound the chicken breasts to about 1/2 an [[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] of thickness. This step is important to ensure the chicken is tender and more importantly to ensure the chicken cooks thoroughly. # Season the chicken breasts with salt and garlic powder. # [[Cookbook:Dredging|Dredge]] the breasts in flour and shake off any excess. # Place both breasts in the heated oil for 3 minutes, then flip and [[Cookbook:Frying|fry]] for an additional 2 minutes. # Remove the breasts and place on a rack or paper towel. # Turn on an [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]], set for [[Cookbook:Broiling|broiling]]. # In a large oven-safe [[Cookbook:Saucepan|sauce pan]], heat the tomato puree and chicken stock until it begins to [[Cookbook:Simmer|simmer]]. # Add the oregano, basil, and pepper to sauce pan and mix # Place cooked chicken breasts in pan and flip a number of times to coat with sauce. # Add mozzarella and parmigiana cheese to the tops of the breasts. # Place in oven for 30-60 seconds. It will burn very quickly so check it frequently. # Remove from oven and serve.
==Tips== * Use thin-sliced chicken cutlets (available at most supermarkets) to avoid the BIG mess and time of pounding. * If pasta is to be served with this meal, it should be timed so that the parmigiana is done right when the pasta is. The pasta should be removed directly from the pot and placed into the pan. The remaining sauce can then be used with the pasta. * This recipe works best with breasts that come from slightly older chickens (such as broiler or fryer chickens). These chickens have a stronger taste but are generally tougher. The tenderizing step takes care of the toughness of the older birds though. * If you do not live in area where fresh tomatoes are grown, canned tomatoes are usually superior to the low-cost ones you will find in the super market. * Tomato puree goes bad very quickly (even in the fridge). Freezing the tomato puree in chunks allows for long-term storage.
==Variations and Varieties== * For [[Cookbook:Veal|veal]] parmigiana, follow the same steps except do not tenderize. Veal is already tender enough. The veal can also be cooked for 2 minutes on each side. * Omit the tenderizing step for [[Cookbook:Eggplant|eggplant]] parmigiana. * If you want to use fresh garlic instead of powder, add it to the sauce instead of adding it to the chicken breast. * You can also try using other types of [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italian]] [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheeses]] such as [[Cookbook:Provolone Cheese|provolone cheese]] or [[Cookbook:Fortina Cheese|fortina cheese]] to add more of a "tasty kick" compared to a mild cheese like mozzarella * You may wish to use [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]]. When frying with olive oil, be sure to use a cheap solvent-extracted grade! The fancy grades can not tolerate heat. They have [[Cookbook:Smoke Point|smoke points]] as low as 200°F (93°C), making for both a fire hazard and a source of cancer-causing fumes. Save the cold-pressed extra-virgin olive oil for a [[Cookbook:Salad|salad]].
[[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Italian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Seafood|Seafood]] | [[Cookbook:Shrimp|Shrimp]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of India|Indian Cuisine]]
'''Prawns''' ([[Cookbook:Shrimp|shrimp]]) - cooked [[WikiPedia:Kerala|Kerala]] style.
==Ingredients==
* ½ kg [[Cookbook:Shrimp|prawns]] * ¼ tablespoon red [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Turmeric|turmeric]] powder * ¼ tea spoon [[Cookbook:Coriander|coriander]] powder * ¼ tablespoon chopped [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] * 3 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] * [[Cookbook:Kudampuli|kudampuli]] (Malabar [[Cookbook:Tamarind|tamarind]]) to your preferred sourness (can be substituted with lime juice) * 15 [[Cookbook:Curry Leaf|curry leaves]] * 20 pieces chipped [[Cookbook:Coconut|coconut]] kernel (thin slices approximately 2cm long each) * 1 big [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|green chillies]] * ¼ big [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] (not sweet) * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] to taste
==Procedure==
#Remove the shrimp tails and heads. #Cook the shrimp in water with ginger, salt, curry leaves, green chillies, kudampuli and coconut. Leave a little water in the vessel at the end of cooking. #Heat the oil in a pan and fry the turmeric, chili powder and coriander powder in it till they turn brown. #Put in the onion and [[Cookbook:Sautéing|sauté]] till wilted. #Put in the cooked shrimp and [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] and stir till it reaches a semi-dry consistency.
[[Category:Indian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Shrimp recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United Kingdom|British Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of New Zealand|New Zealand]]
[[Image:Fishandchips.jpg|frame|right|Fish and chips]] '''Fish and chips''' is a popular dish in Britain, New Zealand and Australia. The traditional [[Cookbook:Fish|fish]] in Britain is cod, though this is likely to fall apart or fail to cook in the middle.
==Ingredients== *[[Cookbook:Fried Fish|Fried fish]] (crumbed or battered) *[[Cookbook:Chips|Chips]] ("french fries") Although cod is widely used today, spiny dogfish is the fish originally used in this recipe. A member of the shark family, its flesh is firmer and the fillets are thinner leading to a quicker cooking time which was important to street vendors years ago. Also it lends itself to the malt vinegar in a way cod does not. Dogfish was orginally used because it was considered a 'junk' fish and was cheap. If you wish to savour this dish as it was meant to be cooked, seek out vendors who use the traditional spiny dogfish.
==Procedure== #Place the fried fish and chips on brown paper or newsprint. #Top with [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and/or [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]]. #Serve with [[Cookbook:Pickles|pickles]], pickled [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], pickled [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]], and [[Cookbook:Mushy Peas|mushy peas]]. (Britain)
{{Wikipedia|Fish and chips}}
[[Category:Fish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:English recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United Kingdom|British Cuisine]] [[Image:Pisum_sativum_green.jpg|thumb|right|start with this]] '''Mushy Peas''' is a popular and characteristic British dish that has helped to give British cooking its well-deserved reputation. Mushy peas are often served with [[Cookbook:Fish and Chips|fish and chips]].
==Ingredients== *Dried [[Cookbook:Pea|peas]] *Water *[[Cookbook:Baking Soda|Baking soda]] (optional)
==Procedure== #Soak the peas overnight. #Add a bit of baking soda if you wish, to help the process along. #Boil the peas for a really long time, at least so they fall apart and/or turn grey-brown.

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] | [[Cookbook:Cake|Cake]]
Sponge cake is the most commonly recognised variety of [[Cookbook:Baking|baked]] confectionery in Britain. It has a sweet taste, often flavoured with [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]], [[Cookbook:Chocolate|chocolate]] or other additions. It can be cut and displayed in a very large number of different ways.
A [[Cookbook:Impossible Sponge Cake|more difficult version of this recipe]] is available for those having a kitchen scale and wanting to use it.
==Ingredients== ===For the cake=== * 2 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|c]] minus 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|T]] Self-Rising [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1/2 c [[Cookbook:Superfine Sugar|superfine sugar]] * 1/2 c [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 2 mounded [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|T]] [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] (unused, but you supposedly need it)
If your eggs seem kind of big, you might want to increase the amounts of some ingredients. Add an extra teaspoon each of sugar and butter, and two extra teaspoons of flour. Also, note the adjustments below based on usage of optional ingredients.
====Extras (Optional)==== * [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] extract (1-2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|t]]) * food coloring (according to looks) * [[Cookbook:Cocoa Powder|cocoa powder]] (according to taste. Use 3 parts less flour for every 4 parts added.) ===For the filling=== Choose one of these to spread between two cakes if making a cake with more than two eggs. * 2 to 4 T jelly (softened with pallette knife or similar) or * buttercream (cream together 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|c]] superfine sugar and 1/2 c butter) ===For dredging=== * 1/3 cup sugar, any type
==Method== #Preheat an oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|400°F]]. #Cream together the sugar and butter in the mixing bowl. They should achieve a creamy texture with quite a thick consistency. The longer, harder and faster the butter and sugar are creamed the lighter the cake will be when cooked. #Add both eggs and mix well. #Add all the flour and mix well. #Add any food coloring, flavoring etc. at this point. If you add liquid ingredients, add the same volume again of sugar-and-flour mix to compensate. If adding dry ingredients, ensure to use 3 parts less flour for every 4 parts of extra ingredient added. #Beat with wooden spoon in a circular motion, trying to incorporate as much air as possible. #Grease one or two cake pan(s) with butter. You may wish to use a [[Cookbook:Springform Pan|springform pan]] for this recipe. #Spoon, then scrape, as much cake mixture as possible into the pan(s). If using two pans, try to ensure that both tins have an equal amount of cake mixture in them and that both are not more than 3/4 filled. #Put the cake tins into the oven and leave them for approximately 10 minutes before checking them. The cooking time should eventually reach around 15 minutes: keep checking them regularly after about 8 minutes since ovens vary. #Turn the cake out onto a wire rack to cool. #If doing two layers, turn one of them upside down and spread your filling onto its base, then stick the other cake (top up) onto the upside-down cake. #Dredge the cake with sugar using a spoon.
[[Category:Cake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:English recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|Cuisine of the United States]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] [[Image:CookbookDatebar.jpg|thumb|160px|four date bars]]
'''Date bars''' have crumbly upper and lower surfaces with a [[Cookbook:Date|date]] filling in the middle. Also see the [[Cookbook:Date Squares|Date Squares]] recipe.
==Ingredients==
*¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *3 c cut-up [[Cookbook:Date|dates]] (1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]]) *1½ cup water *¼ cup [[Cookbook:Shortening|shortening]] *½ cup [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] or [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] *1 cup [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] *½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] *1¾ cup [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *1½ cup quick-cooking [[Cookbook:Oatmeal|oatmeal]] *1 tsp [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
==Procedure==
#Mix the dates, sugar, and water in a [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]]. #Cook over low heat stirring constantly approx. 10 minutes or until thickened. Cool. #Cream together the butter, shortening, and brown sugar in a separate container. #Mix in the flour, salt, baking soda, and oats. (into the crumble crust mix, not the date filling) #Grease a 13x9 pan. #Evenly press ½ of the crumble mixture into the bottom of the pan. #Spread the date filling on top. #Evenly place remaining crumble mixture into the pan, pressing lightly. #[[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] for 25 to 30 minutes at [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|400°F]], or until light brown. #Cut into bars while still warm.
[[Category:Cookie recipes|Date bars]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|Date bars]] [[Category:Date recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Italian recipes|depends on loaf size|10 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine_of_Italy|Cuisine of Italy]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian_cuisine|Vegetarian cuisine]]
This article describes general preparation procedures for the popular Italian appetizer (or ''antipasto'') '''Bruschetta'''. It is a dish coming from the Southern Italy culinary tradition. It is commonly mispronounced in America as "bru-shetta", but should be pronounced with a hard K sound, "bru-sketta."
There are many types of ''bruschetta'', mainly involving special roasted and/or hard bread which may require particular preparation to be served.
This type of ''bruschetta'' is a meeting point between Northern and Southern Italy: it requires Tuscan (''Toscano'') [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]], a kind of saltless bread originating in Tuscania, Italy, usually coming in blocks.
You can adapt this recipe to as many servings as you need. As a guideline, you can serve 1 or 2 ''bruschette'' per person.
==Ingredients== * Tuscan [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]] * fresh [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|mozzarella cheese]] (optional) * [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] or [[Cookbook:Tomato_Sauce|tomato sauce]] (a non-traditional addition) * [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]] * [[Cookbook:Basil|basil]] * [[Cookbook:Black_Pepper|black pepper]] * [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
==Procedure== # Pre-heat the oven at 200°C # Slice out a few 1cm-thick slices from the Tuscan bread (1 or 2 per person) # Put the Tuscan slices in the oven, until they become gold-looking (this takes a few minutes) #* In the meantime, you can prepare the tomatoes, if you're going to use these instead of the tomato sauce; there are two alternatives: you can slice them finely (3mm-thick circa), or grossly (1cm-thick circa). If you slice them grossly, you can then cut them down into small cubes # Take the bread slices from the oven and rub them front and back with a slice of garlic, until they acquire an intense smell; then put the slices on a dish # Lay the cheese and fine tomato slices, cubes, or a thin layer of tomato sauce, on the upper side of the bread # Add a little oil, oregano, salt, black pepper and 2 or 3 leaves of basil # Serve hot.
[[Category:Appetizer recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Italian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Austria|Austrian Cuisine]]
The [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Austria|Austrian]] version of the Goulash [[Cookbook:Soup|soup]] is an easy to prepare, inexpensive, tasty and filling dish well suited for cold winter days. This thick, sweet-spicy soup of [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Hungary|Hungarian]] origin is served in inns and restaurants across Austria.
The key ingredient for goulash soup is a good quantity of sweet [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]] powder. It is important not to use hot paprika, the red powder sold simply as "paprika" in most supermarkets, as this would make the soup too spicy and of the wrong consistency. Sweet paprika can be obtained from [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Poland|Polish]] or central [[Cookbook:European cuisines|European]] delis and specialist supermarkets. It is normally sold in 250 [[Cookbook:g|g]] sachets. For the authentic taste, the [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]], [[Cookbook:Caraway|caraway seeds]] and [[Cookbook:Marjoram|marjoram]] are indispensable. [[Cookbook:Thyme|Thyme]] and tomato puree can be left out if unavailable.
==Ingredients==
* 500 [[Cookbook:g|g]] lean [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] * 2 large [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]] * 2 large [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]], peeled * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbsp]] vegetable [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] * 3 tbsp powdered ''sweet [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]]'' * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] powdered ''hot paprika'' * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Caraway|caraway seeds]] (''not'' cumin) * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Thyme|thyme]] (fresh or dried) * 1 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaf]] * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Marjoram|marjoram]] (fresh or dried) * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]] [[Cookbook:Puree|puree]] * 50 [[Cookbook:ml|ml]] white [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:l|l]] [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] [[Cookbook:Stock|stock]] or 2 stock cubes dissolved in 1 l of water. * [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|black pepper]]
==Procedure==
#Cut the beef and potatoes into 1.5 [[Cookbook:cm|cm]] cubes. Cut the caraway seeds into rough chunks with a kitchen knife. Chop onions into thin slices. Warm the beef stock. #Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a cooking pan to medium/high heat. [[Cookbook:Fry|Fry]] the beef cubes until medium brown and crispy, remove and drain on a kitchen towel. #Turn to medium heat. Add another tbsp of vegetable oil and roast the caraway seeds for 1 min. Add the onions and turn to low heat. Gently roast the onions until they turn yellowish. #Add the beef cubes and roast for another 2 min. Slowly add the vinegar, beef stock, potatoes and tomato puree. Add the sweet paprika and stir well to disperse clumps. #Season with marjoram, thyme, hot paprika, the bay leaf and a pinch of black pepper. [[Cookbook:Simmering|Simmer]] for 30 min.
==Variations==
#Garnish each dish with with a tbsp of [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] or ''[[Cookbook:Creme Fraiche|creme fraiche]]'' and sprinkle with freshly cut [[Cookbook:Chive|chives]] before serving. #Add 100 ml of [[Cookbook:Red Wine|red wine]] after frying beef/onions. #For a more nutritious meal, fry 2 [[Cookbook:Green Pepper|green peppers]], 3 [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]], 1 [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrot]] and 1 [[Cookbook:Leek|leek]] (all chopped) with the onions.
[[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Austrian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Beef recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Hungarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meat Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:North American cuisines|North American cuisines]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|United States cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Cajun cuisine|Cajun cuisine]]
'''Jambalaya''' is a simple dish that works well as an everyday meal. This one uses [[Cookbook:Meat_and_poultry#Poultry|poultry]], [[Cookbook:Tomato|canned tomatoes]], and [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]]. It is not spicy hot at all, but has a strong herbal flavor.
==Ingredients==
* 1/3 cup chopped [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 2/3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] long grain [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]] * 14.5 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] (411[[Cookbook:g|g]]) can of [[Cookbook:tomato|tomato]]es, diced or torn apart * 1.5 cups [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Stock|broth]] * 2 cups cooked and chopped [[Cookbook:Turkey|turkey]], or [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaf]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Savory|savory]] * 1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 teaspoon dried [[Cookbook:Basil|basil]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Thyme|thyme]] * 1.5 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] * 1 drained small can of sliced [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushrooms]] (optional)
==Procedure==
#Mix the salt and unground spices (bay leaf excepted) together, then grind them. #Prepare the canned tomatoes: tear them up, remove the stem ends, remove the seeds, etc. '''Keep the juice.''' #Select a wide pan with a lid. #Lightly [[Cookbook:Frying|fry]] the celery in the butter. Soften the celery, but do not brown it. #Add everything to the pan. (you can add the basil, meat and mushrooms later if you prefer) #Bring to a [[Cookbook:Boiling|boil]], then cover and [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] for about 20 minutes. The liquid should get absorbed into the rice. #Discard the bay leaf.
==Variations== *[[Image:Jambalaya.JPG|thumb|right|Jambalaya with sausage.]] Include [[Cookbook:Sausage|sausage]], cut into 1/2-[[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] slices, in the frying celery, omitting some of the butter and salt if desired. *Use a can of diced tomatoes with [[Cookbook:Jalapeño|jalapeños]] for extra spice and less prep. work.
[[Category:Chicken recipes|Jambalaya]] [[Category:Rice recipes|Jambalaya]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Louisiana recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Duplicate recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Pasta recipes|4|15 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Pasta Recipes|Pasta Recipes]]
Pasta tossed with spices and vegetables from the Southwest United States.
==Ingredients== *12 ounces seashell (or other) pasta *2 tablespoons olive oil *1 onion, chopped *1 green bell pepper, chopped *1 (15 ounce) can sweet corn kernels, drained *1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained *1 (14.5 ounce) can peeled and diced tomatoes with juice *1/4 cup salsa *1/4 cup sliced black olives, drained *1 1/2 tablespoons taco seasoning mix *salt and pepper to taste
==Procedure==
*In a large pot bring 1 quart of lightly salted water to a boil. *Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes until pasta is al dente; drain water. *While pasta is cooking, over medium heat, heat olive oil in a large frying pan. *Cook onions and bell pepper in oil until lightly browned, about 10 minutes. *Stir in corn, beans tomatoes, salsa, olives, taco seasoning, salt and pepper. Cook until thoroughly heated, about 5 minutes. *Toss heated vegetables into pasta, mix well and serve. *Can be served warm or cold.
[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Southwest Pasta]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|Southwest Pasta]] [[Category:Southwestern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Pork recipes|24|prep: 2 hours
cooking: 2 hours|4}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat|Meat]] '''New Mexico Pork Tamales''' are a classic Southwestern United States meal, made from pork and chicken. This version adds cumin, chili powder and garlic powder to outer masa flour of the tamale. ==Ingredients== ===Meat filling=== *1 cup shredded cooked [[Cookbook:Pork|pork ]] *1 cup shredded cooked [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken ]] *1 (15 ounce - ~400g) can beanless chili con carne *2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Oil and fat|cooking oil]] *1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]] *1 tablespoon garlic powder *2 teaspoons ground [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] *1/4 teaspoon of [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper ===Wrappers=== *1 (8 ounce - 230g) package of corn husks (contains about 100 husks) ===Masa mixture=== *2 pounds (900g) [[Cookbook:Corn Masa|Masa flour]] *3 tablespoons [[Cookbook:paprika|paprika]] *3 tablespoons chili powder *3 tablespoons garlic powder *1 tablespoon ground cumin *2 tablespoons salt *2 cups solid vegetable shortening *8 cups warm [[Cookbook:Chicken_Stock#Chicken|chicken stock]] (or 8 cups water and 8 chicken bullion cubes) ==Procedure== ===Meat filling=== #Stir ingredients together and refrigerate until needed. ===Wrappers=== #Soak corn husks in warm water for at least two hours. A dinner plate may have to be used to hold corn husks under water. ===Masa mixture=== #Mix dry Masa flour with paprika, chili powder, garlic powder, cumin and salt. Mix well for even distribution of spices. #Cut shortening into the Masa mixture with a pastry cutter. Mix until mixture resembles the texture of tiny peas. #Slowly add chicken broth one cup at a time. Mix well with electric mixer. Mixture should resemble consistency of peanut butter. #Continue mixing with electric mixer to incorporate air into batter. Mixture is ready to use when 1 teaspoon of batter floats on water. ===Filling and cooking tamales=== #Use one corn husk per tamale. Lay flat on table. The corn husk is roughly rectangle shaped. #Spread 1/2 cup of Masa mixture on entire upward facing corn husk, leaving a 1 inch (2.5cm) gap along the long edge and narrow end of the corn husk. #Spread 1 tablespoon of meat mixture, in a narrow band in the middle, down the length of the masa spread corn husk. #Roll/fold the husk along the wide edge, touching the edges of the masa together, with the meat mixture ending up in the middle of the masa. The part of the husk with the 1 inch gap with no masa should be rolled around the outside of the husk. #Fold about 1 inch of end of rolled husk, upward along the body of the husk. (The narrow end with 1 inch masa gap). You should end up with something resembling a cornucopia, with one end folded over and one end open. #Stand all of the rolled tamales on end in a steaming colander with the open end of the tamale facing upward. #Steam the tamales over boiling water for 2 hours. Place a lid over the steaming colander. Keep the tamales above the boiling water, don't allow them to stand in it. #At the end of the cooking period, open one tamale and make sure the masa is cooked and not doughy. #Allow tamales to rest 30 minutes after cooking, before serving. This will help to keep the masa from sticking to the corn husk. ==Notes, tips, and variations== *Makes about 50 to 75 tamales. *Left over tamales may be frozen in zip lock bags. *Reheat frozen tamales in a microwave. If you reheat by steaming, they may become soggy. Also see [[Cookbook:Tamales|Tamales]] [[Category:Pork recipes]] [[Category:Chicken recipes]] [[Category:Southwestern recipes]] [[Category:Mexican recipes]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units]]

{{recipesummary|Breakfast recipes|5 pancakes|15 minutes|2}} {{recipe}}
==Ingredients== *1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] flour *2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] baking powder *2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] sugar *1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] salt *1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] soy milk *vegetable oil
==Procedure== {| style="float: right; margin-left: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; width: 242px; border: #99B3FF solid 1px" | {{Vegan recipe}} |} #Mix all dry ingredients: flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt. #Mix soy milk into the dry ingredients. #Heat a griddle until water sprinkled on it quickly evaporates. Spread a thin film of oil on the griddle. #Pour pancake batter on griddle to form 4- to 5-inch circles. Bubbles should start forming. #When the underside is light brown, flip the pancake. #When the other side is light brown, serve.
==Variations== *Banana pancakes: add one well mashed banana to the batter. *Chocolate pancakes: add 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] chocolate chips to the batter. *Walnut pancakes: add 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] roughly chopped walnuts to the batter. *Cranberry pancakes: add 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] dried cranberries to the batter.
Any of the above ingredients can be mixed together.
==Notes== * Don't overmix! Overmixing will produce gluten; this will inhibit rising and make the pancakes rubbery. * Optionally, you can serve your pancakes with syrup or jam. * Substituting rice milk for soy milk may make the pancakes fall apart more easily.
==External links== '''Wikipedia:''' [[Wikipedia:Pancake|pancake]]
[[Category:Breakfast recipes|Pancakes (vegan)]] [[Category:Pancake recipes|Vegan]] [[Category:Vegan recipes|Pancakes]]

page.title: Cookbook:Rigatoni pasta with Ricotta in Tomato Cream Sauce

revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Pasta recipes|6|45 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Pasta Recipes|Pasta Recipes]]
'''Rigatoni pasta with Ricotta in Tomato Cream Sauce'''
Pasta with Ricotta cheese in a tomato cream sauce topped with parmasean cheese and parsley. ==Ingredients== *16 ounces Rigatoni (or other) pasta *2 tablespoons olive oil *1 tablespoon butter *1 cup onions, finely chopped *3 garlic cloves, minced *1 can (28 oz) plum tomatoes, drained and chopped *1 1/2 cups tomato sauce *2 tablespoons basil, finely diced *1/2 teaspoon oregano, finely diced *1/2 teaspoon salt *1/8 teaspoon black pepper *16 ounces ricotta cheese *1 cup heavy cream *1 1/2 teaspoons granulated sugar *1/4 cup parsley, chopped. *1/2 cup parmesan cheese, grated
==Procedure==
*In a large pot bring 2 quarts of lightly salted water to a boil. *Cook Rigatoni pasta for 11-minutes (or until al dente), drain and set aside until needed. *Over medium heat, melt butter and heat oil in a large skillet. *Lightly saute onions and garlic cloves, don't brown. Cook about 5-minutes. *Drain canned tomatoes, dice and add to skillet with onions and garlic. *Also add to skillet tomato sauce, basil, oregano, salt and pepper. Simmer 20 minutes. *Stir in ricotta cheese. Mix well and simmer for 5-minutes. *Stir in heavy cream and sugar. Mix well and simmer 5 minutes. *Remove from heat and add to cooked Rigatoni pasta. Mix well. *Stir in chopped parsley and sprinkle grated parmesan cheese over top. *Serve hot.
[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Rigatoni pasta with Ricotta in Tomato Cream Sauce]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|Rigatoni pasta with Ricotta in Tomato Cream Sauce]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|6-8|prep: 30 minutes
cooking: ~30 minutes|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|US Cuisine]] This is a pastry shell pie filled with fresh sliced bananas in a vanilla pudding type base. A layer of whipped cream is added to the top. ==Ingredients== ===[[Cookbook:Pie Crust|Pie crust]]=== *[[Cookbook:Grandma's Pie Crust|Grandma's Pie Crust]]. ===Pie filling=== *1/2 cup white granulated [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *6 tablespoons [[Cookbook:all purpose flour|all purpose flour]] *1/4 teaspoon [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] *2 1/2 cups [[Cookbook:milk|milk]] *1 [[Cookbook:egg|egg]], whipped *1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] *1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:vanilla extract|vanilla extract]] *4 ripe [[Cookbook:banana|banana]]s, sliced *1/4 cup [[Cookbook:lemon juice|lemon juice]] ===Pie topping=== *1/2 cup [[Cookbook:heavy cream|heavy cream]] *1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:vanilla extract|vanilla extract]] *1 1/2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:powdered sugar|powdered sugar]] ==Procedure== ===Pie crust=== #Prepare [[Cookbook:Grandma's Pie Crust|Grandma's Pie Crust]]. ===Pie filling=== #In the top of a [[Cookbook:double boiler|double boiler]], [[Cookbook:whisk|whisk]] together sugar, flour, salt and milk. Stir out any lumps. #Bring water to [[Cookbook:boiling|boiling]] in lower portion of double boiler. #Stir constantly until mixture is thickened, about 5-minutes. #Place lid on mixture and continue cooking for 10 more minutes, stirring occasionally. #Beat egg in a small bowl. Add about 1/2 cup of hot pie filling mixture to egg in bowl and stir well.
