revision.text:
__NOTOC__{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|4|30 minutes|2|Image=[[Image:Cooked Chicken Tikka.jpeg|300px|The cooked Chicken Tikka]]}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat_Recipes|Meat recipes]]
'''Chicken Tikka''' is an [[Cookbook:Cuisine of India|Indian]] dish made by baking [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] which has been [[Cookbook:Marinating|marinated]] in [[Cookbook:Spices and herbs|spices]] and [[Cookbook:Yogurt|yoghurt]]. It should not be confused with [[Cookbook:Chicken Tikka Masala|Chicken Tikka Masala]]. It is traditionally cooked on [[Cookbook:Skewer|skewers]] in a [[Cookbook:Tandoor Oven|tandoor oven]] and is usually boneless.
==Ingredients== [[Image:Tikka Marinade.jpeg|thumb|right|200px|The finished marinade]] *675 [[Cookbook:g|g]] (1.5 [[Cookbook:Pound|lb]]) skinless and boneless chicken breast diced into large cubes *1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]] seed oil (see Notes, tips and variations) *50 [[Cookbook:mL|mL]] (2[[Cookbook:Fluid Ounce|fl oz]]) [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] *150 [[Cookbook:mL|mL]] (5[[Cookbook:Fluid Ounce|fl oz]]) natural [[Cookbook:Yogurt|yoghurt]] *2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] *1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]] puree *2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] chopped fresh [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]] (coriander leaves) *4 large cloves of [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], finely [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] *1-4 chopped fresh red [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chillis]] (depending on strength of the Chillis and the desired strength of the marinade) *2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsps]] [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]] *2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsps]] [[Cookbook:Garam Masala|garam masala]] *1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] powder *1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] [[Cookbook:Turmeric|turmeric]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] (use rock salt for best results)
==Procedure== #Add all of the ingredients except the chicken to a non-metalic [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]] and mix well. #Add the chicken and mix until fully coated. #Ideally, the chicken should now be left in a refrigerator to [[Cookbook:Marinating|marinate]] for at least 24 hours. It may not be safe to leave chicken which has previously been frozen for longer than 24 hours, but fresh chicken should be left to marinate for 48 hours for best results. If you do not wish to leave the chicken to marinate, simply continue to the next step. #The chicken now needs to be cooked. For best results, place on skewers and cook in a [[Cookbook:Tandoor|tandoor]] or ceramic pot oven. The chicken can also be cooked on skewers under a medium [[Cookbook:Grilling|grill]] for 5 minutes on each side or barbecued (cooking times depend on the temperature of the barbecue). Always ensure the chicken is cooked throughout before serving. #Serve with [[Cookbook:Naan|naan bread]], with [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]] or use in a [[Cookbook:Chicken Tikka Masala|Chicken Tikka Masala]].
==Notes, tips and variations== *[[Mustard seed oil]] is considered unfit for human consumption in many parts of the world and is therefore not available. A poor alternative can be made by ''[[crackling]]'' 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] of [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]] seeds in approximately 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] of very hot [[Cookbook:Vegetable Oil|vegetable]] or [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]]. Allow to cool then use in place of mustard seed oil. *It is possible to make a tikka with almost any meat, the most commonly used other than chicken being [[Cookbook:Lamb|lamb]] and [[Cookbook:Mutton|mutton]]. *Tikka can be served either as main meal or as an appetiser. *Powdered or dried ingredients can be substituted for fresh, but at the expense of taste. *Some people prefer to make tikka with meat on-the-bone for improved flavour.
==Links== {{wikipedia|Chicken Tikka}}
[[Category:Indian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Yogurt recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cumin recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Coriander recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|Tikka]] [[Category:Appetizer recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Featured recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|4|1 hour|3|Image=[[Image:Chicken Tikka Masala.jpeg|300px|The finished dish]]}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat_Recipes|Meat recipes]]
'''Chicken Tikka Masala''' is probably the most popular [[Cookbook:Cuisine of India|Indian]] dish in the world. Its popularity has proven so great that almost every Indian restaurant worldwide now offers it.{{fact}} It has conquered even the Indian subcontinent, and has arguably replaced [[Cookbook:Tandoori Chicken|Tandoori Chicken]] as the flagship of Indian food. This is ironic as the dish is in fact a dish originating from Bangladeshi immigrants living in England sometime in the 1970s.
==Ingredients== *675 [[Cookbook:g|g]] (1.5 [[Cookbook:Pound|lb]]) cooked [[Cookbook:Chicken Tikka|Chicken Tikka]] *2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]] seed oil (see '''Notes, tips and variations''' below) *4 large cloves of [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], finely [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] *200 [[Cookbook:g|g]] (7 [[Cookbook:Ounce|oz]]) [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], finely chopped (optional) *1 tin (can) of plum [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]], chopped *1-4 chopped fresh green [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chillis]] (depending on strength of the Chillis and the desired strength of the sauce) *2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] chopped fresh [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]] (coriander leaves) *50 [[Cookbook:mL|mL]] (4 [[Cookbook:Fluid Ounce|fl oz]]) single [[Cookbook:Cream|cream]] *1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] malt [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]] *2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] curry paste *2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] [[Cookbook:Tandoori masala|tandoori masala paste]] *1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] [[Cookbook:Tomato Paste|tomato paste]] *1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] [[Cookbook:Garam Masala|garam masala]]
==Procedure== #Heat the oil in a [[Cookbook:Wok|wok]] (if available, otherwise a large [[Cookbook:Frying Pan|frying pan]]). #Add the garlic and onions (if using) and [[Cookbook:Stir-frying|stir-fry]] until browned. #Add the curry pastes and mix well, adding a little water or yogurt. #Add the cooked chicken tikka and [[Cookbook:Stir-frying|stir-fry]] for two minutes to heat through. #Add the tomatoes, vinegar, tomato paste and chillies and [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] for five minutes. Add more water if required. #Add the cream, garam masala and chopped cilantro and [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] for a few minutes. #Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with [[Cookbook:Naan|Naan bread]], [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]] coloured yellow with [[Cookbook:Turmeric|turmeric]], [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] [[Cookbook:Bahjis|bahjis]] and/or a good glass of white [[Cookbook:Wine|wine]].
==Notes, tips and variations== *[[w:Mustard oil|Mustard seed oil]] is considered unfit for human consumption in many parts of the world and is therefore not available. A poor alternative can be made by ''crackling'' 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] of [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]] seeds in approximately 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] of very hot [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable]] or [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]]. Allow to cool then use in place of mustard seed oil. *Powdered or dried ingredients can be substituted for fresh, but at the expense of taste.
==Links== {{wikipedia|Chicken Tikka Masala}} *[http://www.khanakhazana.com/recipes/k_recipe.aspx?id=1066 Tikka Masala Recipe] *[http://www.numkitchen.com/gc4_chicken%20tikka%20masala.htm CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA Recipe] *[http://www.ifood.tv/node/1543 Video Recipe by renowned Chef Vikas Khanna] *[http://www.punjabi-recipes.com/recipes/11.aspx Punjabi Chicken tikka masala recipe] *[http://www.sonzyskitchen.com/chickentikka.htm Chicken tikka masala: Everything you ever wanted to know about it] with a recipe *[http://www.chickerecipebook.com Chicken Recipes]
[[Category:Indian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Coriander recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Featured recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients==
===Pastry===
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240ml) boiling [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * ½ cup (120g) [[Cookbook:Shortening|shortening]] * 1 cup (120g) [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * ⅛ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]]
===Filling===
* 1 cup (240g) [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * ⅓ cup (80g) [[Cookbook:Cornstarch|cornstarch]] * ⅓ teaspoon salt * 1 egg * 2 cups (480ml) scalded [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] extract
==Procedure==
===Pastry=== # Heat water and shortening in [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]] until it boils up well. # Add all at once flour sifted with salt and stir vigorously. # Remove from heat as soon as mixed. # Cool, and mix in unbeaten eggs, one at a time. # Add baking powder; mix. # Drop by spoonfuls 1½ inches (4cm) apart on greased tin, shaping into circular form with spoon but keeping mixture higher in center. # Bake about 30 minutes in hot oven. # Cut with sharp knife near base to admit filling.
===Filling=== # Mix dry ingredients (sugar, cornstarch and salt). # Add slightly beaten egg. # Stir into this gradually the scalded milk. # Cook about 15 minutes in [[Cookbook:Double Boiler|double boiler]], stirring constantly until thickened. # Cool slightly and add vanilla extract and whisk vigorously for creaminess.
==Tips and variations== * Sweetened whipped [[Cookbook:Cream|cream]] may be used instead of this filling. * Rather than cutting the pastries open, spoon the filling into a [[Cookbook:Pastry Bag|pastry bag]], then inject it from the bottom. * Dust with powdered sugar or drizzle with semi-sweet chocolate
[[Category:Dessert recipes|Cream Puff]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Cream Puff]] [[Category:Pastry recipes|Cream Puff]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients== * 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (480g) granulated [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 5 cups (1.2l) boiling [[Cookbook:Water|water]]
==Procedure== Melt sugar in [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]] and heat slowly, stirring constantly until golden brown; add boiling water. Cook three minutes.
[[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sauce recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} {{recipesummary| | Category = Dessert recipes | Servings = 4 to 6 | Time = prep. 30 minutes
baking 90 minutes
+ cooling time | Rating = 2 | Image = [[Image:Meringues 9027.jpg|300px]] }} '''Meringues''' are crunchy confections made from whipped egg whites and sugar. In Germany and Austria (but not in France) they are called ''Baiser'' (from French kiss). Served with whipped cream, they are a traditional dessert in the canton of Bern in Switzerland. See our [[Cookbook:Meringue|meringue]] page for similar uses of whipped egg whites. ==Ingredients== * whites of 4 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (250ml) [[Cookbook:Superfine Sugar|superfine sugar]] [[Cookbook:Powdered Sugar|powdered sugar]] or [[Cookbook:Granulated sugar|granulated sugar]]. Ideal is a mixture of 50% superfine and 50% powdered sugar. * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] of [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] extract, if desired ==Procedure== # Beat whites of eggs until stiff and dry. # Add lemon juice # Gradually add sugar and continue beating until mixture holds shape and is very shiny. Test if the sugar is wholly solved and no grains remain (this can take longer or shorter depending on the sugar used). # Add vanilla. # Drop by spoonfuls on unglazed paper # Bake in slow oven 80 to 90 minutes, depending on size. Use very low heat, meringues should rather dry than bake and should be dry and only very slightly colored, when finished. # Let cool, before serving # In the original Swiss recipe, two meringues per serving are filled with sweetened whipped [[Cookbook:Cream|cream]], but the cream is often supplemented with [[Cookbook:Strawberry|strawberries]] or other fresh fruits and [[Cookbook:Vanilla Ice Cream|vanilla ice cream]] == Tips and Variations == # The tiniest bit of egg yolk or fat prevents the egg white to get stiff # Meringues are more decorative if shaped with a pastry bag # Another method of baking is, to preheat the oven and bake the meringues 2-3 minutes at moderately hot temperature, then turn down the oven completely and keep it shut for 8 hours. # Meringues do not turn out very well, if the air is very humid (due to climate or due to steam from other cooking) [[Category:Swiss recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|4|9 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Microwave Chocolate Pudding''' is a pudding made with sugar, milk, unsweetened cocoa powder and thickened with cornstarch. It is prepared in a microwave.
==Ingredients==
* 1/3 cup (80g) granulated sugar or "Splenda" sugar substitute * 1/4 cup (60g) unsweetened cocoa powder * 3 Tb cornstarch * 1/8 tsp salt * 2 cups (480ml) of whole, 2%, 1%, or skim milk. Soy milk may also be used. * 1 tsp of vanilla extract or imitation vanilla
==Preparation== # In a 1-qt microwave safe bowl (not metal), mix the dry ingredients (sugar, cocoa, cornstarch and salt). # Add cold milk and mix well with small wisk or electric mixer until all the cocoa lumps are disolved. # Microwave in bowl, on high for 3-minutes. Stir well. # Microwave on high for an additional 4 to 6 minutes, stirring after each minute of cooking. # Remove from Microwave and stir in Vanilla. # Place in 4 small custard cups and chill before serving.
==Notes, tips and variations==
#A microwave safe lid (not metal) can be placed slightly ajar on the bowl while the pudding is cooking. This will prevent the pudding from spattering all over the microwave.
==Warnings==
* Keep close watch on cooking pudding, it can easily boil over.
[[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pudding and Custard recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
'''Yogi tea''' is a spiced tea similar to [[Cookbook:Chai Tea|chai]]. It is also the brand name of a line of herbal teas.
== Ingredients == * 15 whole [[Cookbook:Clove|cloves]] * 20 black [[Cookbook:Peppercorn|peppercorns]] * 3 sticks of [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] * 20 green [[Cookbook:Cardamom|cardamom]] pods (crushed or split) * 8 or more 1/4" (0.75cm) slices of fresh [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] root * 1/2 tsp black [[Cookbook:Tea|tea]] (decaf black tea is acceptable)
== Procedure == # Bring 2 quarts (about 2L) of water to boil in 3-4 quart pot. # Add cloves and boil for 1 minute. # Add peppercorns, cinnamon, cardamom pods and ginger. # Cover and simmer gently for at least 30 minutes. (For best flavor, cover tightly and simmer over low heat for 2 to 3 hours!) # Remove from heat and add tea. # Let cool. # Strain ingredients from the finished tea.
When ready to drink, sweeten to taste with [[Cookbook:Honey|honey]] or [[Cookbook:Maple Syrup|maple syrup]]. Add [[Cookbook:Soy Milk|soy milk]] or dairy [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]].
This tea can be stored.
[[Category:Tea recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cardamom recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Ginger recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Beverage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients==
* 1 cup (240g) [[Cookbook:cottage cheese|cottage cheese]] * 6 [[Cookbook:egg|egg]]s * 1/2 cup (120g) [[Cookbook:flour|flour]] * 1/4 teaspoon [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * 1/4 cup (60ml) [[Cookbook:vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] * 1/4 cup (60ml) [[Cookbook:milk|milk]] * 1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]
==Procedure==
# Place all ingredients in a [[Cookbook:blender|blender]] and blend 1 minute. # Pour about 1/4 cup (60g) batter for each pancake on a [[Cookbook:griddle|griddle]] sprayed wtih cooking spray or lightly coated with vegetable oil. # Let cook until golden on both sides.

{{recipe}}
'''Cilbir''' Serves 4.
== Ingredients == * 4 [[Cookbook:egg|egg]]s * 1 Tbsp. [[Cookbook:vinegar|vinegar]] * 1 lt. [[Cookbook:water|water]] * 2 Tbsp. [[Cookbook:butter|butter]] * 1 tsp. [[Cookbook:hot paprika|hot paprika]] * 1 cup (240ml) [[Cookbook:yogurt|yogurt]] * 1 clove [[Cookbook:garlic|garlic]], minced * [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] and [[Cookbook:pepper|pepper]], to taste
== Procedure == # In a small [[Cookbook:mixing bowl|mixing bowl]], combine the yogurt, garlic and salt. # Add the vinegar and some salt to [[Cookbook:boiling|boiling]] water, and [[Cookbook:poaching|poach]] the eggs. # Remove the eggs with a [[Cookbook:slotted spoon|slotted spoon]] and place an egg in each dish. # Cover the eggs with plenty of yogurt. # Melt the butter in a small [[Cookbook:skillet|skillet]]. # [[Cookbook:Stir|Stir]] in the paprika, and pour the hot butter over the eggs. # Serve immediately.
[[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Yogurt recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes with metric units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients== *3 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] yolks *1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Water|water]] *¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *1½ sticks (170[[Cookbook:Gram|g]]) unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], cut into pieces *½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] *⅛ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]]
==Procedure== # Pour about an inch of water into a large saucepan, bring to a simmer over medium heat, and reduce the heat to low. # Place egg yolks and 1 teaspoon of water in a medium mixing bowl and whisk until mixture lightens in color (1-2 minutes). Add the sugar and whisk for another 30 seconds. # Place the mixture over the simmering water and whisk for 3 to 5 minutes, until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. # Remove the bowl from over the saucepan and gradually add the butter one small piece at a time, and whisk until the butter is incorporated. Place the bowl back over the simmering water occasionally to the melt the added butter. # Add the salt, lemon juice, and cayenne pepper and serve immediately.
==Alternative recipe==
===Ingredients=== *200 g of butter *200 ml of [[Cookbook:Cream|double creme]] *6-8 egg yolks *[[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]] & [[Cookbook:Nutmeg|nutmeg]]
===Procedure=== #Melt the butter (shall not get brown, just melted) #Add the double creme and the egg yolks #Add the pepper and the nutmeg #Heat up with a finger in the sauce and do not stop mixing #When you can not bare the head the remove from fire and serve
[[Category:Sauce recipes]] [[Category:Egg recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Appetizer recipes|24 servings|20 minutes|2|[[Image:FreshMozzarellaBruschetta.jpg|300px]]}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Appetizers|Appetizers]]
Small, open-faced sandwiches, Bruschette make perfect appetizers. They are delicious and quick and easy to make.
Makes about 24 Bruschette
==Ingredients== *1 long loaf crusty [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]] *3 medium ripe roma [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] *3 large fresh [[Cookbook:Mozzerella|mozzarella]] balls *24 fresh [[Cookbook:Basil|basil]] leaves *Coarse [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *Extra virgin [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]]
==Procedure== #Cut Bread into 1/2" (4cm) slices on the diagonal #Lightly toast bread in the oven on both sides #Cut tomatoes into 1/4 inch (0.75cm) slices and place one on each slice of bread. #Cut mozzarella balls into 1/4 inch (0.75cm) slices and place on top of tomato. #Chop basil into thin strips and sprinkle on top #Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
==Notes, tips, and variations== *an optional re-toasting with toppings on will make the mozzarella melty and even more delicious *authentic Italian Bruschetta begins with rubbing roasted garlic cloves on the toasted bread slices
[[Category:Italian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Basil recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Featured recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Soup recipes||1 hour|3}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:North American cuisines|North American Cuisines]]
'''Chicken and Andouille Sausage Gumbo''' is a soup or [[Cookbook:Stews | stew]] which is thickened using [[Cookbook:Okra | okra]] and dark [[Cookbook:Roux | roux]] from the southern United States.
== Ingredients ==
* 1 cup (240ml) canola oil * 1 cup (240g) [[Cookbook:Flour | flour]] * [[Cookbook:The Trinity | trinity]] :* 2 bell pepper :* 1 large onion :* 4 stalks of celery * Water * Chicken breasts * 1 package of pre-cooked andouille sausage or other spicy sausage * [[Cookbook:Cayenne Pepper | cayenne pepper]] to taste * [[Cookbook:Salt | salt]] to taste
== Procedure ==
# Brown outside of chicken breasts in small amount of oil then set aside. # Make a [[Cookbook:Roux|roux]] in a large saucepan. # Add Trinity to roux and soften. # Slowly stir in water. # Cut up chicken breasts and add to gumbo to cook until done. # Slice up pre-cooked andouille sausage and add 1/2 hour later. # Simmer. Serve in a bowl with a little rice and green onions on top. Gumbo will be better if left over night and eaten the next day.
== Notes, tips, and variations ==
*Hot sauce can be added to taste. *[[Cookbook:Filé|Filé]] may be added to thicken individual servings as served.
[[Category:Louisiana recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Okra recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sausage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]]
This recipe makes dough for a 2-pound (900g) loaf of bread, or 2 1-pound loaves. It is intended for use in a bread machine
==Ingredients== * 1 cup (approximately heated for 38 seconds in the microwave ) [[Cookbook:water|water]] * 2 teaspoons (30 ml) [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]] * 1 teaspoon (15 ml) [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * 2 cups [[Cookbook:high-gluten flour|high-gluten flour]] ([[Cookbook:bread flour|bread flour]] in the U.S.) * 1-4 teaspoon(approximately 30 ml) [[Cookbook:active dry yeast|active dry yeast]]/ * 1 spoon full of honey
== Procedure ==
# Add ingredients to a 2-pound capacity [[Cookbook:bread machine|bread machine]] in the order listed, select dough cycle, and press start. # Remove when cycle is complete. # Preheat oven to 400 [[Cookbook:F|°F]] (200 [[Cookbook:C|°C]]) # When dough is finished, form into desired shape on a floured surface, and place on baking sheet or pizza stone. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] until lightly brown and firm. Cooking time will vary with altitude (20-40 minutes). # Cool and enjoy.
==Variations==
*To make a twist loaf, roll dough into a cylindrical shape with your hands, but make one end of the cylinder thicker than the other. Then divide the cylinder with a knife down the center of the thicker end, creating a ring with a protruding cylinder. Braid and bake. *Brush loaf with an eggwash (1 egg + a scant amount of water) or eggwhite, melted margarine or butter, or olive oil for a crisper crust. *Sprinkle brushed loaf with minced garlic, chopped herbs, ground spices, grated cheese, ground pepper and/or kosher salt for flavor. *Toss or roll into a flat disc and top with tomato sauce, olive oil, chopped meat, vegetables and/or grated cheeses to create a pizza (bake until cheese is melted).
[[Category:Bread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Salad recipes||30 minutes|3}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Side dishes | Side dishes]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Canada | Canadian Cuisine]]
'''Potato Salad''' is able to trace its origins to Germany before the turn of the 17th century, where it first became popular to use vinegar and spices on the potato as side to a meal. The salad has a bite to it and is served warm as often as not.
== Ingredients ==
* 2 [[Cookbook:Pound | pounds]] (~1kg) of [[Cookbook:Potato | potatoes]] * 6 slices of [[Cookbook:Bacon | bacon]] * 1/2 cup (120g) of onion * 2 tablespoons of [[Cookbook:Sugar | sugar]] * 1/2 teaspoon of [[Cookbook:Celery seed | celery seed]] * 2 hard boiled [[Cookbook:Egg | eggs]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (60g) [[Cookbook:Flour | flour]] * 1/2 cup (120ml) of [[Cookbook:Vinegar | vinegar]] * 1 cup (240ml) of [[Cookbook:Water | water]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] of fresh [[Cookbook:Parsley | parsley]] * 1 1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt | salt]] * [[Cookbook:Pepper | pepper]] * [[Cookbook:Paprika | paprika]]
== Procedure ==
# Cook bacon strips, cut into small pieces and set aside for later. # Boil potatoes for 5-10 minutes, or until softened and cut into small chunks. # Place potatoes in a large bowl and let them come to room temperature. # In a bowl combine flour, celery seed, parsley, salt and pepper. # Pour the water and vinegar into a pot, stir in sugar. Add the dry mixture and stir until thick. # In the original bowl place potatoes and bacon, pour on thick mixture. # Break apart eggs and stir lightly into the bowl to combine. # Place in large serving bowl and sprinkle with paprika. # Serve
== Notes, tips, and variations ==
* Can be served chilled or warm to preference.
* Chopping the potatoes into small pieces allow more surface to be coated and improves the flavor.
[[Category:Potato recipes|Potato Salad]] [[Category:Salad recipes|Potato Salad]] [[Category:Egg recipes|Potato Salad]] [[Category:Canadian recipes|Potato Salad]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]
