{{recipe}}
'''Broccoli burgers''' are a handheld foodstuff similar to hamburgers though produced with eggs and vegetables in place of beef.
== Ingredients == * 2 large [[Cookbook:egg|egg]]s * 240 ml (1 cup) chopped [[Cookbook:broccoli|broccoli]] * 120 ml (½ cup) chopped toasted [[Cookbook:almond|almond]]s * 190 ml (¾ cup) chopped [[Cookbook:red onion|red onion]] * 120 ml (½ cup) seasoned dry [[Cookbook:bread crumbs|bread crumbs]] * 80 ml (¼ cup) [[Cookbook:water|water]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and [[Cookbook:pepper|pepper]], to taste * toasted [[Cookbook:bun|bun]]s or [[Cookbook:bread|bread]] * [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] * [[Cookbook:Lettuce|lettuce]]
== Preparation == # In a bowl, [[Cookbook:beat|beat]] eggs. # Stir in broccoli, almonds, onion, breadcrumbs and water. # Add salt and pepper to taste. # On an oiled 30 cm x 38 cm (12 by 15 inch) [[Cookbook:baking sheet|baking sheet]] shape mixture into 4 patties, each 2cm (3/4 inch) thick. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] in 190 °C (375 °F) oven, turning halfway through cooking, until each side is golden brown, about 25 minutes total. # Serve on buns with mayonnaise and lettuce.
[[Category:Broccoli recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sandwich recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Beverages|Beverages]]
== Ingredients == * 1 [[Cookbook:banana|banana]] * 6 [[Cookbook:strawberries|strawberries]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:milk|milk]] * 3 tbsp [[Cookbook:yogurt|yogurt]] * 5 scoops [[Cookbook:Vanilla Ice Cream|vanilla ice cream]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:cream|cream]] * 2 tsp [[Cookbook:Apple juice|apple juice]] * 2 tsp [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla extract]]
== Method == # [[Cookbook:Purée|Purée]] all ingredients together in a [[Cookbook:blender|blender]].
[[Category:Beverage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Ice cream recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Strawberry recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dairy recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Banana recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients== * 1 small can frozen [[Cookbook:orange juice|orange juice]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:skim milk|skim milk]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:water|water]] * 1 tsp. [[Cookbook:vanilla extract|vanilla extract]] * 1/4 cup [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]] * 14 crushed [[Cookbook:ice|ice]] cubes
==Method== #Place all ingredients in [[Cookbook:blender|blender]] and [[Cookbook:blend|blend]] until smooth. #Serve and enjoy.

revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook: Vegan cuisine|Vegan cuisine]]
==Ingredients== * [[Cookbook:Spelt|Spelt]] * [[Cookbook:Leek|Leek]] * [[Cookbook:Oatmeal|Oat flakes]] * [[Cookbook:Onion|Onions]] * Spices: [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]], [[Cookbook:Chili|chillies]], [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]]
==Procedure== # Grind the spelt coarsely (if you have entire corns). # Soak the spelt with oat flakes in some water, in order to get a viscous substance. The burgers will be more compact if you add more oat flakes. # Cut onions and leek in small pieces. # Fry onions and leek with some oil. # Mix the substance with onions, leek and spices of your choice (cumin is a good choice). # Form flat burgers in a hot, oiled pan.
== Hints == * The burgers are also quite tasty when they are cold and on the next day.
== See also ==
* [[Cookbook:Bean Spelt Oat Spread|Bean Spelt Oat Spread]] * [[Cookbook:Hamburger|Hamburger]]
[[Category:Vegan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Spelt recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Oat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[de:Veganes Leben: Ernährung: Rezepte: Dinkelbratling mit Poree]]

{{recipesummary|Meat recipes|12 servings|60 minutes|3||88 Cal}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat and Poultry|Meat and Poultry]] | [[Cookbook:Bison|Bison]]
'''Bison Loaf''' is a [[Cookbook:Meat Loaf|meat loaf]] made from bison instead of [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]].
==Ingredients== *2 pounds ground [[Cookbook:Bison|bison]] *1½ cups soft [[Cookbook:Bread crumbs|bread crumbs]] (2 slices of bread) or ½ cup fine dry bread crumbs *1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] *½ cup 1% [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] *½ cup [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], chopped *½ medium [[Cookbook:Green Pepper|green pepper]], chopped *2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Worcestershire sauce|Worcestershire sauce]] (optional) *1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Garlic powder|garlic powder]] *½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]]
==Procedure== # In a large bowl, mix all ingredients together. # Form meat mixture into a loaf or pat into a lightly oiled loaf pan. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] in a 300°F oven for 45 minutes until internal temperature reaches 160°F.
Makes 1 loaf (about 12 1-slice servings)
==Notes, tips, and variations==
{|border="1" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" align="left" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 1em; !colspan=6|Nutrition Information for each serving of Bison Loaf |- |Calories||88||Sodium||74 mg||Vitamin C||4 mg |- |Calories from fat||15||Total Carbohydrate||3 g||Calcium||24mg |- |Total Fat||1.7 g||Dietary Fiber||0 g||Protein||13 g |- |Saturated Fat||0.6 g||Sugar||0 g||Iron||1.8 mg |- |Cholesterol||53 mg||Vitamin A||17 RE|| || |}
<br clear=all /> ---- :This recipe is from the public domain U.S. Department of Agriculture [http://www.fns.usda.gov/fdd/facts/hhpfacts/FS-BisonGrdStewFrz.pdf FDPIR Commodity Fact Sheet ''Bison, ground or stew meat, frozen'' (pdf)].
[[Category:Meat recipes|Bison Loaf]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients==
* 1 tablespoon active dry yeast * 1 cup lukewarm water (105-115 degrees) * 1 tablespoon sugar * 2 1/2 cups unbleached all-purpose flour * 1 teaspoon salt * 1 tablespoon olive oil * 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, chopped * 2 tablespoons butter
==Procedure==
# Place yeast, sugar and water in large bowl and allow to become bubbly. # Mix in 2 cups of flour in yeast mixture with salt and 1 tablespoon of the rosemary. Remove to breadboard and knead for 10 minutes. Add the rest of the flour as necessary until doughball is smooth and elastic. # Oil a bowl with olive oil and place dough in it covering with a towel. # Let dough rise in a warm place for 1 hour until doubled. # Punch down dough and divide in half. Let dough rest for 5-10 minutes. # Melt margarine and brush over tops of loaves. Sprinkle remaining rosemary over loaves and gently press into surface. Sprinkle lightly with salt. # Spray baking pan or cookie sheet with cooking spray. Shape the dough into 2 small oval loaves. # Place in preheated 400 degree oven for approximately 13-15 minutes until golden brown.
==Optional== # Loaves can be frozen after cooking to be later thawed and reheated. # Remove from freezer 1 hour before cooking, place in a 350 degree oven for 5 minutes.
[[Category:Bread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rosemary recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|8 - 10|5 - 10 minutes preparation, must be frozen|1}}
A quick and tasty desert that's easy to make using simple ingredients.
==Ingredients== *8 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] (225g) [[Cookbook:Cream cheese|cream cheese]] *8 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] (225g) [[Cookbook:Whipped cream|whipped cream]] *1 ready-made [[Cookbook:Graham Cracker|Graham cracker]] crust (probably some product available specifically in the USA, based on something like a whole-wheat pie crust) *1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (60ml) of unsweetened or unsweetened baking [[Cookbook:Cocoa|cocoa]] *1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (60g) of [[Cookbook:Powdered sugar|powdered sugar]]
==Procedure== #Melt the cream cheese and the whipped cream into a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. #Stir in the remaining ingredients into the bowl. #Pour ingredients into the into ready-made crust #Cover and place in a refrigerator/freezer. Remove when solid. #Serve.
==Notes, tips and variations== *Fresh fruit, such as blueberries and cherries, make a nice addition. *Melted caramel makes a nice touch when dribbled on top. *Use fudge or melted chocolate bars in place of the cocoa.
[[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pie recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cream Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
[[Image:Chocolate-Chip-Roll-Broken-2006Feb24.JPG|thumb|right|200px|A roll ready to eat]]
'''Chocolate Chip Rolls''' - This is a recipe grown out of an experiment on my usual biscuit recipe; they're not extremely sweet, but fall closer to dessert than just rolls or biscuits.
== Ingredients ==
I tend to cook with half whole wheat flour and half white flour; the recipe should work fine with all white flour as well (probably a little less milk).
* 2c (280g) [[Cookbook:Whole-wheat flour|Whole-wheat flour]] * 2c (280g) [[Cookbook:White unbleached flour|White unbleached flour]] * 1t [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] * 3t [[Cookbook:Baking powder|Baking powder]] * 1 1/2c (360ml) [[Cookbook:Milk|Milk]] ([[Cookbook:soy milk|soy milk]] works fine, too, with no appreciable change in taste) * 1/2c (120ml) [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|Vegetable oil]] * [[Cookbook:Chocolate chips|Chocolate chips]] (or small chocolate pieces)
== Procedure ==
[[Image:Chocolate-Chip-Roll-Dough-With-Chips-2006Feb24.JPG|thumb|right|200px|A roll in progress.]]
* Preheat over to 425°F (210°C) * Mix dry ingredients * Add liquid ingredients to dry, mix * Turn dough out onto floured baking cloth and knead slightly * Roll dough into log, cut into 8-12 pieces * Press pieces flat, sprinkle with chocolate chips, and roll * Place rolls on greased baking sheet, cook 13-15min * Enjoy! Best fresh.
[[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

[[Image:Rice bubble cake.JPG|thumb|right|The finished product]] {{recipe}}
'''Rice Bubble cake''' is a quick and easy to make. Made with ricies, the only other ingredients are butter, sugar and honey.
==Ingredients== *4 oz. [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] *3 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|Tsp.]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *2 heaped [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp.]] [[Cookbook:Honey|honey]] *5 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] Rice Bubbles
==Preparation== #Add the first three ingredients to a large saucepan (large enough to later add the Rice Bubbles) and melt over a medium heat #Bring the mixture to the boil and allow it to turn over for about four minutes or until the mixture starts to turn brown. Stir occasionally #Remove from the heat and add the Rice Bubbles. Stir well to evenly mix everything together #Press the mixture into a lined tin #Before it sets too hard, cut into squares with a knife
<gallery> Image:Rice bubble cake ingredients.JPG|The ingredients. Clockwise from the top is butter, honey, sugar and Rice Bubbbles. Image:Rice bubble cake start boiling.JPG|How the mixture looks at the start of boiling. Image:Rice bubble cake end of boiling.JPG|How the mixture looks at the end of boiling. Image:Rice bubble cake in saucepan.JPG|All the ingredients together in the saucepan </gallery>
[[Category:Dessert recipes|Rice Bubble Cake]] [[Category:Cookie recipes|Rice Bubble Cake]]

[[Image:Gingersnaps.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Foot-shaped ginger snaps]] {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
==Ingredients== * 4 sticks butter (2 C) * 2 C dark molasses * 2 t cinnamon * a little allspice * 1 t ground cloves * 1 lb dark brown sugar * 1 t nutmeg * 1 T ground ginger (or several times more for spicier ginger flavor) * a little black pepper * 10–12 C flour
Makes 500 cookies
==Procedure== [[Image:cutting_ginger_snaps.jpg|300px|right]]
*Soften butter and put in a large bowl; add molasses, sugar, and spices; mix.
*Add flour, mixing in one cup at a time up to 10 cups, working first with a fork, then by hand. Add another cup or two of flour until the dough holds together.
*Let cool.
*Preheat oven to '''350°F'''.
*Roll as thin as possible and cut with cookie cutters.
*Bake for '''7 minutes''' per batch. Let cool on a rack.
[[Category:Cookie recipes|Ginger Snap]] [[Category:Ginger recipes|Ginger Snap]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients== [[Image:Date nut bars.jpg|thumb|Date nut bars]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Nuts and seeds|nuts]], ground (e.g., [[Cookbook:Pecan|pecans]]) * 1 cup seeded [[Cookbook:date|date]]s, ground * ½ cup [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Egg White|egg white]]s * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:cream|cream]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:flour|flour]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * 1½ cup [[Cookbook:Powdered Sugar|confectioner's sugar]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla extract]]
== Directions == ===Bars=== * [[Cookbook:Grinding|Grind]] the nuts and dates; [[Cookbook:sift|sift]] in the granular sugar. * In another bowl, : [[Cookbook:Whipping|whip]] egg whites until stiff. : Gradually add the sugar mixture, whipping constantly. : [[Cookbook:Folding|Fold]] in the cream. * Sift the flour. * Resift the flour with the baking powder and fold into the egg mixture. * Grease and flour baking sheet. * Pat dough ½ thick on [[Cookbook:Cookie Sheet|baking sheet]] and [[Cookbook:Baking|bake]] for 10 minutes at 350°F (175°C).
===Glaze=== [[Cookbook:Mixing|Mix]] confectioner's sugar with lemon juice and vanilla in a [[Cookbook:blender|blender]]. When the cookies are still hot, spread the glaze over them.
[[Category:Cookie recipes|Date nut bar]] [[Category:Date recipes|Date nut bar]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegan cuisine|Vegan cuisine]]
==Ingredients== * [[w:Semolina|Semolina]] * [[w:Oatmeal|Oat flakes]] * [[w:Onions|Onions]] * optional: ** Hacked [[w:paprika|paprika]] ** [[w:Maize|Maize]] ** [[w:Button_mushroom|Champignons]] ** [[w:Leek_%28vegetable%29|Leek]] ** [[w:Soy_sauce|Soy sauce]] ** [[w:Cornstarch|Cornstarch]] ** Breading: [[w:breading|breading mix]], salt, pepper, optional: [[w:cumin|cumin]], [[w:oregano|oregano]], [[w:Savory (herb)|savory]]
==Procedure== * Mix semolina with oat flakes at a ratio of 4 : 1. * Add water and stir until you get a viscous substance. You can add spices to the substance but most spices go into the breading mix, which is where you want them to be. * Cut onions into pieces and fry them with some oil, add maize and paprika to taste when the onions turn glassy. * Mix the breading mix with salt, pepper and spices of your choice on a plate. Keep some of the breading mix to sprinkle it on the patties. * Spread the substance on the breading mix in the form of burger patties. * Sprinkle the remaining breading mix on the patties. * Push the patties carefully on a spatula and fry them in a hot, oiled pan. If you use too much oil the patties will be soaked in fat, if you use too little the breading mix will not be fried. It's probably best to add a little bit of oil and then shuffle the patties around in the pan. The patties very quickly become robust enough so you can easily pick them up and turn them with a spatula to see if the other side had enough oil. * You may want to ** shake off loose breading mix over the plate, so as not to put loose breading mix into the pan. ** topple the patties into the pan. ** flatten the patties a bit with the spatula, so the breading mix on the underside touches the oiled pan everywhere.
== Variants == * Adding 5 to 10% of [[w:cornstarch|cornstarch]] makes the patties looser. * You can mix semolina and oat flakes 1:1, which makes the patties more compact. * Adding [[w:Gluten|gluten]] (or [[w:Wheat_gluten_%28food%29|seitan]] mix) makes the patties tougher, without making them more compact. * Without breading the patties require less oil.
== See also == * [[Cookbook:Hamburger|Hamburger]]
[[Category:Vegan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[de:Veganes_Leben:_Ern%C3%A4hrung:_Rezepte:_Weichweizengrie%C3%9Fbratling]]

{{recipesummary|Pastry recipes|32|20 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Appetizers|Appetizers]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|US Cuisine]]
'''Ackawi Cheese Triangles''' make use of a speciality (ackawi) cheese.
==Ingredients== * 2 sheets frozen puff pastry, * thawed 2 cups (8 ounces) shredded Wisconsin Ackawi cheese * 1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley * 1/4 cup chopped onion * 1 egg white, slightly beaten * 1/4 teaspoon ground red pepper
Makes 32 pieces.
==Procedure==
Combine cheese, parsley, onion, egg white and red pepper; set aside.
On a lightly floured surface, roll 1 sheet pastry into a 12x12 inch square; cut into 16 3x3 inch squares. Place 1 tablespoon cheese mixture on each square; fold pastry over each filling, forming a triangle. Seal edges with tines of a fork; place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 400° F for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Repeat process with second sheet of puff pastry. Serve warm.
[[Category:Pastry recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: copy edit, removed incomplete recipe (don't kill me, see talk page)
revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of India|Indian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Barfi''' is an Indian sweet made from condensed milk, cooked until it solidifies. Barfis or Burfis are popular all over [[Cookbook:Cuisine of India|India]] and are often a part of Indian festivals.
[[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Indian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Coconut recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
== Ingredients == * 1/2 lb. puff pastry
=== Nut roast === * 1 large onion (chopped) * 1 oz. margarine * 8 oz. Brazil nuts * 4 oz. breadcrumbs * 1 1/2 tbsp. lemon juice * 1/4 tsp. dried thyme * 1/4 tsp. mixed spice * 1 egg * Salt and pepper
=== Stuffing === * 4 oz. breadcrumbs * 1 tbsp. onion (chopped) * 1/2 oz. chopped parsley * 2 tsp. lemon juice * 1 1/2 oz. margarine
== Method == # Preheat the oven to 200c # Fry the ''Nut roast'' onion in margarine for 10 minutes, until soft. # Put this in a bowl with the rest of the ''Nut roast'' ingredients. # Mix all of the ''Stuffing'' ingredients in another bowl to make a soft mixture that holds together. # Season. # Form the stuffing into a sausage shape 5 inches long and place down the middle of the pastry. # Pile the nut roast on top of the stuffing. # Fold the ends of the pastry to completely enclose the mixture. Tuck in the ends. # Decorate with pastry holly leaves and make a lattice design on top. # Place on a damp baking sheet, join side down. # Bake for 30 minutes until crisp.
[[Category:Nut recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|4|30 minutes|2|Image=[[Image:Chickenmalvani.jpg|235px|Malvani Kombdi Vade]]}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat_Recipes|Meat recipes]]
'''Kombdi Vade''' is a Malvani dish, which is quite popular in [[Maharashtra]]. The dish consists of the traditional Malvani [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] curry (including chicken pieces with bones), vade (also known as puri, which is a fluffy, fried bread of wheat and nachni flour), onion, lemon and solkadhi (a drink made from coconut milk).
==Ingredients== *800 [[Cookbook:g|g]] (1.8 [[Cookbook:Pound|lb]]) or 8 medium sized pieces of [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] *1 [[Cookbook:Coconut|coconut]] grated *4 [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]] chopped *1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] [[Cookbook:chilli|Chilli Powder]] *1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] [[Cookbook:Turmeric|turmeric]] *2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsps]] [[Cookbook:Garam Masala|garam masala]] *2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsps]] Malvani Special Masala *8 [[Cookbook:Green chilly|green chillies]] chopped *2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] paste *2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] paste *2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbs]] oil *[[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] to taste *finely chopped coriander leaves for garnishing
==Procedure== #Grind half of the green chillies to a paste and mix it well with the ginger and garlic pastes. #Make cuts on the chicken pieces, rub this mixture on to them well and marinate for about an hour at least. #Roast coconut shavings in a little hot oil till light brown. Cool and grind along with half the onions to a paste. #Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pan and saute the onions on medium level for about 2 minute(s) or till they are light brown in color. #Add the remaining chopped green chillies, spice powders and fry for a few seconds. Add the marinated chicken pieces and fry on medium level for about 3 minutes or till they are lightly browned. #Add the paste, salt and mix well. Add water according to the desired level of consistency and bring to a boil. Cover and cook on low level for about 25 minute(s) or till the chicken pieces are tender and fully cooked. #Garnish with finely chopped coriander leaves.
==Notes, tips and variations==
If it is difficult to obtain fresh coconut, it can be replaced by desscicated coconut shavings. For this recipe, there is no need to soak it in warm water. Roast it directly.
==Links== {{wikipedia|Kombdi Vade}} {{wikipedia|Malvani cuisine}}
[[Category:Indian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Meat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Coconut recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Coriander recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
This is an easier version of [[Cookbook:Peanut Brittle|Peanut Brittle]] that can be prepared in under 10 minutes using a microwave.
==Ingredients== *1 cup sugar *1/2 cup white corn syrup *1 cup roasted peanuts *1 teaspoon butter *1 teaspoon vanilla *1 teaspoon baking soda
==Directions== *Lightly grease cookie sheet and set aside. *In 1 1/2 qt. casserole dish stir together sugar and syrup. Microwave at high for 4 minutes. *Stir in peanuts. Microwave at high for 3-5 minutes or until light brown. *Add butter and vanilla, blending well. Microwave at high 1-2 minutes more. Peanuts will be lightly browned and syrup very hot. *Add baking soda and stir gently until light and foamy. *Pour mixture onto greased cookie sheet. Let cool 1/2 hour to 1 hour. When cool, break into small pieces and store in airtight container. *Makes about 1 pound.
==Tips== *Take care not to overcook or undercook. Overcooking results in a burnt taste, and undercooking results in a taffy-like consistency that sticks to the teeth. *Microwave times will depend on the power of your individual microwave. It may take a few experiments before you determine what is the right cooking time. *If you start seeing part of the mixture turning brown, it is probably beginning to burn. Remove immediately.
[[Category:Candy recipes|Peanut Brittle]] [[Category:Peanut recipes|Peanut Brittle]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegan cuisine|Vegan cuisine]]
An '''Rice-Oat_Semolina Burger''' is a [[Cookbook:Vegan cuisine|vegan]] version of a [[Cookbook:hamburger|hamburger]], with a patty made from rice, oats, semolina, and onions.
==Ingredients== * [[Cookbook:Rice|Rice]] * [[Cookbook:Oatmeal|Oat flakes]] * [[Cookbook:Semolina|Semolina]] * [[Cookbook:Onion|Onions]] * optional: ** Chopped [[Cookbook:paprika|paprika]] ** [[Cookbook:Maize|Maize]] ** [[Cookbook:Mushroom|Mushrooms]] ** [[Cookbook:Leek|Leek]] ** [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|Soy sauce]] ** Spices: [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]], [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]], [[Cookbook:cumin|cumin]], [[Cookbook:oregano|oregano]], [[Cookbook:Savory|savory]]
==Procedure== * Mix about the same amount of rice, oat flakes and semolina. * Add water and stir until you get a viscous substance. * Add spices to taste. * Cut onions and leek into pieces and fry them with some oil, add maize, paprika and mushrooms to taste when the onions turn glassy. * Fry in a hot, oiled pan. Use oil sparingly or the patties will be soaked in fat. * You may want to flatten the patties a bit with the spatula.
==Tips== * The patties are also quite tasty entirely without spices, only with onions. * The patties can make a reasonably good substitute for fried chicken meat, e.g. for salads.
== See also == * [[Cookbook:Hamburger|Hamburger]]
[[Category:Vegan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sandwich recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rice recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Oat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[de:Veganes Leben: Ernährung: Rezepte: Reis-Haferflocken-Weizengrießbratling]]

{{recipesummary|Chinese recipes|4|1 hour|3}}
{{recipe}}
'''Steamed Pork With Mustard Greens''' (梅菜扣肉, [[w:Pinyin|pinyin]]: Méicàikòuròu) or '''Mei Cai Kou Rou''' is a [[w:Chinese cuisine|Chinese]] dish from the [[w:Hakka cuisine|Hakka]] people. It is very popular and tasty but contains a lot of saturated fat.
==Ingredients== * About 10.5 ounces [[Cookbook:Mustard Greens|mustard greens]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:cornstarch|cornstarch]] combined with 1 teaspoon cold water * 1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]] * 2 teaspoons light [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Rice Wine|rice wine]] or water * 3/4 pound [[Cookbook:pork|pork]] tenderloin * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Black Bean and Garlic Sauce|black bean and garlic sauce]] * About 2 tablespoons water * Freshly ground [[Cookbook:black pepper|black pepper]]
==Directions== # Wash greens and discard tough stems. Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add greens and time 2 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking. Drain again, then cut greens into long diagonal strips. # In a medium bowl, combine cornstarch and water. Stir in sugar, soy sauce and rice wine. Cut pork into thin slices and add to the mixture. Marinate about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. # Heat oil in a preheated wok or large heavy skillet over medium heat. Add black bean sauce and stir-fry 1 minute, then add pork and stir-fry 2 minutes. Add mustard greens and water. Mix well and simmer gently about 4 to 5 minutes, until pork is cooked through and greens are tender. Season with pepper and serve.
==See Also== * [[w:Chinese cuisine|Chinese cuisine]] * [[w:Hakka cuisine|Hakka cuisine]] * [[w:Braising|Braising]]
==References== * Hsiung, Deh-Ta. ''The Chinese Kitchen: A Book of Essential Ingredients with Over 200 Easy and Authentic Recipes''. New York: St. Martin's Griffin, 2002.
[[Category:Chinese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pork recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Salad Dressing recipes|4|10 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Salad Recipes|Salad Recipes]]
This variation on the basic [[Cookbook:Vinaigrette|vinaigrette]] is much thicker and goes great with contrasting flavors in salad such as dried cranberries and bell peppers.
==Ingredients== * 6 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Dijon Mustard|Dijon mustard]] * 5 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] (light or virgin) * 2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]] or [[Cookbook:Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Honey|honey]] * [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Cookbook:pepper|pepper]] to taste
==Procedure== # [[Cookbook:Mix|Mix]] all ingredients except oil until well blended, and then slowly pour in oil until fully incorporated. # Add salt and pepper to taste.
[[Category:Salad Dressing recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vinegar recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Oil recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Mustard recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|Cuisine of the USA]]
'''Green Chili Stew''' is a New Mexican dish that is known as the beef stew of New Mexico. It is a basic dish with as many variations as there are cooks. Usually served with tortillas or sopapillas.
== Ingredient == * 2 pounds cubed stew meat * 2 tablespoons vegetable oil * 1 chopped onion * 2 minced cloves of garlic * 6 green New Mexican roasted and peeled chiles * 2 peeled and dice potatoes * 3 to 4 cups water * 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano * 1 cup of celery * 1 can of corn (2 if desired)
== Procedure == # Place the meat in a skillet and brown it in the oil, remove the meat and place it in a stock pot. # Put the onions in the skillet, and sauté until they are browned. # Add the garlic and cook for an additional couple of minutes. # Remove them from the skillet and add to the meat. # Add all the remaining ingredients, and simmer for 1 to 2 hours or until the meat is very tender.
[[Category:Chile recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Mexican recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Meat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Stew recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
This is a delicious, refreshing, and simple Brazilian dessert. It does have some alcohol (Creme de Cassis -- blackcurrant liqueur), but a non-alcoholic blackcurrant syrup could be substituted.
==Ingredients == * 1 ripe [[Cookbook:papaya|papaya]] * 1 scoop [[Cookbook:vanilla ice cream|vanilla ice cream]] * 1 tbsp. [[Cookbook:blackcurrant liqueur|blackcurrant liqueur]] * 1 sprig of [[Cookbook:mint|mint]] for decoration (optional)
== Procedure == ;Method 1: #Peel papaya and remove seeds. [[Cookbook:Cube|Cube]] the papaya. #Put papaya pieces in [[Cookbook:blender|blender]] with ice cream and blackcurrant liqueur. [[Cookbook:Blend|Blend]] well until smooth. #Pour into a small bowl and decorate with mint.
;Method 2: #Peel papaya and remove seeds. Cube the papaya. #Put papaya pieces in blender with ice cream and blend until creamy consistency. #Pour some blackcurrant liqueur on the bottom of a large dessert glass. #Add the cream mixture. Add a swirl of blackcurrant liqueur on the top.
;Method 3: #Cut papaya in half and remove seeds. Scoop papaya from peel with a spoon (this is easier and cleaner than peeling the fruit). #Place approximately equal portions of papaya and vanilla ice cream in a blender. Blend until creamy. #Place the mixture into a serving dish and pour about an ounce of [[Cookbook:Creme de Cassis|Creme de Cassis]] on top.
Either way, it is best served immediately, but can be chilled for a short time.
Serves one.
[[Category:Papaya recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Brazilian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]]
'''Pumpkin Bread''' is a type of moist "quick" bread that is relatively simple to make.
==Ingredients== *3½ [[Cookbook:cup|cup]]s (840 ml) [[Cookbook:flour|flour]] *2 [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]]s [[Cookbook:baking soda|baking soda]] *1½ teaspoons [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] *2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:cinnamon|cinnamon]] *1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:nutmeg|nutmeg]] *3 cups (720 ml) [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]] *1 cup (240 ml) [[Cookbook:vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] *4 [[Cookbook:egg|egg]]s *⅔ cups (160 ml) [[Cookbook:water|water]] *2 c. canned [[Cookbook:pumpkin|pumpkin]]
==Method== #Preheat oven to 180 °C (350 °F). #Sift dry ingredients together. #Mix pumpkin, water, oil and eggs together in another bowl. Pour into dry mixture and mix well. #Pour into 2 greased 9x5x3-inch [[Cookbook:loaf pan|loaf pan]]s. [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] 1 hour and 15 minutes or until toothpick inserted in middle of loaf comes out clean. Cool before removing from pans.
[[Category:Pumpkin recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: copy edit, added what I hope is a clarification of step 2 (about lard melting)
revision.text:
{{recipe}}
'''Hot water crust''' is a type of [[Cookbook:Pastry|pastry]] used for savory [[Cookbook:Pie|pie]]s, such as [[Cookbook:Pork Pie|pork pie]]s and [[Cookbook:Steak and Kidney Pie|steak and kidney pie]]s. As it contains [[Cookbook:Lard|lard]], it is unsuitable for [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|vegetarians]]. Vegetable fat or [[Cookbook:Shortening|shortening]] can be substituted in equal measure, but the texture will be slightly different (and mouthfeel will be somewhat lighter) due to the "grain" of lard.
== Ingredients ==
* 170g (6 oz) [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 170ml (6 fl oz) [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 85g (3 oz) [[Cookbook:Lard|lard]] * [[Cookbook:Pinch|pinch]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
== Procedure == # Sift the flour and salt into a bowl. Make a well in the center. # Place the water and lard into a [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]] over low heat. When the lard has melted, bring to a boil. # Pour the mixture into the center of the flour. # Working very quickly, mix with a wooden spoon. # Knead with hands to produce a smooth dough. # This pastry must be used while still warm; otherwise it will become brittle and hard to mould.
== Notes, tips, and variations == * Sometimes an [[Cookbook:Egg|egg yolk]] is added to the flour and salt mixture.
[[Category:English recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pastry recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
As carrots are fairly sweet, they can often be used in sweet dishes with good results. One such recipe is carrot jam; this is a simple version from [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Denmark|Denmark]]:
== Ingredients == * 1 kg peeled, finely grated [[Cookbook:carrot|carrot]]s * 1/4 1 [[Cookbook:water|water]] * Juice of 4 [[Cookbook:lemon|lemon]]s * 1/2 kg [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]]
== Procedure == # [[Cookbook:Boil|Boil]] the water and carrots until tender. # Add juice and sugar, and continue to boil for a further 15-20 minutes.
[[Category:Carrot recipes]] [[Category:Jam and Jelly recipes]] [[Category:Danish recipes]]

revision.comment: Revert to revision 1008267 dated 2007-10-20 12:49:37 by Herbythyme using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Beverages|Beverages]]
'''Butter tea''', known as ''Po Cha'', is a traditional drink of the [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Tibet|Tibetans]] and is also consumed in [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Bhutan|Bhutan]]. Butter tea is an indispensable part of Tibetan life. Before work, a Tibetan will down several bowlfuls of this tangy beverage, and it is always served to guests. Since butter is the main ingredient, butter tea is a very warming drink and a good antidote to the cold, so it is especially suited to high altitudes.
According to the Tibetan custom, butter tea is drunk in separate sips, and after each sip the host refills the bowl to the brim. Thus the guest never drains his bowl yet it is constantly topped up. If the visitor does not wish to drink, the best thing to do is leave the tea untouched until the time comes to leave and then drain the bowl. In this way etiquette is observed and the host will not be offended.
== Ingredients == * 1 tablespoon regular [[Cookbook:Tea|black tea]] (preferably [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Nepal|Nepalese]] or [[Cookbook:Cuisine of India|Indian]]) * 3 cups whole [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] (or 1½ cup "half-and-half" / "lite" milk + 1½ cup water) * 2 tablespoons unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] to taste
== Procedure == # Boil tea with milk for 2-10 min, depending upon the strength of tea desired # Strain into tea cups. # Add butter and salt. Stir thoroughly - ideally by carefully using a blender - and serve. Makes two servings.
==External link== [http://www.tanc.org/new_food/pocha.html Read more]
[[Category:Tibetan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
'''Boilo''' is a traditional Yuletide drink of the north-eastern United States, specifically Pennsylvania.
Boilo is a type of whiskey-based liqueur made with oranges, lemons, sugar and various different spices such as cinnamon. Recipes vary and may include nutmeg, cloves, caraway seed and aniseed.
== Ingredients == * 2 medium-large [[Cookbook:orange|orange]]s * 2 [[Cookbook:lemon|lemon]]s * 1 small box [[Cookbook:raisin|raisin]]s (about 1½ ounces [40g]) * 8 oz (220g) [[Cookbook:honey|honey]] * 12 oz (355 mL) [[Cookbook:whiskey|whiskey]] (or more, to taste).<ref> Use Four Roses, or Seagrams 7, or something similar. At least 80 proof (40% alcohol).</ref> * ½ to 1 teaspoon each of any or all of these spices: [[Cookbook:cinnamon|cinnamon]], [[Cookbook:nutmeg|nutmeg]], [[Cookbook:cloves|cloves]], [[Cookbook:Caraway|caraway seed]], [[Cookbook:Anise|aniseed]]
==Procedure== #Make this in a [[Cookbook:Crock Pot|crock pot]]. It's easier than cooking on the stove and much less likely to overcook or scorch. For the quantities shown here, a small (1.5 quart) crock pot will do. #Peel the oranges and lemons. Cut up the fruit and squeeze them into the crock pot. A [[Cookbook:Garlic Press|garlic press]] works, or some kind of juicer or fruit squeezer. Put the remaining fruit pulp into the crock pot as well. #Add the raisins, honey, and spices. Stir. #*NOTE: do not add whiskey yet! #Start the crock pot and let the mixture cook for about 2-4 hours. Stir occasionally. It's complete when the fruit pulp gets cooked down. #Strain into a pitcher. Mash down the fruit in the strainer to get all the liquid. Now add the whiskey to the pitcher and stir. If you cook the whiskey, even for a short time, the alcohol will start to evaporate . Taste, and add more whiskey to your liking. #Serve hot in shot glasses, espresso cups, or coffee mugs. After the first round, each individual serving can be heated in the microwave. #This recipe makes about 12 ounces (355 mL) of "virgin" boilo. Add 12 ounces of whiskey to this and you get 24 ounces (710 mL) of coal region nectar, enough for 12-18 servings. ==Notes== <references/>
[[Category:Cocktails with whiskey|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Slow cooker recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Thailand|Cuisine of Thailand]]
'''''Bua Loi''''' or '''Thai Rice Balls in Coconut Milk'''
== Ingredients == * 3 cups (700g) [[Cookbook:Rice Flour|glutinous rice flour]] * 1.5 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Pandan Essence|pandan essence]] * 4 cups (950ml) [[Cookbook:Coconut|coconut cream]] * 2 cups (480g) [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]] * 1 teaspoon (5ml) [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * 3 [[Cookbook:egg|egg]]s (optional)
== Procedure == # Mix the rice flour with enough water to make a stiff paste. The pandan essence should be added to the water before mixing with the rice flour. [[Cookbook:Knead|Knead]] well and then form pea-sized balls. # Bring a large pot of water to a [[Cookbook:boil|boil]], toss in the balls and remove when they float to the surface. Drain. # Bring half the coconut cream to a boil, stirring constantly to prevent it from separating, then add the flour balls. # When the mixture returns to a boil, remove from heat and stir in the remaining coconut cream. # Serve as dessert in small bowls. Thais often add [[Cookbook:Sweet Corn|sweet corn]] kernels to the final product.
If serving this dish with eggs, in a separate saucepan bring water to a boil and reduce heat, crack eggs one at a time into the water. When eggs are done, remove from water and set aside. One egg should be added to each bowl prior to serving.
[[Category:Thai recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rice recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Coconut recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes with metric units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegan cuisine|Vegan cuisine]]
'''Seitan burgers''' (''[[wikipedia:Schnitzel|vegetarian Schnitzel]]'') have a consistency similar to that of [[w:fillet|fillet]] and are easy to cover with breading. For the breading the usual spices for meat can be used.
==Ingredients== * [[Cookbook:Gluten|Gluten]] (see [[Cookbook:Seitan|Seitan]] for how to gain gluten from wheat flour) * [[Cookbook:Soy_sauce|Soy sauce]] * Salt * optional: ** Spices (e.g. [[Cookbook:Garlic|Garlic]]) ** [[Cookbook:Onion|Onions]] ** Breading: [[Cookbook:breading|breading mix]], salt, pepper, optional: [[Cookbook:cumin|cumin]], [[Cookbook:oregano|oregano]], [[Cookbook:Savory|savory]]
==Procedure== * Take 25% (volume) more water than gluten flour. * Mix liquid ingredients (e.g. soy sauce) with the water. * Mix solid ingredients (e.g. spices) with the flour. It is much easier to mix solid and liquid ingredients separately than adding ingredients to the gluten dough later, as it is very rubbery and sticky. * Make gluten dough from 100% gluten flour (or use wheat flour, see above) and water. The dough should be suitable for kneading. * The patties can be formed easily by hand and are sticky enough to pick up the breading mix easily. * The finished patties can be fried in an oiled pan. Don't use too much oil but enough to let the breading pick up some oil on both sides.
[[Category:Vegan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Seitan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[de:Veganes_Leben: Ernährung: Rezepte: Seitan-Bratling]]

{{recipe}}
'''Beef Stroganoff''', in its simplest form, is simply tender beef with a mushroom and sour cream sauce served over rice or [[Cookbook:Noodle|noodles]].
The current accepted history of this dish dates back to the 1890s when a chef* working for Count Pavel Alexandrovich Stroganov (the famous Russian general) invented the recipe for a cooking competition in St. Petersburg. After the fall of Imperial [[Cookbook:cuisine of Russia|Russia]], the recipe was popularly served in the hotels and restaurants of [[Cookbook:cuisine of China|China]] before the start of the Second World War. Russian and Chinese immigrants, as well as U.S. servicemen stationed in China, brought several variants of the dish to the [[Cookbook:cuisine of the United States|United States]], which may account for its popularity during the 1950s. It is commonly served with noodles or rice.
It is also very popular in [[Cookbook:cuisine of Brazil|Brazil]] (where it is better known as "strogonoff" or "estrogonofe"), but the recipe is slightly different there.
Note * Despite the allusion of the name "stroganoff" to Count Paul Stroganoff, a 19th century Russian diplomat, the origins of the dish have never been confirmed. Larousse Gastronomique notes that similar dishes were known since the 18th century but insists the dish by this specific name was the creation of chef '''Charles Briere''' who was working in St. Petersburg when he submitted the recipe to '''L 'Art Culinaire''' in 1891, but the dish seems much older. It did not appear in English cookbooks until 1932, and it was not until the 1940s that beef stroganoff became popular for elegant dinner parties in America.
== Traditional ==
=== Ingredients === * 450g (1 pound) [[Cookbook:beef|beef]] [[Cookbook:chuck roast|chuck roast]] * 1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * 1/2 teaspoon ground [[Cookbook:black pepper|black pepper]] * 110g (4 ounces) [[Cookbook:butter|butter]] * 4 [[Cookbook:green onion|green onion]]s, sliced (white parts only) * 4 tablespoons [[Cookbook:all-purpose flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1 300g (10.5 ounce) can condensed [[Cookbook:broth|beef broth]] * 1 teaspoon prepared [[Cookbook:mustard|mustard]] * 1 150g (6 ounce) can sliced [[Cookbook:mushroom|mushrooms]], drained * 160ml (1/3 cup) [[Cookbook:sour cream|sour cream]] * 160ml (1/3 cup) [[Cookbook:white wine|white wine]] * [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] to taste * ground [[Cookbook:black pepper|black pepper]] to taste
=== Procedure === #Remove any fat and gristle from the roast and cut into strips 1/2 inch thick by 2 inches long. Season with 1/2 teaspoon of both salt and pepper. #In a large [[Cookbook:skillet|skillet]] over medium heat, melt the butter and [[Cookbook:browning|brown]] the beef strips quickly, then push the beef strips off to one side. Add the onions and cook slowly for 3 to 5 minutes, then push to the side with the beef strips. #Stir the flour into the juices on the empty side of the pan. Pour in beef broth and bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Lower the heat and stir in mustard. #Cover and simmer for 1 hour or until the meat is tender. #Five minutes before serving, stir in the mushrooms, sour cream, and white wine. Heat briefly then salt and pepper to taste.
Also very popular as a basic food service dish as it is very easy to produce it in large quantities.
== Quick and Easy ==
=== Ingredients === * 2 pkg (around 1.5 - 2.0 pounds) Bit Size [[Cookbook:beef|beef]] (I prefer pre-cut stew meat. Left-over steaks cut into pieces works well. Ground beef browned in a skillet can also work if you have it around.) * 1 can (8oz) [[Cookbook:cream of mushroom soup|cream of mushroom soup]] * 1/2 can (4oz) [[Cookbook:broth|beef broth]] * 1 Tub (8oz) [[Cookbook:sour cream|sour cream]] * 1 bag (16oz) [[Cookbook:egg noodles|egg noodles]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] and [[Cookbook:pepper|pepper]] to taste
=== Procedure === # Cook egg noodles in a large pot according to directions. # While egg noodles cook, season the beef with salt and pepper and [[Cookbook:brown|brown]] the meat in a [[Cookbook:skillet|skillet]] unless it is already cooked. Low and slow makes a tender product. If meat is already cooked, heat the meat in the [[Cookbook:microwave oven|microwave]] or in a skillet. # Drain egg noodles. # Mix cream of mushroom soup, beef broth, and sour cream in the pot used for the egg noodles. Season the sauce with salt and pepper keeping in mind that many of the ingredients contain plenty of salt. # Add noodle mixture with beef and serve.
This meal makes great left-overs.
===External links=== [http://www.maria-brazil.org/brazilian_strogonoff.htm Recipe for Brazilian-style stroganoff]
[[Category:Beef recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Russian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of China|Cuisine of China]]
Cantonese roast duck/goose (烧鸭\烧鹅)
== Ingredients == * Duck/Goose 3-6 pounds (1.3kg - 2.6kg) * 3 green onions or 1 onion
=== Marinade === * 2 tbsps light soy sauce * 2 tbsps dark soy sauce (option, can use light soy sauce instead) * 2 cups (450ml) of white wine/sherry/Chinese cooking wine * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Five Spice Powder|Chinese five spice powder]]
=== Glaze === * 2 tbsps [[Cookbook:Hoisin Sauce|Hoisin Sauce]] * 2 tbsps dark soy sauce
== Procedure ==
=== Preparation === # Mix all marinade ingredients together. # Mix all glaze ingredients together. # Wipe the mixture all over the duck/goose, inside and outside. # Wipe the glaze mixture inside the duck/goose # Sit duck in breast up, in an open container and on a rack # Put in the refrigerator to chill over night.
=== Cooking === # Preheat oven to 450°F (220°C) # Put 1 to 1/2 inch (2.5cm) of water in the roasting pan (so to catch the grease come out from the duck/goose while roasting and prevent smoking of the grease in the oven) # Place onion inside duck/goose, put duck/goose in the roasting pan, on a roasting rack, # Place duck/goose in the oven, back up, for 15 minutes # Turn duck/goose to breast up, roast for another 15 minutes # Turn oven heat to 375°F (190°C), roast the duck/goose until internal temperature reach a minimum of 180F (test between the thigh, the thickest part of the duck/goose, be careful not to touch the bone) # Glaze the duck/goose, turn oven up to 450°F (200°C) and roast again for about 10 minutes
Carve and serve!
[[Category:Duck recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Goose recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chinese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|8-10|prep: 20 minutes
baking: 60 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|United States]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] | [[Cookbook:Cake|Cake]] A recipe for a '''spelt cake'''; an ancient-wheat alternative to yellow cake. ==Ingredients== *1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] *1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] *1 cup (240ml) [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] *2 cups (450g) [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *3 cups (650g) [[Cookbook:Spelt|spelt]] [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *3 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] *3 pinches [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *4 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] ==Procedure== #Preheat oven to 175 °C (350 °F) #Cream the butter and sugar together until fluffy. #Beat in the eggs. #Mix in vanilla. #Gradually sift in the dry ingredients, alternating with small additions of the milk. #Transfer to a greased and floured baking pan. #Bake at 175 °C (350 °F), until a skewer inserted shows no moist crumbs. [[Category:Cake recipes|Spelt Cake]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Spelt Cake]] [[Category:American recipes|Spelt Cake]] [[Category:Spelt recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Bread Recipes|Bread Recipes]]
'''Cinnamon croutons''' are a sweet variation on the classic salad crouton, which can be used to enhance a fruit salad. Alternately, these croutons make a good addition to pumpkin, sweet potato or carrot soups.
==Ingredients== *4 slices day-old [[Cookbook:French bread|French bread]], cubed *4 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Walnut|walnut]] [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] *4 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|ground cinnamon]]
Makes enough croutons for 4 to 6 servings of fruit salad.
==Procedure== # Combine sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl, and set aside. # Preheat the oven to 350°F (~180°C). # Pour the walnut oil into a pan and fry the bread cubes in it, tossing to coat with oil. # Spread the bread cubes on a baking sheet and garnish with cinnamon sugar. Bake for 8 minutes or until crispy and dry. Allow to cool well before handling, as the sugar will make these croutons easier to brown, and thus hotter to handle initially.
[[Category:Bread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes with metric units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{merge|Cookbook:Lemon curd}} {{recipe}}
Lemon curd is a custard-like dessert sauce made with eggs, lemon juice and zest, sugar, and butter. It goes well with scones, short breads, and muffins.
This recipe will produce one full 12-ounce (330g) jar of lemon curd (similar to but not the same as lemon pie filling), plus a little left over so you can lick the bowl. Lemon curd keeps for up to a week in the refrigerator. It is excellent on short bread, biscuits, scones, and English muffins.
You can prepare this recipe in about 20 minutes.
==Equipment==
* 1-quart saucepan * whisk * measuring cup * grater or zester * medium to large strainer of fine-to-medium mesh * rubber spatula * 1-quart kitchen bowl * stove * 12-ounce (about 330g) jar with sealable lid
==Ingredients==
* 1/2 cup (120ml) freshly squeezed [[Cookbook:lemon|lemon]] juice * 2 tablespoons freshly grated lemon [[Cookbook:zest|zest]] ** (Note: you get these from 1/2 [[Cookbook:Meyer lemon|Meyer lemon]], or 1 robust Morgan lemon, or 3 normal lemons) * 1/3 cup (80g) sugar * 3 eggs * 3/4 stick (6 tablespoons or 3 ounces or 90g) of unsalted [[Cookbook:butter|butter]] * pinch (1/16 teaspoon) of salt (optional, to bring out the sweetness and flavor of finished product)
==Directions==
# Grate the lemon rinds to produce two tablespoons of zest. # Extract the juice from the lemons to produce 1/2 cup of juice. # Cut the butter into small chunks. # Put eggs, zest, sugar, and salt into cooled [[Cookbook:saucepan|saucepan]]. # Whisk ingredients in pan till frothy and light in color (a minute or two). # Add lemon juice and whisk 30 seconds. # Add butter chunks. # Set pan on stove burner, turn on heat to medium-to-low, and start whisking contents so they don't coagulate or stick to bottom of pan. # Whisk constantly till butter melts and mixture thickens, then whisk another two minutes, but do not let mixture boil - it should be quite steamy (185 degrees). # Set strainer over bowl and pour mixture into strainer, removing all of the mixture with spatula. Note: Some people like the zest left in. # Work the mixture through the strainer with the spatula to strain out the zest and any egg lumps; rake mixture off bottom of strainer into bowl. # Pour mixture from bowl into jar to within 1/4 inch from top, taking care not to get mixture on rim, then seal jar with lid. # Refrigerate to thicken the product further.
[[Category:Jam and Jelly recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Lemon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Duplicate recipes]] [[Category:Recipes with metric units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{merge|Cookbook:Lemon Curd}} {{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|1 full 12-ounce jar |15 - 20 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
A custard-like dessert sauce made with eggs, lemon juice and zest, sugar, and butter. This dish goes well with scones, short breads, and muffins.
===Ingredients===
* 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (120ml) [[Cookbook:Lemon juice|lemon juice]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] freshly grated lemon zest * 1/3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (80g) [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 3/4 stick of unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] (90g) * Pinch of [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] (optional, to bring out sweetness and flavor of finished product)
===Procedure=== # Grate the lemon rind(s) to produce two tablespoons of zest.Grate only the yellow zest, avoid the inner white pith which is bitter. # Extract the juice from the lemon(s) to produce 1/2 cup (120ml) of juice. # Cut the butter into small chunks - slice long ways, flip 1/4 turn and slice again, cut across 8 times to make little chunks # Put eggs, zest, sugar, and salt into cooled sauce pan. # Whisk ingredients in pan till frothy and light in color (a minute or two). # Add lemon juice and whisk 30 seconds. # Add butter chunks. # Set pan on stove burner, turn on heat to medium-to-low, and start whisking contents so they don't coagulate or stick to bottom of pan. # Whisk constantly till butter melts and mixture thickens, then whisk another two minutes, but do not let mixture boil - it should be quite steamy (185 degrees). # Set strainer over bowl and pour mixture into strainer, removing all of the mixture with spatula. Note: Some people like the zest left in. I don't # Work the mixture through the strainer with the spatula to strain out the zest and any egg lumps; rake mixture off bottom of strainer into bowl. # Pour mixture from bowl into jar to within 1/4 inch (0.75cm) from top, taking care not to get mixture on rim, then seal jar with lid. # Refrigerate to thicken the product further.
==Notes, tips and variations== *Keeps for up to a week in the refrigerator.
[[Category:Lemon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Jam and Jelly recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Duplicate recipes]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|6 - 8|10 - 15 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
This is the basic recipe and method for Jewish Rosehip Soup. It is also popular in Iceland and parts of Scandinavia, where, because of the cold temperatures, it's often used for colds and sore throats.
==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:L|litre]] fresh [[Cookbook:rosehip|rosehips]] * 2 [[Cookbook:L|litres]] [[Cookbook:water|water]] * For each litre, 1 liquid quart of rosehip pulp * 1 1/2 [[Cookbook:tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]] * 1 1/2 [[Cookbook:tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:potato flour|potato flour]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:almond|almonds]]
==Method== #Rinse the rosehips. Crush dried hips. Boil in water till soft. #Press through a [[Cookbook:colander|colander]]. Measure the pulp and dilute with water if necessary. #Bring the pulp to a boil and add sugar. Add more sugar if it is too tart. #Mix potato flour with some cold water. Thicken the soup while you stir and bring to a boil. Add blanched and shredded almond.
==Notes, tips, and variations== *Hot soup is often served with vanilla ice cream and/or macaroons. *Cold soup can be diluted to make a nice thirst-quencher. *The Icelandic recipe differs in that cornstarch is used to thicken it, not potato flour.
[[Category:Jewish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Icelandic recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rosehip recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{cookwork|Page should be split}}
{{recipe}}
'''[[w:frito pie|Frito pie]]''' is a corn (maize) chip and [[Cookbook:Chili con carne|chili con carne]] dish popular in the United States.
==Recipe 1==
This is a traditional, and basic, recipe for frito pie. Minor variants are common.
===Ingredients===
* 3 cups (710 ml) Fritos or other corn (maize) chips (a 10 ounce bag is about 6 cups) * ¾ cup (175 ml) chopped onion * 1 cup (240 ml) grated cheddar cheese * 1 pound of ground beef * 1 package of taco seasoning * 2½ cups (590 ml) chili (homemade or canned)
===Directions===
# Brown the ground beef and season according to taco seasoning mix. # Preheat oven to 350° F (175° C). # Spread 2 cups of Fritos in a baking dish. # Sprinkle half the onion and half the cheese over the Fritos. # Combine ground beef with the chili and pour over the onion and cheese. # Sprinkle the remaining Fritos, onion and cheese over the chili. # Bake for 15 or 20 minutes and cheese is bubbly. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.
===Nutrition===
Per serving: 542 calories (311 fat calories), 35 g fat (13 g saturated), 58 mg cholesterol, 19 g protein, 39 g carbohydrates, 6 g fiber, 1075 mg sodium.
==Recipe 2==
This is an alternate recipe. It includes making the chili for the pie.
===Ingredients===
* 2 tablespoons (Tbsps.) (30 ml) vegetable oil * 2 cups (475 ml) chopped onions * Salt * Cayenne pepper * 2 pounds (900 g) beef bottom round, cut into ½ inch (13 mm) cubes * 1 teaspoon (tsp.) (5 ml) chili powder * 2 tsps. (10 ml) ground cumin * Crushed red chile peppers * 2 tsps. (10 ml) dried oregano * 2 Tbsps. (30 ml) chopped garlic * 3 cups (710 ml) crushed tomatoes * ½ cup (120 ml) tomato paste * 2 cups (475 ml) beef stock * 2 cups (475 ml) canned dark red kidney beans * 1½ Tbsps. (22 ml) each masa and flour * 1 bag (10 oz. / 280 g) Fritos * 1½ cups (350 ml) grated Monterey Jack cheese * 6 Tbsps. (90 ml) sour cream * 1 small jar of jalapeños
===Directions===
# In a large saucepan, heat the vegetable oil. # When the oil is hot, add the onions and saute for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the vegetables start to wilt. # Season with salt and cayenne. # Stir in the beef, chili powder, cumin, crushed red pepper, and oregano. # Brown the meat for 5 to 6 minutes. # Stir in the garlic, tomatoes, tomato paste, beef stock, and beans. # Bring the liquid up to a boil and reduce to a simmer. # Simmer the liquid, uncovered for 1 hour, stirring occasionally, or until the beef is tender. Skim off the fat occasionally. # Mix the masa and flour together with a little liquid from the stock pot. # Slowly stir in the masa slurry and continue to cook for 30 minutes. # Reseason with salt and cayenne. # Place a handful of the chips in each shallow bowl. # Spoon the chili over the chips. # Garnish with the grated cheese, sour cream and jalapeños. Makes 8 servings.
==Recipe 3==
Your basic, on the go, craving Frito Pie, recipe:
===Directions===
# Buy a 99¢ Grab-Bag of Fritos. # Buy a basic 99¢ cup of chili from Wendy's (or wherever you like to buy chili) # Carefully open the bag without ripping the sides # Pour the chili over the top of the chips in the bag. # Pour on the hot sauce from the little packets, and a little more grated cheese. # Carefully eat it right out of the bag with a plastic fork, and enjoy.
[[Category:Southwestern recipes|Frito pie]] [[Category:Beef recipes|Frito pie]] [[Category:Stew recipes|Frito pie]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
'''Potato Skins''' is a dish made with Potato halves with cheese and sometimes bacon, green onions, and sour cream sprinkled on top.
==Ingredients== *8 small baking [[Cookbook:potato|potato]]es *Vegetable oil *Garlic salt *2 [[Cookbook:cup|cup]]s (8 oz.) shredded [[Cookbook:Cheddar cheese|Cheddar cheese]] *12 slices [[Cookbook:bacon|bacon]], cooked & crumbled (optional) *2 [[Cookbook:tablespoon|tablespoon]]s chopped fresh [[Cookbook:chive|chive]]s, divided
==Procedure== Scrub potatoes and rub skins with oil. Prick each potato several times with a fork. Bake at 400 degrees for 30-45 minutes or until potatoes are done. Allow potatoes to cool to touch. Cut top third off each potato; discard tops. Carefully scoop out pulp, leaving about 1/8 inch thick shells. (Reserve potato pulp for other uses.)
Fry potato skins in hot oil (375 degrees) for 3-4 minutes or until browned. Invert and drain on paper towels. Place potato skins, cut side up, on an ungreased baking sheet. Sprinkle with garlic salt and Cheddar cheese. Broil 6 inches from heat for 30 seconds or until cheese melts. Top potato skins with bacon if using them and 1 tablespoon chives.
Press green chiles between paper towels to remove excess moisture. Combine chilies, sour cream and red pepper in a small bowl; stir well. Top with remaining 1 tablespoon chives. Serve with potato skins.
Yield: 8 servings.
==Notes== You don't have to make the chili sour cream. You can just put a spoonful of sour cream right onto of the potato skin.
You can also bake these off in the oven to melt the cheese if you didn't want to fry them in oil.
==External links== *[http://www.cooks.com/rec/doc/0,1950,151175-224194,00.html Potato Skins- Cooks.com]
[[Category:Potato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
This popular and tasty dessert makes 10 portions.
==Ingredients== * 8 [[Cookbook:coconut|coconut]]s * 1/2 cup (120g) of [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]] * 9 [[Cookbook:Egg yolk|egg yolk]]s * 3 or 4 [[Cookbook:Pound Cake|pound cake]]s ([[Cookbook:biscochuelo|biscochuelo]]) cut in 1/2in slices * 1 bottle of [[Cookbook:moscatel wine|moscatel wine]] * powdered [[Cookbook:cinnamon|cinnamon]]
== Procedure == # Grate the coconuts. Separate the coconut from the milk of the coconut. Combine the coconut (reserve the milk) with the sugar. Cook until a thick syrup is made. Remove from heat and to allow to rest. # Beat the yolks with a little bit the coconut milk, add this to the syrup. Mix well, return to the heat. Stir constantly until it thickens well. Idea is to obtain a rather thick, very coconutty, coconut cream. # In a glass dish, layer the coconut crème and the pound cake slices soaked in the wine. Continue alternating biscochuelo layers with the coconut cream. Sprinkle the top generously with cinnamon.
[[Category:Coconut recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
[[Image:Pita.jpg|thumb|200px|right|Pita prepared on open fire]]
'''Pita''' (also known as ''pita bread'', ''arabic bread'' etc.) is a [[Cookbook:Yeast|yeast]]-made [[Cookbook:Wheat|wheat]] bread originating from North-African, to Middle-Eastern and to Mediterranean cuisines. It is usually eaten with sauces, dips and fillings. Known dishes that use pita are [[Cookbook:Kebab|kebab]], [[Cookbook:Gyros|gyros]], and [[Cookbook:Shwarma|shwarma]]. Pita is low in saturated fat and cholesterol. 100 grams (3½ oz.) of regular pita has about 250 calories.
==Ingredients== * 2½ dl (1 cup) of warm water * 25 g (1 oz.) of yeast * 1 tsp. of salt * 2 tbsp. of vegetable oil * 5 dl (17 fl. oz) of durum wheat flour
== Procedure == # Dissolve the yeast in a bowl of warm water. Add salt, oil and flour, mix it, and knead it into a dough. # Let the dough rise to twice of its size. # Divide the risen dough into 8 pieces and shape them into balls. # Then roll the balls into flat and round pita breads (to a diameter of 15 cm or 6"). # Let the breads rise in a warm place covered with a cloth for about 30 minutes. # Bake in 225°C (435°F) for about 12 minutes.
===Optional additions=== Cut the bread into two pieces so it can be used like a sandwich filled with salad or meat. Or the exact same, wrapped into a reel. Pita is delicious when dipped in sauces just like that, too. There are lots of possible ideas and combinations!
Makes 8 pitas.
==External links== {{Wikipedia}} * [http://www.nutritiondata.com/facts-B00001-01c21GH.html Nutritional facts] at Nutrition Data * [http://www.mediterrasian.com/delicious_recipes_pita.htm Greek Salad Pita Pockets] - MediterrAsian.com
[[Category:Mediterranean recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Middle Eastern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Flatbread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Breakfast recipes|12|20 - 25 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast Recipes]]
A delicious muffin recipe that makes an excellent [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|breakfast]].
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240ml) [[Cookbook:Bran|natural bran]] * 3/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (180ml) [[Cookbook:Buttermilk|butter milk]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240ml) [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (120ml) [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]]
==Procedure== #Stir Bran and Butter Milk together in a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. #Combine Egg, Brown Sugar and Margarine in another [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. #Stir remaining ingredients in a third bowl. Add to batter. #Stir just to moisten. #Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. #Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|400°F]] (200°C) for 15 to 20 minutes.
==Notes, tips and variations== *For '''Bran Raisin Muffins''', add 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisins]]. *If you do not want to buy store-bought buttermilk, you can make your own by adding 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] or [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]] to 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] of [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]]. Let it sit for five minutes before using. *Tastes best when still warm.
[[Category:Muffin recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Breakfast recipes|12|20 - 25 minutes|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]] |[[Cookbook:Breakfast|Breakfast]] A delicious muffin recipe that makes an excellent [[Cookbook:Breakfast|breakfast]]. ==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240ml) [[Cookbook:Oats|rolled oats]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240ml) [[Cookbook:Buttermilk|buttermilk]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (60ml) [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240ml) [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking powder|baking powder]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking soda|baking soda]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 3/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (180ml) [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (60ml) [[Cookbook:Coconut|coconut]] ==Variations== '''Oatmeal Raisin Muffin:''' Add 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (120ml) [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisins]].
'''Blueberry Oat Muffins:''' Omit Coconut, fold 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240ml) frozen [[Cookbook:Blueberry|blueberries]] before filling muffin cups. ==Procedure== #Stir Rolled Oats and Butter Milk together in a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. #Combine flour, coconut, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in another [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. Stir together to mix. Make a well in the center. #Add egg and margarine to oat mixture. Mix well. #Pour all at once into flour mixture. Stir just to moisten. #Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. #Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven Temperatures|400°F]] (200°C) for 15 to 20 minutes. [[Category:Oat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Muffin recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Coconut recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]
