{{Recipesummary| |Category=Breakfast recipes |Servings=12 |Energy=271 Cal |Time=30 minutes |Rating=2 |Image=[[Image:Chocolate Chocolate Chip Muffins.JPG|300px]] }}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast Recipes]]
A deliciously sweet muffin recipe that makes an excellent [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|breakfast]].
==Ingredients== * 1 3/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Chocolate chips|chocolate chips]] * 3/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|granulated sugar]] * 1/3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Cocoa|cocoa]], sifted if lumpy * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1/3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Cooking oil|cooking oil]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]]
==Procedure== #Combine all-purpose flour, chocolate chips, sugar, cocoa, salt and baking powder in a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. Create a well in the center. #Beat egg in a small bowl. Add milk, cooking oil, and vanilla. Stir and pour into well. Stir until just moistened. #Grease 12 muffin cups with cooking spray. Fill cups 3/4 full. #Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|400°F]] (205°C) for 20 minutes until golden.
==Notes, tips and variations== *Taste best when still warm. *If you don't have cooking spray...simply use muffin cups (metal or paper work!)
[[Category:Muffin recipes]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Breakfast recipes|12|25 - 30 minutes|1||206 calories (1 muffin)}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast|Breakfast]]
[[Image:Banana-Nut-Muffins-2005-Aug-24.jpg|right|thumb|Banana Chip Muffins.]]
A muffin with a cake texture and wonderful banana taste.
==Ingredients== * 1 3/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|granulated sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] *1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Chocolate chips|semisweet chocolate chips]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Cooking oil|cooking oil]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Banana|mashed ripe banana]] (about 3 medium)
==Procedure== #Measure flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and chocolate chips into a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. Make a well in the center. #Beat egg in a small [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]] until frothy. Mix in cooking oil, milk and banana. #Pour into well in flour mixture. Stir just to moisten ''(note that the batter will be lumpy)'' #Fill greased muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|400°F]] (205°C) for 15 to 20 minutes.
==Notes, tips and variations== *Taste best when still warm.
[[Category:Muffin recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: remove raw egg warning from cooked food recipe
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Breakfast recipes|8|20 - 25 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast Recipes]]
A tasty muffin recipe with apple chunks and dried cranberries.
==Ingredients== * 3/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (180g) [[Cookbook:Bran|natural bran]] * 3/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (180g) [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (360g) [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * 1 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] * 3/4 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Nutmeg|nutmeg]] * 3/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (180g) [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * 1/3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (80ml) [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 1 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (360g) [[Cookbook:Apple|chopped, peeled apples]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (120g) dried [[Cookbook:Cranberry|cranberries]]
==Procedure== #Combine bran and milk into a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. Let rest for 5 minutes. #Combine flour, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, baking soda and nutmeg in another [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. #Stir brown sugar, cooking oil, and egg into the bran mixture. Stir in dried ingredients, apples and cranberries. #Spoon batter into greased muffin cups. #Fill greased muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|400°F]] (200°C) for 15 to 20 minutes, or until tester comes out clean.
==Notes, tips and variations== *For an optional topping, add 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] of granulated sugar and 1/4 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] of cinnamon to the batter when they are in the muffin cups. *Taste best when still warm.
[[Category:Muffin recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cranberry recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Apple recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bran recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: split cinnamon between topping and muffin
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Breakfast recipes|12|20 - 25 minutes|3||237 calories (1 muffin)}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast]]
A delicious muffin recipe filled with apples.
==Ingredients== * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Sugar|granulated sugar]] * 1¾ cups [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] or [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]], softened * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 2 tsp [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|ground cinnamon]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * ⅔ cup (180ml) [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * ¼ cup (60ml) [[Cookbook:Cooking oil|cooking oil]] * 1 grated [[Cookbook:Apple|apple]]
==Procedure== #Combine brown sugar, ¼ cup of flour and ½ tsp cinnamon in a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. #Cut in until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Set aside. #Combine softened margarine/butter, 1½ cup of flour, 1½ tsp cinnamon, sugar and baking powder in a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]]. Make a well in the center. #Beat egg, milk and cooking oil in a small bowl. Add apple and stir. Pour into well. Stir until just moistened. #Fill muffin cups ¾ full. Divide and sprinkle toppings over each. #[[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] at [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|400°F]] (200°C) for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden.
==Notes, tips and variations== *Taste best when still warm.
[[Category:Muffin recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: remove raw egg warning from cooked food recipe
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|20|20 - 25 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]] A tasty oatmeal cookie, just like those you remember.
'''NOTE:''' This recipe requires a [[Cookbook:mixer|mixer]]. ==Ingredients== * 3/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (180g) [[Cookbook:Shortening|shortening]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (120g) [[Cookbook:Sugar|white sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (60ml) [[Cookbook:water|water]] * 1 [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:vanilla|vanilla]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (700g) [[Cookbook:Oats|rolled oats]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) [[Cookbook:flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] ==Procedure== #Using a mixer, [[Cookbook:cream|cream]] together the shortening, brown sugar, white sugar, egg, water and vanilla until light and fluffy (about 10 minutes on high). #In a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]], mix together the oats, flour, baking soda, and salt. #Add dry ingredients into wet, mix well using mixer. #Scoop the portions out - this recipe makes 20 cookies, so use 20 portions. #Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|350°F]] (180°C) for 8 to 10 minutes. ==Notes, tips and variations== *Taste best when still warm. [[Category:Cookie recipes|Oatmeal Cookies]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|Oatmeal Cookies]] [[Category:Oat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|20|20 - 25 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]]
A tasty cookie with an 'eye' of jam in the middle.
==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) [[Cookbook:Butter|soft butter]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) [[Cookbook:sugar|white sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 2 [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:vanilla|vanilla]] * 1 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (360g) [[Cookbook:flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:baking powder|baking powder]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (120g) [[Cookbook:Jam|jam]] (raspberry/strawberry)
==Procedure== #In a mixer, cream together the butter and sugar. #Once creamed, add the egg and vanilla. Beat until smooth. #In a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]], stir together the flour and baking powder. #Add flour to creamed mixture. Beat on low speed until throughly combined. #Portion out the dough into round, firm balls. Place on sheet pan. Using the end of a wooden spoon, press down on the dough ball to form wells. #Fill each well with jam. Do not overfill the well, as they will overflow and burn. For the same reason, keep the edges of the dough clean. #Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven Temperatures|300°F]] (160c) for 22-24 minutes, until a light golden brown.
==Notes, tips and variations== *These cookies taste best when still warm.
[[Category:Cookie recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|20|15 - 20 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]]
A delicious macaroon cookie recipe that does not even require baking!
==Ingredients== * 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (480g) [[Cookbook:sugar|white sugar]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (120g) [[Cookbook:margarine|margarine]] or [[Cookbook:butter|butter]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240ml) [[Cookbook:milk|milk]] * 1 [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:vanilla|vanilla]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (120g) [[Cookbook:cocoa|cocoa]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (700g) [[Cookbook:oatmeal|oatmeal]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (700g) [[Cookbook:coconut|coconut]]
==Procedure== #Place the bottom half of a [[Cookbook:double boiler|double boiler]] on the stove to heat. #Place a large metal [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]] on top of the boiler. Melt the margarine/butter in this bowl. #Add the white sugar, whisk until dissolved. #Whisk in the milk. #Whisk in the cocoa, breaking up lumps first. #Remove from heat, take to preparation area. #Using a spatula, throughly mix in coconut and oatmeal. There should be no dry sections. #Portion onto pan.
==Notes, tips and variations== *If your macaroons are too crumbly, they have been overcooked.
[[Category:Coconut recipes|Chocolate Macaroons]] [[Category:Cookie recipes|Chocolate Macaroons]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|Chocolate Macaroons]] [[Category:Oat recipes|Chocolate Macaroons]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Desserts|Desserts]]
'''Flapjacks''' are a type of cake made using rolled [[Cookbook:oats|oats]], [[Cookbook:butter|butter]], [[Cookbook:brown sugar|brown sugar]], and [[Cookbook:golden syrup|golden syrup]]. This is a simple version with no fruit or raisins added. More successful commercialised versions of flapjacks are McVities Hobnobs.
== Ingredients == * 4 oz (110g) [[Cookbook:brown sugar|light brown sugar]] * 6 oz (175g) [[Cookbook:butter|butter]] * 1 dessertspoon [[Cookbook:golden syrup|golden syrup]] * 6 oz (175 g) [[Cookbook:rolled oats|rolled oats]]
== Procedure == #Pre-heat the oven to gas mark 2, 300 °F (150 °C). #Place the sugar, butter and golden syrup together in a medium saucepan and heat until the butter has melted. #Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the porridge oats. #Press the mixture out over the base of the prepared tin (7½ inch (19 cm) square baking tin, 1½ inches (4 cm) deep, lightly greased) #[[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] in the centre of the oven for 40 minutes. #When baked, allow to cool in the tin for 10-15 minutes before cutting into oblong bars. #Leave until cold before removing the flapjacks from the tin, then store in an airtight container. == Serving suggestion == * Serve with [[Cookbook:Whipped Cream|whipped cream]] or with melted [[Cookbook:Chocolate|chocolate]] to dip.
[[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Oat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
The Cuban dish picadillo is a great filling for tacos.
==Ingredients==
*1 to 1 1/2 lbs (450g to 625g) of ground beef *One large yellow onion, chopped *5 cloves of garlic, chopped *One large green bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and chopped *1 large russet potato, cubed *2 tbsp of olive oil *1/8 tsp. salt *Black Pepper, Cumin, Oregano and Garlic Powder to taste (about 2-2 1/2 tablespoons total)
;Optional *1/2 c. (100g) of raisins *1/2 c. (100g) of green olives *1/4 c. (50g) pine nuts
==Procedure== #In a large, heavy [[Cookbook:sauce pan|sauce pan]], heat olive oil. Dump onions, garlic, bell pepper and seasonings into heated olive oil. #When the bell pepper starts to discolor, add to it ground beef, stirring to break up large pieces and brown evenly. #As meat is browning, add potato. #When the potato is fork-tender, and the meat is browned thoroughly, add onions, olives and pine nuts if desired.
Serve hot with white rice.
= Alternate Recipe = == Ingrediants ==
* 1/4 cup olive oil * 1 large white onion, chopped * 8 garlic cloves, minced * 6 Turkish bay leaves * 2 pounds ground beef (15 to 20 percent fat) * 1 14 1/2-ounce can diced tomatoes in juice * 3/4 cup raisins * 3/4 cup sliced drained pimiento-stuffed green olives (from 5-ounce jar) * 1/4 cup tomato paste * 1 1/2 teaspoons red wine vinegar * 1 teaspoon chili powder * 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
== Procedure == Heat oil in large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic, and bay leaves; sauté until onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Add beef; sauté until cooked, breaking up with back of fork, about 7 minutes. Add all remaining ingredients. Simmer until picadillo thickens, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Discard bay leaves. Serve picadillo warm.
Makes 6 servings.
[[Category:Cuban recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) flour * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] baking powder * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] baking soda * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] salt * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] sugar * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240ml) soy milk * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] vegetable oil * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] vanilla * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] apple cider vinegar ==Procedure== {| style="float: right; margin-left: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; width: 242px; border: #99B3FF solid 1px" | {{Vegan recipe}} |} # Preheat oven to 230° Celsius (450° Fahrenheit) and oil an eight-inch oven-safe skillet. # Combine dry ingredients: flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar. # Add the soy milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla; stir well. # Stir in the apple cider vinegar, mix well, and pour immmediately into the skillet. # Bake at 230° Celsius (450° Fahrenheit) for 18 to 20 minutes, and serve.
==Notes== When a toothpick is inserted into the completed product, it should come out clean.
==External links== '''Wikipedia:''' [[Wikipedia:Pancake|pancake]]
[[Category:Breakfast recipes|Oven pancakes (vegan)]] [[Category:Pancake recipes|Oven, vegan]] [[Category:Vegan recipes|Oven pancakes]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]]
'''{{PAGENAME}}''' is delicious warm or cold as a dessert or "stand-alone" cake, this simple and reliable recipe is tried and tested. Cuts into 8 slices.
==Ingredients== * 5 [[Cookbook:ounce|ounces]] (145g) [[Cookbook:butter|butter]] * 2 large [[Cookbook:egg|egg]]s * 8 [[Cookbook:ounce|ounces]] (230g) [[Cookbook:Caster sugar|caster sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:almond essence|almond essence]] * 8 [[Cookbook:ounce|ounces]] (230g) [[Cookbook:Self Raising Flour|self-raising flour]] * 1½ level [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * approx. ¾ [[Cookbook:pound|pounds]] (330g) peeled cooking [[Cookbook:apple|apple]]s (Bramleys) * [[Cookbook:Powdered Sugar|icing sugar]] to dredge
==Method== * Grease a 9" (23cm) loose-bottomed [[Cookbook:Springform Pan|spring-form cake tin]]. * Melt the butter in a pan gently, then pour into a large bowl. * Add the eggs, sugar and almond essence and stir well until mixed. Then add the flour and baking powder. Stir well - at this point, it should be a stiff mixture. * Spread just under two-thirds of the mixture into the cake tin. * Immediately afterwards, peel, core and slice the apples and place on top of the mixture in the tin. Cover these with the remainder of the cake mixture. At this stage, the cake may appear "untidy", but the cooking process eliminates most unevenness or gaps in the surface. * Bake for 1¼ to 1½ hours in a pre-heated oven at 325 °F/160 °C/Gas Mark 3.
''Once cooked, allow to cool slightly in the tin, loosen the sides of the cake with a knife and gently push the cake out onto a plate. Lightly dust the top of the cake with sieved icing sugar once cool. Serve warm or cold, with cream for best results.''
==Storage== This cake will last for at least 3-4 days, and can be re-heated as necessary. Keep covered or alternatively refrigerate.
[[Category:Cake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Apple recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Almond recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Confection recipes||50 - 55 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Confections|Confections]]
A wonderful square recipe with the flavor of dates. Also see the [[Cookbook:Date Bar|Date Bar]] recipe.
==Ingredients== ===Crumb Mixture=== * 1 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (360g) rolled [[Cookbook:oat|oat]]s * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] (packed) * 1 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (260g) [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking soda|baking soda]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
===Filling=== * 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]]s (480g) chopped [[Cookbook:date|date]]s * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (120g) [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240ml) [[Cookbook:water|water]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Margarine|lemon juice]]
==Procedure== #In a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]], combine rolled oats, 1 cup brown sugar, flour, baking soda, salt and melted butter. Mix until crumbly. #Press '''half''' the crumb mixture into a lined and greased square baking pan. #In a sauce pan, over low heat, cooker dates, sugar and water until thickened and smooth (about 10 minutes). #Add lemon juice and mix well. #Spread date mixture over crumble layer. #Sprinkle remaining crumb mixture over date filling. #Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven Temperatures|350°F]] (180c) for about 35 minutes, until lightly browned.
[[Category:Cookie recipes|Date Squares]] [[Category:Date recipes|Date Squares]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Cookie recipes||55 - 60 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Confections|Confections]]
A wonderful square recipe with the flavor of lemon.
==Ingredients== ===Base=== * 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]]s (480g) [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 3/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (180g) [[Cookbook:icing sugar|icing sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) [[Cookbook:margarine|margarine]] (softened)
===Topping=== * 4 [[Cookbook:egg|egg]]s * 1/3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (80ml) [[Cookbook:lemon juice|lemon juice]] * 1 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (360g) [[Cookbook:white sugar|white sugar]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (60g) [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking soda|baking soda]] * 1 [[Cookbook:tablespoon|tablespoon]] grated [[Cookbook:lemon|lemon]] peel ([[Cookbook:zest|zest]]) * [[Cookbook:powdered sugar|powdered sugar]], as needed
==Procedure== ===Base=== #Combine flour and sugar in a medium mixing bowl. #Cut in margarine until mixture resembles fine crumbs. #Press firmly into a greased square (8 x 8 or 9 x 9-inch) pan. #Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven Temperatures|350°F]] (180°C) for about 20 - 30 minutes, until lightly browned.
===Topping=== #Beat eggs in large mixing bowl, until frothy. Add the lemon juice and rind. Stir. #In another bowl, stir together the sugar, flour and baking powder. #Add dry mixture to wet mixture. Stir until just moistened. #Spread evenly over base, and return to oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until set or slightly brown. #Let squares cool before removing from pan and cutting. Dust with icing sugar.
[[Category:Lemon recipes]] [[Category:Cookie recipes]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units]]

{{recipesummary|Cookie recipes|15-20 squares|50 - 55 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}}
A delicious square recipe with a pleasant flavor of oranges and cranberries.
==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) rolled [[Cookbook:oat|oat]]s * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 3/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (180g) [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * 3/4 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:baking soda|baking soda]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (120g) [[Cookbook:butter|butter]] (melted) * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240ml) whole [[Cookbook:cranberry sauce|cranberry sauce]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:orange juice|orange juice]]
==Procedure== #Lightly oil and line a square pan. #In a [[Cookbook:Mixing Bowl|mixing bowl]], combine the rolled oats, flour, sugar, and baking soda using a whisk. #Using your hands, mix the melted butter into the rolled oats mixture, until it forms pea-sized clumps. '''Do not over mix'''. #Reserve 1 1/2 cups (360g) of mixture to be used as the topping. #Press remainder of oat mix into the bottom of the pan, making sure it covers the whole bottom. #Mix the orange juice with the cranberry sauce. #Spread evenly over the base. #Sprinkle the reserved oats mixture over the top. #Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven Temperatures|350°F]] (180°C) for 40 minutes, or until golden brown. #Cool and cut into squares.
==Notes, Tips and Variations== *This recipe can be doubled to fit a 13" by 9" (30cm by 24cm) pan.
[[Category:Oat recipes|Cranberry Orange Squares]] [[Category:Orange recipes|Cranberry Orange Squares]] [[Category:Cranberry recipes|Cranberry Orange Squares]] [[Category:Cookie recipes|Cranberry Orange Squares]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Confection recipes||50 - 55 minutes|3}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Confections|Confections]]
A delicious square recipe with a tropical flavor.
==Ingredients== ===Base=== * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:white sugar|white sugar]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (60g) hard [[Cookbook:margarine|margarine]] (softened) * 1/4 [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:baking powder|baking powder]] * 1 [[Cookbook:egg|egg]] (beaten)
===Top Layer=== * 2 [[Cookbook:egg|egg]]s (beaten) * 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (480g) [[Cookbook:coconut|coconut]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) [[Cookbook:white sugar|white sugar]] * 1 tin crushed [[Cookbook:pineapple|pineapple]] (drained) * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] hard [[Cookbook:margarine|margarine]] (melted) * 1 [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:lemon juice|lemon juice]]
==Procedure== ===Base=== #Stir together flour, sugar and baking powder using wooden spoon. #Cut in the margarine, until the mixture looks like fine crumbs. #In a small bowl, beat the egg well. Mix into dry mixture using wooden spoon until combined. #Press into lined and lightly greased square tray.
===Top Layer=== #Drain '''all''' of the juice out of the pineapple by wringing it with a cloth. #Add and mix remaining ingredients with the pineapple using a wooden spoon. '''Do not over work'''. #Spread evenly over base. #Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven Temperatures|350°F]] (180c), or until topping is set and coconut is light brown. #Let cool before removing from pan.
[[Category:Cookie recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pineapple recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Confection recipes||30 - 35 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Confections|Confections]]
A chocolate square recipe that tastes delicious.
==Ingredients== ===Base and Topping=== * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (120g) [[Cookbook:margarine|margarine]] (soft) * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240g) [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:egg|egg]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:vanilla|vanilla]] * 1 1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (300g) [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1 1/2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (350g) rolled [[Cookbook:Oats|oat]]s * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:salt|salt]]
===Filling=== * 2/3 [[Cookbook:cup|cup]] (160ml) sweetened condensed [[Cookbook:milk|milk]] * 1 [[Cookbook:cup|cup]] (240g) [[Cookbook:Chocolate Chips|chocolate chips]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] hard [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:vanilla|vanilla]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:salt|salt]]
==Procedure== ===Base and Topping=== #Cream together the margarine and brown sugar, until light and fluffy. #Beat in egg and vanilla. #In a mixing bowl, blend together the flour, oats, baking soda and salt. #Mix in flour mixture into creamed mixture by hand, using a wooden spoon to start, until crumbly looking. #Reserve roughly 1/3 of the mixture in a bowl and set aside. #Press remaining mix into a greased, lined square pan.
===Filling=== #In a mixing bowl, over a pot of boiling water, heat all Filling ingredients until chocolate chips are '''just''' melted. #Spread chocolate mixture evenly over base, keeping the sides of the pan clean. #Take reserved mixture and sprinkle over the top. Note that it will '''not''' cover it all. #Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|350°F]] (180°C) for 20 to 25 minutes, or just until oatmeal mixture has a light golden colour. #Let cool, cut and serve.
[[Category:Chocolate recipes|Chocolate Squares]] [[Category:Cookie recipes|Chocolate Squares]] [[Category:Confection recipes|Chocolate Squares]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Sauce recipes|2-4 servings|5-10 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Sauces|Sauces]]
This is a basic tartar sauce, suitable for fish and chips. The recipe is largely based on a trial and error recreation of the tartar sauce used at a local restaurant I frequent.
==Ingredients== * 10 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] (280g) [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]]<!-- (240 [[Cookbook:mL|mL]]) --> * 2 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>4</sub> ounces (65ml) [[Cookbook:Ketchup|ketchup]] * 2 ounces (55ml) [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]] * 2 ounces (55ml) [[Cookbook:Relish|relish]] * <sup>1</sup>/<sub>4</sub> [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Garlic Salt|garlic salt]] * <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> teaspoon [[Cookbook:Celery Salt|celery salt]]
==Procedure== # I suggest placing the [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] in the mixing bowl first, and whipping it until it's smooth. # Mix in the other ingredients
==Notes, tips, and variations== * I've found that using [[Cookbook:Pickle Juice|pickle juice]] (and lowering the amount of relish) is often better. This is especially true if you plan on using this in a squeeze bottle (as the relish can block the opening if it's too thick/chunky).
==External links== {{Wikipedia|Tartar sauce}}
[[Category:Sauce recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Malaysia|Cuisine of Malaysia]]
==Ingredients== *1kg [[Cookbook:Rice|glutinous rice]] *500ml [[Cookbook:Coconut Milk|coconut milk]] *A pinch of salt *300gm sugar *1 [[Cookbook:Durian|durian]] *2 screwpine leaves (or optionally, [[Cookbook:Pandan Essence|pandan paste]]
==Procedure==
# Steam the glutinous rice with a pinch of salt until it is cooked. # Combine the flesh of durian with coconut milk, sugar, salt and screwpine leaves / pandan paste, and boil them until its sauce thickens. # Serve it hot with the rice.
[[Category:Malaysian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Durian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Coconut recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rice recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
Arepas are fried or baked yellow or white corn pancakes, either plain or with a filling. Most Venezuelans and Colombians eat them as part of their daily diet in place of bread, mostly at breakfast, at least in Colombia. They are one of the national dishes of Venezuela and there are many food stands or small restaurants called ''areperas'' which specialise in the making of these small delights.
Arepas have been an important staple in the diets of the poor Venezuelan's diet for centuries; today they are eaten by rich and poor alike. Originally they were made from dried corn kernels which were soaked in water and lime to remove the skins, then cooked, drained, dried and ground into flour. Thanks to modern technology, it is now possible to buy the masa harina (corn flour) ready to use, cutting out the lengthy soaking and drying process, which means they can be prepared in just a few minutes.
Arepas can be eaten for breakfast; at any time of the day as a snack; as an appetiser or starter, especially when accompanied with a sauce; or as an accompaniment to a main course, much like bread rolls. They can be eaten plain; cooked with a filling of meat, poultry or cheese; simply split open and buttered; or filled like a sandwich. They can be poached, grilled, baked, griddled or (most often) fried, making them not only of the most traditional but also one of the most versatile foods in Venezuela.
==Ingredients==
* 2 2/5 cup (500g) [[Cookbook:corn flour|corn flour]] for arepas * 1 1/5 tsp [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * 3/5 (140g) cup grated white [[Cookbook:cheese|cheese]] * 2 2/5 (500g) cup cool [[Cookbook:water|water]] (or more if needed)
==Procedure== # In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and white cheese. Stir in enough water to make a firm, slightly moist dough. Cover the dough and let it rest for 5 minutes. Divide the dough into 10 pieces and form each piece into a ball. Flatten the ball slightly. # Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180c). # Oil a griddle very lightly and warm it over medium heat. Cook the arepas on the griddle for about 5 minutes on each side, until a golden brown crust forms. Transfer the arepas to a baking sheet and bake 20 to 25 minutes, turning them several times as they bake.
Serve immediately, with cheese, ham and black beans.
==Links== [La mejor arepa de Colombia, Arepa Santandeana][http://www.mailxmail.com/curso/vida/cocinacolombiana/capitulo2.htm Recipe]
[[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pancake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Corn recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]

{{recipesummary |Category = Venezuelan recipes |Servings = 4 |Time = 40 minutes }} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Venezuela|Cuisine of Venezuela]]
'''Pabellón Criollo''' is Venezuela's national dish and no visit to this South American country will be complete unless you try it. This flavorful dish consists of shredded flank steak, black beans, rice, plantains or bananas, onions, tomatoes, and spices. The end result and presentation should resemble the national flag, hence the name of the dish.
==Ingredients==
* 3 Tbsp [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], chopped * 1 tsp finely chopped [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * 1 x 400g/14oz tin chopped [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * ½ tsp ground [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 900g/2lb [[Cookbook:Beef|lean steak]], (sirloin or rump) about 12mm/½ - inch thick
==Procedure== # Heat the oil in a large saucepan, add the onions and garlic and cook over a medium heat for about 5 minutes until the onions are soft and transparent. # Add the tomatoes, cumin and salt, mix well, reduce the heat to low and cook uncovered, for about 30 minutes, stirring often, until the tomato juices evaporate and the sauce becomes thick. # 15 minutes before the end of the cooking time, preheat the grill to hot, place the steak on the grill pan and cook under the grill for 5 minute on each side. # Remove from the grill and cut into pieces about 12mm/ ½ -inch long and 6mm/ ¼ -inch wide then add the strips of beef to the sauce, mixing well.
Traditionally served with [[Cookbook:Plantain|plantains]], [[Cookbook:Black Bean|black beans]] and [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]].
[[Category:Venezuelan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Beef recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary |Category = Venezuelan recipes |Time = 2 days including advance preparation |Servings = 20 hallacas |Image = [[Image:Hallaca.jpg]] }} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Venezuela|Cuisine of Venezuela]]
Requires 2 days of advanced preparation.
The '''hallaca''' (pronounced AH-JAC-KA) is the main Venezuelan Christmas dinner dish. It was created by the slaves during the colony times. They put the left-overs of their master's Christmas festivities in a bit of cornmeal dough, wrapped this with banana leaves and cooked to mix the flavors. As many things in my country, the hallaca has the influence of three cultures, the white one (European ingredients like raisins, nuts and olives), the native one (the corn meal colored with annatto seeds), and the black one (banana leaves used to cook the food). The original hallaca is made with meat (pork, poultry, beef, lard, crisp pork rind, etc) and boiled eggs. The hallaca tastes better once it has cooled. It requires hours of preparation, but it is usually prepared by the whole family. Its preparation is a celebration by itself. Music and drinks make up the festive atmosphere. Mothers nagging children as they steal bits of fillings from the table, and the guys complaining of being relegated to the leaf cleaning and last minute shopping are typical during the hallaca making party.
''Please note: the banana leaves are not intended to be eaten, they are just for cooking!''
==Ingredients== [[Image:Ingredientes fundamentales de una hallaca.JPG|right|thumb|Just some of the ingredients for Hallaca]] ** Old Fashioned: A whole leg of pork, preferably from a latinamerican/cuban supermarket to insure freshness ** Old Fashioned: Two or three roasting hens * 1 can of [[Cookbook:Mock Duck|mock duck]] or 1 packet of [[Cookbook:Tofu|tofu]] marinated pieces * 500g of cooked and mashed [[Cookbook:Potato|new potatoes]] * 50g of [[Cookbook:Almond|almonds]] * 4 [[Cookbook:Onion|white onions]] * 2 red onions * 2 [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrots]], 6 [[Cookbook:Brussels Sprout|Brussels sprouts]], and a handful of [[Cookbook:Green Bean|green beans]] (or another similar combination of vegetables) * 1 can of [[Cookbook:Artichoke|artichoke hearts]] * 1 can of [[Cookbook:Asparagus|asparagus]] * 1 can of [[Cookbook:Chickpea|chickpeas]] * 1 head of [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * 1 packet of ''mi-cuit'' (half dried) [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] or 1 tube of [[Cookbook:Tomato Paste|tomato paste]] * 4 red [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|bell peppers]] * 2 green bell peppers * 100g of mixed vine fruit * 20 [[Cookbook:Prune|prunes]] * 1 jar of green [[Cookbook:Olive|olives]] * 1 jar of mixed pickles in mustard sauce * 1 jar of [[Cookbook:Caper|capers]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Leek|leeks]] * 2 packets of [[Cookbook:Green Onion|spring onions]] * 1 large bunch of [[Cookbook:Spices and herbs|herbs]] ([[Cookbook:Cilantro|coriander]] (cilantro), [[Cookbook:Thyme|thyme]], [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]], [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]]) * 1 Tsp of [[Cookbook:Pepper|black peppercorns]] * 1 tsp of [[Cookbook:Coriander|coriander seeds]] * 1 tsp of [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin seeds]] * 1 Tsp of [[Cookbook:Annatto|annatto seeds]] (also called "achiote" or "onoto") * 1 Kg of instant [[Cookbook:Polenta|polenta meal]] (coarse corn meal) * 1 roll of kitchen string * 1 Kg of [[Cookbook:Banana|banana leaves]] (for wrapping, not for eating!) * 250 ml of [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 1 vegetable [[Cookbook:Bouillon Cubes|stock cube]] * 1 mushroom stock cube
[[Cookbook:Marmite|Marmite]], [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soya sauce]] and [[Cookbook:Hot Pepper Sauce|chili sauce]] to season
** OPTIONAL for overseas expatriates and daring cooks: 20mx30cm roll of strong [[Cookbook:Aluminum foil|aluminum foil]] (unless you are rich enough or have access to a Sedano's supermarket as to buy triple quantity of banana leaves and wrap the hallacas exclusively with banana leaves, in the Old Fashioned Way)(See Goya.Com for provenance within the US)
==Procedure== Make sure you have enough friends and family to help you with the procedure below, and that they include people who know how to fold them once filled, wrap them and tie them properly... no kidding.
===Leaves=== # With a damp cloth wipe the banana leaves. # Heat the banana leaves with a flame (gas cooker, camping fire, etc). The leaves turn softer and darker, with a distinctive smoky smell. # Cut the hard rim without shredding the leaves. Cut in 30 cm segments along the transversal veins.
===Polenta dough=== # In a small pan, warm (at very low heat) 5 Tsp of olive oil with the annatto seeds for 20 minutes. The oil should turn red. # In the meantime, fry in a deep pan the spices (cumin, black pepper, and coriander seeds) in 2-3 Tsp of olive oil. Cut the white onions in slices and add to the pan. Add 5 cups of boiling water. Add the stock cubes and a Tsp of Marmite to season. Add the green part of the leeks plus the white part of 2 leeks in 1-inch chunks. Cut 1 and a half packet of spring onions and add to the pan. Add all the herbs (keep some parsley to garnish) and the garlic head cut in halves. # Simmer this broth for 15 minutes. # Put the content of the pan in a food processor and liquidise it. # Strain it very well keeping the liquid and discarding the solid waste (may want it to make vegetable cakes, up to you). Put the broth in a large bowl and add the red oil (previously strained to remove the annatto seeds). # Pour the water content of the olive and the caper jars in the bowl. Add the polenta meal, 1 cup at a time, stirring very well. The consistency should be smooth. Mix the mashed potatoes with the polenta dough. # Make a small test for the consistency of the dough. Wrap 1 Tsp of dough with a small segment of banana leaf. Wrap it in aluminum foil and boil it in water for 15 minutes. If the cooked dough maintain the shape of the banana leaf "package", the dough is OK. If it crumbles or comes out half dissolved in water, then add more polenta meal. If it comes out rock hard, then add more water to the dough. Rectify the salt as well.
===Fillings=== # Grill peppers: Rub olive oil in two red bell peppers and grill them. # Remove the skin and seeds and cut in 1cm wide strips. # Put them apart in a small bowl.
===Sauce=== # Slice two red onions. Chop the rest of the spring onions and a leek. # Stir fry quickly. # Liquidise the ''mi-cuit'' tomatoes, two red peppers and two green peppers and add to the stir fry onions and leek. Stir for a minute. # Add soya sauce, chili sauce and ground cumin to season. Add some cooking wine if you want. Let it simmer for another minute. # Add some wheat or corn flour to thicken. Put the sauce apart in a bowl.
===Small bowls===
# Vegetables: shred the carrots and Brussels sprouts, mix with the green beans, chopped. Put them apart in a bowl. # Soak the vine fruit in cooking wine or replacement. Put it apart in a small bowl. # Soak prunes in cooking wine or replacement. Put in a small bowl. # Drain chickpeas and put them apart in a small bowl. # Put pickles apart in a small bowl. # Blanch and toast the almonds, and put them apart in a small bowl. # Drain and chop the mock duck into 1cm cubes and put them in a small bowl. # Put the olives apart in a small bowl. # Put the capers apart in a small bowl. # Drain the artichoke hearts, cut in quarters and put them in a small bowl. # Drain the asparagus and put it in a plate.
===Hallaca=== [[Image:Ingredientes fundamentales de la Hallaca.JPG|right|thumb|Wrapping the hallaca]] # Cut a 35 cm long piece of aluminum foil and put it over the table. Cover with a banana leaf, the transversal veins along the horizontal axis. Rub oil on front face of the banana leaf. Put a bit more than half a ladle of dough in the centre of the leaf. Extend with a spoon to cover a 14cm-diameter circle. # Put 1 Tsp of Sauce in the middle. Put 1½ Tsp of shredded vegetables over the sauce. Put 2 olives and 2 capers, one on each corner of the dough. Keep placing the rest of the fillings as in a collage: 1 tsp. of vine fruit, 1 prune, 2 tsp. of pickles, 1 Tsp of chickpeas, 3 cubes of mock duck, 1 asparagus, 2 strips of grill pepper and some leaves of parsley. # Wrap this with the banana leaf (not against the veins). Fold the foil to seal the ends of the banana leaf packet. Then, fold the foil to wrap the whole packet. Tie it with kitchen string. Repeat for the rest of the dough (see diagrams below). # Boil the hallacas covered in water for 20-30 minutes. You may have to do this in batches unless you have a huge cauldron. Drain the hallacas and let them cool for 10 hours. Put them in the fridge or freezer. Heat the hallacas in boiling water, simmering for 10 minutes before eat them. Enjoy your meal!
[[Category:Venezuelan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
''Makes about 6 dozen cookies.''
== Ingredients == * 1/2 cup [[Cookbook:vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] * 4 sq. [[Cookbook:unsweetened chocolate|unsweetened chocolate]] (4 oz.), melted * 2 cups [[Cookbook:granulated sugar|granulated sugar]] * 4 [[Cookbook:egg|egg]]s * 2 tsp. [[Cookbook:vanilla extract|vanilla extract]] * 2 cups [[Cookbook:all purpose flour|all purpose flour]] * 2 tsp. [[Cookbook:baking powder|baking powder]] * 1/2 tsp. [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:confectioners' sugar|confectioners' sugar]]
== Procedure == # Mix oil, chocolate, and granulated sugar. # Blend in one egg at a time until well mixed. # Add vanilla. # Stir flour, baking powder, and salt into oil mixture. # Chill several hours or overnight. # Heat oven to 350° [[Cookbook:F|F]]. # Drop teaspoonfuls of dough into confectioners' sugar. # Roll in sugar; shape into balls. # Place about 2" apart on greased baking sheet. # Bake 10 to 12 minutes.
[[Category:Chocolate recipes|Chocolate Crinkles]] [[Category:Cookie recipes|Chocolate Crinkles]]

{{recipe}}
Green olives marinated in hers and garlic are very common in Spanish restaurants. They are commonly served free when you order a drink, and are often served with toasted, salted nuts.
This recipe makes 1 pound (450 G). Preparation time is about 10 minutes, and takes 3-7 days to marinate.
==Ingredients==
*2 cups (16oz/450g) unpitted large green Spanish olives *7 cloves garlic, peeled and minced *2 bay leaves *1/2 medium lemon, sliced *1 teaspoon dried oregano *1 teaspoon ground fennel seeds *1/2 teaspoon dried thyme *1/2 teaspoon ground cumin seeds *1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary *1/2 teaspoon Spanish paprika *1/2 teaspoon black pepper
==Recipe==
# Lightly crush the olives with a mallet, or make slight slits on each olive with a knife, to ensure that the marinade permeates them. # Place the olives in a sealable glass jar and add the remaining ingredients. # Fill the jar with water and shake well. # Marinate at room temperature for several days to a week.
Serve the olives with toasted almonds and fresh bread.
[[Category:Olive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Duplicate recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Indonesia|Cuisine of Indonesia]]
==Ingredients==
* 100g [[Cookbook:Ikan Bilis|ikan bilis]] (dried anchovies) * 3 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Tempoyak|tempoyak]] * 2 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] * A pinch of [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
===Ingredients for making sambal===
* 10 [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|bird's eye chillis]] (W:chilli padi|chilli padi]]) * 2 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chilli paste]] * 2cm piece fresh [[Cookbook:Turmeric|turmeric root]] * 2 stalks [[Cookbook:Lemongrass|lemon grass]], smashed * 2 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Coconut milk|coconut milk]] * 10 pieces [[Cookbook:Petai|petai]] (''Parkia speciosa'') seeds, skin removed
==Procedure==
#Remove heads and entrails from ikan bilis. Wash and soak for 10 minutes. Deep-fry until it becomes crisp. #Blend 2 tablespoon of tempoyak and coconut milk together with the sambal ingredients. #Heat oil in a pan and stir-fry the sambal ingredients and lemon grass until it becomes fragrant. Add the rest of tempoyak and boil gently over low heat until gravy is thickened. #Add salt to taste. Serve with crisp ikan bilis, petai and rice.
[[Category:Durian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Indonesian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients==
* 2 large [[Cookbook:Durian|durian]] fruit, remove flesh and discard the seeds * 4 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
The salt is used as a preserving agent and thus one needs to be generous with it.
==Procedure== #Place the durian flesh in a clean jar. Add salt, then beat the mixture until it becomes soft and creamy. #Close the jar tightly and leave it to [[Cookbook:Fermentation|ferment]] for 1 week. #The fermented durian can be kept in the refrigerator for up to a year.
[[Category:Durian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fermented food recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients== *1 mashed banana *2 Tablespoons reduced-fat peanut butter *1 cup vanilla yogurt *2 teaspoons cinnamon sugar
==Procedure==
Combine all the ingredients
==Notes== Works well as a spread for [[Cookbook:French toast|French toast]].
[[Category:Peanut Butter recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Banana recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Indonesia|Cuisine of Indonesia]]
{{Recipesummary| |Category=Fish recipes |Servings=4-6 |Time=60 minutes |Rating=3 |Energy= |Image=[[Image:IkanPepes.JPG|300px]] }}
''Pepes'' is cooking method of steaming the ingredients (fish, chicken, tofu, or mushroom) wrapped in banana leaves until it becomes tender, then grilling the packets. In this recipe any fresh water fish or salt water fish can be used as substitute. In restaurants serving West Java cuisine, where ''Ikan Pepes'' is always on the menu, the use of carp fish is very common.
==Ingredients== * 1 kg whole fish (carp or snapper) * 1 [[Cookbook:Tomato|chopped tomato]] * 1 stalk [[Cookbook:Green onion|green onion]] * 1 stalk [[Cookbook:Lemongrass|lemongrass]] * 5 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|salam leaves]] * 50 g [[Cookbook:Basil|kemangi leaves]] (sweet basil) * salt * 1 tsp. sugar * 2 tbl. salad oil * banana leaves or aluminum foil to wrap
Spice paste, grind the following ingredients: * 2 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * 4 [[Cookbook:Shallot|shallot]] * 2 cm [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] * 2 cm [[Cookbook:Turmeric|turmeric]] * 50 g [[Cookbook:Chili_Pepper|fresh chili pepper]] * 5 [[Cookbook:Candlenut|candlenut]] * 5 g [[Cookbook:Tamarind|tamarind]] * 1/2 tsp. salt * 25 cc water
==Directions== #Scale and clean the fish. #Take out the intestines but not the egg. #Make three diagonal slashes on each side of the fish for spice paste flavor to immerse. #Marinade the fish with salt and tamarind for 15 minutes then wash the fish with a bowl of water to remove excess salt. #Add cooking oil to the spice-paste, mix. #Coat fish with spice paste. #Put kemangi leaves, salam leaves and sliced lemon grass for the flavor. #Wrap the fish in banana leaves or aluminum foil. #Steam with medium fire, 30 minutes. Use pressure cooker for faster cooking time and better taste. #Let it cool and grill the wrapped fish over charcoal fire.
==Notes, tips and variations== * The use of Kemangi leaves is optional.
[[Category:Fish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Indonesian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Indonesia|Cuisine of Indonesia]]
{{Recipesummary| |Category=Meat recipes |Servings=10 |Time=180 minutes |Rating=3 |Energy= |Image=[[Image:Rendang.JPG|300px]] }}
'''Rendang''' is made from beef or water buffalo meat slowly cooked in coconut milk and spices. Thick coconut milk used in cooking produces delicious spicy condiments which is more delicious than the meat itself.
==Ingredients== * 1 kg beef cut into big cubes to make 20 pieces * 4 [[Cookbook:Kaffir Lime Leaf|lime leaves]] * 1 stalk [[Cookbook:Lemongrass|lemongrass]] * 2 liter ready-to-use [[Cookbook:Coconut milk|coconut milk]] or coconut milk from 1 big fresh coconut
Spice paste, using food processor grind the following ingredients: * 2 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * 4 [[Cookbook:Shallot|shallot]] * 25 g [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] * 15 g [[Cookbook:Turmeric|turmeric]] * 75 g young [[Cookbook:Galangal|galangal]] * 1 tbl. [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|ground fresh red chili pepper]] * 1 tsp. [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 1/2 dried [[Cookbook:Nutmeg|nutmeg]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Candlenut|candlenut]] * 1/2 tbl. salt * 1 tbs. [[Cookbook:Gula Jawa|Gula Jawa]] (Indonesian Palm Sugar)
==Directions== #Marinate meat with the spice paste for at least 1 hour #In a pan, stir occasionally while cooking coconut milk over slow fire until some oil surfaces from the coconut milk (at least for 20 minutes) #Put 300 cc of coconut milk to cover the marinated meat and all the spices (including lime leaves and lemon grass) in a big wok (the bigger the better) and cook over slow to medium fire while occasionally stir the ingredients until half of the coconut milk is evaporated #Pour 100 cc of coconut milk and stir until almost all of the coconut milk is evaporated #Keep on stirring and pouring the rest of the coconut milk, 100 cc at a time #Cook for until the meat is tender (at least one and a half hour) and almost all the liquid from the coconut milk is evaporated and turned into spicy condiments
==Notes, tips and variations== *When cooled, the coconut oil in the rendang may solidify. Reheat in a pan before serving. A reheated rendang often has better flavor *Fresh coconut milk produces a better gravy *Chicken or mutton can be used in place of beef *Beef liver may be used but produces a darker gravy
[[Category:Beef recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Indonesian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[id:Resep:Rendang]]

revision.comment: [[Cookbook:Soto Ayam]] moved to [[Cookbook:Soto ayam]]: to match title in en: id: es: wikipedia
revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Indonesia|Cuisine of Indonesia]]
{{Recipesummary| |Category=Chicken recipes |Servings=6-8 |Time=45 minutes |Rating=2 |Energy= |Image= }}
There are many variations of '''Soto Ayam''' depending on the ingredients, the way it served, and the amount of spices used.
==Ingredients== * 1 whole chicken with bones or 1 kg chicken parts with bones
* 200 g cabbage, thinly sliced * 200 g [[Cookbook:Bean sprouts|bean sprouts]] blanched * 4 potatoes, steamed, peeled, deep fried until golden brown * 2 fresh tomatoes * 25 g sohun vermicelli, soak in hot water for 10 minutes * 25 g fried shallots * 3 hard boiled eggs * 1.8 chicken stock
* 3 [[Cookbook:Kaffir Lime Leaf|kaffir lime leaves]] * ½ stalk [[Cookbook:Lemongrass|lemongrass]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaves]] * 1 stalk [[Cookbook:Green onion|green onion]] * 25 g [[Cookbook:Galangal|galangal]] * 2 tbl. cooking oil
Spice paste, grind the following ingredients by using food processor: * 5 g [[Cookbook:Turmeric|turmeric]] * ½ tsp. [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Candlenut|candlenut]] * 15 g [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Shallot|shallot]] * 2 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * 2 tsp. salt
==Procedure== #Stir fry spice paste over slow fire until fragrant. #Make soup by cooking the whole chicken with spice paste, galangal, lime leaves, lemon grass, and bay leaves in a pot for at least 30 minutes until the meat is tender. Use pressure cooker for faster cooking time and better broth. for traditional aisan cooking bring soup to boil, cover and turn off heat and let steep for 30 to 40 minutes. this makes meat more tender. #Add a little bit of salt or pepper to taste #Leave the chicken in a pot until the soup is cool #Remove the meat from the bones and slice the meat into tiny bit size using fork and knife, then set aside #Put back the bones into the soup, put sliced green onion and bring the soup to the boil right before serving
==How to serve== #In a bowl, arrange in layers: sliced potatoes, sliced tomatoes, vermicelli, cabbage, bean sprouts, sliced egg, and the meat on top #Pour the boiling soup over the ingredients, but no bones or chicken skin may go into the bowl #Put fried shallots on top, squeeze a slice of lemon #Serve with hot steamed rice or slices of lontong (steamed rice roll)
==Notes, tips and variations== * Many versions of soto Ayam dont have tomato. * Some prefer not to mix cabbage with bean sprouts. * As fried potato substitute, some like to put potato chips into the soup.
[[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Indonesian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[id:Resep:Soto ayam]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegan cuisine|Vegan cuisine]]
A fresh Seitan sausage is similar to a [[w:Bratwurst|Bratwurst]]. Gluten inflates in a hot pan but deflates nearly as quickly when it cools down. The cooled down sausage may look somewhat flat but tastes as well as the spices you used (gluten is almost without taste). With sausage spices, especially [[w:Curry|Curry]] you can create a vegetarian Bratwurst or [[w:Currywurst|Currywurst]] few unaware meat eaters would suspect to be vegetarian.
==Ingredients==
* [[Cookbook:Gluten|Gluten]] (see [[Cookbook:Seitan|Seitan]] for how to gain gluten from wheat flour) * Water, [[Cookbook:Soy_sauce|Soy sauce]], [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|Vegetable oil]] * additional spices, e.g.: [[Cookbook:Coriander|Coriander]], [[Cookbook:Cardamom|Cardamom]], [[Cookbook:Thyme|Thyme]] and [[Cookbook:Oregano|Oregano]] * optional: [[Cookbook:Tofu|Tofu]]
==Procedure== * Use 25% (volume) more water than gluten flour. * Mix liquid ingredients (e.g. soy sauce) with the water. * Mix solid ingredients (e.g. spices) with the flour. It is much easier to mix solid and liquid ingredients separately than adding ingredients to the gluten dough later, as it is very rubbery and sticky. * mashed tofu can be added to the solid ingredients because tofu remains juicier after longer roasting. * Make gluten dough from 100% gluten flour (or use wheat flour, see [[Cookbook:Seitan|Seitan]]) and water. The dough should be suitable for kneading. Knead the dough until it is well combined and allow it to rest for 10 minutes. * Roll the dough into sausages and fry them in a pan. * To fry the sausages an oiled non-stick pan is recommended. To fry the sausages on a grill they must be cooked first in order to make the gluten dough less rubbery. * The gluten inflates but is also bit runny. To form round sausages you have to turn them on all sides and squeeze from both sides with two [[w:Spatula|spatulas]]. * For an original Currywurst you add [[w:Ketchup|Ketchup]] and sprinkle Curry on the sausage.
== Attention ==
* If the sausages aren't eaten fresh they deflate a lot but still taste good. (You clearly have to recognize the inner values over the outer appearance here).
== See also == {{wikipedia|Bratwurst}}
* [[Cookbook:Vegan_Paprika_Bratwurst|Vegan Paprika Bratwurst]] * [[Cookbook:Falafel Seitan Bratwurst|Falafel Seitan Bratwurst]]
[[Category:Vegan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Seitan_recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tofu_recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[de:Veganes_Leben:_Ern%C3%A4hrung:_Rezepte:_Seitan_Bratwurst]]

== Procedure == #Combine cornmeal and milk/orange juice, and let stand 10 minutes. #Combine dry ingredients. #Add egg and oil to cornmeal mixture, then add dry ingredients. Stir until combined. #Bake at 400°F (205°C) for 15-20 minutes.

Rojak, a dessert with chilli.

*1 [[Cookbook:Turnip|turnip]], peeled and sliced very thin *1 [[Cookbook:Mango|mango]] *2 [[Cookbook:Apple|sour apple]]s *1 Small [[Cookbook:Pineapple|pineapple]] *2 Large [[Cookbook:Cucumber|cucumber]]s *3 [[Cookbook:Orange|orange]]s

{{recipe}}
'''Whipped cream''' is a stable aerated form of [[Cookbook:Cream|cream]], usually with [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]], [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] or other flavors added. It's traditionally produced by whipping air into heavy cream.
It's often served on top of desserts such as [[Cookbook:Pie|pie]], [[Cookbook:Vanilla Ice Cream|ice cream]], and strawberries. It's also used to give mousses their fluffy texture, by gently folding it into a flavoring substance such as chocolate. It can also be used as a [[Cookbook:Leavening agent|leavening agent]] for batters.
Pre-whipped cream can be bought at grocery stores in both tubs and spray tubes.
==Ingredients:== *1 cup(0.25 l) heavy cream (or whipping cream), cold
==Procedure== # Chill a medium mixing bowl and the beaters of an electric mixer in the refrigerator for at least 10 minutes. (If using a mixer with various kinds of beaters, use the [[Cookbook:Whisk|whisk]] attachment). This step is very important, because the cream will not rise if the mixer is warm. # In the chilled bowl, beat heavy cream until soft peaks form. Do not overbeat.
Makes: 2 cups/0.5 l
== Tips, Notes and Variations == * Contrary to whipping egg whites, it's not important to make sure there's no fat in the mixture. It is important, however, to make sure that the bowl and mixers are dry. * To sweeten the cream, about two tablespoons of sugar per cup (0.25 l) of heavy cream are appropriate.
[[Category:Dairy recipes|Whipped Cream]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|Whipped Cream]] [[Category:Leavening Agents|Whipped Cream]] [[Category:Ingredients|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{Recipesummary| |Category=Pork recipes |Servings=12-16 |Time=12 to 28 hours |Rating=3 |Energy= 240 Cal }} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat_Recipes|Meat recipes]]
'''Cochinita pibil''' (also '''puerco pibil''') is a traditional [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Mexico|Mexican]] slow-roasted pork dish from the [[Wikipedia:Yucatán|Yucatán]].
This version of the dish was adapted from [[Wikipedia:Robert Rodríguez|Robert Rodríguez]]'s DVD extras on ''[[Wikipedia:Once Upon a Time in Mexico|Once Upon a Time in Mexico]]''.
==Ingredients==
* 5 [[Cookbook:tablespoon|Tbsps.]] (75 ml) [[Cookbook:annatto|annatto]] seeds * 2 [[Cookbook:teaspoon|tsps.]] (10 ml) [[Cookbook:cumin|cumin]] seeds * 1 Tbsp. (15 ml) [[Cookbook:black pepper|peppercorns]] * 8 [[Cookbook:allspice|allspice]] berries * ½ tsp. (8 ml) whole [[Cookbook:clove|cloves]] * 2 [[Cookbook:chile peppers|habanero chile]]s (or milder chile) * ½ [[Cookbook:cup|cup]] (120 ml) [[Cookbook:orange |orange]] juice * ½ cup (120 ml) white [[Cookbook:vinegar|vinegar]] * 2 Tbsps. (30 ml) [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * 8 cloves of [[Cookbook:garlic|garlic]] * juice of 5 [[Cookbook:lemon|lemon]]s * splash of [[Cookbook:tequila|tequila]] * 5 pounds (2.3 kg) [[Cookbook:pork|pork]] butt * [[Cookbook:Banana|banana]] leaves and/or heavy-duty [[Cookbook:aluminum foil|aluminum foil]] * white or Spanish [[Cookbook:rice|rice]], [[Cookbook:taco|taco]] shells, or [[Cookbook:tortilla|tortilla]]s for serving
== Procedure ==
# Place the annatto, cumin, peppercorns, allspice, and cloves in a spice grinder and process to a '''fine''' powder. (You can use an electric coffee grinder for the spices, but it will not be suitable for coffee afterwards.) # Remove the seeds and veins from the habanero chiles and chop coarsely. (If you want a hotter dish, leave some of the veins and seeds in. If you want a milder dish, substitute a milder chile.) # Process the orange juice, vinegar, chiles, salt, garlic, and the powder you made in step 1 in a [[Cookbook:blender|blender]] or [[Cookbook:food processor|food processor]] until liquefied. Add the lemon juice and tequila. # Cut the pork into 2 inch (5 cm) chunks. Leave the fat on the meat, to keep the pork moist while roasting; you can remove it after cooking if you wish. Place in a large, self-sealing plastic bag with the [[Cookbook:marination|marinade]]. Seal bag and turn to evenly coat the meat. Refrigerate for 8 to 24 hours, turning occasionally. # Heat oven to 325° F (160° C). Dump the meat and the marinade in a roasting pan lined with banana leaves or foil, making sure to wrap tightly so no steam escapes. If using banana leaves, an outer wrapping with foil will help seal in the steam. [[Cookbook:Roast|Roast]] for 4 hours. Open packet carefully; the meat should shred easily with a fork. # Serve over rice, or shred and serve with taco shells or tortillas.
==Nutrition==
Per serving: 240 calories (84 fat calories), 9.3 g fat (2.9 g saturated, 3.8 g monounsaturated), 92.2 mg cholesterol, 33.1 g protein, 5.2 g carbohydrates, 0.7 g fiber, 1037 mg sodium.
[[Category:Pork recipes|Cochinita pibil]] [[Category:Mexican recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chile recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|8|35 minutes + cooling|1}} {{recipe}}
==Ingredients== * 2.5 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (600g) white [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] * 1 stick [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 9 inch (22cm) pre-made [[Cookbook:Pie Crust|pie crust]]
==Procedure== # Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) # Mix sugar, butter, and vinegar in saucepan. Bring to a boil. # Beat eggs in bowl. # Add contents of saucepan to eggs, then add vanilla. # Pour mixture into pie crust. # Cook pie in 375°F (190°C)oven for 35 minutes. # Let cool.

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Indonesia|Cuisine of Indonesia]]
{{Recipesummary| |Category=Vegetable recipes |Servings=4 |Time=10 minutes |Rating=2 |Energy= |Image= }}
This vegetable soup is a must-have item on the menu of every West Java (Sundanese) restaurant in Indonesia. This soup has some kind of appetizing effect because of the use of tamarind or (dried) sour starfuit as one of the ingredients. Sayur asem is a compliment to main dish such as ayam [[Cookbook:Ayam_Goreng_Kuning|Ayam Goreng Kuning]], [[Cookbook:Pepes_Ikan|Pepes Ikan]] or fried salty fish.
==Ingredients== * Vegetable for the soup ** 100 g [[Cookbook:Yardlong bean|yardlong bean]] ** 1 [[Cookbook:Chayote|chayote]] ** 50 gr [[Cookbook:Corn|corn]] ** 100 g [[Cookbook:Jackfruit|young jackfuit]] ** 50 gr [[Cookbook:Gnetum gnemon|Gnetum gnemon]] leaves and fruits ** 1 [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]] ** 105 g [[Cookbook:Galangal|galangal]] ** 2 [[Cookbook:Salam leaves|salam leaves]] ** 20 g [[Cookbook:Tamarind| fresh tamarind]] or Asam Jawa tamarind paste, or ** 5 (dried) [[Cookbook:Bilimbi|Belimbing sayur]]
*Spice paste, using food processor grind the following ingredients: ** 1 [[Cookbook:Chili_Pepper|fresh red chili pepper]] ** 2 [[Cookbook:Shallot|shallot]] ** 2 g [[Cookbook:Terasi|terasi]] ** 1/2 tbl. salt
==Directions== #Clean the vegetables, cut into bite size #Boil 1.2 liter of water in a pot #Put the spice paste and the ingredients, with vegetables needs longer cooking time first (potatoes, corn, young jackfruit etc.) #Add salt and sugar to taste
[[Category:Indonesian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tamarind recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Jackfruit recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chayote recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
