revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Rice recipes|4 persons|40 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday]] | [[Cookbook:Rice|Rice]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 3/4 [[Cookbook:cup|cup]]s (400g) risotto [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]] (plump, medium grain rice that contains a lot of starch, the types Arborio or Carnaroli are traditionally best. Other rices that work well are Roma, Vialone, Nano and Maratelli.) * 1 [[Cookbook:tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 2 tablespoons extra-virgin [[Cookbook:olive oil|olive oil]] * 1 small yellow [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] diced * ½ cup (60ml) of sweet [[Cookbook:white Wine|white wine]], such as Riesling * 4½ cups (1kg) [[Cookbook:chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Stock|stock]]/broth * 1½ (360g) cups cooked [[Cookbook:pumpkin|pumpkin]], or 1 (15-[[Cookbook:ounce|ounce]]) can pumpkin puree * 1½ [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]]s grated fresh [[Cookbook:ginger|ginger]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]] * 1 cup (240g) grated [[Cookbook:Parmesan cheese|Parmesan cheese]] * [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Cookbook:black pepper|black pepper]] taste
==Preparation==
''Make sure your stock is simmering before you begin. It's important that the temperature is as high as possible, without letting the stock boil. The surface of the stock should just be moving a little. '' # In a large thick pot combine oil, butter, and onion, and [[Cookbook:sauté|sauté]] over medium heat until the onion is soft, about 6 minutes. # Add rice and stir until well coated with oil and butter. Increase heat to medium high and add wine. Stir constantly until wine has been absorbed. # Add broth, ½ (120ml) cup at a time, stirring constantly, and adding more liquid as it is absorbed. # Once the rice has absorbed all the broth, reduce heat to medium-low. Taste to check the texture. The rice should be firm, but cooked through. If the rice is too hard or dry, add more broth, ½ cup (120ml) at a time. # When the rice reaches the desired texture, stir in the pumpkin, ginger, and cayenne pepper. Cook, stirring constantly, 2-3 minutes. Stir in Parmesan cheese, then season to taste with salt and pepper.
[[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Italian recipes|Risotto, Peppery Pumpkin]] [[Category:Rice recipes|Risotto, Peppery Pumpkin]] [[Category:Pumpkin recipes|Risotto, Peppery Pumpkin]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Risotto, Peppery Pumpkin]]

{{recipesummary|Chili recipes|12 persons|4 hours|3}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:beans|Beans]] | [[Cookbook:Chili|Chili]]
==Ingredients==
* 3½ [[Cookbook:cup|cup]]s dried [[Cookbook:black beans|black beans]] * 2 [[Cookbook:tablespoon|tablespoon]]s [[Cookbook:Corn oil|corn oil]] or other [[Cookbook:vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] * 1 medium [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], diced * 2 [[Cookbook:cloves|cloves]] [[Cookbook:garlic|garlic]], minced * 1 chipotle [[Cookbook:chile|chile]] * ¼ ancho chile * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:cumin|cumin]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:paprika|paprika]] * 1 tablespoon dried [[Cookbook:oregano|oregano]] * ¾ tablespoon sea [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * ⅛ [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]] * 2 tablespoons wine [[Cookbook:vinegar|vinegar]] (red or white) * 1½ cups diced [[Cookbook:tomato|tomato]]es * 1½ cups [[Cookbook:tomato|tomato]] puree * 4 cups [[Cookbook:water|water]] * [[Cookbook:sour cream|sour cream]] for [[Cookbook:garnish|garnish]]
==Preparation==
# Place beans in a large pot and cover with enough water to cover by 2 inches, and allow to soak overnight. Drain beans and cover again with fresh water. Bring to [[Cookbook:boil|boil]], reduce heat, and [[Cookbook:simmer|simmer]] for 2 hours. # Heat the corn oil in a stockpot or other very large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onions and [[Cookbook:saute|sauté]] until tender, about 3 minutes. Add garlic, chipotle and ancho chiles, cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, cayenne, and vinegar, and sauté for 5 to 10 minutes. # Add tomatoes, tomato puree, and 4 cups water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the beans with their juice. Simmer for 1 hour. Serve with or without sour cream.
[[Category:Slow cooker recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bean recipes|Black Bean Chili]] [[Category:Chili recipes|Black Bean Chili]] [[Category:American recipes|Black Bean Chili]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Black Bean Chili]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Indonesia|Indonesian Cuisine]]
'''Kare Ayam (Chicken Curry)''' is one of the signature dishes of Indonesian cuisine. In spite of the name "curry", this dish does not use Indian curry spice, and is actually a spicy but sweet dish.
Makes 4 servings.
== Ingredients == * 1 lb. (450g) boneless, skinless [[Cookbook:chicken|chicken]] parts * 5 [[Cookbook:Shallot|Asian shallots]], sliced (or 1/2 cup chopped onions) * 2 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], minced * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]], minced or grated * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Lemongrass|lemongrass]], minced or grated * 6 [[Cookbook:Candlenut|kimiri]] (candlenuts), ground * 2 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|salam Leaves]] (Indonesian bay leaves) * 4 [[Cookbook:Kaffir Lime Leaf|kaffir lime leaves]] * ½ tsp [[Cookbook:Turmeric|turmeric root]] (ground or grated) * ½ tsp [[Cookbook:Galangal|galangal root]] (ground or grated) * 1 cup (240ml) [[Cookbook:Coconut Milk|coconut milk]] * ½ tsp salt (to taste) * 2 tbs [[Cookbook:Gula Jawa|gula jawa]] * 2 tbs [[Cookbook:Oil|cooking oil]] * 2 Hot [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chilies]] (optional) * ¼ tsp [[Cookbook:Terasi|terasi]] (fermented shrimp paste)
== Procedure == # Wash chicken parts. # In a [[Cookbook:Food Processor|food processor]] (or [[Cookbook:Mortar and Pestle|mortar and pestle]]) grind the garlic, ginger, kimiri nuts, turmeric, galangal, hot chilies, and terasi into a paste (bumbu). # In a wok or skillet, cook the paste over medium heat for 1 minute. # Add the chicken parts to the wok and brown. # Add the shallots, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and salam leaves to the wok and sauté for another minute. # Add the coconut milk and bring to a light boil. # Simmer on low heat for 10 minutes.
== Notes, tips, and variations == * Serve with white rice (nasi putih), yellow rice (nasi kuning), or coconut rice (nasi uduk). * Top with fried shallots. * Substitute fish, shrimp, or lamb for the chicken.
[[Category:Chicken recipes|Kare Ayam]] [[Category:Indonesian recipes|Kare Ayam]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Rice recipes|6 persons|2 hours|3}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday]] | [[Cookbook:Rice|Rice]]
==Ingredients==
* 1½ [[Cookbook:pound|pound]]s (650g) [[Cookbook:pumpkin|pumpkin]] or winter [[Cookbook:squash|squash]]), whole * ½ [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:kosher|kosher]] [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * 6 grinds freshly cracked [[Cookbook:black pepper|black pepper]] * 1 bunch fresh [[Cookbook:marjoram|marjoram]], chopped (some reserved for garnish) * 2 [[Cookbook:cloves|cloves]] [[Cookbook:garlic|garlic]], peeled and thickly sliced * 5 tablespoons extra-virgin [[Cookbook:olive oil|olive oil]], divided * 1 [[Cookbook:quart|quart]] (120ml) [[Cookbook:chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Stock|stock]]/broth * 10 [[Cookbook:tablespoon|tablespoon]] unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] at room temperature, divided * 1 medium red [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], finely diced * 1½ [[Cookbook:cup|cup]]s (360g) [[Cookbook:risotto|risotto]] [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]] (plump, medium grain rice that contains a lot of starch, the types Arborio or Carnaroli are traditionally best. Other rices that work well are Roma, Vialone, Nano and Maratelli.) * 5 tablespoons extra-dry white vermouth * 1½ cups (360g) Parmiggiano Reggiano, finely grated, plus extra to sprinkle at the table
==Preparation==
# Preheat oven to 425° F (210c). # Remove seeds and fiber from inside the pumpkin and cut into chunks. Place skin side down on a baking pan brushed with a little olive oil. Season with salt and pepper, scatter the marjoram and garlic over the pieces, cover with foil and bake about 45 minutes, or until soft. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Cut the flesh from skin into smll cubes and reserve the baking juices. # Heat the chicken stock and check for seasoning. # Melt 6 tablespoons butter and 2 tablespoons olive oil in a wide, heavy-bottomed sauté pan or pot. Add onion and gently sauté until soft. Add rice and stir until completely covered in oil. Now, add vermouth and stir until it is absorbed by the rice. # Turn heat to medium high and begin adding stock, ½ cup (120ml) at a time, and stir until stock is completely absorbed by the rice. Continue this process until all the stock is incorporated. # Stir in remaining butter in small pieces, pumpkin with its juices, and cheese. Serve immediately with a sprinkle of cheese and fresh marjoram to garnish.
[[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Pastry recipes|3 pie crusts|prep: 30 minutes|2|}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] This quick pastry is a no-fail recipe made easily with ingredients usually found in most kitchens. Be sure to use cold water and keep well-wrapped until ready to use. In contrast to [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]], pie crust and other pastries should be made in a way that minimizes the development of [[Cookbook:Gluten|gluten]]. Once the water has been added, the dough should be worked as little as possible, to minimize toughness in the finished crust. == Ingredients == * 3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]]s (700g) [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1¼ cup (300g) [[Cookbook:Shortening|shortening]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]], beaten * ⅓ cup (80ml) cold water * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] white [[Cookbook:vinegar|vinegar]] == Procedure == # Combine flour, shortening and salt. Cut in shortening with fork (or pastry blender) until it resembles corn meal. # Combine water and vinegar with beaten egg. Add to flour mixture a little at a time until a soft dough forms. # Divide dough into three discs, and use or freeze individually. # When using, roll out onto a floured surface to desired measurements.
* Makes three single crusts. * Note: When baking two pies at once, rotate the pies 180 degrees at 15 minutes and 45 minutes to ensure the crust does not burn due to its proximity to the oven walls. [[Category:Pastry recipes|Pie Crust, Flaky]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary||4|40 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}}
''This was the first thing I could cook. I learned to make it staying with a friend as I was leaving the Navy. For years I have called it "Keith's Whats-it."''
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] uncooked [[Cookbook:Pasta|pasta]], such as [[Cookbook:Macaroni|macaroni]], elbows, or wagon wheels * 1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] [[Cookbook:Ground Beef|ground beef]] or [[Cookbook:Hamburger|hamburger]], crumbled * a sprinkle of [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * a sprinkle of minced [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * 1 or 2 cans condensed [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]] [[Cookbook:Soup|soup]]
==Procedure==
# [[Cookbook:Boil|Boil]] pasta al denté in 4-6 cups salted, oiled water, drain. # While pasta is cooking, sprinkle 10" skillet with garlic salt and minced onion, and brown beef. # Add tomato soup and cook a minute or two. # Stir in drained pasta.
==Notes, tips and variations==
# May add beans, vary spices, add onions; anything you like! # Makes a decent chili base with chili powder added. # Good in leftovers, if that is possible.
[[Category:American recipes|Hamburger Skillet Dinner]] [[Category:Beef recipes|Hamburger Skillet Dinner]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|Hamburger Skillet Dinner]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|Hamburger Skillet Dinner]]

{{recipe}} * 1 can [[Cookbook:Red Kidney Bean|red kidney beans]], drained * 1 can [[Cookbook:Black Bean|black beans]], drained * 2 cans crushed [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * 1 small can of [[Cookbook:Tomato Paste|tomato paste]] * 2 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], diced * 1 medium [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], chopped * 1 medium green [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|bell pepper]], chopped * 1 medium red bell pepper, chopped * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbsp.]] [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] or vegetable oil * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp.]] [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]] * 1/2 tsp. [[Cookbook:Cayenne Pepper|cayenne pepper]] * 1 tsp. [[Cookbook:Thyme|thyme]], [[Cookbook:Basil|basil]], [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]], or other spice
# Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large pan. # Add garlic and onion and cook until the onion is translucent (more clear than white). # Add peppers and [[Cookbook:Saute|saute]] for a few minutes. Add crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, and spices. # When mixture is bubbling, reduce heat to [[Cookbook:Simmer|simmer]] and add beans. Cover and simmer for at least 1 hour, stirring occasionally. The longer it simmers, the better it tastes.
Serves 4
===See also=== *[[Cookbook:Chili (Vegan)|Chili (Vegan)]] *[[Cookbook:Chili_con_carne|chili con carne]] *[[Cookbook:Texas Easy Chili|Texas easy chili]] *[[Cookbook:Red Chile Sauce|red chile sauce]] *[[Cookbook:Easy Chili|Easy Chili]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Holiday recipes|Holiday recipes]]
The ancient Romans, who sacrificed a pig to their god Saturn about the same time Christmas is celebrated nowadays, are probably the starters of a Christmas tradition still alive in some parts of the world. This is a recipe for a boneless, lightly salted Finnish-style ham, popular since about the 1940s, before which Finns used to eat several kinds of meats during Christmas.
This is often eaten with traditional [[Cookbook:Christmas recipes|Christmas cuisine]], including [[Cookbook:baked potato|baked potato]]es, [[Cookbook:red wine|red wine]], and potato, carrot, and rutabaga casseroles, as well as during the night or in the morning and in-between 'proper' meals with bread, mustard and milk. Ham goes well with almost anything. If you have been eating ham for several days with mustard, try chili for a change.
==Ingredients== * 1 7-10 kg [[Cookbook:ham|ham]], lightly salted, boneless * [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]] * [[Cookbook:Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]
==Procedure== # If ham is frozen, thaw it in its plastic package, for 3 days in the refrigerator for a 7kg ham, 5 days for a 10kg ham. A 10kg ham is considered better-tasting as the pig has gotten bigger. # Before putting the ham in the oven, take it out from the refrigerator and let come closer to room temperature. If you intend to put the ham in the oven in the evening, take it out during the early morning. The ham should be about 10 degrees C (50 F) when you put it in the oven. # Use a wet paper towel to clean the ham a bit; then dry it. #Place ham on baking tray in oven, with some water on the tray. Or, if you have a large roasting bag, there is no need for water. # Note: do not use only the grill as it lets drop all the liquid from the ham, messing up your oven if the roasting bag fails. However, you can use the grill and put the ham on it and baking tray beneath that. An aluminum foil can also be used on the baking tray. # Preheat oven to 200 °C (you can skip this if you are not worried about the possible bacteria on the ham) and let ham roast in the warm oven for half an hour, then turn temperature down. # Cook at 100-125 °C, for about 1 hour/kilo, so a 7 kg ham will take 7 hours or more, until meat thermometer shows 75-80 °C. 'Traditional' ham is ready at 80 °C but most take the ham out of the oven at 77 °C or so, when the ham has more water left in it and is considered tastier. # The use of a meat thermometer is recommended because the actual temperature of an oven commonly varies from its setting; thus the ham can be severely under- or overcooked if you do not use a thermometer. Thermometer should be placed in the middle of the ham. Be careful that it does not touch the oven walls. You can test if the thermometer works properly before using it by dipping it in boiling water - it should show about 100 °C. # After you take the ham out of the oven, wait a little while before removing the thermometer. It is recommended you do not pour the liquid from the bag or baking tray down the drain. # Wait until ham is cool enough to handle, then glaze it with mustard and breadcrumbs. First remove the rind from the ham, then cover the ham with mustard, then with breadcrumbs. Put in 250 °C oven for 10 minutes. # Ham is ready to eat when it has cooled down a bit. This makes about enough for 3 or 4 people for a week, but if you think you will not eat it all within a week, freeze the rest.
==Notes, tips, and variations== *It is possible to salt a ham yourself, if you buy ham from a farm or butcher or buy a pig in time to fatten it for Christmas. There are several methods available; here is one that is called ''tönkkösuolaus'': Use a 10kg ham, put 1,8 kg of large crystal salt into 10 liters of water which is near or slightly below 0c, ham must be completely submerged, let be there for two months, changing the water from time to time, during the last week you can keep ham in water only, if you want it to be slightly less salty). *Several people swear by sauna-cooked ham, in which case you will put the ham in a sauna instead of an oven (glazing still done in oven), it will take maybe 12-24 hours for a ham in a 100 °C sauna, several days in a 80 °C sauna. Use a meat thermometer if you use a sauna to cook a ham and remember to have something beneath the ham collecting all the liquid. Often people also use a wood-burning stove to cook a ham, this method is hardest as you can not use a meat thermometer easily with one, so unless you have good instructions to the very oven you have (or have a spare ham just in case), this would not be recommended for first-time Christmas ham lovers.
[[Category:Finnish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes with metric units|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Ham recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Christmas recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Pastry recipes|1 9-inch
4-cup volume shell|prep: 30 minutes|2|}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] | [[Cookbook:Vegan_cuisine|Vegan Cuisine]] ''Be sure to use '''cold''' water and keep well wrapped until use.'' In contrast to [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]], pie crust and other pastries should be made in a way that minimizes the development of [[Cookbook:Gluten|gluten]]. Once the water has been added, the dough should be worked as little as possible, to minimize toughness in the finished crust. == Ingredients == * 1 [[Cookbook:cup|cups]] all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * ½ [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 cup cold vegetable [[Cookbook:Shortening|shortening]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|Tablespoons]] cold water [add 1 additional tablespoon of water as needed] == Procedure == # Combine flour and salt in medium bowl. # Cut in vegetable shortening with a [[Cookbook:Pastry Blender|pastry blender]] or two knives, until mixture is crumbly. # Sprinkle with cold water; blend until mixture holds together. # Shape dough into a ball; place on lightly floured surface. # Roll out dough to 1/8 inch thickness. # Line pie plate with pastry. # Trim around perimeter for 1-inch overhang to fold under and crimp as desired. == Note == To make two crusts, double all ingredients, follow procedure above, and divide dough in half. == Pie Crust Edges == ==== Simple Fork Edge ==== # Fold overhang under and press down with your fingers. # Using the tines of a lightly floured fork, press the edge of the pastry to the rim of the pie pan. ==== Fluted Edge ==== # Fold overhang under and pinch to make the edge stand up. # With the thumb and forefinger of one hand, pinch the outside edge of the pastry, while pressing from the inside with the forefinger of your other hand. ==== Rope Edge ==== # Fold overhang under and pinch to make the edge stand up. # Press the pastry along the edge of the pie plate between the side of your thumb at an angle, pinch and slightly twist. [[Category:Vegan recipes|Pie Crust, Homemade]] [[Category:Pastry recipes|Pie Crust, Homemade]]

revision.comment:

revision.text:
== Pie Crust Edges ==
==== Simple Fork Edge ==== # Fold overhang under and press down with your fingers. # Using the tines of a lightly floured fork, press the edge of the pastry to the rim of the pie pan.
==== Fluted Edge ==== # Fold overhang under and pinch to make the edge stand up. # With the thumb and forefinger of one hand, pinch the outside edge of the pastry, while pressing from the inside with the forefinger of your other hand.
==== Rope Edge ==== # Fold overhang under and pinch to make the edge stand up. # Press the pastry along the edge of the pie plate between the side of your thumb at an angle, pinch and slightly twist.
[[Category:Recipes|Pie Crust Edges]] [[Category:Pastry recipes|Pie Crust Edges]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|8|55-65 minutes
2 hours cooling|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday]] Serve your pumpkin pie warm or cold, topped with whipped cream or not! ==Ingredients== * ¾ [[Cookbook:cup|cup]] (180g) granulated [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 teaspoon ground [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] * ½ teaspoon ground [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] * ¼ teaspoon ground [[Cookbook:Cloves|cloves]] * 2 large [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 1 can (15 ounces - 425g) [[Cookbook:Pumpkin|pumpkin]] * 1 can (12 fluid ounces - 350ml) evaporated [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1 unbaked nine inch [[Cookbook:Pie Crust|pie shell]] * [[Cookbook:Whipped Cream|whipped cream]] * '''NOTE:''' 1¾ teaspoons pumpkin pie spice may be substituted for the cinnamon, ginger, and cloves; however, the taste will be slightly different. ==Procedure== # Preheat oven to 425°F (210c) # Mix sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves in small bowl. Beat eggs in large bowl; stir in pumpkin and sugar spice mixture. Gradually stir in evaporated milk. # Pour into the unbaked pie shell. # Bake at 425°F (210c) for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350°F (180c) 40-50 minutes or until knife inserted near center come out clean. Cool on wire rack 2 hours. # Let cool and serve. # Top with whipped cream before serving. ==Notes and tips== '''Before you bake.''' Make the batter ahead, if you wish, but pour it into the pie shell just before baking to keep the crust crisp. '''During baking.''' The baking instructions start with a high oven temperature, then direct you to reduce the heat partway through baking. This is an important step which allows the crust time to crisp. '''Is it done?''' Insert a knife near the center of the pie to test for doneness, as the center will still cook after you take the pie out of the oven. [[Category:American recipes|Pumpkin Pie]] [[Category:Pie recipes|Pumpkin Pie]] [[Category:Pumpkin recipes|Pumpkin Pie]] [[Category:Thanksgiving recipes|Pumpkin Pie]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Pumpkin Pie]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday recipes]] [[Image:2005 baking of saffron buns 04.jpg|thumb|300px|Saffron buns]]
'''Lussekatter''' ('''Saffron Buns''') are served on [[w:St. Lucia Day|St. Lucia Day]] (13 December) in Scandinavia.
==Ingredients==
*½ tsp. crushed [[Cookbook:saffron|saffron]] threads (¼ tsp. powder) *¾ c. (180ml) [[Cookbook:Half and Half|half and half]], lukewarm *two pkgs. [[Cookbook:yeast|yeast]] (4½ tsp.) dissolved in ¼ c. very warm (edit lukewarm) water *½ c. (120g) melted butter *two eggs, beaten *¾ c. (180g) sugar *one tsp. salt *4-5 c. sifted flour *[[Cookbook:Raisin|Raisins]] to decorate
==Procedure== #Mix saffron in warm half and half and let stand while dissolving yeast in the water. #Mix half of flour with other ingredients and beat until well blended. #Add flour until dough is smooth but not too firm. Knead on floured surface for ten minutes. #Place dough in buttered bowl and let rise until double (1½ hours). #Roll seven-inch-long sticks and form S-shaped buns with their ends curled in. Place a raisin in each curl. #Place buns on buttered sheet, cover and let rise 45 minutes. Brush with beaten egg and bake at 375-400°F (190-200°C) for 10-15 minutes.
<gallery> Image:2005 baking of saffron buns 01.jpg|Let the dough rise until double Image:2005 baking of saffron buns 02.jpg|Brush with beaten egg Image:2005 baking of saffron buns 03.jpg|Let the finished buns cool off </gallery>
==External link== *[http://www.flickr.com/photos/tomhe/sets/72057594122213908/ Photos of baking saffron buns]
[[Category:Bread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Saffron recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Holiday recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Swedish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[sv:Lussekatt]]

{{recipesummary|Rice recipes|4 persons|90 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Rice|Rice]] ==Ingredients==
* ½ cup (120g) uncooked [[Cookbook:rice|rice]] * 1 can [[Cookbook:beef consommé|beef consommé]] * ½ stick [[Cookbook:margarine|margarine]] * 1 small [[Cookbook:onion|onion]], chopped
==Procedure==
# [[Cookbook:Sauté|Sauté]] onion in margarine over medium heat. # Mix rice and consommé in [[Cookbook:baking dish|baking dish]]. Pour onion and margarine over rice and consommé and mix. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] covered for 30 minutes at 350 °F (180 °C). # Remove from oven, add ½ can water over rice mixture. # Cover and cook an additional 30 minutes.
[[Category:Rice recipes|Browned Rice]] [[Category:Recipes with metric units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

page.title: Cookbook:No Name Easy Christmas Fruit Cake

revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] | [[Cookbook:Desserts|{{PAGENAME}}]]
NO NAME EASY CHRISTMAS FRUIT CAKE
== Ingredients == *1 1/2 cup (360g) raisins *1/4 cup (60ml) orange juice *1 cup (240g) butter (softened) *1 packet of cream cheese (250g) *1 1/2 cups (360g) brown sugar *4 eggs *4 teaspoons grated orange rind *1 cups (140g) all purpose flour *1 tablespoon baking powder *1/2 teaspoon salt *1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
== Procedure ==
#IN A SAUCEPAN ON LOW HEAT WARM RAISINS AND ORANGE JUICE UNTIL LIQUID IS ASORBED. SET ASIDE!! #iN LARGE BOWL BEAT BUTTER CREAM CHEESE WITH SUGAR UNTIL FLUFFY, ADD EGGS ONE AT A TIME AND ORANGE RIND. STIR AGAIN. #IN A SEPARATE BOWL MIX FLOUR, BAKING POWDER, SALT AND NUTMEG, STIR INTO BATTER ADDING RAISIN MIXTURE. #SPOON INTO A GREASED AND FLOURED 9 INCH TUBE PAN OR BUNDT PAN. #BAKE IN 300f (~160c). OVEN FOR ABOUT 80 MINUTES. CHECK IT AT 60 MINUTES WITH A CAKE TESTER STICK. #LET COOL IN PAN FOR 5 MINUTES TURN ONTO A RACK TO COOL COMPLETELY. #THIS CAKE CAN BE EATEN A DAY LATER NO FUSS NO WAITING AROUND FOR IT TO AGE.
THIS RECIPE WAS WRITTEN OUT BY MY HUSBANDS SISTER WHO PASSED AWAY AT A VERY YOUNG AGE OF 37, 12 CHRISTMAS'S AGO. THOUGHT WE'D KEEP HER CAKE ALIVE AND PASS IT ON. WE HAVE NO IDEA WHAT RECIPE BOOK THIS IS OUT OF BUT LETS KEEP IT ALIVE AS A MEMORY CAKE.
Diane and Lorne Merry Cake Christmas to one and all.

{{recipesummary| |8|40 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}}
'''Tuna Rice Casserole''' - A simple, quick-to-make meal, even kids can make! (Under supervision)
==Ingredients==
* 2 (6-ounce - 150g) cans [[Cookbook:tuna|tuna]] * 1 (10 oz - 280g) package frozen [[Cookbook:peas|peas]], cooked * 3 [[Cookbook:cup|cup]]s cooked [[Cookbook:rice|rice]] * ¾ cup (6-ounces - 180ml) water * 1 (10 oz - 280g) can [[Cookbook:cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]] [[Cookbook:soup|soup]]
==Procedure==
# Preheat oven to 400° F (200c). ''Takes about 20 minutes.'' # In large bowl, combine tuna, peas, and rice, mix well. # In another large bowl, combine cheddar cheese soup and water. # Place soup mixture in bowl with tuna mixture. # Place combined mixture in greased casserole dish. # Bake in a preheated 400° F (200c) oven for 20 minutes.
==Tips==
* ''Optional''-add 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]]s minced [[Cookbook:onion|onion]], to first bowl before mixing. * Tastes '''great''' with a [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] or two of ''Texas Pete''! * May substitute chopped chicken or turkey for the tuna.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Casserole recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tuna recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rice recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary| |4-8|80 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}}
Traditional '''Tuna Casserole''' - A simple, quick-to-make meal, mentioned by Garrison Keillor on ''A Prairie Home Companion.''
==Ingredients==
* 2 (6-ounce - 150g) cans or 1 12-ounce can [[Cookbook:tuna|tuna]] * 1 [[Cookbook:cup|cup]] (240g) uncooked [[Cookbook:macaroni|macaroni]], or other short [[Cookbook:pasta|pasta]] * 1 can of [[Cookbook:peas|peas]] * 1 can of [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushroom]]s * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]]s minced [[Cookbook:onion|onion]] * ⅛ cup (30ml) [[Cookbook:milk|milk]] * 1 can (10¾-ounces ~290ml) cream of mushroom or [[Cookbook:cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]] [[Cookbook:soup|soup]] * several slices of cheese
==Procedure==
# Preheat oven to 350-400° F (180-200c). ''Takes about 20 minutes.'' # Mix all ingredients, except cheese slices, in large casserole dish. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] for 1 hour stirring 2 or 3 times. # When macaroni is tender, cover top with cheese slices and return to oven for 5 minutes.
=Alternate Method-'''Skillet Dinner'''= ==Ingredients==
* 1-1½ cups (240ml - 360ml) hot water * all other ingredients as above
==Procedure==
# Assemble all ingredients, except sliced cheese, in large skillet. # Bring to boil, simmer 15 minutes, frequently stirring. # Melt cheese on top before serving.
==Tips==
* Tastes '''great''' with a [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] or two of ''Texas Pete''! * May substitute chopped chicken or turkey for the tuna.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Midwestern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Casserole recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tuna recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Mushroom recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Stew recipes |4-8|20 minutes preparation
12 hours cooking|2}} {{recipe}} We called this recipe '''Sticky Stew''' and had it frequently when we bought our first crock pot. ==Ingredients== * 2 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]]s (900g) stew [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]], cut into 1 inch (2.5cm) cubes ''This can be the cheapest beef in the market, it will get tender in the pot!'' * 5 [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrot]]s, cut into 1 inch pieces * 1 large [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], cut into chunks * 3 stalks of [[Cookbook:celery|celery]], sliced * 1 large can [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]]es * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] quick cooking tapioca * 1 whole [[Cookbook:Clove|clove]] or ½ tsp. ground clove * 2 bay leaves * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] and [[Cookbook:pepper|pepper]] to taste ==Procedure== # Trim all fat from meat. # Put all ingredients in crockpot; mix thoroughly. # Cover and cook on low 12 hours or on high 5 to 6 hours. # Remove bay leaves before serving. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Slow cooker recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Stew recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Beef recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]]
==Ingredients== *1½ cup (200g) [[Cookbook:Sifter|sifted]] [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *2 tsp. [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] *½ tsp. [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *½ cup (120g) [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] *1 cup (240g) [[Cookbook:Granulated sugar|granulated sugar]] *½ cup (120g) (packed) [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] *2 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] *1 cup (240g) coarsely chopped [[Cookbook:almond|almond]] [[Cookbook:toffee|toffee]] *1 tsp. [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]]
==Procedure== # Sift flour, baking powder and salt together. Cream butter; add sugars and cream well. Add eggs and vanilla; beat until fluffy. Blend in dry ingredients. Stir in chopped Almond Toffee. # Spread over bottom of well greased 9 x 13 inch (18cm x 30cm) pan. # Bake at 350°F (180°C) for about 30 minutes. When cool, cut into bars 3 inches long and 1 inch wide. If desired, bars may be frosted when cool with a white or chocolate butter frosting before cutting. Sprinkle more crumbled Almond Toffee on top. # Serve warm with your favorite cold beverage.
Yield: 3 dozen.
[[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[:Category:Fermented food recipes|Fermented food recipes]] {{recipesummary |Category = Fermented food recipes |Time = soak: 12 hours
prep: 2 hours
ferment: 24 hours |Rating = 3 |Image = [[Image:Tempeh fava.jpg|300px]] }} '''Tempeh''' is a traditional [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Indonesia|Indonesian]] food made from soybeans. It is a [[Cookbook:Fermentation|fermented]] food, utilising a special type of mould that forms a cake. When fresh, tempeh has a nice mushroom-like smell and flavour. ==Ingredients== * 400 grams (14 ounces) [[Cookbook:Soy|dried soybeans]] * water for soaking the soybeans * water for cooking the soybeans * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon tempeh starter (or ''ragi tempe'') ==Equipment== * [[Cookbook:Pressure Cooker|Pressure cooker]] or [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]], at least 3 litres (3 quarts) * Large tray (or trays) for spreading cooked beans on to dry * Banana leaves, zip-lock bags or shallow dishes for incubating the fermenting tempeh * Somewhere warm to incubate the tempeh at about 30-35°C / 86-95°F (e.g. your oven, with the light on!) * Thermometer (optional) for keeping a watch on the temperature of the incubator ==Preparation== [[Image:Tempeh fava ready.jpg|thumb|right|Cooked fava beans, inoculated with starter and ready to ferment.]] # Cover soybeans with water, and soak overnight or at least 12 hours. # Remove the hulls (i.e. skins) from the beans by rubbing between both hands (see notes). # Skim off most of the hulls either by washing them away or by using a [[Cookbook:Skimmer|skimmer]] or strainer. Some hulls may be left behind without affecting tempeh quality. # Cook beans until just tender, not mushy; undercooked is best for tempeh (see notes). # Drain beans, and spread to dry somewhere with airflow (see notes). # Collect beans into a bowl, and mix in the cider vinegar. This acidifies the beans slightly, inhibiting unwanted spoilage organisms during fermentation. # Sprinkle the tempeh starter over the beans and mix in well (see notes). # Pack the beans loosely into banana leaves, zip-lock bags, or shallow dishes for incubating. Zip-lock bags must be punctured at roughly 1cm / ½ inch intervals to keep oxygen up to the fermenting beans. ==Fermentation== # Load the soon-to-be tempeh into your incubator, preferably on racks that will allow air circulation. An electric oven with a light on makes a pretty good incubator, because the light provides just enough heat to keep the beans warm while the fermentation starts happening. # Incubate for 12 hours or so at around 30-35°C / 86-95°F with a heat source (unless it's already that hot where you are) # After 12 hours, remove or turn off the heat source - the fermenting beans will be making their own heat, and may overheat if you keep them too warm # Monitor periodically from then on, and remove when the beans are totally consumed by fluffy white tempeh with no gaps. # After fermentation is complete, serve straight away in your favourite tempeh recipe, refrigerate for two to three days, or freeze for up to two months. ==Notes, tips, and variations== [[Image:Tempeh tempe.jpg|thumb|right|Fresh tempeh at market, Jakarta, Indonesia]] * Tempeh can be made from almost any legume (beans, chickpeas, split peas), most grains, and some nuts. Soybeans are probably one of the cheapest beans to use, but more flavoursome beans make more flavoursome tempeh! * Tempeh can also be made from [[Cookbook:Okara|okara]], the presscake left over from making [[Cookbook:Soy Milk|soy milk]] and [[Cookbook:Tofu|tofu]]. In Indonesia, this is called ''tempe gembus''. * There are many ways to remove the hulls or skins from the beans, including: ** cracking dried beans in a grain mill and winnowing to remove hulls ** grinding soaked beans in hands ** rubbing soaked beans between both hands ** rubbing cooked beans between both hands (but don't get burnt!) ** buy them pre-hulled - e.g. [[Cookbook:Chickpea|chana dal]], [[Cookbook:Fava Bean|split fava beans]], [[Cookbook:Pea|split peas]] * Soybeans can be cooked easily in a pressure cooker at 15psi for 10 minutes with slow-release method, or on a [[Cookbook:Rolling Boil|rolling boil]] for 30 minutes in a saucepan. Soft, ready-to-eat soybeans are not the target here, so don't cook too long. * It can be difficult to distribute the teaspoonful of tempeh starter through the beans evenly. To make the job a little easier, mix the tempeh starter into a couple of tablespoons of [[Cookbook:Rice Flour|rice flour]] first, then sprinkle and stir this mixture into the beans a little at a time. ==External links== {{Wikipedia|Tempeh}} *[http://www.tempeh.info/ Information on tempeh, and a source of tempeh starter] *[http://www.google.com/search?q=%22ragi+tempe%22+%22shopping+cart%22 Google search for tempeh starter (''ragi tempe'')] *[http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/TEMPEH/ Yahoo! group dedicated to making tempeh] [[Category:Ingredients]] [[Category:Indonesian recipes]] [[Category:Vegan recipes]] [[Category:Gluten-free recipes]] [[Category:Soy recipes]] [[Category:Fermented food recipes]] [[Category:Recipes with metric units]] [[id:Resep:Tempe]]

{{recipesummary|Pork recipes|5 or 6 persons|90 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meat Recipes]]
Pork and Lima Skillet-This is an unusually flavored recipe, delightful with all the basil!
== Ingredients ==
* 2 10-ounce packages frozen baby lima beans * 5 or 6 [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]] loin chops * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] pork-flavored gravy base [granules] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * ⅛ teaspoon dried [[Cookbook:basil|basil]], crushed * ¾ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] water
==Procedure ==
# Cook limas according to package directions, omitting salt in cooking water; drain. # In skillet, brown chops over medium heat. Remove chops from skillet. Pour off all but 1 tablespoon drippings. # Add gravy base to skillet. Blend in flour and basil. # Add ¾ cup water; cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. # Add limas to skillet, stirring to coat with sauce. # Arrange chops over limas. Cover and cook over low heat about 5 minutes, or until heated through.
Serves 5-6 people.
[[Category:Meat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|Pork and Lima Skillet]] [[Category:Pork recipes|Pork recipes]] [[Category:Ham recipes|Ham recipes]] [[Category:Basil recipes|Pork and Lima Skillet]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Russia|Russia]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
{{recipesummary | Category = Soup recipes | Servings = about 6 | Time = 75 minutes | Rating = 2 <!--| Energy = --> | Image = [[Image:Borscht.jpg|300px]] }}
'''Borscht''', or '''borsch''' is a hearty Russian [[Cookbook:Vegetables|vegetable]] [[Cookbook:Soup|soup]]. Recipes of borscht vary, but beetroot is an essential ingredient.
==Ingredients== ===Soup=== *1½ cups thinly sliced [[Cookbook:Potato|Potato]]es (about 3 small potatoes) *1 cup thinly sliced [[Cookbook:Beet|Beet]]s. *4 cups water *1-2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Butter|Butter]] *1½ cups chopped [[Cookbook:Onion|Onion]] (about ⅓ of a large onion) *1½ teaspoons [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] *1 stalk [[Cookbook:Celery|Celery]], chopped *1 medium [[Cookbook:Carrot|Carrot]], chopped *3 to 4 cups shredded [[Cookbook:Cabbage|Cabbage]] (about ⅓ of a large cabbage) *a little fresh ground [[Cookbook:Black pepper|Black pepper]] *1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Dill|Dill]] weed *1 to 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Cider vinegar|Cider vinegar]] *1 to 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Brown sugar|Brown sugar]] or [[Cookbook:Honey|Honey]] *1 cup [[Cookbook:Tomato|Tomato]] purée or ¼ to ½ cup tomato paste
===Garnish=== *[[Cookbook:Sour cream|Sour cream]] or [[Cookbook:Yogurt|Yogurt]] *Dill weed
==Procedure== #Place the potatoes, beets, and water in a medium-sized [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]]. Cover and cook over medium heat until tender (20-30 minutes). While that is cooking, do steps 2-3. #Melt the butter in a [[Cookbook:Dutch oven|Dutch oven]]/[[Cookbook:Stock pot|soup pot]]. Add the onion and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the onions are translucent (8 to 10 minutes). #Add the celery, carrots, cabbage, and two cups of the water in which the potatoes and beets are cooking. Cover and cook over medium heat until the vegetables are tender (8 to 10 minutes). #Add the remaining soup ingredients (including the potatoes, beets, and the rest of the water in which they are cooking). Cover and simmer for at least 15 more minutes. Correct the seasonings. If it is too thin, let it simmer uncovered, and maybe add a ''little'' more tomato paste. #Serve hot, topped with sour cream or yoghurt and sprinkled with dill. (If desired the sour cream or yoghurt can be served with the soup and used as a condiment to taste.)
Serves about 6.
==Notes, tips, and variations== *Sour environment is essential for the authentic taste and preservation of the red color, but excessive amount of [[Wikipedia:acetic acid|acetic acid]] from the vinegar (esp. distilled) causes sharp restaurant smell and taste. The cider vinegar can be replaced with sauerkraut or extra tomatoes. *[[Cookbook:Ukrainian Cabbage Soup (Kapusniak)|Ukrainian Cabbage Soup (Kapusniak)]] *[[Cookbook:Montreal Russian Borscht|Montreal Russian Borscht]]
[[Category:Soup recipes|Borscht]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Borscht]] [[Category:Russian recipes|Borscht]] [[Category:Borscht recipes|Borscht]] [[Category:Beet recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cabbage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meat Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Midwestern cuisine|Midwestern cuisine]]
==Ingredients== *1 1/2 pounds of [[Cookbook:Ground Beef|ground beef]] *1 cup Ritz [[Cookbook:Cracker|crackers]] *2 beaten [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] *8 ounces Del Monte [[Cookbook:Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] *1/2 cup [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] *1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *1/4 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]]
==Procedure== #Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. #Pound the Ritz crackers until fine like [[Cookbook:Bread Crumbs|bread crumbs]]. #Mince the onion finely. #In a separate bowl, add the meat and the other ingredients and mix with your hands until the ingredients are all mixed together and the mixture is smooth. #Grease a glass baking pan with vegetable [[Cookbook:Shortening|shortening]]. #Put the meat mixture in the pan and shape like a [[American football|football]]. #Bake in the oven for 1 hour. #Take out the meat loaf and serve warm.
[[Category:Beef recipes|Meatloaf III]] [[Category:Midwestern recipes|Meatloaf III]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|5|50 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meat Recipes]]
==Ingredients== *1 can cream of [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] soup *1 can cream of [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushroom]] soup *1 can mixed [[Cookbook:Vegetable|vegetables]] *1 can white chunk chicken *2 frozen [[Cookbook:Pie|pie]] [[Cookbook:Pie Crust|crusts]]
==Procedure== #Mix soup, vegetables, and chicken in a large bowl. #Pour mixture into one of the pie crusts #Cover with other pie crust and press around edges to seal. #Cut several small slits in top of pie. #Bake at 375 °F for 30-40 minutes or until golden brown.
[[Category:American recipes|Chicken Pot Pie I]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|Chicken Pot Pie I]] [[Category:Pot Pie recipes|Chicken Pot Pie I]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meat Recipes]]
==Ingredients== *1 package [[Cookbook:Pie Crust|pie crust]]s *1/3 cup [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] (or [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]]) *1/3 cup chopped [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] *1/3 cup all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *1/4 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] *1 1/2 cups [[Cookbook:Chicken Broth|chicken broth]] *2/3 cup [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] *3 cups [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]], cooked *1 cup frozen [[Cookbook:Corn|corn]], thawed *1 cup frozen [[Cookbook:Pea|pea]]s, thawed
==Procedure== #Heat oven to 425°[[Cookbook:Fahrenheit|F]]. #Prepare pie crusts as directed on package for two-crust pie using 9-inch pie pan. #In a medium saucepan, melt margarine over medium heat. #Add onion; cook 2 minutes or until tender. #Stir in flour, salt, and pepper until well-blended. #Gradually stir in broth and milk; cook, stirring constantly, until bubbly and thickened. #Add chicken, corn, and peas; remove from heat. #Spoon chicken mixture into crust-lined pan. #Top with second crust and flute; cut slits in several places. #Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until crust is golden-brown. #Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
[[Category:American recipes|Chicken Pot Pie II]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|Chicken Pot Pie II]] [[Category:Pot Pie recipes|Chicken Pot Pie II]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|6-8|prep: 45 minutes
baking: ~35 minutes|3|Image=[[Image:Lemon Meringue Pie 1.jpg|300 px]]}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|US Cuisine]] This is the traditional old-fashioned [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemon]] [[Cookbook:Meringue|meringue]] [[w:Pie|pie]] with a gel-like filling. If you want a sticky filling, use the [[Cookbook:British Lemon Meringue Pie|the other]] recipe instead. ==Ingredients== ===Pie filling=== *1½ (360ml) cups cold water *1 cup (240g) white granulated [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *2 tablespoons all purpose flour *3 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Cornstarch|cornstarch]] *¼ teaspoon salt *½ cup (120ml) [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] (from about 2 [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemons]] or bottled lemon juice) *1 tablespoon lemon [[Cookbook:Zest|zest]] (from about 2 lemons) *2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] *4 egg yolks, beaten ===Meringue=== *4 egg whites *6 tablespoons white granulated sugar *¼ tsp cream of tartar ==Procedure== ===Pie Crust=== #Prepare [[Cookbook:Grandma's Pie Crust|Grandma's Pie Crust]]. ===Pie filling=== #In a [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]] [[Cookbook:Whisk|whisk]] together water, sugar, flour, cornstarch, salt, lemon juice and lemon zest. Make sure any flour or cornstarch lumps are stirred until they dissolve. #Cook over medium heat until mixture starts to [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]]. Stir constantly. #Add butter, stir until melted. #Beat egg yolks in a small bowl. Add about ½ cup (120g) of hot lemon mixture into eggs and stir well. This tempers the egg yolks so they won't [[Cookbook:Scrambled Eggs|scramble]] when added to the simmering lemon mixture. #Pour tempered egg mixture into pan of simmering lemon mixture. Stir until well mixed. #Continue simmering lemon filling about 2 minutes until it thickens, stirring constantly. #Pour into cooked pie shell and allow to cool. ===Meringue=== #Place 4 egg whites in [[Cookbook:Mixer|mixer]] and beat at high speed until they start to foam. #While continuing to beat, add sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time. Beat about 30-seconds between spoonfuls of sugar. #Continue to beat egg whites until they can form stiff peaks. #Spread meringue over pie, starting on lemon pie filling, using rubber [[Cookbook:Spatula|spatula]]. Spread over edges of crust, completely sealing in the lemon pie filling. #To form peaks in meringue, using a rubber spatula, touch flat side of spatula on meringue and pull away. Repeat over entire surface of meringue. #Place pie in [[Cookbook:Oven Temperatures|350°F]] (180°C) oven for 15 minutes until high points of meringue are lightly browned. #Serve at room temperature or chilled. ==Warnings== * The pie filling is quite hot when pouring it into pie shell. * Keep this pie refrigerated. [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pie recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Lemon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Meat recipes|4|prep ½ hour
bake 1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meat Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Midwestern cuisine|Midwestern cuisine]] ==Ingredients== * 4 medium [[Cookbook:Potato|potato]]es, sliced * 1 [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], sliced * ½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] [[Cookbook:Ground Beef|ground beef]] * ½ pound bulk [[Cookbook:Sausage|sausage]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]], [[Cookbook:Beat|beat]]en * 6 soda crackers, [[Cookbook:Crumble|crumble]]d * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * ~1 can [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar cheese]] [[Cookbook:Soup|soup]] Makes 1 bread pan of meat loaf ==Procedure== # Preheat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]] # Place sliced potatoes in baking dish. # Place sliced onion over potatoes in baking dish. # Combine all ingredients except cheddar cheese soup, and mix well. # Press into baking dish, forming an indentation in the middle. # Pour cheddar cheese soup in indentation. # Bake 1 hour at [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]] # Stand 5 minutes before serving. ==Tips== ''Serving suggestion:'' Cut vertically with metal spatula, which will yield potato, onion, meat, and cheese in every serving.
''Comment:'' The kids always whined, because it had onions in it. {{recipesummary|Casserole recipes|12|prep 10 minutes
bake 25|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Midwestern cuisine|Midwestern cuisine]] ==Ingredients== * 2 cans cream of mushroom [[Cookbook:Soup|soup]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 8 cups cooked cut [[Cookbook:Green Beans|green beans]] * 2⅔ cups French fried onions ==Procedure== # Preheat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. # Stir soup, milk, soy sauce, pepper, beans, and 1⅓ cups onions in a 3-quart casserole. # Bake at [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]] for 25 minutes or until hot. # Top with remaining onions. Makes 12 servings. ==Tips== * Stir in ½ cup chopped [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|red pepper]] with the soup. * Stir in ½ cup shredded [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar cheese]] with the soup, and omit the soy sauce. [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Green Bean Casserole]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|Green Bean Casserole]] [[Category:Casserole recipes|Green Bean Casserole]] [[Category:American recipes|Green Bean Casserole]] [[Category:Midwestern recipes|Green Bean Casserole]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Midwestern cuisine|Midwestern cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Casserole recipes|4|45 minutes|2|Image=[[Image:Green bean casserole.jpg|300px]]}}
'''Green bean casserole''' was invented in 1955 by the Campbell Soup Company. It has since become a Thanksgiving favorite in the United States.
There are many basic recipes for green bean casserole. Here is one example:
==Ingredients== *1 can (approx. 14.5 ounces) French-style [[Cookbook:Green Bean|green beans]], drained *1 can or jar (approx. 15 ounces) small whole [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], drained *2 tablespoons diced drained [[Cookbook:Pimento|pimiento]] *1 can (10¾ ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup
===Topping=== *¼ cup fine [[Cookbook:Bread Crumb|bread crumbs]] *¼ cup grated [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|Parmesan cheese]]
==Procedure== # In a lightly buttered 1½-quart casserole, combine green beans, onions, diced pimiento, and mushroom soup. # Combine topping ingredients; sprinkle over the top of the casserole. # Bake, uncovered, at 350°F (175°C) for 25 to 30 minutes.
Serves 4.
==Alternative recipe==
===Ingredients===
* 8 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] cooked [[Cookbook:Green Bean|green beans]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 2⅔ cups (canned) French fried [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], divided into 2 equal portions * ¼ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Pepper|ground black pepper]] * 2 10¾-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] cans cream of [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushroom]] [[Cookbook:Soup|soup]] * 2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]]
===Procedure===
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|350°F]] (175°C). # Stir beans, milk, ½ of onions, pepper, soup, and soy sauce in a 3-quart casserole. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] until hot, about 25 minutes. # Sprinkle top with rest of onions. # Bake another 5 minutes.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Cream of mushroom soup may be regular or reduced sodium. * If you love [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]], substitute ½ cup shredded cheese for the soy sauce. * ½ cup of chopped [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|red bell peppers]] will make it very colorful.
[[Category:Midwestern recipes]] [[Category:Bean recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]] [[Category:Casserole recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Breakfast recipes|3 4-section waffles|prep 10 minutes
5 minutes per waffle|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast Waffle Recipe]] '''Favorite Waffles''' ==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * 1½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]]s [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Vegetable Oil|vegetable oil]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Eggs|eggs]], [[Cookbook:Separate|separated]] * 1¾ cups [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] ==Procedure== # Lightly brush grids with oil, close waffle iron, and heat on "waffle." # In small bowl, [[Cookbook:Beat|beat]] egg whites until stiff (but not dry) and set aside. # In large bowl, beat egg yolks until thick and lemon-colored. # Continue beating, adding milk and oil. # Add dry ingredients, beat until smooth, and fold in egg whites. # Pour 1 cup of batter on heated grid, close unit and bake until light goes out. This will take about 5 minutes. Makes 3 4-section waffles. ==Variation== * Spread ¾ cup batter, then quickly cover surface of batter with thinly sliced apples. Close cover and cook as usual. {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]] [[Image:CookbookPancake.jpg|right|thumb|200px|3 pancakes with real [[Cookbook:Maple_Syrup|maple syrup]]]] These pancakes make a good [[Cookbook:Breakfast|breakfast]] for a family. They go well with real [[Cookbook:Maple Syrup|maple syrup]]. They are healthly too (as long as you don't over do the syrup) since whole wheat flour contributes to your fiber intake.
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Whole Wheat|whole wheat]] [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] common granulated [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * 1/4 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] * additional oil for [[Cookbook:Frying|frying]]
==Procedure==
#Oil a frying pan. #Mix the dry ingredients in one bowl. #In another bowl, scramble the egg, then add the other wet ingredients. This includes the 2 tablespoons of oil. #Mix the dry and wet ingredients together, well enough to eliminate dry spots but no more. #Heat the frying pan to medium temperature. The pan is hot enough when a drop of water dances around rather than simply boiling away. #Pour a pancake, about 4 inches in diameter using about a 1/4 cup of batter. (see below for making large and very large ones in a regular frying pan) #The pancake will bubble. When the bubbling settles down and the edges are slightly dry, flip the pancake. #When the pancake looks done, remove it and start another one.
==Toppings== Traditionally, pancakes are topped with butter and maple syrup. Other toppings can include strawberries, applesauce, cinnamon, or sugar.
==Variations==
The pancakes will come out thinner if you overmix them, let the batter sit for a long time, use white flour instead of wheat, or increase the liquid. Doing the opposite will result in thick pancakes. Pouring the batter with a spiral motion will be needed to prevent very large pancakes from being too thick in the middle. If using white flour, the milk should be reduced to 1/2 cup or 3/4 cup.
Large pancakes normally require a professional flat cooktop (no pan) and a very large turner. You can produce large pancakes one at a time in a normal small frying pan though, by air flipping. This is also known as the Boy Scout method, because it's a rather macho way to flip your pancakes. You should be using a non-stick pan. Loosen the pancake with a normal turner, so that the pancake slides freely. Put the turner down. Rapidly move the pan away from you, then up, then back just a bit toward you, and then very rapidly downward. Catch the pancake in the pan. You have to be brave in doing this; any hesitation will cause you to lose the pancake.
Filled pancakes can be made. Soon after pouring the pancake, take a spoonful of something (chocolate sauce, chocolate chips, wild (small) [[Cookbook:Blueberry|blueberries]], maple syrup, or [[Cookbook:Jam|jam]]) and put it in the middle. Cover the exposed filling with more batter. (direct contact between the filling and pan can overheat it and cause it to pop)
By increasing the sugar to 1/3 cup, you can make pancakes that don't require a sweetened topping.
You can also use cheese to cover one side of the pancake. You can do this right after pouring the batter, or use cheese as a topping when it's done. When adding them after pouring the batter you must be careful flipping the pancake, since the cheese will get stuck if you don't use a non-stick pan.
[[Category:Bread recipes|Whole-Wheat Pancakes]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes|Whole-Wheat Pancakes]] [[Category:Pancake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Flatbread recipes|3|15 minutes|2|[[Image:Banana_on_pancake.jpg|300px|Pancakes]]}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Flatbread|Flatbread]]
'''Pancakes''' are a type of [[Cookbook:Flatbread|flatbread]] prepared from a [[Cookbook:Batter|batter]] that is baked on a hot griddle or frying pan. They exist in several variations in many different local [[Cookbook:Cuisine|cuisine]]s. Most pancakes are [[Cookbook:Quick Bread|quick bread]]s, although some are also made using a [[Cookbook:Yeast|yeast]]-raised or fermented batter. Here are some basic pancake recipes.
==Pancakes from Scratch== ===Ingredients=== *1 cup all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] (white, whole grain or 1:1 mix of white and whole grain) *1½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] *1 pinch [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *1 cup [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] (substitute buttermilk or 1:1 mix of milk and buttermilk) *3 [[Cookbook:Eggs|eggs]], [[Cookbook:Separate|separated]]
===Procedure=== #In large bowl, [[Cookbook:Mix|mix]] dry ingredients together until well-blended. #Add milk and [[Cookbook:Mix Well|mix well]] until smooth. #[[Cookbook:Separate|Separate]] eggs, placing the whites in a medium bowl and the yolks in the batter. [[Cookbook:Mix Well|Mix well]]. #[[Cookbook:Beat|Beat]] whites until stiff and then [[Cookbook:Fold|fold]] into batter gently (skip this step for heavier pancakes or if 1 cup buttermilk is substituted for milk). #Pour ladlefulls of the mixture into a non-stick pan, one at a time. #Cook until the edges are dry and bubbles appear on surface. Turn; cook until golden. Serves 12 to 14 pancakes.
===Notes, tips, and variations=== # Serve with butter, maple syrup, fruit, jam or cheese. # Pancakes do not store well. # Use [[Cookbook:Buttermilk|buttermilk]] instead of milk, or wholegrain flours instead of white. This will change the consistency of the final product (i.e. whole grain flours generally lead to a denser heavier pancake, so try mixing white and wheat in various proportions as suggested above to get the feel you want). # Add sliced fruit such as [[Cookbook:Banana|banana]] and [[Cookbook:Apple|apple]], or broken crispy bacon to the batter after pouring into the skillet and before flipping.
==Banana-Spirulina Pancakes (Vegan)== This is a recipe for '''Banana-Spirulina Pancakes''' that makes about 5-6 large pancakes (serves two people well).
===Materials===
*1¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Flour|Flour]] (check that label!) *2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|Sugar]] *2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Baking powder|Baking powder]] *½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] *About 1 teaspoon powdered [[Cookbook:Spirulina|Spirulina]] (optional, but recommended) *2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|Vegetable oil]] *1¼ cup [[Cookbook:Rice milk|Rice milk]] ([[Cookbook:Soy milk|soy]] might also work) *1 thinly sliced [[Cookbook:Banana|Banana]] (if you freeze the banana first, you can get very thin slices) *non-stick [[Cookbook:skillet|skillet]], [[Cookbook:sauté pan|sauté pan]], or [[Cookbook:griddle|griddle]] *[[Cookbook:Spatula|Spatula]] *[[Cookbook:Maple syrup|Maple syrup]] *non-stick spray
===Steps=== Sift and mix flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and spirulina in a big bowl. # In a separate bowl, mix oil and milk. # Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. # Dump in the liquid ingredients and lightly mix the two together. # Do not whisk, beat, or otherwise try to mash out all of the batter lumps. You will end up with tough, flat, and ugly pancakes. Keep a light hand, and your pancakes will remember by yielding fluffy results. # Gently toss in the bananas and stir them just to coat in the batter. # Heat up the non-stick pan and spray evenly with oil. # Using a 1/3 cup measure as a scoop, dip into the batter and pour evenly into the [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]]. Watch your heat carefully, you want it on medium-hot (don't burn them). # When bubbles begin to form in the middle of the pancake, and the edges look somewhat set, give it another spray of oil. # Immediately, flip over. # Cook for another minute or so, then remove the pancake, and put it in the toaster oven on warm (Or find some way of keeping it warm while you finish off the batter). # Spray the pan again, and repeat until the batter is all gone.
===Serving Tips===
A light maple syrup is very good. Some prefer this without anything.

{{recipesummary|Bread recipes|1 pound|Prep ½ hour
Rise 1 hour
Bake ½ hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]] ==Ingredients== * 1¼ [[Cookbook:cup|cup]]s warm [[Cookbook:water|water]] * 2 packages dry [[Cookbook:Yeast|yeast]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 1 tablespoon melted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 1½ [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 3½ cups [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] slivered [[Cookbook:Pepperoni|pepperoni]] * ½ cup shredded [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]] ==Procedure== # Stir yeast and sugar into warm water. Let stand until bubbly. # Add the salt and about half the flour so the dough can be handled. # Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, adding flour only if necessary. # Cover the ball of dough and let sit 10-15 minutes. # Roll into 14x16-inch rectangle. # Spread with slivered pepperoni, cheese, and herbs of your choice. # Sprinkle liberally with fresh grated black pepper. # Roll as you would a jellyroll, sealing edge by [[Cookbook:Pinch|pinching]]. Form the roll into a circle. '''[[Cookbook:Dutch Oven|Dutch oven]]''' # Put in 14-inch Dutch oven. # Let rise. # Place 11 charcoal briquettes on bottom and 17 on top. # Time/temperature: see "Notes" below. # Brush with melted butter. '''Conventional oven''' # Place in a well-greased round pan. A cast iron fry pan works well. # Let rise for one hour. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] at [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|375°F]] for one hour. # Brush with melted butter. ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * Rising bread requires warmth. Cool or dry weather inhibits the process. When outside temperatures are too cool for breads to rise, place 3-4 hot coals on top of the oven with bread inside. If it's windy, provide a windbreak. * Start baking breads slightly before reaching the "double" stage. As the oven heats, the dough continues to rise. Have the bottom heat ready to go when the bread is. Add top heat immediately. When bread is ⅔ baked, take off bottom heat. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|Bread, Deli Roll]] [[Category:American recipes|Bread, Deli Roll]] [[Category:Camping recipes|Bread, Deli Roll]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Bread, Deli Roll]] [[Category:Bread recipes|Bread, Deli Roll]]

{{recipesummary|Bread recipes|1 pound|Prep 15 minutes
Rise 2 hours
Bake ¾-1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]] ==Ingredients== * 2 [[Cookbook:cup|cup]]s [[Cookbook:Boil|boiling]] [[Cookbook:water|water]] * 1 cup rolled oats * ⅛ cup vegetable [[Cookbook:Shortening|shortening]] * ½ cup light [[Cookbook:Molasses|molasses]] or [[Cookbook:Honey|honey]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 2 packages active dry [[Cookbook:Yeast|yeast]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]], lightly beaten * 6½ cups [[Cookbook:Whole Wheat|whole wheat]] [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] ==Procedure== # [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] two 8-inch [[Cookbook:Dutch Oven|Dutch ovens]] # Combine boiling water, oats, shortening, and molasses. # Add salt, cool to lukewarm. # Add yeast and mix well. # Blend in eggs. # Gradually add flour, mixing until dough is well blended. # Place dough in greased Dutch oven; let rise until double (''about two hours''). '''Dutch oven''' # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] in Dutch oven for 45 minutes ([[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]). Place 5 briquettes on bottom and 11 on top. '''Conventional Oven''' # Place in a well-greased round pan. # Let rise until doubled. # Bake in conventional oven for one hour. (350°F) ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * Rising bread requires warmth. Cool or dry weather inhibits the process. When outside temperatures are too cool for breads to rise, place 3-4 hot coals on top of the oven with bread inside. If it's windy, provide a windbreak. * Start baking breads slightly before reaching the "double" stage. As the oven heats, the dough continues to rise. Have the bottom heat ready to go when the bread is. Add top heat immediately. When bread is ⅔ baked, take off bottom heat.
