revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United Kingdom|Cuisine of the UK]]
'''Faggots''' are traditional [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United Kingdom|English]] meatballs, made from meat off-cuts and [[Cookbook:Organ Meat|offal]], usually [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]].
== Ingredients == * 500g (1 lb) [[Cookbook:Liver|pig's liver]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * 100g (4 oz) white [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]] or [[Cookbook:Bread Crumb|breadcrumbs]] * 50g (2 oz) shredded [[Cookbook:Suet|suet]] * 1 tsp chopped [[Cookbook:Sage|sage]] (or ½ tsp dried sage) * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste
== Procedure == # Mince the liver and onions together into a mixing bowl. # Add the breadcrumbs, suet, and sage, and season with salt and pepper according to taste. Ensure that enough breadcrumbs are added such that the mixture can be shaped. # Shape the mixture into balls and place onto a greased oven tin. # Bake in an oven for approximately 30 minutes.
=== Optional === The juices in the tin can be combined with boiling water and flour to make gravy to accompany the faggots.
{{wikipediapar||Faggot (food)}}
[[Category:English recipes]] [[Category:Welsh recipes]] [[Category:Liver recipes]]

page.title: Cookbook:Black Bean Soup with Tomato-Tomatillo Salsa

revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|6|2-3 hours|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Mexico|Mexican cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:beans|beans]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
Black Bean Soup with Tomato-Tomatillo Salsa
==Ingredients==
Soup: * 1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] dried [[Cookbook:Black Beans|black beans]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Onion|large onions]], [[Cookbook:Dice|finely diced]] * 4 to 6 [[Cookbook:Garlic|cloves garlic]], minced * 6 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Water|cold water]] * 1 cup peeled, seeded and chopped [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]] (fresh or canned) * Small sprig fresh or dried epazote (optional) * 1 tablespoon finely chopped canned chipotle chile (or ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cayenne Pepper|cayenne pepper]], more to taste) * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Cumin|ground cumin seed]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Coriander|ground coriander]] * 2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Kosher|kosher]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
Salsa: * 1 large tomato, finely diced * 3 medium tomatillos, husks removed and finely diced * 1 small red onion, very finely diced * 1 serranos or [[Cookbook:Jalapeño|jalopeño]] chile, very finely diced * ¼ cup roughly chopped fresh [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro leaves]] * Salt, to taste * Crème fraîche or [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]], for [[Cookbook:Garnish|garnish]]
==Directions==
Soup: # Pick over the beans. Soak, if desired and drain. # In a deep, heavy-based pot, heat oil over medium heat. # Add onions and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. # Add beans, garlic and water. # Bring to a [[Cookbook:Boil|boil]], skimming any foam that rises to the surface. # Reduce to a [[Cookbook:simmer|simmer]] and when the beans are soft, after about 1 hour, add tomato, epazote, chipotle chile, cumin, coriander and salt. # Cook until the beans start to break down and broth begins to thicken. # Taste for seasoning; add salt and pepper if needed.
Salsa: # In a small bowl, combine tomato, tomatillo, onion, jalapeno and cilantro. # Taste for seasoning and add salt as needed.
Together: # Ladle soup into individual serving bowls. # Garnish each with a spoonful of Crème fraîche and salsa.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* If you're serving this soup immediately, you can thicken it by [[Cookbook:Puree|pureeing]] a cup or two of the beans in a [[Cookbook:Blender|blender]] or [[Cookbook:Food Processor|food processor]] and then recombining them with the rest of the soup. If refrigerated overnight, the soup will thicken on its own. * The salsa will taste best if assembled no more than an hour before serving. * Epazote is an herb that looks like a weed and is regularly used in Mexican cooking. If you can't find it, use an equal amount of cilantro. * Tomatillos look like rock hard tomatoes with papery skin. Look for them canned in the Hispanic section of your market, if you can't find fresh. They will be perfectly acceptable. * Crème fraîche is similar to sour cream, but richer. Look for it in the fancy cheese section.
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Mexican recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bean recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: New page: {{recipesummary|Soup recipes|12|1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|S...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|12|1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
Mushroom Soup
==Ingredients==
* ½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] (2 sticks) [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], divided * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]], divided * 12 cups [[Cookbook:Stock|beef stock]] * 6 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive oil]] * 4 cups sliced [[Cookbook:Mushroom|portobello mushrooms]] * 4 cups sliced [[Cookbook:Mushroom|shiitakes]] * 4 cups [[Cookbook:Mushroom|button mushrooms]], sliced if large * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Wine|sherry]]
==Directions==
# In a large pot over medium heat, melt one stick of the butter. # Add ½ cup of the flour, stirring constantly, to form a [[Cookbook:Roux|roux]]. # Cook, continuing to stir constantly, until roux takes on a pale blond color, about 5 minutes. # Slowly stir in the beef stock. # Bring to a boil, stirring frequently. # Reduce heat to a simmer. # In a large [[Cookbook:saucepan|saucepan]] over medium-high heat, melt the remaining stick of butter with the olive oil. # Add the portobellos, shiitakes and button mushrooms and [[Cookbook:Sauté|sauté]] until mushrooms are moist and tender, 5 to 10 minutes. # Remove pan from heat and dust mushrooms with the remaining ½ cup of flour, stirring gently to incorporate flour. # Combine mushrooms and beef stock in the large pot. # Stir in the sherry. # Cook, stirring occasionally, until flavors are melded and soup thickened slightly, about 10 minutes. # Serve hot.
[[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Mushroom recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Bread recipes|12|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]]
Quick Oat Bread
==Ingredients==
* 1⅓ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Flour|white whole wheat flour]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 2¼ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * 1¼ teaspoons [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Oats|quick-cooking (not instant) oats]] * 1 cup minus 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] plain [[Cookbook:Yogurt|low-fat yogurt]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]], [[Cookbook:Beat|beaten]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Canola Oil|canola oil]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Honey|honey]] * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Milk|low-fat milk]]
==Directions==
# Preheat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|375°F]]. # Butter a 9-by-5 loaf pan; set aside. # In a large mixing bowl, combine white whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda; set aside. # In a medium bowl, combine oats, yogurt, egg, oil and honey, then stir in milk until combined. # Pour oat mixture over flour mixture and gently stir until just combined and flour is no longer visible. # Scrape batter into prepared pan and smooth the top. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] 40 to 50 minutes, until a wood pick tests clean. # During the last few minutes of baking, tent with foil to prevent overbrowning if needed. # Let bread stand in the pan 15 minutes, then turn out onto a cooling rack to cool. # Serve slightly warm.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* One manufacturer of white whole wheat flour is King Arthur brand. * To avoid compacting the flour while measuring it, spoon the flour into the measuring cup instead of digging it down into the flour. Then run a flat knife over the top edge of the cup to scrape off the excess.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|Oat Bread, Quick]] [[Category:American recipes|Oat Bread, Quick]] [[Category:Camping recipes|Oat Bread, Quick]] [[Category:Oat recipes|Bread, Quick Oat]] [[Category:Egg recipes|Oat Bread, Quick]] [[Category:Bread recipes|Oat Bread, Quick]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Oat Bread, Quick]]

{{recipesummary|Seafood recipes|4|½ hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]]
Bacon-Wrapped Scallops
==Ingredients==
* ½ [[Cookbook:Gallon|gallon]] [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] for [[Cookbook:Fry|frying]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Teriyaki|teriyaki]] glaze * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]] * 1 pound of [[Cookbook:Scallops|scallops]] (20- to 30-count)
==Directions==
# Heat oil in a deep fryer or other pot to 350 degrees, making sure that the pot is large enough that the oil doesn't fill it more than halfway. # Combine teriyaki glaze, soy sauce and sugar in a medium bowl. Set aside. # Cut bacon strips in half lengthwise. # Wrap each scallop with one of these half strips of bacon, and secure by skewering with a wooden toothpick. # Working in batches so as not to crowd the fryer, fry the scallops until golden brown, about 4 minutes. # Remove from oil, drain briefly and toss in the soy-teriyaki sauce. # Serve immediately.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Do not eat toothpick.
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Scallop recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Meat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bacon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Asian recipes|4|½ hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:beans|beans]] | [[Cookbook:Rice|Rice]]
Black Bean Stir-Fry
==Ingredients==
* 3 [[Cookbook:Garlic|cloves garlic]], minced * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] minced [[Cookbook:Ginger|fresh ginger root]] * 1 or 2 [[Cookbook:Chile|fresh hot chiles]], minced (or ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|hot red pepper flakes]]) * 4 [[Cookbook:Scallions|scallions]], separated: white part minced, green part cut on the diagonal in ½-inch pieces * 3 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Black Beans|Chinese black beans]] * ¼ to ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Stock|stock]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] * 2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Sesame Oil|sesame oil]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cornstarch|cornstarch]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Wine|rice wine]] or [[Cookbook:Wine|sherry]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] [[Cookbook:Shellfish|shellfish]] ([[Cookbook:Clam|clams]], [[Cookbook:Mussel|mussels]], [[Cookbook:Crab|crabs]], and/or [[Cookbook:Lobster|lobster]]) or 1 pound of [[Cookbook:shrimp|shrimp]], [[Cookbook:Fish|fish]], [[Cookbook:Poultry|poultry]], or [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]] * 1½ tablespoons [[Cookbook:Canola Oil|canola oil]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Onion|onion cubes]] * 1 Red [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|bell pepper]] or ½ red and ½ [[Cookbook:Green Pepper|green peppers]], cut in cubes * 2 to 3 cups, thinly sliced [[Cookbook:Vegetable|vegetables]] ([[Cookbook:Cabbage|cabbage]], [[Cookbook:Snow Peas|snow peas]], and/or [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrots]] * [[Cookbook:Steam|Steamed]] [[Cookbook:Rice|white rice]], optional
==Directions==
# In small bowl, combine garlic, ginger root, chiles, scallion whites, and black beans. # In another small bowl, combine ¼ cup stock, soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil, and stir until sugar dissolves. # In a third small bowl, dissolve cornstarch in wine or sherry. # Scrub clams, if using, cut shellfish into 1-inch pieces or thinly slice poultry or meat. # Just before serving, heat a [[Cookbook:Wok|wok]] over high heat. # Swirl in canola oil. # [[Cookbook:Stir-Fry|Stir-Fry]] onion and bell pepper for a minute then add garlic and bean mixture and cook for 15 seconds, or until fragrant but not brown. # Add seafood and stir-fry for 1 minute. # Add stock-based sauce and cook for 2 to 5 minutes, or until seafood is cooked; if necessary to prevent mixture from sticking to pan, add remaining stock. (If steaming clams, tightly cover wok.) # Stir cornstarch mixture and add to stir-fry along with scallion greens and sliced vegetables. # Bring sauce to a [[Cookbook:Boil|boil]]. # Serve immediately along with white rice if desired.
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Seafood recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bean recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rice recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Stir fry recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Breakfast recipes|6 to 8|3 hours altogether|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast|Breakfast Cuisine]]
Sausage-Egg Breakfast Dish
==Ingredients==
* 1 (16-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]]) package of [[Cookbook:Sage|sage]]-flavored [[Cookbook:Sausage|sausage]] * [[Cookbook:Pinch|Pinch]] of [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 6 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 1½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 4 cups [[Cookbook:Cube|cubed]] stale [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]] * 4 ounces shredded [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar cheese]]
==Directions==
# Brown sausage and sprinkle with pepper. # Drain off excess fat. # Let sausage cool. # [[Cookbook:Beat|Beat]] eggs and add milk. # Fold in cubes of stale bread, cheese, and cooled sausage. # Pour into and 8 by 8 inch baking dish coated with [[Cookbook:Cooking Spray|cooking spray]]. # Refrigerate for at least an hour (or freeze for later). # Preheat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|325°F]]. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] for 1 hour. # Cool and cut into squares.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Casserole recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Midwestern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
[[Category:Meat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sausage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegan cuisine|Vegan Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast|Breakfast]]
It's now easy to find oat bran in the bulk section of the supermarket, but it's often hard to find the right ratios of bran, water and salt online. This is an original recipe.
== Ingredients ==
* 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbsp]] [[Cookbook:oat bran|oat bran]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:water|water]] * 1/8 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] [[Cookbook:salt|salt]]
== Procedure == #Boil water #Add oat bran and salt #Reduce heat and cook for 4-6 minutes
== Notes, Tips, and Variations ==
* Maple syrup and sliced bananas are great additions to oat bran cereal.
[[Category:Oat recipes|Cereal]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes|Cereal]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Cereal]]

{{recipesummary|Bread recipes|1½ pound loaf|A day|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]]
Famous No-Knead Bread
*This recipe has circled the Internet faster than an African get-rich-quick scam, since it appeared in the ''New York Times'' in November, 2006, and has been translated into German and Togo. *The original recipe came from Jim Lahey, owner of Sullivan Street Bakery in Manhattan. It lets time, instead of you, do the work. Simply stir together the ingredients, and let the mixture sit for 18 hours. After brief handling, it sits for 2 to 3 hours more, then bakes in a covered cast-iron pot in a 450 degree oven. *It should result in a round, rustic loaf, with a chewy crust and an interior with irregularly shaped holes, not fine-textured, but similar to an Italian ciabatta. It's tasty and makes great crostini.
==Ingredients==
* 3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] all-purpose or bread [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Yeast|yeast]] * 2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 5/8 cups warm tap [[Cookbook:Water|water]]
==Directions==
# In a large bowl combine flour, yeast, and salt. # Add water and stir until blended. ''The dough will be shaggy and sticky.'' # Cover bowl with plastic wrap. # Let dough rest at least 12 hours, preferably 18 hours, at warm room temperature, about 70 degrees F. # When the surface is dotted with bubbles, lightly flour a work surface or silicone mat and place dough on it. # Sprinkle it with a little more flour, and fold it over on itself once or twice. # Cover loosely with plastic wrap and let rest 15 minutes. # Using just enough flour to keep dough from sticking to the work surface and your fingers, gently and quickly shape the dough into a ball. # Generously coat a lint-free linen towel with flour. ''Not a terrycloth towel.'' # Put the dough seam side down on the towel and dust with more flour. # Cover with another lint-free linen towel and let rise for 2 to 3 hours. ''Dough will be more than double in size and will not readily spring back when poked with a finger.'' # At least half an hour before baking, place a 3 to 4 quart heavy covered pot (cast iron, enamel, Pyrex, or ceramic) in the oven and preheat to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|450°F]]. # When the dough is ready, carefully remove the pot from the oven. # Slide your hand under the towel and turn the dough over into the pot. seam side up. ''It may look like a mess, but that's okay.'' # Shake the pan once or twice if the dough is unevenly distributed; it will straighten out as it bakes. # Cover with lid and bake 30 minutes. # Remove the lid and bake 15 to 30 minutes more, until the loaf is beautifully browned. # Remove the loaf from the pot and cool on a rack.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* If you can't find a pot, look in a neighborhood hardware store. * You can substitute up to 50% whole-wheat flour, but much more and the texture will suffer. * Add herbs or other seasoning when initially mixing the dough. * Use wheat bran or corn meal to coat the towels, if desired. * If the pot has handles, remove them if they are not heat-resistant. * Use sturdy oven mitts. * Before removing the heated pot from the oven, place 2 or 3 cooling racks on the counter. * Do not place the superheated pot on the counter or anything else you don't want to scorch.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|No-Knead Bread, Famous]] [[Category:American recipes|No-Knead Bread, Famous]] [[Category:Bread recipes|No-Knead Bread, Famous]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|No-Knead Bread, Famous]]

revision.comment: New page: {{recipesummary|Casserole recipes|8|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Pasta|Pasta]] Spaghetti Bake ==Ingredients== * 1 [[Co...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Casserole recipes|8|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Pasta|Pasta]]
Spaghetti Bake
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] [[Cookbook:Turkey|ground turkey]] or [[Cookbook:Ground Beef|beef]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] * 1 (26-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]]) jar [[Cookbook:Spaghetti Sauce|spaghetti sauce]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] Italian seasoning * 1 (8-ounce) package [[Cookbook:Cream Cheese|cream cheese]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Cottage Cheese|cottage cheese]] * ½ cup light [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] * 1 (16-ounce) box of [[Cookbook:Noodle|spaghetti noodles]] * ⅛ cup [[Cookbook:Bread Crumbs|bread crumbs]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Parmesan cheese|Parmesan cheese]]
==Directions==
# Preheat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. # [[Cookbook:Sauté|Sauté]] ground meat with onion. When cooked through, mix in spaghetti sauce and seasoning. # Combine cream cheese, cottage cheese, and sour cream; mix well. # Cook spaghetti noodles according to package directions. # Spray 3-[[Cookbook:Quart|quart]] dish with [[Cookbook:Cooking Spray|cooking spray]]. # Layer half the spaghetti noodles on the bottom of the dish. # Spoon cheese mixture on top of noodles. # Layer remaining noodles on top of cheese mixture. # Spread meat mixture on top of second noodle layer. # Mix bread crumbs and parmesan cheese and sprinkle on top. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] 30 minutes until bubbly and heated through.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Casserole recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Meat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Beef recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Turkey recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Middle Eastern cuisines|Middle Eastern cuisine]]
'''Ma'amoul''' are pastries filled with dates or nuts.
==Ingredients== * 1 lb. (500 g) [[Cookbook:Flour|plain white flour]] (up to a quarter of the flour may be replaced with fine [[Cookbook:Semolina|semolina]]) * 2 tbsp. [[Cookbook:Sugar|white sugar]] * ½ lb. (250 g) unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] (Normandy butter is best) * 1-2 tbsp. [[Cookbook:Rosewater|rose water]] or [[Cookbook:Orange#Oranges in Cooking|orange flower water]] * 2 tbsp. [[Cookbook:Water|water]] or [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * [[Cookbook:Powdered Sugar|icing sugar]] * pinch of [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] (optional) * [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] (optional)
===Pistachio filling===
Mix ½ lb. (250 g) finely chopped [[Cookbook:Pistachio|pistachios]] with a somewhat smaller weight of sugar and 1 tbsp. rose water. (You can use ground [[Cookbook:Almond|almonds]] instead of pistachios.)
===Walnut filling===
Mix ½ lb. (250 g) finely chopped [[Cookbook:Walnut|walnuts]] with a somewhat smaller weight of sugar and 1 tbsp. [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]].
===Date filling===
Chop 1 lb. (500 g) stoneless [[Cookbook:Date|dates]], and bring to the boil with half a teacup of water, squashing the mixture against the side of the pan with a wooden spoon until approximately uniform in consistency. Blend with an electric chopper if desired. One variant is to add some butter to the mixture as it cooks. Allow to cool.
==Equipment==
Ma'amoul may be made in special wooden moulds. These should be oiled and wiped, then dusted with flour before use (and after every three to four balls, to prevent sticking). There are three shapes of mould. The flattish circular shape is used for date ma’amoul; the round domed shape for walnut ma’amoul; the long oval for pistachio ma’amoul.
Some families do not use moulds, but have special crimping tweezers for making patterns on the top of the pastry. Alternatively, a fork may be used.
==Procedure== # Sift the flour into a mixing bowl. Mix with 2 tablespoons white sugar, and a pinch of salt if desired. Some people add a very small quantity of baking powder. # Work in the butter until the consistency is as uniform as possible; one way is to heat the butter in the microwave first until it is nearly melted, and then mix it with the flour into a sort of crumble. Cover and leave for some hours or overnight (not in the fridge, or it will go rock hard). # Break up the dough with your fingers and add the rose water or orange flower water and 2 tbsp. water or milk until it is malleable, and knead the whole into a smooth ball. # Take a walnut-sized ball of the dough, stick your thumb into it and hollow out into a cup shape, so that the walls are as thin as possible without breaking. # Insert filling to about three-quarters full, and pinch the aperture closed. Pat gently into a ball, not letting the walls break. # Repeat until all the dough and the filling is used. If at any stage the remaining dough shows signs of drying out, knead in a little more water or milk. # Decorate the balls on top with tweezers or the prongs of a fork. Alternatively, pat each one into a wooden mould and flatten the exposed bottom surface, then bang the mould face down on the work surface to extract the moulded pastry. # Place the pastries on a baking sheet (not greased, as the dough is already very buttery) and bake in a preheated oven (180°C / 355°F; 160°C if a fan oven) for 20 minutes: they must not be allowed to become hard or brown. In fact they should look a little moist and underdone when removed from the oven: they will steam off and harden as they cool. # Leave the pastries to cool, and dust with icing sugar when cold. Keep in a sealed plastic box or biscuit tin.
==Karabij==
One variant, used on very special occasions, is known as ''karabij''. Make nut ma’amoul, using water rather than milk and no flower water, in the form of balls rather than in a mould, leaving them smooth without making any indentations. Arrange in a pyramid and serve with a special cream called ''naatiffe''. This is made by boiling water, lemon juice, orange flower water and ground soapwort (''Saponaria officinalis'') into a syrup, and folding in stiffly beaten egg whites. (Some books mention ''bois de Panama'' instead of soapwort, but apparently this is a fallacy.)
{{Wikipedia|Ma'amoul}}
[[Category:Middle Eastern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pastry recipes|Ma'amoul]] [[Category:Walnut recipes|Ma'amoul]] [[Category:Date recipes|Ma'amoul]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|Ma'amoul]]

{{recipesummary|Breakfast recipes|1|Cooking Time: 10 Minutes|3}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Eggs]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|US Cuisine]]
This is a neat to-go version of our favorite poached egg dish.
==Ingredients==
*2 large [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] *1 [[Cookbook:Pita|pita]] *2 Tbsp [[Cookbook:Cream Cheese|cream cheese]] *[[Cookbook:Smoked Salmon|smoked salmon]] *1 dash [[Cookbook:Vinegar|white vinegar]] *[[Cookbook:Water|water]]
==Procedure== #Boil enough water to fill a deep pan. #Add Vinegar to the water. #Crack 2 eggs into the boiling water/vinegar mixture. Leave them alone for 5-7 minutes. #Cut open the top of a pita. #Line the inside of the pita with cream cheese and smoked salmon. #Take eggs out using slotted spoon and drop them into the pita. #Eat Immediately
[[Category:Breakfast recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Frosting and Icing recipes|enough for 1 cake|½ hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
Chocolate Icing
==Ingredients==
* ¼ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] (110g) [[Cookbook:Chocolate|sweet chocolate]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Cream|cream]] * [[Cookbook:Sift|sifted]] [[Cookbook:Powdered Sugar|confectioner's sugar]]
==Directions==
# Melt chocolate over [[Cookbook:Water|hot water]]. # Add the cream. # Gradually [[Cookbook:Beat|beat]] in sugar until [[Cookbook:Icing|icing]] is creamy and thick enough to spread.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Frosting and Icing recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Milk recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{cookwork|This recipe needs quantities}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Cuisine of Italy]]
'''Ciceri e Tria''' is the most beloved dish of [[w:Salento|Salento]], [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italy]]. It's a brothy pasta dish, with the addition of chickpeas. A third of the pasta is fried, the rest boiled directly into the broth. Its brothiness varies and sometimes you'll be given a spoon with it, sometimes you won't. Cheese is always absent. The addition of the fried pasta was meant to mimic the texture of meat, back when it was scarce.
==Ingredients== * [[Cookbook:Chickpea|chickpeas]] * [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrots]], [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] finely * [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], diced finely * [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]], diced finely * [[Cookbook:Barley|barley flour]] * [[Cookbook:Flour#Wheat Flour|hard durum wheat flour]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chilli peppers]] * [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]], diced * [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaves]] * [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]]
==Procedure==
# Soak the chickpeas overnight. # Drain the chickpeas and add to a large pot with fresh water. Add the vegetables, bay leaves and salt and simmer until tender. # Meanwhile, make the pasta, by adding roughly 30% barley flour to the 70% hard durum wheat flour and water until you reach pasta consistency. Roll out into thin ribbons, several times thicker than egg pasta allows. Dry a few hours. # Take a third of the pasta and fry in small batches, in extra virgin olive oil. # Regulate water, bring the chickpeas to a boil again, and add the raw pasta. # Cook until tender, around 3 minutes. Add fried pasta, the diced parsley and a good glug of raw oil.
Serve in bowls.
''Translated and adapted by Silvestro Silvestori, Owner of The Awaiting Table Cookery School, Lecce, Italy.''
[[Category:Italian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chickpea recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Frosting and Icing recipes|6|½ hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
Lemon Icing
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg yolk]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] * [[Cookbook:Pinch|pinch]] of [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|confectioner's sugar]]
==Directions==
# Break the egg yolk into a small bowl. # Add the lemon juice and salt; [[Cookbook:Beat|beat]] lightly. # Gradually beat in confectioner's sugar.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* If you want extra stiff icing, add a little more sugar.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Frosting and Icing recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Frosting and Icing recipes|6|7 minutes!|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
Seven Minute Icing
==Ingredients==
* 1 unbeaten [[Cookbook:Egg White|egg white]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] cold [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * ½ teaspoon flavoring
==Directions==
# Put the egg white, sugar, and water in the top of a [[Cookbook:Double Boiler|double boiler]]. # Place over boiling water and [[Cookbook:Beat|beat]] with a [[Cookbook:Beater|rotary egg beater]] seven minutes. # Then add baking powder and flavoring. # Remove from heat and beat until thick. # Spread in swirls over cake.

{{recipesummary|Frosting and Icing recipes|enough for 1 cake|½ hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
Brown Sugar Icing
==Ingredients==
* 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] * ⅔ cup [[Cookbook:Cream|cream]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]]
==Directions==
# [[Cookbook:Boil|Boil]] sugar and cream together until a soft ball forms in cold water. # Cool to 125°F. # Add vanilla and butter; beat until thick enough to spread.

revision.comment: You can never go wrong with chocolate!
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Confection recipes|Makes 16|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] Double Chocolate Brownies
''This is a long awaited favorite from my good friend Charlene.'' ==Ingredients== ¾ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Flour|all purpose flour]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ⅓ cup [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] ''(I prefer unsalted)'' * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * one 12 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] package [[Cookbook:Chocolate Chips|chocolate chips]], divided * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Nut|nuts]] ''(optional)'' ==Directions== # Preheat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|325°F]] # In a small bowl, combine flour, soda, and salt. # Set aside. # In small [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]], combine butter, sugar and water. Bring just to a [[Cookbook:Boil|boil]], then remove from heat. # Add 1 cup (6 oz) chocolate chips and vanilla. # Stir until smooth. # Transfer to a large bowl. # Add eggs one at a time-- [[Cookbook:Beating|beating]] well after each addition. # Gradually blend in flour mixture. # Stir in remaining chocolate chips-- and nuts if desired. # Spread in a greased 9" square pan. # Bake @325F for 30-35 minutes. # Cool completely before cutting into 2-1/4" squares. ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * * [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Confection recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Milk recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Breakfast recipes|1
''Who said you have to share?''|7 minutes|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast|Breakfast Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] ''OK, you've heard of Reese's Peanut Butter Cups, and you've heard of peanut butter toast. Why not combine them?!'' ==Ingredients== * 1 slice of [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]] * 2-4 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Peanut Butter|peanut butter]], smooth or crunchy, whatever you like. * 1-2 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] [[Cookbook:Chocolate Chips|chocolate chips]] ==Procedure== # [[Cookbook:toast|Toast]] the bread in a [[Cookbook:Oven|toaster oven]], using the broiler, one side, then the other. # Smear the peanut butter on the bread. ''C'mon, now, this is not rocket science!'' # Sprinkle chocolate chips lightly (or heavily, if you want!) on the peanut butter. # Put the toast back under the broiler for about 20 seconds. ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * If you don't like this, there's sompin' wrong wich-ya! * Some people like to spread the chocolate chips, after softening under the broiler. A variation that I like is to spread Marshmallow Fluff over the peanut butter and replace the chocolate chips with a Nestles crunch bar, and I use 2 toasts and make it a sandwich. Just a thought, if you are not actually using Reese's cups then you don't need that in the title, but then, why aren't we using the Reese's? Yumm! ==Uses== * I like it for late breakfast, but there ''NEVER'' has to be a reason for chocolate! [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Peanut Butter recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|8|Cook 1.5 hours|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Colombia|Cuisine of Colombia]]
'''Ajiaco''' is a quintessential dish from Bogotá, [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Colombia|Colombia]].
==Ingredients==
===Soup:===
* 1 whole skin-on bone-in [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] breast (approximately 750[[Cookbook:G|g]]) * 1 [[Cookbook:L|l]] chicken broth * 1 [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], peeled * 2 [[Cookbook:Scallion|scallions]] (white part and first 2 cm of green) * 2 [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrots]], peeled * 4 [[Cookbook:Clove|cloves]] [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], peeled * 1 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaf]] * 3 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]] dried [[Cookbook:Thyme|thyme]] * 2 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]] ground [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] * 4 sprigs fresh [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]] * 10 [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|black peppercorns]] * 5 [[Cookbook:ML |ml]] tomato paste * .5 [[Cookbook:Kg|kg]] small yellow [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]]. peeled * .5 [[Cookbook:Kg|kg]] small purple [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]]. peeled * .5 [[Cookbook:Kg|kg]] mashing [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]], peeled and sliced 2 cm thickness * 1 [[Cookbook:L|l]] water * 2 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]] of beef bullion granules * .25 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]] of frozen [[Cookbook:Peas|peas]]
===Garnishes:===
* 4 ears of [[Cookbook:Corn|corn]], quartered lengthwise and cooked * 10 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]] of whipping cream mixed with 10 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]] of créme fraíche * 2 ripe but firm Hass [[Cookbook:Avocado|avocados]], peeled, pitted and cut into eight slices right before serving * 10 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]] of finely chopped [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]]
==Procedure==
# Combine chicken, broth, onions, scallions, carrots, garlic, bay leaf, thyme, cumin, cilantro and peppercorns in large sauce pan and bring to a boil. Skim off froth as it rises. Reduce heat to low and cover when frothing finishes. # Remove and reserve chicken after it is cooked through (approximately 20 minutes). # Strain broth through sieve and return to pot, boil again over medium heat. Reserve carrots. # Add tomato paste and yellow and purple potatoes. Cover and cook until potatoes are soft (approximately 20 minutes). # While yellow and purple potatoes are cooking, boil sliced mashing potatoes in water and beef bullion in separate pot. Once boiling, reduce to medium heat until potatoes start to fall apart (approximately 30 minutes). # Drain and reserve a quarter of the slices and mash the rest of the sliced potatoes. Add mashed and sliced potatoes to soup. # Remove bones and skin from chicken and discard. Cut chicken into strips 1 cm wide and 3 cm long. # Add chicken and peas to soup and simmer for 5 minutes. Slice the carrots into .5 cm thick rounds and add back into soup. Salt to taste. # Serve hot with garnishes available.
==Notes, tips, and variations==
* If soup is too thick add boiling water in small amounts; the consistency should be like that of heavy cream. Soup will thicken as it cools.
[[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Colombian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Meat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: New page: {{recipesummary|Meat recipes|6 to 8|1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Cuba|Cuban cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Caribbean cuisines|Caribbean cuisine]] Cuban Picadillo ==Ingredients==...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Meat recipes|6 to 8|1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Cuba|Cuban cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Caribbean cuisines|Caribbean cuisine]]
Cuban Picadillo
==Ingredients==
* 2 [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] [[Cookbook:Ground Beef|ground beef]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]], divided * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] [[Cookbook:Onion|Oso Sweet onions]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Green Pepper|green pepper]], diced * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * 1 15-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] can [[Cookbook:Tomato Sauce|tomato sauce]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] ground [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] * 2 teaspoons dried [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisins]] * ½ cup chopped [[Cookbook:Olive|pimento-stuffed green olives]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Vinegar|red wine vinegar]] * [[Cookbook:Kosher|Kosher]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|fresh ground black pepper]] to taste
==Directions==
# In large [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]], brown beef in 2 tablespoons olive oil over high heat; drain and reserve. # In same skillet, lightly brown onion, pepper, and garlic in remaining oil. # Add tomato sauce, cumin, and oragano; bring to [[Cookbook:Boil|boil]]. # Reduce heat and [[Cookbook:simmer|simmer]] 20 minutes, stiring occasionally, until mixture has thickened. # Stir in beef, raisins, olives and season to taste with salt and pepper. # Bring back to boil, simmer 10 minutes and serve over steamed rice with [[Cookbook:Sauté|sautéed]] sliced ripe [[Cookbook:Plantain|plantains]] and [[Cookbook:Black Beans|black beans]].
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Make a double batch and freeze half for up to three months. Defrost in [[Cookbook:Microwave Oven|microwave oven]]. * Use Texmati rice, a hybrid of American long-grain rice with Indian basmati, for perfect, fluffy results.
[[Category:Cuban recipes|Picadillo, Cuban]] [[Category:Meat recipes|Picadillo, Cuban]] [[Category:Beef recipes|Picadillo, Cuban]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|Picadillo, Cuban]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of India|Cuisine of India]]
==Ingredients== * ½ kg [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|Green chillies]] (medium) * 4 [[Cookbook:Onion|Onions]] (large, finely chopped) 4 * 2 Tbs Khus khus ([[Cookbook:Poppy Seed|poppy seeds]]) * 2 Tbs [[Cookbook:Sesame Seed|Sesame seeds]] (til) * 2 Tbs [[Cookbook:Coriander|Coriander seeds]] (dhaniya) * 1 Tbs [[Cookbook:Cumin|White cumin]] (sufaid zeera) * 1 Tbs Desiccated [[Cookbook:Coconut|coconut]] powder * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|Red chillies (grounded)]] * 1 Tbs [[Cookbook:Turmeric|Turmeric]] (haldi) * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] to taste * 1 Tbs ground paste of [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] and [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] * 6 to 7 [[Cookbook:Curry Leaf|Curry leaves]] * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Nigella|Nigella seeds]] (kalonji) * 1 tea cup [[Cookbook:Tamarind|Tamarind juice]] * 6 [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|Red chillies]], whole * 6 [[Cookbook:Fenugreek|Fenugreek seeds]] (methi daana) * 5 Tbs [[Cookbook:Oil|Oil]]
==Procedure== # Lightly roast the khus khus, sesame seeds, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, desiccated coconut, and grind in a [[Cookbook:Mortar and Pestle|mortar and pestle]]. # Put oil in frying pan and stir fry the green chillies with some salt. Drain the oil from the green chillies and keep aside. # Start cooking by putting the spices namely cumin seeds, whole red chillies, fenugreek seeds and a couple of curry leaves for tarka in very hot oil. # When ready and popping, add chopped onions to it and fry till golden brown. # Add the rest of the spices i.e. red chillies, turmeric, garlic ginger paste and nigella seeds. Stir well and let it cook for 2 minutes. # Now add the tamarind juice and let it cook for a minute. Add the green chillies and top it with the remaining curry leaves and let it simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. # When ready serve with any meat accompaniment or rice dishes like [[Cookbook:Biryani|Biryani]]
[[Category:Indian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chile recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: New page: {{recipesummary|Bread recipes|6|2 hours|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:South American cuisines|South American cuisines]] | [[Cookbook:Caribbean cuisines|Caribbean cuisine]] '''Chicken and Co...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Bread recipes|6|2 hours|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:South American cuisines|South American cuisines]] | [[Cookbook:Caribbean cuisines|Caribbean cuisine]] '''Chicken and Corn Empanadas'''
''Empanadas, which come from the Spanish word for "bread," are baked or fried turnovers made from bread, pastry, phyllo, or even pizza dough. Find out why empanadas, the Spanish hand-held meal-in-a-pocket, are enjoyed from Buenos Aires to Miami!'' ==Ingredients== * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] [[Cookbook:Onion|Oso Sweet onions]] * 1 diced red [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|bell pepper]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] (hot) [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|crushed red pepper]], ''optional'' * 1½ cup frozen [[Cookbook:Corn|corn kernels]] * 2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]] * 3 cups (1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]]) diced cooked [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] * 6 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] shredded Monterey Jack [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]] * [[Cookbook:Kosher|Kosher]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|fresh ground black pepper]] to taste * 2 14-ounce packages frozen [[Cookbook:Rolls|crescent rolls]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]], lightly [[Cookbook:Beat|beaten]] with 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Water|water]] ==Directions== # In large [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]], heat oil and lightly brown onions. # Add pepper, crushed red peppers (if desired), corn, and oregano, and cook 5 minutes over moderate heat or until liquid has mostly cooked away. # Remove from heat; stir in chicken and cheese, season to taste and chill. # Unroll crescent dough into two perforated squares. # Place one square over second square. # Roll out with a little flour to form a single large rectangular sheet. # Cut out four circles about 5 in inches in diameter. # Repeat with remaining package of rolls. # Refrigerate circles on waxed paper until firm, about 30 minutes. # Spoon ¼ cup filling into center of each circle, leaving a 1-inch border. # Brush edges with egg mixture. # Fold over to seal, stretching dough slightly. # Press edges together while pushing out any air pockets. # Seal by crimping with the tines of a fork. # Brush top with egg wash. # Prick with fork. # Arrange empanadas on buttered and floured baking pan. # Refrigerate until ready to bake, up to two days ahead of time. # Preheat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|400°F]]. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] 25 to 30 minutes or until puffy and brown and filling in bubbling hot. ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * Use rotisserie-roasted chicken. * Oso Sweet onions are the winter sweet onion from Chile, in season from January to March. They have record-high sugar content, crisp texture, and mild flavor. * Vidalias would be a reasonable onion substitute if Oso Sweet onions cannot be found. * You can use this as a base to experiment with any filling or combination you desire. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|Empanadas, Chicken and Corn]] [[Category:South American recipes|Empanadas, Chicken and Corn]] [[Category:Caribbean recipes|Empanadas, Chicken and Corn]] [[Category:Bread recipes|Empanadas, Chicken and Corn]] [[Category:Meat recipes|Empanadas, Chicken and Corn]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|Empanadas, Chicken and Corn]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|Empanadas, Chicken and Corn]] [[Category:Corn recipes|Empanadas, Chicken and Corn]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|Empanadas, Chicken and Corn]]

{{recipesummary |Category = Dutch recipes |Servings = 6-8 |Rating = 2 }} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the Netherlands|Cuisine of the Netherlands]]
'''Hotpot''' (in Dutch: Hutspot)
Makes: 6-8 servings
== Ingredients == * 5 lbs [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]], quartered * 3½ lbs [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrots]], cut into pieces * 2 lbs [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], diced * 2 cups [[Cookbook:Ham|ham]], cubed
== Instructions == # Cook potatoes in pan, adding salt to taste, until done. Drain. # Cook carrots, onions and ham, adding small amount of salt until carrots are done. Drain, reserving water from carrot, onion, and ham pot. # Mash all ingredients, adding enough of reserved juices from carrots to reach a mashed potato consistency. Add 2 to 3 chunks of butter while mashing, to taste.
[[Category:Dutch recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|8|1½ hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
Picante Peach Cobbler
==Ingredients==
* 1 24-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] jar picante sauce * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] packed [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * ¼ cup all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] ground [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] * ⅛ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 29-ounce can [[Cookbook:Peach|cling peach halves]], drained and [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] * ½ 15-ounce package refrigerated [[Cookbook:Pie Crust|pie crust]] (1 crust)
==Directions==
# Mix picante sauce, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, and salt in 3-[[Cookbook:Quart|quart]] [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]]. # Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture [[Cookbook:Boil|boils]]. # Reduce heat to low. # Cook and stir 2 minutes more or until mixture thickens. # Stir in peaches. # Remove from heat and let cool. # Pour mixture into 9-inch deep-dish pie plate. # Heat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|400°F]]. # Let pie crust stand at room temperature 15 minutes or until it's easy to handle. # Gently put the pie crust over the sauce mixture. # Crimp or roll edges to seal. # Cut slits in crust with knife. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Serve warm.
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cobbler recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fruit recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} ==Ingredients== * 4 tbsp. [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] * Spices: ** 6 whole [[Cookbook:Cardamom|cardamom pods]] (remove seeds, discard shells) ** 2 tsp whole [[Cookbook:Coriander|coriander seeds]] (it's not too strong, so use plenty) ** ⅛ tsp ground [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] ** ¼ tsp whole [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin seeds]] ** 1 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaf]] ** 1 clove [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], chopped * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], chopped (increase spices if using lots more onion, otherwise the taste is weak) * 2 lb fryer, or [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] parts (OPTIONAL: substitute [[Cookbook:Tofu|firm tofu]] for the chicken.) * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] (or 1 cup plain [[Cookbook:Yogurt|yogurt]] & ½ cup sour cream) * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Currant|currants]] (or [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisins]], if currants are unavailable) ===Optional extras:=== * ¼-⅓ cup [[Cookbook:Almond|slivered almonds]] (toasted if you prefer) * 2 tbsp shredded (or chipped) [[Cookbook:Coconut|coconut]] (also toasted) ==Procedure== # Heat oil until quite hot (not smoking.) # Add spices and bay leaf. Cook until seeds crack. (1-2 minutes.) # Reduce heat. # Add garlic and onion. Cook until tender & translucent. # Reserve onion, garlic & spices into a side dish. # Season chicken with salt & pepper. Roll in flour. # Fry chicken. (Add oil if needed.) # When chicken is almost done, add reserved onion/spice mixture. # Add currants.
– At this point, chicken may be cooled & frozen. # To serve, add sour cream (or mixture of sour cream and yogurt) and simmer until chicken is tender and sauce has cooked down a little. # Serve with [[Cookbook:Saffron Sweet Rice|Saffron Sweet Rice]] ==Notes== *After cooking, the spices continue to infuse the chicken and mellow the flavor. Refrigerating this dish for a day then warming it, enhances its flavor! [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients== * 1½ cup [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]] (we prefer basmati over plain) * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * large scoop (⅛ tsp) [[Cookbook:Saffron|saffron]] (expensive but worth it!) * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisins]] (or [[Cookbook:Currant|currants]]) * ¼-½ cup [[Cookbook:Almond|slivered almonds]] (toasted if you prefer)
==Procedure== # Wash rice and add enough water cover rice with water equal to the depth of the rice. # Add salt, saffron, sugar & raisins. # Cook over high heat until water disappears and steam is rising from holes in the surface of the rice. # Reduce heat to warm. # Add almonds. # Cover tightly and let stand for 20 minutes.
==Notes, tips and variations== * For diabetics, you may replace sugar with 4 to 6 packets of SPLENDA sweetner. * Saffron Sweet Rice is a nice complement to [[Cookbook:Amar's Chicken|Amar's Chicken]] and [[Cookbook:Amar's Tofu|Amar's Tofu]].
[[Category:Rice recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Saffron recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary |Category = Tofu recipes |Servings = 6-8 |Time = 60 minutes |Rating = 3 }} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Tofu|Tofu]]
== Ingredients == *Spices: **6-8 whole [[Cookbook:Cardamom|cardamom pods]] **2 tsp whole [[Cookbook:Coriander|coriander seeds]] **½ tsp whole [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin seeds]] **1 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaf]] *4 Tbsp [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] *1 (or 2) [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] cloves, chopped *1 (or 2) large [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], chopped coarsely *1 [[Cookbook:Tofu|Tofu cake]] –extra firm (or firm), cut into ¾-inch cubes. *½ cup [[Cookbook:Currant|currants]] *½ cup [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] *½ cup creamy plain [[Cookbook:yogurt|yogurt]] – 2% (fat?) is good *1 Tbsp [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] (optional) *½ cup [[Cookbook:Coconut milk|coconut milk]] (optional) *¼ cup (or more) [[Cookbook:Almond|slivered almonds]], lightly toasted *⅛ cup toasted [[Cookbook:Coconut|coconut]] threads or flakes (optional)
==Procedure== # Crack open the cardamom pods. Reserve the seeds; discard the shells. # Heat oil to quite hot (not smoking.) # Add spices and bay leaf. # Cook until seeds crack. (1-2 minutes.) # Reduce heat to medium. # Add onion and garlic. Cook until tender & translucent # Reserve onion, garlic & spices to a side dish # Season tofu with salt & pepper. Then fry. (Adding oil if needed.) # When tofu is heated through, [[Cookbook:Sautéing|sauté]] until lightly brown (5-8 minutes). # Add reserved onion/spice mixture. # Add currants and [[Cookbook:Sautéing|sauté]] for 3-5 minutes. #* At this point, tofu may be cooled & chilled for re-heating the following day, up to a week. #* The spices continue to blend their flavors – this dish re-heated tastes as well as, or better than, when freshly cooked! # Add sour cream, yogurt and, if using: coconut milk & butter. # Simmer until sauce has cooked down a little. # Add toasted almonds (and toasted coconut, if using.)
Serve hot with [[Cookbook:Saffron Sweet Rice|Saffron Sweet Rice]].
[[Category:Tofu recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}}
==Ingredients== * 7 to 8 cups [[Cookbook:Broccoli|broccoli florets]]. Two bunches of broccoli supplies enough florets. If not, then add stems and stalk (peeled and chopped finely). * 10 slices crisp [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]], chopped finely (smoked bacon works well) * ⅔ cup [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisins]] * ⅔ cup chopped sweet [[Cookbook:Apple|apple]] (optional) * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] (or equivalent in SPLENDA sweetner) * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Pecan|pecans]], chopped * ½ cup sweet [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], chopped (Vidalia are recommended) * 2 Tbsp [[Cookbook:Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]]
==Procedure== # Mix well. # Cover. # "Cook" overnight in the refrigerator. # Serve with (optional) additional chopped pecans sprinkled over the top.
[[Category:Bacon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{cookwork|needs translation into English - e.g. what are "refrigerator biscuits"?}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
==Ingredients==
* 4 cans of biscuits, cut into quarters
For rolling: * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]]
Glaze: * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] or [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Sugar|white sugar]] * 1½ tsp [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]]
==Procedure==
# Combine cinnamon and sugar for rolling. # Roll biscuit sections in mixture, placing in greased [[Cookbook:Bundt Pan|bundt pan]] or high-sided [[Cookbook:Cake Pan|cake pan]]. Do not pack tightly. # Bring glaze ingredients to a boil, pour over dough. # Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 40-50 minutes. # Invert onto plate, serve warm.
==Alternate recipe==
===Ingredients===
* 4 tubes of refrigerated Pillsbury Buttermilk Biscuits * 2 cups Cinnamon-sugar mixture * 1/2 cup [[Cookbook:Sugar|white sugar]] * 1/2 cup [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * 2 sticks [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * PAM spray * Bundt Pan
===Procedure===
# Use PAM cooking spray to fully grease inside of Bundt Pan. Set oven to 350°F (175°C). # Take biscuits out of can. Notice that they're cut up into 8 sections. Use scissors to cut each section into quarters, so that you have 4 pieces with each section. This should be a total of 32 pieces per can. # Put pieces into bowl with cinnamon-sugar mixture. Roll pieces until they are fully covered in cinnamon sugar. Place pieces into bundt pan. # Melt and bring to a boil: 1/2 cup white sugar, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2 sticks butter. After glaze has thickened, pour glaze on top of biscuit pieces in bundt pan. # Put Monkey Bread in oven for 25-30 minutes. Invert onto plate. Serve.
[[Category:Cookie recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: Revert to revision 747076 dated 2007-02-08 02:22:59 by Webaware using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United Kingdom|Cuisine of the United Kingdom]] | [[Cookbook:Omelet Recipes|Omelet Recipes]]
'''Friar's Omelette''' is a traditional Scottish recipe, for an egg recipe with apple usually being its main ingredient, however apple can be substituted for other fruit such a [[Cookbook:Rhubarb|rhubarb]], [[Cookbook:Plum|plums]] (with stones removed) or [[Cookbook:Blackberry|blackberry]].
==Ingredients== *6 medium [[Cookbook:Apple|cooking apples]] *4 ounces (125g or one stick) [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] plus butter for greasing a baking dish *2 ounces (50g or 4 tablespoons) [[Cookbook:Sugar|white sugar]] *1 ounce (25g or rounded tablespoon) white sugar for decoration *2 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]], well beaten *4 ounces (125g or 1 cup) [[Cookbook:Bread Crumb|breadcrumbs]] *a quarter pint (150mL) [[Cookbook:Water|water]] *a squeeze of [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]]
==Procedure== # Peel and core the apples, slice and place in a saucepan with the water. # Cook until soft (similar to apple sauce), then remove from heat and add butter, sugar and lemon juice; mix well. # While this is cooling, beat the eggs very well - when the apple mixture is cool, mix in the eggs as well. # Butter a deep baking dish and spread the breadcrumbs around it so that they stick to the bottom and the sides, keeping a good amount for the top. # Pour the apple and egg mixture into the dish and cover with a thick layer of breadcrumbs. # Bake in a moderate oven (350°F/180°C/Gas Mark 4) for about half an hour. # Turn out onto a flat dish and sprinkle with sugar before serving.
[[Category:Scottish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Omelette recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{cookwork|needs quantities}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of India|Cuisine of India]]
==Ingredients== * [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] * [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * [[Cookbook:Yogurt|yoghurt]] * [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|green chillies]], chopped * [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|green chillies]], whole * [[Cookbook:Mint|mint leaves]], chopped * [[Cookbook:Ghee|ghee]] * [[Cookbook:Garam Masala|garam masala]], both powder and whole spices * [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] and [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] paste * [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]] * [[Cookbook:Saffron|saffron]] * [[Cookbook:Cilantro|coriander leaves]] * [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]]
==Procedure==
# Marinate chicken with fried onions (should be red and just crush it with hand, don't blend), yoghurt (put a lot of yoghurt and onions if you want a lot of masala), chopped green peppers (don't use [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|red mirchi powder]], the taste won't be the same), chopped mint leaves, ghee, garam masala powder, salt, ginger garlic paste. Leave this to marinate at least 4-5 hours if it's chicken, and 12 hours if it's [[Cookbook:Lamb|lamb]] or [[Cookbook:Goat|goat]]. # Meanwhile prepare for the rice by putting all these ingredients out, because the rice gets ruined if you start looking for everything while doing the ... mix food color or zaafran (saffron) in milk, chop coriander leaves, a few green peppers (whole, don't chop), garam masala powder, fried onions, butter or ghee, lemon juice. # Boil water, when it starts getting hot, put whole garam masala (long, big ilaichi - the black one, kala zeera ([[Cookbook:Black Cumin|black cumin]]), whole [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]], [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon sticks]]) and a little bit of oil so that the rice grains don't stick to each other (something I learned from my mommy) and salt... when the water comes to boil, put the rice in and boil slightly (I keep the mark by checking the rice and I strain it when the rice grain gets 3-4 lines on 'em LOL... cook it a lot less than you normally would for regular [[Cookbook:Biryani|biryani]] because it has to cook more with the chicken...) # Once you strain the rice, leave a thin layer of rice on the bottom of the pot because the chicken/meat tends to stick, so if there's rice on the bottom, that'll stick, not the meat. # Dump the marinated chicken in the pateela, and cover the chicken with rice. # Cut the butter stick into 4 pieces and put each piece in a different part of the pot. # Pour the lemon juice over the rice, I like to make a smilie face with the color/saffron milk sticking the green peppers in the rice as eyes LOL... # Then put the coriander, fried onions and sprinkle a bit of garam masala powder. # Cover the pot completely with foil and then the cover so that no steam gets out. Leave it on high heat for a while (maybe 10 mins) after that turn it to medium. # If you have a burner, its better than an electric stove because the heat gets everywhere; but to be on the safe side, rotate the pot every 10 mins so that the meat cooks evenly. # After about 30-35 mins, you'll smell the biryani because of immense steam coming out of the pot... you might want to check if the rice looks properly cooked... if so you can turn it off... if there's no steam coming out, then leave it a few minutes more...
[[Category:Indian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rice recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Suriname|Cuisine of Suriname]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
==Ingredients== * 1 kg. [[Cookbook:Cassava|cassave]] (cassava) * 1 [[Cookbook:Coconut|coconut]] * 4 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Almond|almond essence]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla essence]] * 200 grams [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 75 grams [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * a [[Cookbook:Pinch|pinch]] of [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 big glass of [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 100 grams [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisins]]
==Procedure== # You need to peel and grate the cassave, and grate the white coconut meat. # Beat the eggs and sugar until firm. Add the vanilla and almond essence. # Combine the eggs and sugar with the grated coconut and cassava. # Add the cinnamon, milk, raisins and salt. # Melt the butter and add it to the mixture. # Rub the dish you want to use with butter or use Pam. # Put the mixture in the dish. Put the dish in a pre-heated oven at 350°F (175°C). Bake the Bojo for about an hour. It needs to be firm on top but not dry on the inside.
Serving idea: sprinkle some cinnamon on top of the bojo
[[Category:Surinamese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Filipino recipes|6 to 8|Active: 1 hour
24 hours start to finish|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the Philippines|Cuisine of the Philippines]] '''Chicken Lumpia''' These Filipino egg rolls make a tasty dish. ==Ingredients== * 1½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] ground [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] or [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]] * ⅓ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Water Chestnut|water chestnuts]] * ½ cup chopped [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * 4 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|black pepper]], to taste * 2 packages small-to-medium size [[Cookbook:Egg Roll|egg roll]] wrappers (also called "wonton wrappers"), about 40 wrappers, total * 4 cups [[Cookbook:Oil|cooking oil]] * [[Cookbook:Sweet and Sour|sweet and sour sauce]] ==Directions== # In a large bowl, combine meat, water chestnuts, onion, eggs, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. # Mix well and set aside. # On a clean, dry surface, place one egg roll wrapper with one corner facing you (like a baseball diamond). # Place about 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] of the meat mixture in the center of the wrapper. # Dip your fingers in a glass of water and lightly wet the corner pointing away from you (second base). # Fold the corner closest to you (home base) over the mixture, then fold the side corners over that and roll away from your body. # The wet corner should seal the roll. # Repeat the process with the remaining ingredients. # Place the rolls in large zip-close plastic bags and freeze overnight. # In a large [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]], heat the oil to about 350°F (use an instant cooking thermometer), or until it begins to shimmer and the oil bubbles lightly when a wooden chopstick is inserted. # Using [[Cookbook:Tongs|tongs]], place each frozen lumpia roll in the hot oil and [[Cookbook:Fry|fry]] until brown, about 3 to 4 minutes. # Use tongs to turn rolls to ensure even cooking. # Remove the rolls to a plate covered with paper towels to absorb excess oil. ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * Serve with sweet and sour sauce. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fried recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Filipino recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Meat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

New page: {{recipesummary|Poultry recipes|4|15 minutes active
1¾ hours total|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] '''Chicken Tagine with Lemon and Olives'...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Poultry recipes|4|15 minutes active
1¾ hours total|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] '''Chicken Tagine with Lemon and Olives''' ==Ingredients== * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] boneless, skinless [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] breasts, cut in three pieces * ¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] * 1/8 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|ground red pepper]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Turmeric|ground turmeric]] * 2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive oil]] * 1 medium [[Cookbook:Onion|yellow onion]], [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] * 2 teaspoons grated [[Cookbook:Ginger|fresh ginger]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic cloves]], minced * ½ cup fat-free low-sodium [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * ¼ cup pitted [[Cookbook:Olive|green olives]] * 2 teaspoons grated [[Cookbook:Lemon zest|lemon zest]] * 3-inch [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon stick]] * 2 tablespoons chopped [[Cookbook:Cilantro|fresh cilantro]] ==Directions== # In a large zip-close plastic bag, combine the juice and chicken. # Seal and [[Cookbook:Marinate|marinate]] in the refrigerator 30 minutes. # Remove chicken from bag and discard marinate. # Pat chicken dry with paper towels. # In a shallow bowl, combine the flour, salt, and black and red peppers, and turmeric. # Dredge the chicken through the flour mixture, lightly coating both sides, and set aside. # In a large, deep nonstick [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]], heat the oil over medium-high heat. # Add the chicken and cook for 3 minutes per side, or until lightly browned. # Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside. # Add the onion, ginger, and garlic to pan. # [[Cookbook:Sauté|Sauté]] 5 minutes, or until tender. # Return the chicken to the pan. # Add the broth, olives, lemon zest, and cinnamon stick. # Bring to a [[Cookbook:Boil|boil]], then cover, reduce heat, and [[Cookbook:Simmer|simmer]] 1 hour or until chicken is tender. # To serve, discard the cinnamon stick and stir in cilantro. [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Meat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Meat recipes|6|1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Rice|Rice]]
Middle Eastern Meatballs
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] low-fat plain [[Cookbook:Yogurt|yogurt]] * 1 to 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] finely [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * 1 teaspoon crushed dried [[Cookbook:Mint|mint]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] to taste * ¾ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] 93% lean [[Cookbook:Ground Beef|ground beef]] * ½ cup cooked [[Cookbook:Rice|brown rice]] * ⅓ cup finely chopped [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * ¼ cup packed [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]], chopped * ¼ cup packed flat-leaf [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]], chopped * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|ground cinnamon]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cumin|ground cumin]] * ⅛ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|red pepper flakes]] * ⅛ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|ground black pepper]] * ½ teaspoon salt
==Directions==
# In a small bowl, [[Cookbook:Whisk|whisk]] together the yogurt, garlic, and mint. # Season to taste with salt. # Set the [[Cookbook:Broil|broiler]] rack 5 inches from the heat. # Preheat the broiler. # In a mixing bowl, combine the meat, rice, onion, cilantro, parsley, cinnamon, cumin, red and black peppers, plus ½ teaspoon salt, stirring mixture with a fork until it is well blended # With your hands, for the mixture into 1½ inch meatballs. # As you make them, place the meatballs on a baking sheet that fits under the broiler. # Broil the meatballs until they are well browned on top, 4 to 5 minutes. # Using [[Cookbook:Tongs|tongs]], turn and cook until the meatballs are browned outside and no longer pink in the center, 3 to 4 minutes. # Transfer them to a serving plate and serve warm, passing the yogurt sauce in a bowl.
[[Category:Middle Eastern recipes|Meatballs, Middle Eastern]] [[Category:Meat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Beef recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rice recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Omelette recipes|4|1 to 2 hours|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Eggs|Eggs]]
'''Parmesan Cheese Soufflé'''
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] freshly grated [[Cookbook:Parmesan cheese|Parmesan cheese]] * 2 cups low-fat [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] * ½ cup all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 5 large egg yolks * 7 large [[Cookbook:Egg White|egg whites]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cayenne Pepper|cayenne pepper]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] fresh [[Cookbook:Chives|chives]]
==Directions==
# Preheat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. # Butter a 2-[[Cookbook:Quart|quart]] [[Cookbook:Soufflé|soufflé]] dish. # Add 1 cup cheese, tilting dish to evenly coat the bottom and sides. # Shake out any excess. # Set aside in refrigerator. # Place the sour cream in a large mixing bowl. # [[Cookbook:Sift|Sift]] the flour into the sour cream, then [[Cookbook:Whisk|whisk]] until well combined. # Add the egg yolks, one at a time, whisking after each addition. # Stir in salt, cayenne, chives, and remaining 2 cups cheese. # In a large clean bowl (copper is ideal), vigorously whisk the egg whites until stiff peaks form. # Gently fold egg whites into the sour cream mixture. # Pour the batter into the prepared soufflé dish and [[Cookbook:Bake|bake]] until soufflé has risen 2 to 3 inches above the rim and top is golden brown, 1 to 1½ hours. # Serve immediately.
[[Category:Casserole recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Omelette recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sour Cream recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Salsa recipes|¾ cup|5 minutes|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Mexico|Mexican cuisine]]
'''Salsa Verde'''
''The classic green salsa recipe.''
==Ingredients==
* ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] extra-virgin [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 9 [[Cookbook:Anchovy|anchovy]] fillets, drained, patted dry, minced * 6 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] finely [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] fresh flat-leaf [[Cookbook:Parsley|curly parsley]] * 3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh [[Cookbook:Rosemary|rosemary]] * 3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh [[Cookbook:Thyme|thyme]] * 3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh [[Cookbook:Mint|mint]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] * ⅛ teaspoon freshly ground [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|black pepper]]
==Directions==
# In a small bowl, mix together all ingredients. # Serve with chips or grilled meat.
[[Category:Mexican recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Salsa recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Anchovy recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
(warning: not classic salsa verde)

{{recipe|Gozleme}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Turkey|Cuisine of Turkey]] {{recipesummary |Category = Turkish recipes |Servings = 10 |Time = 40-60 minutes |Rating = 2 |Image =[[Image:Gözleme.JPG|300px]] }}
'''Gözleme''' is a savory Turkish pastry made by rolling dough with a thin roller and repeatedly folding it. It is filled, and browned in a pan. Varieties include:
* etli = meat * ispanakli = with spinach * karisik = mixed * kasar peynirli = with yellow cow's milk cheese * katmer = plain * kiymali = with ground lamb * mantarlı = mushrooms * patatesli = with mashed potatoes * peynirli = with white sheep's milk cheese (feta)
A modern variation is honey and banana served hot with a slice of lemon.
== Ingredients == Serves 10
* 5¼ cups (600 grams) of [[Cookbook:flour|all-purpose flour]] * 2½ teaspoons (15 grams) of [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 2 teaspoons (7 grams) of [[Cookbook:Yeast|dry yeast]] * 1 teaspoon (4 grams) of [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 1¼ (300 grams) of [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * ½ cup (100 grams) of [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] * ⅓ cup (65 grams) of [[Cookbook:Butter|butter ]]
== Procedure == [[Image:Istanbul turkey restaurant pancakes.jpg|right|thumb|Preparing gözleme; Istanbul, Turkey.]] ===The Dough=== # Sift flour in a large bowl, reserving one cup of flour. # Sprinkle with salt and mix. Make a hole in the centre. # Combine yeast and sugar in a small bowl. # Add ¼ of a cup of warm water, stir. Pour into hole in the centre of the flour. # Cover yeast with some flour. Let stand for 10 minutes to rise. # Stir in remaining water, blending thoroughly. Knead for 5 minutes to form a medium soft dough. # Cover and let rise in a warm place for one hour or until double in bulk.
===The Gözleme=== # Place dough on lightly floured board. Divide into 10 portions with floured hands. # Shape into balls; roll each ball out with rolling pin into rectangles 5 mm thick. Brush with oil. # Fold opposite edges over, bringing edges together in centre. # Spread filling over half of pastry. Then fold other half over filling shaping into an oblong. # Seal edges well, pressing slightly.
===The Cooking=== # Heat griddle or a cast iron skillet. # Grease with butter and place gözleme on griddle. # Brown on both sides. Serve hot.
[[Cookbook:Ayran|Ayran]] is almost always served with gözleme.
[[Category:Turkish recipes]] [[Category:Pastry recipes]]

revision.comment: New page: {{recipesummary|Cake recipes|16 slices|1 hour|4}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Cake recipes|16 slices|1 hour|4}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Valentine's Day Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] '''Mocha Delight''' ==Ingredients== =====Cake===== * 4 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], melted * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] graham cracker crumbs * 1 22.5-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] box [[Cookbook:Brownie|brownie mix]] =====Frosting===== * 3 [[Cookbook:Egg White|egg whites]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 1 cup (2 sticks) [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], softened * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Coffee|instant expresso coffee]] (dry) =====Decoration===== * 1 bag Dove Rich Dark [[Cookbook:Chocolate|Chocolate]] Hearts * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Whipped Cream|whipped cream]] or topping ==Directions== # Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. # Line bottom of 9-inch [[Cookbook:Springform Pan|springform pan]] with waxed paper; grease. # Add melted butter to graham cracker crumbs and press into bottom of pan. # Prepare brownie mix according to package instructions; spread over crumbs. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] until firm, approximately 35 to 50 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. # Remove from oven to a [[Cookbook:Wire Rack|wire rack]]; cook completly and remove from pan.

Meanwhile, prepare frosting: # [[Cookbook:Whisk|Whisk]] egg whites and sugar together over [[Cookbook:Simmer|simmering]] water until sugar is dissolved. # Remove from heat; using [[Cookbook:Mixer|electric mixer]], [[Cookbook:Beat|beat]] until cooled. # Add butter one nugget at a time while continuing to beat. # Dissolve expresso in 2 tablespoons warm water. # Beat expresso into frosting. # Frost top and sides of cake. # Snip small corner of a resealable plastic bag; place whipped cream inside. # Pipe 3 rosettes around outside edges of cake. # Place a chocolate heart atop each rosette.

To serve: # Place 8 chocolate hearts in a small resealable plastic bag. # [[Cookbook:Microwave Oven|Microwave]] until melted, about 15 seconds. # Cut a corner of the bag; randomly drizzle chocolate on dessert plates. # Place a cake wedge on each plate. [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Frosting and Icing recipes]] [[Category:Confection recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes]]

revision.comment: New page: {{recipesummary|Sauce recipes|1 cup of 1 tablespoon servings|½ hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian ...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Sauce recipes|1 cup of 1 tablespoon servings|½ hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] '''Balsamic Glaze'''
