''This is an excellent drizzle sauce for [[Cookbook:Brassicas|cruciferous vegetables]], i.e., [[Cookbook:Broccoli|broccoli]], [[Cookbook:Cabbage|cabbage]], [[Cookbook:Cauliflower|cauliflower]], [[Cookbook:Chard|chard]], [[Cookbook:Kale|kale]], [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard greens]], [[Cookbook:Rutabaga|rutabagas]], and [[Cookbook:Turnip|turnips]]. Sort of like putting lipstick on a pig.'' ==Ingredients== * ¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Vinegar|balsamic vinegar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Honey|honey]], or to taste * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] minced [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * 1 teaspoon minced peeled [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] * 1 teaspoon extra-virgin [[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive oil]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]], seeded and [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|fresh ground black pepper]] to taste ==Directions== # Combine ingredients in a [[Cookbook:Blender|blender]] and blend until just [[Cookbook:Puree|pureed]]. # Transer to a nonstick [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]]. # Bring mixture to a [[Cookbook:Boil|boil]], then immedietely reduce heat to moderate. # Cook, Stirring frequently, unitl sauce is slightly syrupy. # Check taste and if glaze seems too acidic, stir in slightly more honey. # Add salt and pepper to taste, if desired. # Drizzle over hot, cooked vegetables and serve immediately, or to store, covered, in refrigerator up to 3 days. # Reheat and chill glaze before using. [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Ginger recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Pork recipes|8 servings|about an hour|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern Cooking]] | [[Cookbook:Meat|Meats]]
Lemon Rosemary Pork Tenderloin
==Ingredients==
* 1 medium [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], [[Cookbook:Chop|finely chopped]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive]] or [[Cookbook:Canola Oil|canola oil]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] minced [[Cookbook:Rosemary|fresh rosemary]] * 1 teaspoon minced [[Cookbook:Thyme|fresh thyme]] * 1 teaspoon grated [[Cookbook:Lemon Rind|lemon peel]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic clove]], minced * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 2 pork tenderloins (1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] each)
==Directions==
# Combine the first nine ingredients. # Rub over tenderloins. # Place on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] uncovered at [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|400°F]] or until a meat thermometer reads 160°F. # Cover with foil and let stand 10 minutes before slicing.
[[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Meat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pork recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|12|about two hours|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
Black Forest Tart
==Ingredients==
=====Crust===== * 1¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Chocolate|chocolate]] wafer crumbs * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], melted
=====Filling===== * ½ cup butter * 6 squares (1 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] each) semisweet chocolate, [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * ⅔ cup sugar * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Vanilla Extract|vanilla extract]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ⅔ cup all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]]
=====Topping===== * 1 can (21 ounces) [[Cookbook:Cherry|cherry]] pie filling * 2 squares (1 ounce each) semisweet chocolate, chopped * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Cream|heavy whipping cream]]
==Directions==
=====Crust===== # Preheat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. # In a small bowl, combine wafer crumbs and sugar; stir in butter. # Press onto the bottom and up the sides of a lightly greased 11-inch tart pan with removable bottom. # Place pan on baking sheet. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. # Cool on a [[Cookbook:Wire Rack|wire rack]].
=====Filling===== # In a [[Cookbook:Microwave Oven|microwave]] safe bowl, melt butter and chocolate; stir until smooth. # Cool for 10 minutes. # In a large mixing bowl, [[Cookbook:Beat|Beat]] the eggs, sugar, vanilla, and salt until thickened, about 4 minutes. # Blend in chocolate mixture. # Add the flour and mix well. # Pour into crust; spread evenly. # Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. # Cool completely on a wire rack.
=====Finalé===== # Spread pie filling over the top. # In a small microwave bowl, combine chocolate and cream. # Microwave on high for 20 to 30 seconds or until chocolate is melted; stir until smooth. # Cool for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. # Drizzle over tart. # Chill until set.
[[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Frosting and Icing recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Confection recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Cake recipes|24|1½ hours|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Valentine's Day Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Tunnel of Love'''
==Ingredients==
=====Cake===== * 1 bag Dove Rich Dark [[Cookbook:Chocolate|Chocolate]] Hearts * 3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (450g) [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 2½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|soda]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ¾ cup (180g) [[Cookbook:Shortening|vegetable shortening]] * 1⅔ cups (400g) [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Orange|orange]] [[Cookbook:Zest|zest]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 1 cup (240ml) [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * ½ cup (120ml) [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]]
=====Glaze===== * 1 bag Dove Rich Dark Chocolate Hearts * ¼ cup (60g) [[Cookbook:Corn Syrup|light corn syrup]] * ½ cup (120ml) [[Cookbook:Heavy Cream|heavy cream]]
==Directions==
=====Cake===== # Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]] (180c). # Grease and flour 12-cup [[Cookbook:Bundt Pan|Bundt pan]], set aside. # Combine flour, baking powder, soda, and salt in mixing bowl, set aside. # In separate bowl, [[Cookbook:Microwave Oven|microwave]] 1 bag chocolate hearts until melted (about 1½ minutes), stopping to stir occasionally; set aside. # In large bowl, [[Cookbook:Beat|beat]] shortening, sugar, and orange zest until fluffy; add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. # In another bowl, combine milk and sour cream. # With [[Cookbook:Mixer|electric mixer]] on low, alternately add flour and milk mixtures into shortening mixture, beating until smooth. # Stir 1 cup cake batter into cooled melted chocolate; set aside. # Spoon half of plain batter into bottom of prepared pan. # Cover with all the chocolate batter # Top with remaining plain batter. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] for 55 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. # Remove from oven to [[Cookbook:Wire Rack|wire rack]], cook completely.
=====Glaze===== # From 1 bag chocolate hearts, set aside 8. # In microwave-safe bowl, combine remaining chocolate hearts, corn syrup, and heavy cream. # Heat in microwave oven 1 to 2 minutes, stirring frequently until smooth. # Cool slightly. # Remove cake from pan to wire rack set over sheet pan covered with waxed paper. # Spoon glaze over cake, allowing excess to drip. # Decorate with reserved chocolate hearts.
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Frosting and Icing recipes]] [[Category:Confection recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: New page: {{recipesummary|Mousse recipes|6|15 minutes, start to finish!|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Mousse recipes|6|15 minutes, start to finish!|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Instant Chocolate Mousse'''
==Ingredients==
* ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] unsweetened [[Cookbook:Cocoa Powder|cocoa powder]] * ¼ cup plus 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] hot [[Cookbook:Coffee|coffee]] * [[Cookbook:Pinch|Pinch]] of [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Pint|pint]] [[Cookbook:Heavy Cream|heavy cream]] (also called [[Cookbook:Whipped Cream|whipping cream]]) * ⅔ cup [[Cookbook:Powdered Sugar|powdered sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] kirsch (cherry brandy), chocolate brandy, or coffee liqueur * 6 chocolate cups or shells * Small [[Cookbook:Chocolate|chocolate bar]] (for [[Cookbook:Garnish|garnish]]) * 6 [[Cookbook:Cherry|maraschino cherries]]
==Directions==
# In a medium bowl, [[Cookbook:Whisk|whisk]] together the cocoa powder, coffee, and salt. It should whisk easily and have the consistency of melted chocolate. # If it is too thick, whisk in another tablespoon of coffee. # Set aside. # In a large bowl, use an [[Cookbook:Mixer|electric mixer]] on medium-high to whip the cream for 1 minute. # Add the powdered sugar and whip for another minute. # Add the kirsch and coffee-cocoa powder mixture. # Whip on high until stiff peaks form, about another minute. # Spoon the mousse into a medium plastic bag and twist the top closed. # Use scissors to snip off one corner (about ½ inch up). # Arrange the chocolate cups on serving plates. # If the cups don't sit flat, place a dollop of mousse under them. # Squeeze the bag to pipe the mousse into the chocolate cups. # Use a [[Cookbook:Vegetable Peeler|vegetable peeler]] to shave the chocolate bar over the mousse-filled cups, letting some of the shavings scatter on the plate. # Top each mousse with a cherry.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Refrigerate if not eating immediately.
[[Category:American recipes|Instant Chocolate Mousse]] [[Category:Pudding and Custard recipes|Mousse, Instant Chocolate]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Chocolate Mousse, Instant]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|Mousse, Instant Chocolate Mousse]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|Chocolate Mousse, Instant]]

{{recipesummary|Meat recipes|4|½ hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Meat|Meats]]
'''Spicy Chicken Cutlets'''
==Ingredients==
* 4 thinly-sliced [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken breasts]] (about 1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]]) * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|black pepper]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] * ½ cup chicken [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * ¼ cup vodka or vermouth * Juice of 1 [[Cookbook:Lime|Lime]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Jalapeño|minced pickled jalopeños]] * 15-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] can [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Cornstarch|cornstarch]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Water|cold water]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Cilantro|fresh cilantro]]
==Directions==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|200°F]] # Season both sides of each chicken breast with salt and pepper. # Place the flour on a plate and dredge the chicken breasts through it, lightly coating both sides. # Set aside. # In a large[[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] heat the oil over a medium-high heat. # Add the breasts and cook 3 minutes, or until lightly browned. # Flip and cook another 2 or 3 minutes, or until cooked through. # Transfer the chicken to an oven-proof plate and place in the oven to keep warm. # Return the empty skillet to the burner. # Increase the heat to high and add the chicken broth and vodka to deglaze the pan. # As the liquid bubbles, Scrape the bottom of the pan with a [[Cookbook:Wooden Spoon|wooden spoon]] # Add half of the lime juice and the jalopeños and cook 30 seconds. # Add the tomatoes and bring to a [[Cookbook:Simmer|simmer]]. # In a small glass, add the cornstarch to the water, then add to the skillet. # Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 2 minutes. # Remove the skillet from the heat. # Stir in remaining lime juice. # Arrange each chicken breast on a plate and top with pan sauce. # [[Cookbook:Garnish|Garnish]] with cilantro.
[[Category:Fried recipes|Chicken Cutlets, Spicy]] [[Category:American recipes|Chicken Cutlets, Spicy]] [[Category:Camping recipes|Chicken Cutlets, Spicy]] [[Category:Meat recipes|Chicken Cutlets, Spicy]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|Spicy Chicken Cutlets]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|Chicken Cutlets, Spicy]]

{{recipesummary |Category = Flatbread recipes |Servings = 8 |Time = 2½ hours |Image = [[Image:Afghan bread.jpg|300px]] }} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Afghanistan|Cuisine of Afghanistan]]
'''Afghan bread''' or '''Nan-i-Afghani''' is the national bread of [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Afghanistan|Afghanistan]]. It is a [[Cookbook:Flatbread|flatbread]] and can be oval or rectangular. It is baked in a [[Cookbook:tandoor|tandoor]], the primary cooking equipment of the sub-continent region. The Afghan tandoor sits above ground and is round and made of bricks, which are heated to cook the bread. Afghan bread, also known as "nan breads", are shaped, then stuck onto the sides of the oven to bake. Often black cumin seeds or caraway seeds are sprinkled on Afghan bread for decoration as much as taste, and lines are made in the dough lengthwise to add texture to the bread. Afghan bread is similar to [[Cookbook:Pita|pita]] or [[Cookbook:Lebanese Bread|Lebanese bread]].
Afghan bread is commonly stocked at [[Cookbook:Middle Eastern cuisines|Middle Eastern]] grocery stores in western countries. In Afghanistan the baker still cooks the bread the traditional way by spreading the dough around the tandoor, whereby it gets puffy quickly and starts to colour and emit a fresh bread smell that draws the early morning throngs of people. The baker then uses two long iron tongs to pull the bread from the tandoor wall. It is carried in cloth bags by Afghans, unlike western breads packaged in plastic.
Afghans serve bread with most meals; it is used as an equivalent to a fork to envelop foods and soak up liquids on the plate. Generally the bread is torn into shreds and used to pinch the foods, similar to a sandwich. The bread acts as both fork and spoon, as Afghan often use their hands to eat. The bread has no firm crust and tastes similar to Indian [[Cookbook:naan|naan]] bread. It has a dense and rich taste.
==Ingredients== makes 8 Afghan breads * 1½ cups plus 1 tablespoon of [[Cookbook:Water|water]] (divided) * 1 700 grams dry [[Cookbook:yeast|yeast]] * 1 tablespoon of [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]] * 4 cups of [[Cookbook:flour|flour]] * 1 tablespoon of [[Cookbook:salt|salt]] * ¼ cup of [[Cookbook:Corn Oil|corn oil]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg Yolk|egg yolk]]
==Procedure== # Mix ½ cup water, yeast, and sugar. Let it sit for 10 minutes. # Place flour in a mixing bowl and sprinkle in the salt. Make a well, then add oil and yeast mixture. Stir in and add small amounts of water until it forms a soft dough that can be moulded. Knead for 5 mins. Cover with paper and let rise for 1½ hours. # Mix together the egg yolk and 1 tablespoon of water, and set aside. # Divide dough into eight parts and roll each into a ball. Roll each bread into an oval shape 20cms long 5cms thick. # Make lines in top of dough. Brush on egg mix and sprinkle with black cumin seeds. # Bake in a preheated 350°F (175°C) oven for 25 mins.
Total cooking time is around 2½ hours.
[[Category:Afghan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Flatbread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Tofu recipes|Just one!|½ hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Soybean|Soybeans]]
Tofu Tamale Pie
==Ingredient==
* 4 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] [[Cookbook:Tofu|Tofu]], washed, drained well and broken up * 1 ounce sharp [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar cheese]], grated * 1 ounce finely [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * ½ C finely [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Green Pepper|green pepper]], finely chopped * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste * 1 medium [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrot]], grated * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] instant [[Cookbook:Bouillon Cubes|beef bouillon]] * 8 ounces [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato juice]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic salt]] * 2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]] or to taste * 1 ounce [[Cookbook:Cornmeal|corn meal]]
==Directions==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. # In non-stick [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]], add onion, celery, green pepper. # Add instant beef bouillon, tomato juice, and cook till vegetables are tender. # Add tofu, carrot, garlic salt, chili powder. # [[Cookbook:Simmer|Simmer]] a few more minutes. # Add corn meal and mix thoroughly. # Pour into a one [[Cookbook:Quart|quart]] casserole and top with grated cheese. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] at 350°F for 20 minutes or until browned.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Substitute Vegetable Broth in place of Beef Bouillon for vegetarian. * May add [[Cookbook:Black Beans|black beans]] for added protein and flavor.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Casserole recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bean recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Carrot recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Celery recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tofu recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Frosting and Icing recipes|about a cup|just a few minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Royal Icing'''
==Ingredients==
* 2 large [[Cookbook:Egg White|egg whites]] * ⅛ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Cream of Tartar|cream of tartar]] * 2½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Confectioners' Sugar|confectioners' sugar]] * liquid or paste food coloring
==Directions==
# In the bowl of a [[Cookbook:Mixer|stand mixer]] fitted with the [[Cookbook:Whisk|whisk]] attachment, [[Cookbook:Beat|beat]] the egg whites on low until they become loose, about 1 minute. # Add the cream of tartar and continue mixing on low until the whites become frothy, about 2 minutes. # Gradually add the confectioners' sugar with the mixer on low. # Continue to mix until the icing holds a stiff peak and is dull in appearance, about 2 minutes. The icing is ready to use for piping lines.
=====Flooding (filling in an icing outline)===== * Add a small amount of [[Cookbook:Water|water]] to the frosting and mix until the icing reaches a looser consistency.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* If desired, divide the icing among smaller bowls and add coloring(s). * To store icing for later use: # Clean the inner sides of the bowl or container to remove any drips. # Place a dampened paper towel directly on the surface of the icing and then cover the bowl very tightly with plastic wrap. # Refrigerate up to 5 days.
==Uses==
* Use on top of [[Cookbook:Gingerbread|gingerbread]] or any other cookies.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Frosting and Icing recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

page.title: Cookbook:Gingerbread Cookies Frosted with Royal Icing

revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Cookie recipes|Makes about 3 dozen|Prep: 30-40 minutes
Then 15 minutes per batch|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] Gingerbread Cookies Frosted with Royal Icing ==Ingredients== * (flourless) [[Cookbook:Cooking Spray|cooking spray]] * 3¾ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]], plus extra for dusting * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * 1½ teaspoons [[Cookbook:Ginger|ground ginger]] * 1½ teaspoons [[Cookbook:Allspice|ground allspice]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 8 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] (1 stick) [[Cookbook:Butter|unsalted butter]], at room temperature * ¾ cup tightly packed [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|dark brown sugar]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Honey|honey]] * 2 large [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * [[Cookbook:Royal Icing|royal icing]] ==Directions== # Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|375°F]]. # Lightly spray [[Cookbook:Cookie Sheet|cookie sheets]] with cooking spray or line with parchment paper. # [[Cookbook:Sift|Sift]] together the flour, baking soda, ginger, allspice, and salt. Set aside. # In a [[Cookbook:Mixer|stand mixer]] fitted with the paddle attachment, cream together the butter, brown sugar, and honey on medium speed, about 2 minutes. # Add the eggs and mix until smooth and light, another 2 or 3 minutes. # Add the sifted dry ingredients and mix on low until the dough is evenly mixed. # Turn the dough out on a lightly floured work surface. # Pat into an even disk. # Cover with plastic wrap and chill until firm, about 20 or 30 minutes. # Roll out the dough to a ¼-inch thickness. # Use 5½-inch cookie cutters to cut out cookies. # Transfer cookies to prepared cookie sheets, spacing them about an inch apart. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] the cookie until they are firm, about 10 to 14 minutes, depending on size. # Transfer the cookies to [[Cookbook:Wire Rack|wire racks]] and let cool completely before decorating, if desired. # Bake the remaining dough in batches, as directed. # Frost with royal icing. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Confection recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cookie recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Ginger recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Bean recipes|4|3 to 4 hours|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Mexico|Mexican cuisine]]
'''Classic Black Beans and Rice'''
==Ingredients==
* ½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] dry [[Cookbook:Black Bean|black beans]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Green Pepper|green pepper]], chopped * 2 [[Cookbook:Garlic|cloves garlic]], minced * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]] * 1 packet sazón (Latino seasoned salt, see below) * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Wine|cooking wine]] or [[Cookbook:Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|ground pepper]] * 4 servings [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]]
==Directions==
# [[Cookbook:Soak|Soak]] and rinse beans. # In large [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]], soak beans in 4 cups water. DO NOT DRAIN. # Meanwhile, heat oil in a [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] over medium heat. # Add onion, pepper, and garlic; cook until tender, about 5 minutes. # Add remaining ingredients. # Stir mixture into beans in saucepan. # Bring to [[Cookbook:Boiling|boil]], reduce heat, cover, and [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] until beans are tender. # Serve over hot cooked rice.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* If sazón unavailable, make your own with [http://www.recipesource.com/side-dishes/condiments/sazon-preparado1.html| Sazón Recipe].
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Mexican recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bean recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|1 pie - not nearly enough!|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Pie|Pies]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Layered Pecan Pie'''
==Ingredients==
===Filling=== * 1 (8-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]]) package [[Cookbook:Cream Cheese|cream cheese]] * ⅓ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Vanilla Extract|vanilla extract]] * 1 9-inch unbaked [[Cookbook:Pie Shell|pie shell]], or single homemade pie crust * 1¼ cups [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Pecan|pecans]]
===Topping=== * 3 eggs * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Corn Syrup|light corn syrup]] * ¼ cup sugar * 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
==Directions== # Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|375°F]]. # Combine the cream cheese, sugar, and salt; [[Cookbook:Beat|beat]] until smooth. # Add egg and vanilla, beating well after each. # Spoon mixture into unbaked pie shell. Sprinkle with pecans. # Combine 3 eggs, corn syrup, remaining sugar, and vanilla; beat well. # Pour this mixture over pecans. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] for 35 to 40 minutes or until set.
{{DEFAULTSORT:{{PAGENAME}}}} [[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Southern recipes]] [[Category:Dessert recipes]] [[Category:Pie recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Wine recipes|a gallon|a month|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Beverages|Beverages]]
'''Apricot Wine'''
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] [[Cookbook:Apricot|dried apricots]] * 4 [[Cookbook:Quart|quarts]] [[Cookbook:Water|warm water]] * 6½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|granulated sugar]] * 2¼ cups brown sugar * 1½ cups [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisins]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemons]], sliced thin * 2 [[Cookbook:Orange|oranges]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Yeast|yeast cake]]
==Directions==
# Wash the apricots in several changes of water, then dry and cut in halves. # Place in a large crock and pour on the warm water, reserving ½ cup of water in which to dissolve the yeast cake. # Stir in the sugars, fruit, raisins, and ginger. # Add the dissolved yeast and mix well. # Cover with the top of the crock and let stand. # Stir every other day. # After thirty days, strain the mixture and bottle it.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* '''Be sure to check with national, regional, and municipal laws, to produce wine lawfully!''' * '''Please drink alcoholic beverages responsibly, and have someone sober drive you, if you need to travel after imbibing.''' * '''Please do not share with underage people.''' * To jump start the yeast, dissolve in water with a pinch of the sugar the night before starting, and let stand covered with cloth or a paper towel in a warm place, like the top of the refrigerator. * An actual wine yeast from a wine making store or supplier would also improve outcome. * Extreme cleanliness will prevent spoiling due to bacteria or wild yeast. * For best fermentation, keep in a temperature you are comfortable in. Too cool and it ferments slower, too warm and it will ferment bitter, too hot and the yeast will die. ''They are alive, you know!''
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Beverage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Raisin recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Ginger recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Lemon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Orange recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fruit recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Homebrew recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Sauce recipes||4 days|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]]
Raspberry Vinegar
==Ingredients==
* 4 [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] [[Cookbook:Raspberry|raspberries]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]] * [[Cookbook:Sugar|Sugar]]
==Directions==
# Mash the berries and add the vinegar and let stand for four days. # To each cup of liquid, add one cup of sugar. # Bring to a [[Cookbook:Boil|boil]] and cook for 20 minutes. # Strain and bottle.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sauce recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|8|an hour or so|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Blueberry Cream Pie'''
==Ingredients==
=====Pie filling=====
* 1 (8-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]]) [225g] container [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * ¾ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (150g) [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]], [[Cookbook:Beat|beaten]] * 2½ cups (500g) fresh [[Cookbook:Blueberry|blueberries]] * 1 (9-inch or 23cm) unbaked [[Cookbook:Pie Crust|pie shell]]
=====Topping=====
* 3 tablespoons flour * 3 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 3 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Pecan|pecans]], [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]]
==Directions==
* Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|400°F]] (200°C).
=====Pie filling=====
# In a mixing bowl, combine sour cream, flour, sugar, vanilla and egg. # [[Cookbook:Beat|Beat]] until very smooth. # Fold in blueberries. # Pour filling into pie shell. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] for 25 minutes.
=====Topping=====
# In a small bowl, mix flour, butter and pecans, stirring well. # Sprinkle over pie and bake an additional 10 minutes. # Remove from oven. # Cool on [[Cookbook:Cooling Rack|wire rack]], then chill. A little whipped cream on top is a nice addition.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sour Cream recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Blueberry recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|8 slices|1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Cherry-Berry Jumble Fruit Pie'''
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] sweet [[Cookbook:Cherry|cherries]], canned with juice * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Cornstarch|cornstarch]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1¼ cups fresh [[Cookbook:Blueberry|blueberries]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Raspberry|raspberries]] * ¾ cup fresh [[Cookbook:Blackberry|blackberries]] * 1½ cups fresh [[Cookbook:Strawberries|strawberries]], sliced * 2 tablespoons strawberry preserves * 1 tablespoon fresh [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] * two ready-made or homemade [[Cookbook:Pie Crust|pie crusts]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], melted
==Directions==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. # Drain cherries, reserving juice; set cherries aside. # Add water to juice if necessary to make ½ cup liquid. # In a large [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]], mix together cherry juice, sugar, cornstarch and flour. # Stir until smooth. # Cook on medium heat until it starts to thicken. # Add fruit, preserves and lemon juice. # Mix well. # Place one crust in a 9-inch pie pan or plate. # Spoon in fruit filling. # Cut several slits in the middle of the second crust and place it over the filling. # Crimp the edges and brush with melted butter. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] until the pie is golden brown, 40 to 45 minutes. Oven temperatures vary, so the time may vary.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fruit recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: Reverted edit of [[Special:Contributions/71.127.217.241|71.127.217.241]], changed back to last version by Webaware
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Vegan recipes|4 servings|10 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegan cuisine|Vegan cuisine]]
'''Tofu bacon''' is easy to make. It can be used interchangeably with bacon in most recipes. Great with breakfast or in a b.l.t.
== Ingredients == * 1 block extra firm tofu * 3 tbsp vegetable oil * 3 tbsp soy sauce or tamari * 3 tbsp nutritional yeast * liquid smoke (optional)
== Instructions ==
Slice the tofu into thin strips (as bacon) and fry in a pan on medium, turning once, until crispy and gold brown on each side. Add soy sauce and one to two drops of liquid smoke (available in any large grocery store), toss with the tofu bacon slices, coat with nutritional yeast, and remove from heat.
Enjoy with friends.
[[Category:Vegan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tofu recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

page.title: Cookbook:Chicken with Orange, Spinach and Cherry Tomatoes

revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|4|prep 5 min, cooking 20 min|2|}} {{recipe}} | A simple recipe that combines vegetable and fruit with chicken. The recipe utilizes baking in foil, which is a great low-fat cooking method that produces wonderfully tender and juicy chicken. ==Ingredients== *4 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|Tbsp.]] minced fresh [[Cookbook:Dill|dill]] *4 [[Cookbook:tsp|tsp.]] grated [[Cookbook:Orange|orange]] peel *3 [[Cookbook:tsp|tsp.]] minced [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] *3/4 [[Cookbook:tsp|tsp.]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *4 [[Cookbook:cup|cup]] cherry tomatoes, halved *1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|Tbsp.]] olive oil *4 skinless boneless chicken breast halves, thinly sliced crosswise *4 [[Cookbook:cup|cups]] firmly packed torn fresh spinach leaves (about 8 ounces) ==Equipment and supplies== *large baking sheet *medium bowl *small bowl *aluminum foil ==Procedure== #Preheat oven to 400°F. #Place large baking sheet in oven to heat. #Mix dill, orange peel, garlic and salt in medium bowl. Season with pepper. #Combine tomatoes, oil and 1 teaspoon dill mixture in small bowl. #Add chicken to remaining dill mixture in medium bowl and toss to coat. #Cut 4 sheets of foil each about 20 inches long. #Arrange 1 cup spinach on 1 sheet of foil. #Place 1/4 of sliced chicken mixture atop spinach. #Spoon 1/4 of tomato mixture atop chicken. #Fold foil over, enclosing contents completely and crimping edges tightly to seal. #Repeat with remaining 3 foil sheets, forming 4 packets total. #Arrange foil packets in single layer on heated baking sheet. #Bake until chicken is just cooked through, about 15 minutes. #Transfer to plates; let stand 5 minutes. ==Notes, tips, and variations== *Serve with rice. ==References==
[[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Seafood recipes|4|an hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Rice|Rice]]
'''Smoking Shrimp Creole'''
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Canola Oil|canola oil]] * ¾ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * 1 small seeded [[Cookbook:Green Pepper|green bell pepper]] * 1 small [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]] rib, thinly sliced * 2 teaspoons finely chopped [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * 1 can (14-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]]) crushed [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaf]] * 1 teaspoon ground [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]] * ¼-½ ground chipotle chili * ¾ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] small or medium [[Cookbook:shrimp|shrimp]], shelled * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|black pepper]] * 2 cups cooked long-grain [[Cookbook:Rice|brown rice]]
==Directions==
# Heat the oil in a medium [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] over medium-high heat. # [[Cookbook:Sauté|Sauté]] the onion, celery, pepper, and garlic until the onion is translucent, 4 to 5 minutes. # Add the tomatoes, bay leaves, paprika, and chipotle chili. # [[Cookbook:Simmer|Simmer]] the sauce, uncovered, until it is thick, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring it 2 or 3 times. # Add the shrimp and cook, uncovered, until they are pink and firm, 5 to 7 minutes, depending on their size. # Season to taste with salt and pepper.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Serve over cooked brown rice.
[[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fried recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Shrimp recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rice recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Confection recipes|Makes 36|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Mexico|Mexican cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Native American cuisine|Native American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
Chocolate-Jalapeño Truffles
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Coffee|instant coffee powder]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] boiling [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 10 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] best-quality semisweet [[Cookbook:Chocolate|chocolate]], in small pieces or chips * 10 tablespoons (1¼ sticks) best-quality unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], cold and cut into small pieces * 2 or 3 [[Cookbook:Jalapeño|jalapeños]], roasted, peeled, seeded, and finely [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] (wear rubber gloves) * ½ cup unsweetened [[Cookbook:Cocoa Powder|cocoa powder]], [[Cookbook:Sift|sift]] onto a plate
==Directions==
# In a metal 1-[[Cookbook:Quart|quart]] mixing bowl, dissolve coffee in water. # Add the chocolate and set on top of a pan of gently [[Cookbook:Simmer|simmering]] water. # When the chocolate has softened completely but is not hot, remove from heat and stir until smooth. # [[Cookbook:Beat|Beat]] in the cold butter a small piece at a time, adding a new piece as soon as the previous one is almost absorbed. # Beat with a [[Cookbook:Mixer|hand-held electric mixer]] until creamy, about 10 minutes. # Continue beating for a few minutes to cool. (This can also be done in a stand mixer, fitted with the whip attachment.) # Add half of the jalapeños and taste. Add more jalapeño to your taste; remember that the heat will intensify with time. Try for a balance of sweet and heat. # Scrape into a small, deep container, press a piece of plastic wrap on the surface, and chill overnight, until completely firm. # Scoop out small balls and roll in the cocoa powder. # Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Roll the balls in finely chopped pistachios, almonds or macadamia nuts.
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Mexican recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Confection recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|8|1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
'''Corn and Shrimp Chowder'''
Ingredients:
* 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive oil]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrot]] chopped * 1 [[Cookbook:Garlic|clove garlic]], chopped * 3½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] canned [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Dill|dill seeds]] * 3 cups frozen [[Cookbook:Corn|corn]] kernels * 1½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] medium [[Cookbook:shrimp|shrimp]], shelled * ¼ cup light [[Cookbook:Cream|cream]] or [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1 tablespoon fresh [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]], chopped * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste
==Directions==
# In a large [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]], heat olive oil over low heat. # Add onion, carrot and garlic. # Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is transparent, about 5 minutes. # Add broth and dill seeds. # Bring to a [[Cookbook:Boil|boil]]. # Reduce heat and [[Cookbook:Simmer|simmer]], covered, for 20 minutes. # Add corn to broth and simmer, covered, until the corn is just tender, about 5 minutes. # In a [[Cookbook:Blender|blender]] or [[Cookbook:Food Processor|food processor]], [[Cookbook:Puree|puree]] the newly made chowder and pour it back into the saucepan. # Add shelled shrimp, simmer and cook until shrimp are almost done, about 1 minute. # Stir in milk and parsley, salt and pepper. # Bring mixture back to simmer. # Serve immediately.
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Seafood recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Carrot recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|20 slices|4½ hours|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
==Ingredients==
;Crust:
* 3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] vanilla wafer crumbs * ¾ cup (1½ sticks) unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], melted * 6 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|brown sugar]], light or dark
;Filling:
* 6 (8-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]]) bricks [[Cookbook:Cream Cheese|cream cheese]], softened * 6 tablespoons low-fat [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] * 1½ cups sugar * 6 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Cream|heavy cream]] * 4 teaspoons grated [[Cookbook:Orange|orange]] peel * [[Cookbook:Boiling|boiling]] [[Cookbook:Water|water]] (for baking cake)
;Topping:
* ¾ cup sugar
==Procedure==
* Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|325°F]].
;Crust:
# In a bowl, mix vanilla wafer crumbs, butter and brown sugar until well-blended. # Pat the wafer mixture into the bottom and sides of a 10-inch [[Cookbook:Springform Pan|springform pan]]. # Set aside.
;Filling:
# In a large bowl, mix cream cheese, sour cream and 1½ cups sugar on medium speed of [[Cookbook:Mixer|electric mixer]] until smooth. # Add eggs, heavy cream and orange peel. # Beat until all the mixture is smooth. #Pour cream cheese mixture into the springform pan. # Place the springform pan into a larger pan. # Add boiling water to the larger pan to come halfway up the sides of the springform pan. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] for 50 minutes or until set. # Carefully remove the springform pan from the water and cool at room temperature for 30 minutes. # Refrigerate for 3 hours. # Remove cake from the springform pan.
;Topping:
# Sprinkle sugar on top of cheesecake. # [[Cookbook:Broil|Broil]] under the oven broiler until the sugar melts and browns (be careful not to burn the sugar).
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* The sugar can also be melted with a cooking torch. * The cheesecake may be served with fresh or frozen strawberries or blueberries.
[[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Cheesecake recipes]] [[Category:Dessert recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]] [[Category:Sour Cream recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|2|1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]]
'''Lemon Chicken Pasta'''
==Ingredients==
* 12 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] (340g) boneless skinless [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken breasts]], cut into ½-inch (1cm) thick slices * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste * [[Cookbook:Oregano|Oregano]], to taste * About ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]], for dredging * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 2 (¼-inch-thick) (0.5cm) [[Cookbook:Lemon|Lemon slices]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Artichoke|artichoke hearts]], cut into quarters (canned is fine) * ½ cup (120g) oil-packed [[Cookbook:Tomato|sun-dried tomatoes]], drained * 4 [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic cloves]], peeled * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Caper|capers]] * [[Cookbook:Pinch|Pinch]] [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|crushed red pepper flakes]] * ½ cup (120ml) dry [[Cookbook:Wine|white wine]] * 3 ounces (¼ cup plus 2 tablespoons or 90g) [[Cookbook:Cream|heavy cream]] * 1 cup [240g] (loosely packed) [[Cookbook:Spinach|fresh spinach]] * Pinch [[Cookbook:Rosemary|fresh rosemary]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] (225g) [[Cookbook:Pasta|linguine]], cooked al dente and drained
==Directions==
# Season the chicken slices with salt, pepper, and oregano. # Dredge in flour, shaking off excess flour. # Heat a heavy-bottomed [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] or large [[Cookbook:Sauté|sauté pan]] (not non-stick) over high heat until very hot. # Add olive oil. # When oil begins to smoke, add the chicken pieces. # Cook until pieces are seared on both sides, 1 to 2 minutes per side. # Remove chicken to a plate and keep warm, leaving the oil in the pan. # Add the lemon slices to the hot pan and cook until [[Cookbook:Caramel|caramelized]], about 1 minute per side. # Add the artichokes, sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, capers, and red pepper flakes, and sauté for 2 minutes. # Add the white wine and cook until reduced to a glaze. # Return the chicken to the pan with the cream, and sauté for 2 minutes. # Add the spinach, rosemary, and cooked linguine. # Cook, tossing to combine linguine and sauce, just until spinach is wilted, about 1 minute. # Serve immediately.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fried recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Lemon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Spinach recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|10|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Pasta|Pasta]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
'''Sausage and Tortellini Soup'''
==Ingredients==
* [[Cookbook:Cooking Spray|Vegetable spray]] or 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive oil]] * 2 (19.76-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]]) packages sweet [[Cookbook:Sausage|Italian sausage]] * 2 (8-ounce) cartons sliced, fresh [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushrooms]] * 1 (9-ounce) bag fresh [[Cookbook:spinach|baby spinach]] * 2 (14-ounce) cans [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * 2 (32-ounce) cartons low-sodium [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * 1 (28-ounce) package fresh Three Cheese [[Cookbook:Pasta|Tortellini]] (from dairy case) * Grated [[Cookbook:Parmesan cheese|Parmesan cheese]] for [[Cookbook:Garnish|garnish]], optional
==Directions==
# Coat a large [[Cookbook:Stock Pot|stock pot]] with vegetable spray or 1 teaspoon olive oil. # Remove sausage from casings and heat over medium heat in stock pot until sausage is crumbled and no longer pink. # When the sausage is completely cooked, add sliced mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are [[Cookbook:Sauté|sautéed]]. # Add the entire bag of baby spinach. # Cook, stirring occasionally, until spinach is lightly sautéed. # Add diced tomatoes and stir thoroughly. # Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. # Add tortellini and [[Cookbook:Simmer|simmer]] on low for 10 to 15 minutes until the pasta is cooked. # [[Cookbook:Ladle|Ladle]] into soup bowls and sprinkle generously with Parmesan cheese.
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Italian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Meat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sausage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Mushroom recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Spinach recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

page.title: Cookbook:Sweet Mole and Vanilla Bean Ice Cream

revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|2|½ hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Mexico|Mexican cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Sweet Mole and Vanilla Bean Ice Cream'''
==Ingredients==
* 1 whole [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chile ancho (dried pepper)]] * ¾ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (4 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]]) piloncillo (brown sugar cane) * 1 [[Cookbook:Clove|clove]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] * 4 ounces semi-sweet dark [[Cookbook:Chocolate|chocolate]] bar, cut into pieces * 2 cups best quality [[Cookbook:Vanilla Bean|vanilla bean]] ice cream
==Directions==
# Wash, devein and remove seeds from chile ancho. # [[Cookbook:Boil|Boil]] the chile, then blend with the least amount of water possible. # Strain off water. # In a [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]], add [[Cookbook:Purée|pureed]], chile, piloncillo, clove, cinnamon and chocolate. # Boil for 3 minutes. # Remove clove. # To serve, allow vanilla ice cream to soften slightly in a bowl and stir in mole.
[[Cookbook:Southwestern cuisine|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Mexican recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chile recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Sandwich recipes|about 112 party-size sandwiches|½ hour|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]]
'''Vegetable Party Sandwiches'''
==Ingredients==
* 1 (¼-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]]) envelope unflavored [[Cookbook:Gelatine|gelatin]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] cold [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 2 large [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrots]], grated very fine * 2 ribs [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]], [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] very fine * 2 [[Cookbook:Cucumber|cucumbers]], peeled, seeded and chopped fine * 1 small [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], minced * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] * 1 pint [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]], such as Hellmann's * 2 long square loaves white [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]]
==Directions==
# Dissolve gelatin in water according to directions. # In a large bowl, mix dissolved gelatin with carrots, celery, cucumber, onion, lemon juice, and mayonnaise. # Refrigerate for 25 hours. # If the mixture becomes too jelled to spread well, add ⅓ to ½ cup more mayonnaise. # Using an electric knife, trim crusts from bread edges. # Spread vegetable mixture on bread and make 28 sandwiches. # Cut into quarters. # Layer cut sandwiches in a large covered plastic container with damp paper towels between layers until serving time.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Mushroom recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Carrot recipes|Tuscan Soup, (Meatless)]] [[Category:Celery recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cucumber recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Gelatin recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Onion recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

page.title: Cookbook:Mexican Chocolate Cake with Mocha Buttercream

revision.comment: New page: {{recipesummary|Cake recipes|10 servings|2 hours|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Mexico|Mexican cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday R...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Cake recipes|10 servings|2 hours|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Mexico|Mexican cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Mexican Chocolate Cake with Mocha Buttercream'''
==Ingredients==
* Nonstick [[Cookbook:Cooking Spray|cooking spray]] for the pan * 3 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] Ibarra or semisweet [[Cookbook:Chocolate|chocolate]] * 3 ounces unsweetened chocolate * 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] cake [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] (increase to 2 teaspoons if using the semisweet chocolate) * 1 cup (2 sticks) [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], softened * 1 cup plus 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] * 4 large [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * [[Cookbook:Mocha Buttercream|Mocha Buttercream]] * Cinnamon, unsweetened [[Cookbook:Cocoa Powder|cocoa]], and confectioner's sugar, optional toppings
==Directions==
# Preheat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. # Generously spray a deep 9-inch [[Cookbook:Springform Pan|springform pan]] with nonstick cooking spray. # Melt the chocolates in a [[Cookbook:Double Boiler|double boiler]] or in a [[Cookbook:Microwave Oven|microwave oven]] at low power. # Set aside to cool. # [[Cookbook:Sift|Sift]] together the flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon into a medium-size bowl. # Place the butter and sugar in a large mxing bowl and [[Cookbook:Cream|cream]] at high speed with an [[Cookbook:Mixer|electric mixer]]. # Add the vanilla and the eggs, one at a time, [[Cookbook:Beat|beating]] well after each. # Pour in the cooled chocolate mixture, and beat well until everything is incorporated. # Add ⅓ of the flour mixtue, and stir until it is just barely incorporated, then pour in half the milk. # Stir briefly, then repeat with another ⅓ of the flour and the remaining milk. # Add the rest of the flour mixture and stir just enough to blend. ''Don't overmix, or the cake will toughen.'' # Spread into the prepared pan and [[Cookbook:Bake|bake]] for 55 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. # Cool completely before assembling and frosting. # Cut the cake into 3 equal layers, using a long serrated knife and a gentle sawing motion. # Spread Mocha Buttercream between the layers, and stack them evenly. # Spread more buttercream on the sides and the top. # Artfully sprinkle the top with extra cinnamon, cocoa, and confectioner's sugar, if desired.
[[Category:Mexican recipes|Chocolate Cake with Mocha Buttercream, Mexican]] [[Category:Cake recipes|Chocolate Cake with Mocha Buttercream, Mexican]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Milk recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|1 cake|5 or 10 minutes|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Mexico|Mexican cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Mocha Buttercream'''
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (2 sticks) [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], softened * 3½ cups [[Cookbook:Sugar|confectioner's sugar]] (possibly a little more) * ½ cup unsweetened [[Cookbook:Cocoa Powder|cocoa powder]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] * ½ cup very strong [[Cookbook:Coffee|coffee]]
==Directions==
# Combine butter, confectioner's sugar, cocoa, vanilla, and coffee in a medium-large bowl, mixing slowly until everything is moistened. # [[Cookbook:Beat|Beat]] at high speed with an [[Cookbook:Mixer|electric mixer]] until uniform and fluffy. # If it seems a little too wet to spread, you can beat in up to ½ cup additional confectioner's sugar.
[[Category:Mexican recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Frosting and Icing recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|12|1 hour preparation
then 4 hours in refrigerator|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] ==Ingredients== ===Crust=== * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] * 2½ cups (12 ounces) bread [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 2 roasted [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|red bell pepper]], packed in oil ===Filling=== * 10 ounces [[Cookbook:Chocolate|milk chocolate]], cut into pieces * 1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter * ½ teaspoon vanilla * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Vodka|pepper vodka]] * 1¼ cups sugar * 3 eggs * 1¼ cups (6 ounces) bread flour ===Topping=== * 1 pint heavy whipping cream * 1 cup (4 ounces) confectioners' sugar * ¼ cup pepper vodka * 12 ounces white chocolate, melted * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Nutmeg|nutmeg]] ==Procedure== ===Crust=== # Place sugar, butter, egg and vanilla in a mixing bowl, and mix at low speed until combined. # Add flour and mix until incorporated; do not over mix. # Set the dough on a floured cookie pan and press flat. # Refrigerate until firm enough to roll out, 45 minutes to an hour. # After making filling, line an 11-inch cake pan with the crust. # Line the bottom of the unbaked tart shell with a single thin layer of red bell peppers that have been wiped free of most of the oil. ===Filling=== # Melt chocolate and butter over low heat in a [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]]. # Stir in vanilla. # Take off the heat and add pepper vodka and let cool slightly. # While the chocolate mixture is cooling, whip the sugar and eggs until light and fluffy. # Fold into cooled chocolate mixture. # [[Cookbook:Sift|Sift]] the flour into this mixture, making sure there are no lumps. # Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. # Pour chocolate mixture on top of red bell pepper layer, leaving ¾ inch at the top of pan. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] for about 20 minutes. The center should be soft, similar to a pumpkin pie when it is done. # Let cool before taking it out of the pan. # Refrigerate overnight before cutting. ===Topping=== # Whip cream and confectioners' sugar until peaks are thick, then slowly whip in vodka. # When vodka is completely mixed in, add melted white chocolate while whisking. # Refrigerate for 4 hours. # Top each piece with plenty of whipped cream, sprinkle lightly with nutmeg and enjoy. [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Nutmeg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|6|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
==Ingredients==
* 2 (14-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]]) cans fat-free vegetable [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 1 (1-[[Cookbook:Pound|pound]]) bag frozen [[Cookbook:Mixed vegetables|mixed vegetables]] * 1 (14½-ounce) can no-salt-added [[Cookbook:Stew|stewed]] [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * ⅓ cup broken [[Cookbook:Pasta|angel-hair pasta]], in 1 to 2-inch lengths * 1 (15-ounce) can no-salt-added [[Cookbook:Kidney Bean|kidney beans]] * 1 (15-ounce) can no-salt-added [[Cookbook:Black Bean|black beans]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] Italian seasoning * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic powder]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|Parmesan cheese]]
==Procedure==
# Pour broth and water into a 4½-[[Cookbook:Quart|quart]] [[Cookbook:Dutch Oven|Dutch Oven]] or soup pot. # Place pot over high heat. # While liquid is heating, add frozen vegetables, stewed tomatoes with their juices and uncooked pasta. # Cover pot and bring to [[Cookbook:Boil|boil]]. # Meanwhile, rise and drain beans. # When soup comes to a boil, uncover it and stir well. (''Scrape the pot with a [[Cookbook:Wooden Spoon|wooden spoon]] to loosen any pasta.'') # Add beans, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder. # Reduce heat to medium-high or medium, maintaining a moderate boil. # Stir frequently and cook until pasta is tender, about 5 minutes. # Reduce heat to low and add Parmesan. # Stir occasionally and simmer for 5 minutes to develop the flavor. # Serve at once or simmer on low until ready to serve.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bean recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Pasta|Pasta]]
'''Skillet Lasagna''' is a lasagne style casserole that tastes just like real lasagne, but is ready a lot faster.
==Ingredients== * 1 pound lean [[Cookbook:Ground Beef|ground beef]] * 1 26. oz jar of [[Cookbook:Spaghetti Sauce|pasta sauce]] * 1 cup shredded [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|mozzarella cheese]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|green bell pepper]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 1/3 cup Italian [[Cookbook:Salad Dressing|salad dressing]] * 10 uncooked [[Cookbook:Pasta|noodles]], broken into squares * 1 clove [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]]
==Procedure==
=== Preparing the noodles=== # Boil one clove of garlic in a saucepan. # Add noodles and cook until tender. # Remove from heat and set aside.
=== Preparing the Meat=== # Brown one pound of ground beef in heavy skillet. Drain grease. # Add pasta sauce, water, dressing, and bell pepper. # Stir until well combined and bell pepper is tender. # Cover and let simmer under medium heat for 5 minutes. # Drain noodles and add to meat. Stir until well combined. # Cover and let stand under low heat for 5 minutes. # Add cheese and stir well, then turn off heat and let cool.
[[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{Cookwork}} {{recipe}}
'''Rumaki''' is a pūpū (hors d'œuvre) of [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Hawaii|Hawaiian]] origin. Its ingredients and method of preparation vary, but usually it consists of water chestnuts and pieces of chicken liver wrapped in bacon and marinated in soy sauce and either ginger or brown sugar.
(Yes, you can actually get away with serving liver to your guests.)
''The Rumaki recipe is a classic party appetizer recipe, proving that anything wrapped in bacon tastes good—even liver. But you can opt for scallops, shrimp or stuffed olives, instead.''
== Ingredients ==
===Rumaki=== *12 slices [[Cookbook:bacon|bacon]], halved crosswise *12 ounces [[Cookbook:chicken liver|chicken liver]]s, halved *12 whole [[Cookbook:water chestnuts|water chestnuts]], halved
===Marinade=== *¼ cup [[Cookbook:soy sauce|soy sauce]] *1 teaspoon fresh minced [[Cookbook:ginger|ginger]] *2 tablespoons dry [[Cookbook:sherry|sherry]] *1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:sugar|sugar]]
==Procedure== #The Rumaki recipe begins with the marinade: Combine soy sauce, ginger, sherry and sugar in a small bowl. Add the chicken livers and water chestnut pieces and marinate them in the refrigerator for 1/2 hour. #Place 1 chicken liver piece and 1 chestnut piece in the center of each bacon-half, wrap, and secure with a toothpick. #Place the Rumaki on a [[Cookbook:broiler pan|broiler pan]] or shallow [[Cookbook:baking pan|baking pan]] and [[Cookbook:broil|broil]], about 5 or 6 inches from the heat, until the bacon is crisp, about 10 to 15 minutes. Or, you may bake the appetizers in a 375 °F oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 24 appetizers.
==Notes, tips, and variations== *Add fresh sliced [[Cookbook:scallion|scallion]]s to the combination above. *Substitute [[Cookbook:Scallop|sea scallops]] for the chicken livers and/or water chestnuts. *Omit marinade and wrap bacon around [[Cookbook:Smoked Oysters|smoked oysters]], stuffed [[Cookbook:Olive|green olives]], or [[Cookbook:pineapple|pineapple]] chunks. *[[Cookbook:Shrimp Rumaki|Shrimp Rumaki]]: 1 medium shrimp with 1 whole water chestnut and a piece of green onion, with or without the marinade.
== References == * [http://www.epicurious.com/recipes/recipe_views/views/106255?id=106255 Epicurious.com] * [http://recipes.epicurean.com/recipe/2354/rumaki.html Epicurean.com] alternate recipe, substituting chicken livers with pineapples
[[Category:Hawaiian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Suriname|Cuisine of Suriname]]
'''Pastei''' is a very old dish and was brought to Suriname by the Jewish settlers. It is a simple dish made from chicken, carrots and peas, and closely resembles chicken pot pie. It is served best with plain white rice.
==Ingredients==
===For the dough===
* 200 g [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] or [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] * 250 g [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 2 dl (200 ml) cold [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 2 tsp [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
===For the filling===
* 3 large pieces of [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] (drumstick and thigh, breast, what have you. I use breast most often.) * 3 [[Cookbook:Pickle|pickles]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Hard Boiled Eggs|hard boiled eggs]] * 1 or 2 cans of [[Cookbook:Pea|peas]] and [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrots]] * 1 tblsp [[Cookbook:Piccalilli|piccalilli]] ([[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]] can be substituted) * 2 large [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * [[Cookbook:Allspice|allspice]] * 1 piece of young [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]] * 1 fresh [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chili pepper]] (or [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|bell pepper]] if preferred) (optional) * 2 tblsp [[Cookbook:Ketchup|ketchup]] * 150 g [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] or [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaf]] * 1 tsp [[Cookbook:Worcestershire Sauce|Worcestershire sauce]] (optional) * 1 large [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] or [[Cookbook:Bouillon Cubes|bouillon cubes]] to get the right taste.
==Procedure==
===For the dough===
# Mix the butter with an electric mixer or a wooden spoon. Keep adding little bits of the water until the butter has absorbed it all. # Sift the flour, baking powder and the salt all together and add this through the butter gradually. To see if the dough is rollable, press your finger on it and if the dough doesn't stick to it, it's fine. If the dough does stick however, add about 25 more grams of flour. # Roll out the dough to make it flat. # Put the flattened dough in a baking pan or aluminum foil pan (the pan has to be buttered on the inside before the dough is put in it). Press the dough to the corners of the pan so that as much filling as possible can go in. Do not use all the dough for the inside of the pan, because after the pan has been filled, it needs to be closed off at the top with dough as well.
===For the filling===
# Wash the chicken (if necessary). # For about half an hour, cook the chicken, 100 g butter, fine chopped onion, 2 or 3 bouillon cubes, the fresh pepper, the bay leaf and some allspice in about 1 or 1.5 cups of water. # After this time, strip the chicken (discarding the bones) into little pieces. # Put the rest of the butter in the broth in which the chicken had been boiled. # In a pan, put a little bit of oil and when that is hot, add a little bit of fine chopped onion. # Add the chicken. After a minute add the chopped tomatoes and the peas and carrots. # Every so often, add a little bit of the chicken broth to the pan so that it won't burn. # Add the chopped pickles. # After the broth has been added and the whole seems good, taste to see if it has enough salt, otherwise add some. # After the whole has cooled off a bit, get the baking pan with the dough already in it put the chicken and sch in the pan until it is nicely filled. # Slice your cooked eggs and place them on top of the filling in the pan. # After this is done, the baking pan can be closed off with another piece of dough on the top of the pan. Try to close it up as best as possible. # Put the pastei in a preheated oven and leave it for about ¾ of an hour. # A few minutes before you take it out of the oven, you can lightly streak the top with some whisked egg to make the top shiny and a little crisp.
Enjoy.
[[Category:Surinamese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Pie recipes|1 pie|1 hour|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Choco-Nutty Pie'''
==Ingredients==
* ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], melted and cooled * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]], [[Cookbook:Beat|beaten]] slightly * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1 (6-ounce) package [[Cookbook:Chocolate Chips|chocolate chips]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Nut|nuts]] (your choice) * 1 unbaked [[Cookbook:Pie Crust|pastry pie shell]]
==Directions==
# Combine the first four ingredients and mix until well blended. # Stir in chocolate chips, vanilla, and nuts. # Pour into unbaked pie shell and [[Cookbook:Baking|bake]] at [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]] for 45 to 50 minutes. # Let cool before cutting.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pie recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Cookie recipes|Makes about a dozen and a half|15 minutes|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Choco-Crunch Cookies'''
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Sunflower Seeds|sunflower seeds]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Raisin|raisins]], [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] * 1 cup mini-[[Cookbook:Chocolate Chips|chocolate chips]] * ¼ cup rice crispies * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Peanut Butter|peanut butter]]
=====Topping=====
* ½ cup [[Cookbook:Powdered Sugar|powdered sugar]] or * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Coconut|coconut]]
==Directions==
# Mix all ingredients except the topping together. # Form into 1-inch balls by pressing the mixture firmly together with clean hands. # Gently roll in either the powdered sugar or coconut. # Cover and refrigerate any leftovers.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cookie recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Coconut recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|4|2 hours|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the Mediterranean|Mediterranean cuisine]]
'''Mediterranean Green Chicken'''
==Ingredients==
* 1 bunch [[Cookbook:Parsley|curly parsley]], washed * 2 [[Cookbook:Shallot|shallots]], peeled and coarsely [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Garlic|cloves garlic]] * 6 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 3 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Dijon Mustard|Dijon mustard]] * 1 tablespoons Italian herb blend * Juice of 1 [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemon]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 whole [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]], cut up (or any 8 chicken pieces - any combination of leg, breast, thigh, and wing)
==Directions==
# In a [[Cookbook:Blender|blender]] or [[Cookbook:Food Processor|food processor]], combine parsley, shallots, garlic, olive oil, mustard, Italian herb blend, lemon juice, pepper, and salt. # [[Cookbook:Purée|Purée]]. # Transfer mixture to a [[Cookbook:Gallon|gallon]] zip-lock bag. # Add chicken, making sure are covered on all sides by the [[Cookbook:Marinating|marinate]]. # Seal bag and refrigerate for an hour. # Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|300°F]]. # Transfer chicken pieces to a rimmed baking sheet. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] about 40 minutes, turning pieces after 20 minutes, until juices run clear.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Mediterranean recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: New page: {{recipesummary|Confection recipes|Makes about 2 dozen|1 hour|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Confection recipes|Makes about 2 dozen|1 hour|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Nutty Brownie Bars'''
==Ingredients==
* 1 regular package [[Cookbook:Brownie|brownie]] mix * 3 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] sweetened condensed [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Almond|almonds]] * ¼ cup chopped [[Cookbook:Walnut|walnuts]] * 10 miniature [[Cookbook:Chocolate|chocolate]] [[Cookbook:Coconut|coconut]] candy bars, chopped
==Directions==
# Prepare brownie mix according to package directions, reducing oil to 3 tablespoons. # Pour into lightly greased 9-by-3-inch pan. # Spread condensed milk over the brownie batter. # Sprinkle with chopped nuts and candy bars. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] at [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]] for 35 to 38 minutes or until done. # Cool completely. # Cut into bars.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Confection recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Coconut recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Milk recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|2|1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
'''Orange Brulée'''
==Ingredients==
* 1 large [[Cookbook:Orange|navel orange]] * 1 large Cara Cara orange * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Butter|unsalted butter]], melted * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Sugar|brown sugar]] * [[Cookbook:Pinch|Pinch]] [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] * [[Cookbook:Vanilla|Vanilla]] [[Cookbook:Yogurt|yogurt]] * [[Cookbook:Mint|Mint sprigs]], for optional [[Cookbook:Garnish|garnish]]
==Directions==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Broiling|broil]] and position rack on the second from top position. # Cut off ends of each orange, then cut off the rind using a paring knife, making certain that no bitter white pith remains. # Cut each orange crosswise into thirds and place in an oven proof baking dish. # Combine melted butter with brown sugar, then spread over orange rounds. # Sprinkle with cinnamon. # Place oranges in the oven and broil several minutes until the oranges are hot and begin to form brown spots on the tops.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* The deep ruby color of the Cara Cara orange contrasts beautifully with the navel orange, but you can use two navel oranges if you prefer.
==Uses==
* To serve, arrange oranges in pretty stemmed glassware and drizzle with any cooking juices. Top with a dollop of yogurt and a mint sprig.
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Confection recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fruit recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Fruit recipes|8, ½-cup servings|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Midwestern cuisine|Midwestern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] '''Homemade Light Applesauce'''
''This is a nice applesauce to enjoy any time, but especially with latkes during Hanukkah. You don't need to get your blender dirty; you just need a potato masher and a little elbow grease.'' ==Ingredients== * 3 [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] (1300g) [[Cookbook:Apple|apples]] (whichever type you prefer), peeled, cored, and [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] (about 8 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]]) * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 6 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Sugar|granulated sugar]] * 6 tablespoons Splenda® * Juice from 1 [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemon]] (about 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]]) * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|ground cinnamon]] or apple pie spice ==Directions== # Put chopped apples in a large non-stick [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]] and stir in water, sugar, Splenda®, and lemon juice. # Bring mixture to a [[Cookbook:Boil|boil]], cover, and reduce heat to medium-low. # Cook until apples are tender (about 10 minutes). # Use a [[Cookbook:Potato Masher|potato masher]] to break cooked apples up into a nice [[Cookbook:Purée|purée]]. # Stir in ground cinnamon or apple pie spice. # Serve warm or cold. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Fish recipes|4|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Fish|Fish]]
'''Honey-Peppered Salmon'''
==Ingredients==
* ¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Honey|honey]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Dijon Mustard|Dijon mustard]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Garlic|cloves garlic]], minced * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Cayenne pepper|cayenne]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Coriander|ground coriander]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|fresh lemon juice]] * [[Cookbook:Kosher|Kosher]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]], to taste * 4 (6-ounce) center-cut [[Cookbook:Salmon|salmon]] fillets
==Directions==
