# In a shallow dish, combine oil, honey, mustard, garlic, cayenne, coriander, lemon juice, and salt. # Mix well. # Add salmon and let [[Cookbook:Marinating|marinate]] at room temperature for 30 minutes. # Preheat oven to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. # Grease a baking dish. # Remove salmon from marinade and place in a prepared dish. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] for 10 to 12 minutes or until desired "doneness".
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Salmon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Suriname|Cuisine of Suriname]]
'''Kipspek''', which literally translates into "chickenbacon" is a very easy snack that they used to make in the restaurant my mother managed.
==Ingredients==
* 1 or 2 [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken breasts]] (cubed) * [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]] (in strips) * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]] * 1 or 2 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * [[Cookbook:Bread Crumb|breadcrumbs]] (These breadcrumbs should be very fine, almost like a powder) * [[Cookbook:Toothpick|toothpicks]] * [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]]
==Procedure== # Put some salt and black pepper on the chicken so that it has some flavor. # Take the strips of bacon and wrap the each cube of chicken into a separate strip. # To make sure the bacon doesn't roll of the chicken, stick a toothpick from one end to the other. # Roll the kipspek in the breadcrumbs. # Whisk the egg(s) and for every kipspek, drop it in the egg quickly and take it out. # Roll the kipspek through the breadcrumbs once again. # leave them for about half an hour. # heat the oil in a frying pot. # Fry the kipspek's until they're golden brown. # Serve with ketchup or mustard
Don't forget to remove the toothpick before taking a bite.
Enjoy
[[Category:Surinamese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: New page: {{recipesummary|Fish recipes|4|¾ hour|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Fish|Fish]] '''Thin Fish Fillets''' ==Ingredients== * 4 (...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Fish recipes|4|¾ hour|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Fish|Fish]]
'''Thin Fish Fillets'''
==Ingredients==
* 4 (6-ounce) flounder or other flat [[Cookbook:Fish|fish]] fillets * [[Cookbook:Olive oil|Olive Oil]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] dry [[Cookbook:Wine|vermouth]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] (¼ stick) unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], softened * [[Cookbook:Kosher|Kosher]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * Freshly ground [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|black pepper]] * 4 [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemon]] wedges
==Directions==
# At least 20 minutes before you plan to cook, preheat [[Cookbook:Broil|broiler]]. # Lightly oil bottom of a 9- by 13-inch ovenproof dish. # Arrange fillets in a single layer in the dish. # Pour in vermouth, using only enough to be about ½ inch deep. # Put pan under broiler and broil the fish as close to the heat as possible for about 2 minutes. # Remove and quickly spread softened butter over the fillets. # Return the pan to the broiler and cook for about 5 minutes more, until fish is just cooked through. # Remove fish from the broiler. # Salt and pepper each fillet and serve it with lemon wedges.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|2|1 hour-
Marinating Time: 30 minutes
Cook Time: 15 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Poultry|Poultry]] '''Italian Marinated Chicken''' ==Ingredients== * 1¾ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (420g) [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] canned [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]], drained * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] grated [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|Parmesan cheese]] * ½ teaspoon Italian seasoning, crushed * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic powder]] * 6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves ==Directions== # Mix broth, tomatoes, cheese, Italian seasoning and garlic powder in a shallow non-metallic dish. # Add chicken and turn to coat. # Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. # Remove chicken from broth mixture. # Grill or [[Cookbook:Broiling|broil]] chicken for 15 minutes or until done, turning and brushing often with broth mixture. # Discard remaining broth mixture. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fried recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Garlic recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Pie recipes|6 to 8 servings|2 hours|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 (3.4-ounces) package banana cream-flavored pudding mix * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 5 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] coffee liqueur, divided * 1 (8-ounce) container frozen whipped topping * 2 bananas, sliced * 1 (6-ounce) [[Cookbook:Chocolate|chocolate]] [[Cookbook:Graham Cracker|Graham cracker]] [[Cookbook:Pie Crust|pie crust]] * 3 (1.4-ounce) toffee candy bars, [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]]
==Procedure==
# Combine pudding mix, milk, and 4 tablespoons liqueur (If desired) in a medium bowl. # Stir with [[Cookbook:Whisk|wire whisk]] until smooth. # Gently fold 1 cup whipped topping into pudding mix. # Toss banana slices with remaining 1 tablespoon liqueur (if desired) and arrange over crust. # Sprinkle with half of chopped candy. # Spoon pudding mixture over chopped candy. # Cover and chill 1½ hours until set. # Spoon remaining whipped topping on top of pie just before serving. # Sprinkle with remaining chopped candy.
[[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pie recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pudding and Custard recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Banana recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Milk recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Pasta recipes|6|½ hour|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Pasta|Pasta]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 (20-ounce) package Italian [[Cookbook:Sausage|sausage]] * 1 (26½-ounce) can meat-flavored [[Cookbook:Spaghetti Sauce|spaghetti sauce]] * 1 (6-ounce) can tomato paste * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] hot [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 8 ounces dry penne [[Cookbook:Pasta|pasta]], cooked according to package directions * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] shredded [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|Parmesan cheese]]
==Directions==
# Remove casings from sausages. # Cook sausage in large [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] over medium heat until browned and crumbled; drain. # Stir in spaghetti sauce, tomato paste, and water. # Add pasta and stir until well coated. # Bring to a [[Cookbook:Boiling|boil]]. # Reduce heat, [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] over low heat 10 minutes or until heated through. # Sprinkle with cheese.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sausage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

page.title: Cookbook:New Orleans Style Chicken Wing Dipping Sauce

revision.comment: not a chicken recipe, removed cats and moved things around a little
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Sauce recipes|8 to 10|2 hours|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Mardi Gras Recipes]]
'''New Orleans Style Chicken Wing Dipping Sauce'''.
==Ingredients==
* 1 (12-ounce) jar of refrigerated chunky blue cheese dressing * ¾ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] Creole [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]] * ⅓ cup [[Cookbook:Scallion|scallions]], finely [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] (reserve a teaspoon of chopped green tops for [[Cookbook:Garnish|garnish]]) * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] Creole seasoning
==Procedure==
# Combine all ingredients and refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving (overnight is preferable).
==Notes, tips and variations==
* Serve as a dipping sauce for celery stalks and cooked [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken wings]] (baked, broiled, fried, or grilled), 24 pieces of wings (tips discarded) or "drummettes" for the quantities given. * Can use with any other raw vegetable.
[[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sauce recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Sandwich recipes|6|½ hour|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]]
==Ingredients==
* 6 large [[Cookbook:English Muffins|English muffins]], split and buttered * grated [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|Parmesan cheese]] * 1½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (6 ounces) shredded [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar cheese]] * 6 [[Cookbook:Hot Dog|frankfurters]] * 1 (10.5 ounce) can [[Cookbook:Pizza Sauce|pizza sauce]] * 1 cup (4 ounces) shredded [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|mozzarella cheese]]
==Directions==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. # Sprinkle buttered muffins with Parmesan cheese. # [[Cookbook:Toast|Toast]] under [[Cookbook:Broiling|broiler]] until golden brown. # Place 1½ [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] of shredded cheddar cheese on each muffin. # Cut frankfurters crosswise in ¼-inch slices; arrange on muffins. # Top each with about 2 tablespoons of pizza sauce, sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of mozzarella cheese. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] 12 to 15 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: moved vegetarian information to Notes, tips, variations
revision.text:
{{recipesummary | Category = Chinese recipes | Servings = 2 | Time = 30 minutes | Rating = 2 | Image = [[Image:Mapo tofu.JPG|300px]] }} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of China|Cuisine of China]]
'''Mápó dòufu''' (麻婆豆腐) is a classic spicy tofu and meat dish from Szechuan province in [[Cookbook:Cuisine of China|China]]. It is very flavoursome, easy to prepare, and best of all, spicy!
==Ingredients==
* 200g (7 oz) [[Cookbook:Mincing|minced]] [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]], [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]] * 500g (1 lb) [[Cookbook:Tofu|silken tofu]], cubed * small piece of [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]], minced (about 2 tsp) * 4 cloves of [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], minced * 2 tbsp [[Cookbook:Chili Bean Paste|chili bean paste]] * 1-2 tsp crushed dried [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chili]] pepper * 1 tbsp [[Cookbook:Szechuan Pepper|Szechuan pepper]], roasted and ground * 1 tbsp [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], sliced * 3-4 [[Cookbook:Green onion|green onions]], cut into 2cm (1") pieces * 1 tbsp [[Cookbook:Rice Wine|rice wine]] * 2-3 [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushrooms]] – tree ears preferred (optional)
==Procedure==
# If adding dried mushrooms, soak these in hot water for 10 minutes while preparing the rest of the ingredients, then slice before adding later. # [[Cookbook:Sautéing|Sauté]] the onion with the ginger and crushed chili. # Add the minced meat and garlic, and fry until brown. # Mix in the other ingredients (including sliced mushrooms), lower heat, and simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Serve over steamed [[Cookbook:Rice|jasmine rice]].
==Notes, tips and variations== * Some extra chili pepper can be substituted for Szechuan pepper, but the taste and mouthfeel will be different (no numbness). * A little ground [[Cookbook:Coriander|coriander]] and [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] are very nice in this dish, especially if you can't get the Szechuan pepper easily. * A [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|red bell pepper]], a tomato, and fresh [[Cookbook:Cilantro|coriander leaf]] are all welcome additions, though not traditional. * The meal is just as good with whole [[Cookbook:Legume|beans]] instead of tofu. * A vegetarian version of this meal can be made by substituting the meat with [[Cookbook:Ground_Tofu|ground tofu]] (e.g. [http://shiokfood.com/notes/archives/000016.html Shiok Food's Vegetarian Ma Po Tofu])
{{Wikipedia|Mapo doufu}}
[[Category:Chinese recipes]] [[Category:Tofu recipes]] [[Category:Chile recipes]] [[Category:Pork recipes]] [[Category:Beef recipes]] [[Category:Gluten-free recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] {{recipesummary|Cheesecake recipes||Slightly less than an hour|2}}
==Ingredients==
===Crust=== *1¼ cups of [[Cookbook:shortbread|shortbread]] crumbs *¼ cup of ground [[Cookbook:Almond|almonds]] *2 tablespoons of [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *1/8 teaspoon of almond extract *3 tablespoons of melted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]]
===Filling=== *175 grams of chopped white [[Cookbook:chocolate|chocolate]] *1.5 kilograms of soft [[Cookbook:Cream Cheese|cream cheese]] *250 grams of soft light cream cheese *5 room temperature large [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] *¾ cup of sugar *3 tablespoons of [[Cookbook:flour|flour]] *1 teaspoon of [[Cookbook:vanilla|vanilla essence]] *¼ teaspoon of almond extract
==Procedure==
#Mix ingredients for the crust (shortbread crumbs, ground almonds, sugar, almond extract and melted butter) and press into the bottom of a springform pan. #Bake at 200 degrees for 5-6 minutes. #Remove from oven and cool. #When cool, grease the sides of the pan lightly. #Melt and cool the chocolate. #Mix together cream cheeses, then add eggs, one at a time. #Mix in sugar, flour, vanilla, and almond extract. #Stir 1 cup of mixture into the chocolate, then mix all. #Pour into the pan and bake at 160 degrees for 40 minutes.
[[Category:Cheesecake recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Pancake recipes|8 4-inch pancakes|prep 10 minutes
5 minutes per skillet of pancakes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] ==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] all-purpose bleached [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Buttermilk|buttermilk]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], melted * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla extract]] * [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|Vegetable oil]] for brushing [[Cookbook:Griddle|griddle]] ==Procedure== # Heat a large non-stick [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] or griddle over low heat while preparing ingredients. # Mix flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in medium bowl. # [[Cookbook:Microwave Oven|Microwave]] buttermilk and milk in a 2-cup Pyrex measuring cup to room temperature, 20 to 30 seconds. # [[Cookbook:Whisk|Whisk]] in egg, butter, and vanilla. # Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and whisk until just mixed. # Return batter to measuring cup, stirring in a teaspoon or two of [[Cookbook:Water|water]], if necessary, to make a thick, but pourable batter. # Increase heat to medium and generously brush skillet or griddle with oil. # When oil starts to spider, but before it starts to smoke, pour batter, about ¼ cup at a time. # Work in batches, if necessary, to avoid overcrowding. # When pancake bottoms are golden brown and tops start to bubble, 2 to 3 minutes, flip pancakes. # Cook until pancakes are golden brown on remaining side. # Repeat, brushing skillet or griddle with oil. # Serve hot. ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * Use all-purpose flour (which is softer than unbleached), not unbleached flour to make a tender pancake. * If using salted butter, reduce salt to ¼ teaspoon. * I usually substitute a tablespoon of lemon juice (or vinegar) in milk for the buttermilk. * Pancake batter should pour, not glug! On the other hand, runny batter makes thin, oddly shaped pancakes that frequently collide on the griddle. Stir in a touch more flour into thin batter. For batter that's too thick, whisk in water, a teaspoon at a time. * The temperature of the pan or griddle is important: too hot and the pancakes are dark and raw; too cool and they're blond and hard. For tender, golden brown pancakes, heat the pan or griddle on low while you make the batter. Then increase the heat to medium and generously brush the pan or griddle with oil. It's ready when the oil starts to shimmer and, in any skillet or griddle other than non-stick, sends out tendrils that resemble an octopus or spider. But if the pan starts to smoke, set it down off the burner until the smoking subsides and the oil cools a bit. * This recipe easily doubles for a crowd. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pancake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Milk recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vanilla recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Pancake recipes|8 4-inch pancakes|prep 10 minutes
5 minutes per skillet of pancakes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] ==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] all-purpose bleached [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Buttermilk|buttermilk]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], melted * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Almond|almond]] extract * [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|Vegetable oil]] for brushing [[Cookbook:Griddle|griddle]] ==Procedure== # Heat a large non-stick [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] or griddle over low heat while preparing ingredients. # Mix flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in medium bowl. # [[Cookbook:Microwave Oven|Microwave]] buttermilk and milk in a 2-cup Pyrex measuring cup to room temperature, 20 to 30 seconds. # [[Cookbook:Whisk|Whisk]] in egg, butter, and almond extract. # Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and whisk until just mixed. # Return batter to measuring cup, stirring in a teaspoon or two of [[Cookbook:Water|water]], if necessary, to make a thick, but pourable batter. # Increase heat to medium and generously brush skillet or griddle with oil. # When oil starts to spider, but before it starts to smoke, pour batter, about ¼ cup at a time. # Work in batches, if necessary, to avoid overcrowding. # When pancake bottoms are golden brown and tops start to bubble, 2 to 3 minutes, flip pancakes. # Cook until pancakes are golden brown on remaining side. # Repeat, brushing skillet or griddle with oil. # Serve hot. ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * Use all-purpose flour (which is softer than unbleached), not unbleached flour to make a tender pancake. * If using salted butter, reduce salt to ¼ teaspoon. * I usually substitute a tablespoon of lemon juice (or vinegar) in milk for the buttermilk. * Pancake batter should pour, not glug! On the other hand, runny batter makes thin, oddly shaped pancakes that frequently collide on the griddle. Stir in a touch more flour into thin batter. For batter that's too thick, whisk in water, a teaspoon at a time. * The temperature of the pan or griddle is important: too hot and the pancakes are dark and raw; too cool and they're blond and hard. For tender, golden brown pancakes, heat the pan or griddle on low while you make the batter. Then increase the heat to medium and generously brush the pan or griddle with oil. It's ready when the oil starts to shimmer and, in any skillet or griddle other than non-stick, sends out tendrils that resemble and octopus or spider. But if the pan starts to smoke, set it down off the burner until the smoking subsides and the oil cools a bit. * This recipe easily doubles for a crowd. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pancake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Almond recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Milk recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Pancake recipes|8 4-inch pancakes|prep 10 minutes
5 minutes per skillet of pancakes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] ==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] all-purpose bleached [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Nutmeg|nutmeg]] * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Buttermilk|buttermilk]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], melted * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla extract]] * [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|Vegetable oil]] for brushing [[Cookbook:Griddle|griddle]] * 2 small [[Cookbook:Banana|bananas]], thinly sliced ==Directions== # Heat a large non-stick [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] or griddle over low heat while preparing ingredients. # Mix flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in medium bowl. # [[Cookbook:Whisk|Whisk]] nutmeg into dry ingredients. # [[Cookbook:Microwave Oven|Microwave]] buttermilk and milk in a 2-cup Pyrex measuring cup to room temperature, 20 to 30 seconds. # Whisk in egg, butter, and vanilla. # Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and whisk until just mixed. # Return batter to measuring cup, stirring in a teaspoon or two of [[Cookbook:Water|water]], if necessary, to make a thick, but pourable batter. # Increase heat to medium and generously brush skillet or griddle with oil. # When oil starts to spider, but before it starts to smoke, pour batter, about ¼ cup at a time. # Drop 5 or 6 slices of banana over the uncooked side of each pancake as it cooks. # Work in batches, if necessary, to avoid overcrowding. # When pancake bottoms are golden brown and tops start to bubble, 2 to 3 minutes, flip pancakes. # Cook until pancakes are golden brown on remaining side. # Repeat, brushing skillet or griddle with oil. # Serve hot. ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * Use all-purpose flour (which is softer than unbleached), not unbleached flour to make a tender pancake. * If using salted butter, reduce salt to ¼ teaspoon. * I usually substitute a tablespoon of lemon juice (or vinegar) in milk for the buttermilk. * Pancake batter should pour, not glug! On the other hand, runny batter makes thin, oddly shaped pancakes that frequently collide on the griddle. Stir in a touch more flour into thin batter. For batter that's too thick, whisk in water, a teaspoon at a time. * The temperature of the pan or griddle is important: too hot and the pancakes are dark and raw; too cool and they're blond and hard. For tender, golden brown pancakes, heat the pan or griddle on low while you make the batter. Then increase the heat to medium and generously brush the pan or griddle with oil. It's ready when the oil starts to shimmer and, in any skillet or griddle other than non-stick, sends out tendrils that resemble and octopus or spider. But if the pan starts to smoke, set it down off the burner until the smoking subsides and the oil cools a bit. * This recipe easily doubles for a crowd. {{recipesummary|Pancake recipes|8 4-inch pancakes|prep 10 minutes
5 minutes per skillet of pancakes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] ==Ingredients== * ¾ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] all-purpose bleached [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Cornmeal|fine yellow corn meal]] * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Buttermilk|buttermilk]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], melted * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla extract]] * [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|Vegetable oil]] for brushing [[Cookbook:Griddle|griddle]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Corn|frozen corn]] ==Procedure== # Heat a large non-stick [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] or griddle over low heat while preparing ingredients. # Mix flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in medium bowl. # [[Cookbook:Whisk|Whisk]] corn meal into dry ingredients. # [[Cookbook:Microwave Oven|Microwave]] buttermilk and milk in a 2-cup Pyrex measuring cup to room temperature, 20 to 30 seconds. # Whisk in egg, butter, and vanilla. # Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and whisk until just mixed. # Return batter to measuring cup, stirring in a teaspoon or two of [[Cookbook:Water|water]], if necessary, to make a thick, but pourable batter. # Increase heat to medium and generously brush skillet or griddle with oil. # When oil starts to spider, but before it starts to smoke, pour batter, about ¼ cup at a time. # Sprinkle 2 tablespoons corn over the uncooked side of each pancake as it cooks. # Work in batches, if necessary, to avoid overcrowding. # When pancake bottoms are golden brown and tops start to bubble, 2 to 3 minutes, flip pancakes. # Cook until pancakes are golden brown on remaining side. # Repeat, brushing skillet or griddle with oil. # Serve hot. ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * Use all-purpose flour (which is softer than unbleached), not unbleached flour to make a tender pancake. * If using salted butter, reduce salt to ¼ teaspoon. * I usually substitute a tablespoon of lemon juice (or vinegar) in milk for the buttermilk. * Pancake batter should pour, not glug! On the other hand, runny batter makes thin, oddly shaped pancakes that frequently collide on the griddle. Stir in a touch more flour into thin batter. For batter that's too thick, whisk in water, a teaspoon at a time. * The temperature of the pan or griddle is important: too hot and the pancakes are dark and raw; too cool and they're blond and hard. For tender, golden brown pancakes, heat the pan or griddle on low while you make the batter. Then increase the heat to medium and generously brush the pan or griddle with oil. It's ready when the oil starts to shimmer and, in any skillet or griddle other than non-stick, sends out tendrils that resemble and octopus or spider. But if the pan starts to smoke, set it down off the burner until the smoking subsides and the oil cools a bit. * This recipe easily doubles for a crowd. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pancake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Corn recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Milk recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Molasses recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Nutmeg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vanilla recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Pancake recipes|8 4-inch pancakes|prep 10 minutes
5 minutes per skillet of pancakes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] ==Recipe 1== ===Ingredients=== * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] all-purpose bleached [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|ground cinnamon]] * 1½ teaspoons [[Cookbook:Ginger|ground ginger]] * ⅛ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Clove|ground cloves]] * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Buttermilk|buttermilk]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], melted * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla extract]] * 4 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Molasses|molasses]] * [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|Vegetable oil]] for brushing [[Cookbook:Griddle|griddle]] ===Procedure=== # Heat a large non-stick [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] or griddle over low heat while preparing ingredients. # Mix flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in medium bowl. # [[Cookbook:Whisk|Whisk]] ground cinnamon, ground ginger, and ground cloves into the dry ingredients. # [[Cookbook:Microwave Oven|Microwave]] buttermilk and milk in a 2-cup Pyrex measuring cup to room temperature, 20 to 30 seconds. # Whisk in egg, butter, vanilla, and molasses. # Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and whisk until just mixed. # Return batter to measuring cup, stirring in a teaspoon or two of [[Cookbook:Water|water]], if necessary, to make a thick, but pourable batter. # Increase heat to medium and generously brush skillet or griddle with oil. # When oil starts to spider, but before it starts to smoke, pour batter, about ¼ cup at a time. # Work in batches, if necessary, to avoid overcrowding. # When pancake bottoms are golden brown and tops start to bubble, 2 to 3 minutes, flip pancakes. # Cook until pancakes are golden brown on remaining side. # Repeat, brushing skillet or griddle with oil. # Serve hot. ==Recipe 2== {{recipesummary|Pancake recipes|6 servings|prep 10 minutes
5 minutes per skillet of pancakes|2}} ===Ingredients=== * 3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] complete pancake mix (see Note) * 1 cup brewed [[Cookbook:Coffee|coffee]], cooled to room temperature * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Molasses|molasses]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Nutmeg|grated nutmeg]] * [[Cookbook:Cooking Spray|Cooking spray]] ===Procedure=== # In a mixing bowl, combine pancake mix, coffee, water, molasses, cinnamon, ginger, and nutmeg. # Stir until combined. # The batter will be thin; for thicker pancakes, add more mix, 1 tablespoon at a time. # Coat a [[Cookbook:Skillet|nonstick frying pan]] with cooking spray and place over medium heat. If using an electric skillet, heat to 375°F. # Pour ¼ cup of batter into hot pan; cook 2 minutes or until bubbles appear and edges look dry; flip pancakes and cook 1 or 2 minutes more. # Serve with butter and syrup, if desired. ==Notes, tips and variations== * Use all-purpose flour (which is softer than unbleached), not unbleached flour to make a tender pancake. * If using salted butter, reduce salt to ¼ teaspoon. * You can substitute a tablespoon of lemon juice (or vinegar) in milk for the buttermilk. * Pancake batter should pour, not glug! On the other hand, runny batter makes thin, oddly shaped pancakes that frequently collide on the griddle. Stir in a touch more flour into thin batter. For batter that's too thick, whisk in water, a teaspoon at a time. * The temperature of the pan or griddle is important: too hot and the pancakes are dark and raw; too cool and they're blond and hard. For tender, golden brown pancakes, heat the pan or griddle on low while you make the batter. Then increase the heat to medium and generously brush the pan or griddle with oil. It's ready when the oil starts to shimmer and, in any skillet or griddle other than non-stick, sends out tendrils that resemble and octopus or spider. But if the pan starts to smoke, set it down off the burner until the smoking subsides and the oil cools a bit. * This recipe easily doubles for a crowd. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pancake recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Ginger recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Milk recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Molasses recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Nutmeg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vanilla recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

For tender, golden brown pancakes, heat the pan or griddle on low while you make the batter. Then increase the heat to medium and generously brush the pan or griddle with oil. It's ready when the oil starts to shimmer and, in any skillet or griddle other than non-stick, sends out tendrils that resemble and octopus or spider. But if the pan starts to smoke, set it down off the burner until the smoking subsides and the oil cools a bit. * This recipe easily doubles for a crowd. {{recipesummary|Pasta recipes|2|30 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italian cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Pasta|Pasta]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive oil]] * 2 tablespoons freshly chopped [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * ¼ cup roasted [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|red peppers]], [[Cookbook:Julienne|julienned]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Tomato|sun-dried tomatoes]], julienned * ¼ cup pitted Kalamata [[Cookbook:Olive|olives]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Artichoke|artichoke heart]] (canned is fine), cut into 8 pieces * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] dry [[Cookbook:White Wine|white wine]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Oregano|dried oregano]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Basil|dried basil]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]], [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]], and granulated garlic, to taste * ½ cup fresh [[Cookbook:Broccoli|broccoli florets]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] [[Cookbook:Pasta|linguine]], cooked al dente and drained * crumbled [[Cookbook:Feta Cheese|feta cheese]] (about ¼ cup) and chopped [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]] (1 to 2 tablespoons), for [[Cookbook:Garnish|garnish]]
==Directions==
# Heat oil in a [[Cookbook:Sauté|sauté]] pan over high heat. # Add garlic, and sauté until it just begins to brown (be careful not to burn), about 1 minute. # Stir in red peppers, sun-dried tomatoes, olives and artichoke heart. # Add white wine, chicken broth, oregano and basil, and bring to a [[Cookbook:Boil|boil]]. # Season to taste with salt, pepper and granulated garlic. # Add broccoli and cook just until bright green and tender, 1 to 2 minutes. # Add pasta and toss to combine. # Garnish with crumbled feta cheese and chopped parsley, and serve hot.
[[Category:Italian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Artichoke recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Olive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Onion recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Snacks recipes|24 servings (½ cup each)|Prep Time:15 min
Start to Finish:1 hr 15 min|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] '''Party Mix''' – ''Still great after all these years! Chex® Party Mix has been a party favorite for over 50 years.'' ==Ingredients== * 6 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] or [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Worcestershire Sauce|Worcestershire sauce]] * 1½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] seasoned salt * ¾ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic powder]] * ½ teaspoon onion powder * 3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] (360g) corn cereal squares * 3 cups (360g) rice cereal squares * 3 cups (360g) wheat cereal squares * 1 cup (100g) [[Cookbook:Nut|mixed nuts]] * 1 cup (120g) bite-size [[Cookbook:Pretzel|pretzels]] * 1 cup (120g) garlic-flavor bite-size bagel chips or regular-size bagel chips, broken into 1-inch pieces ==Procedure== # Heat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|250°F]] (120°C). # In ungreased large roasting pan, melt butter in oven. # Stir in seasonings. # Gradually stir in remaining ingredients until evenly coated. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes. # Spread on paper towels to cool, about 15 minutes. # Store in airtight container. ==[[Cookbook:Microwave Oven|Microwave]] Directions== # In large microwavable bowl, microwave butter uncovered on High about 40 seconds or until melted. # Stir in seasonings. # Gradually stir in remaining ingredients until evenly coated. # Microwave uncovered on High 5 to 6 minutes, thoroughly stirring every 2 minutes. # Spread on paper towels to cool. # Store in airtight container. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Snacks recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

page.title: Cookbook:Shrimp Scampi Angel Hair Pasta with Lemon and Pine Nuts

revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Pasta recipes|4|Prep Time: 6 minutes
Cook Time: 12 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italian cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Seafood|Seafood]] | [[Cookbook:Pasta|Pasta]] ==Ingredients== * 1 package (12 ounces) [[Cookbook:Shrimp|shrimp scampi]], garlic and butter flavor * 12 ounces [[Cookbook:Pasta|angel hair pasta]], dry * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] fresh [[Cookbook:Parsley|flat-leaf parsley leaves]], roughly [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] * ⅓ cup [[Cookbook:Pine Nut|pine nuts]], [[Cookbook:toast|toasted]] * Finely grated [[Cookbook:Zest|zest]] and [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|juice of 1 lemon]] * [[Cookbook:Kosher|Kosher]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]] ==Directions== # [[Cookbook:Boiling|Boil]] large pot of cold [[Cookbook:Water|water]] and salt it generously. # Add the pasta and cook, stirring occasionally until al dente, 4 to 5 minutes. # Drain the pasta reserving about 1 cup of the cooking water. # Prepare the shrimp in a large [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] according to package directions. # Stir the lemon zest and juice into the shrimp. # Add the pasta, reserved pasta water, parsley and pine nuts, and toss in the skillet to coat the pasta evenly. # Divide shrimp and pasta among warm pasta bowls and serve. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Italian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sauce recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Seafood recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|4|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * 1 (14-ounce) can diced [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * 1½ cups [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] or vegetable [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * 1 (16-ounce) can [[Cookbook:Tomato Sauce|tomato sauce]] * 1 tablespoon fresh snipped [[Cookbook:Basil|basil]] (or 1 teaspoon dried) * 1 teaspoon fresh snipped [[Cookbook:Thyme|thyme]] (or ¼ teaspoon dried) * Dash [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Vinegar|balsamic vinegar]], optional * 4 to 6 fresh basil leaves, sliced thinly into strips, optional for [[Cookbook:Garnish|garnish]]
==Procedure==
# In a 2-quart [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]], [[Cookbook:Sautéing|sauté]] onion in olive oil until tender but not browned. # Add tomatoes, broth, tomato sauce, basil, thyme and pepper. # Bring to a [[Cookbook:Boiling|boil]]. # Reduce heat, cover and [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] 20 minutes. # Stir in vinegar, if desired, just prior to serving. # Ladle into bowls and garnish with basil strips.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Onion recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

page.title: Cookbook:Meringues with Roasted Raspberries and Hazelnut Creme Anglaise

revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|4|4 hours|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
==Ingredients==
* 5 [[Cookbook:Egg White|egg whites]], at room temperature * [[Cookbook:Pinch|Pinch]] of [[Cookbook:Cream of Tartar|cream of tartar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] plus 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]], divided * ⅛ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Pint|pint]] fresh [[Cookbook:Raspberry|raspberries]] * 1 tablespoon toasted hazelnut oil * 1⅓ cups [[Cookbook:Creme Anglaise|hazelnut creme anglaise]], chilled
==Directions==
# Heat the [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|200°F]] to 200 degrees. # In the bowl of a [[Cookbook:Mixer|standing mixer]] or with a hand-held mixer, whip egg whites and cream of tartar on high speed until soft peaks form, about 1 minute. # Reduce mixer speed to low and add 1 cup sugar in a steady stream; continue whipping until stiff and glossy, about 4 minutes. # Whip in cinnamon. # Fill a pastry bag fitted with a medium star tip with the meringue. # Onto a Silpat or oiled piece of parchment paper, pipe the mixture into rounds, starting in the center and moving outward in a spiral to form a 3-inch disk. # Bake for 2 hours, until crisp but not browned. # Cool on the Silpat or parchment, then carefully remove the meringues. # Set aside, uncovered, on a wire rack in a cool, dry place. # Increase oven temperature to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|350°F]]. # Toss raspberries with remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and hazelnut oil. # Mound the berries on a baking sheet lined with Silpat or parchment paper and roast them for about 5 minutes, until glistening and very fragrant, but not mushy. # Remove from the oven. # Pour ⅓ cup of chilled hazelnut creme anglaise into the middle of a soup plate. # Place a cooled meringue in the center, then spoon one-fourth of the roasted raspberries on top of each meringue. # Serve immediately.
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Confection recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Dessert recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fruit recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Pasta recipes|4|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italian cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Pasta|Pasta]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Garlic|freshly chopped garlic]] * 2 cups [[Cookbook:Cream|heavy cream]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Tomato|sun-dried tomatoes]], [[Cookbook:Julienne|julienne]] * 1½ cups [[Cookbook:Marinara Sauce|marinara sauce]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]], [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]], and granulated garlic, to taste * ½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] [[Cookbook:spinach|fresh spinach]] * ½ cup grated [[Cookbook:Pecorino Romano Cheese|Pecorino Romano cheese]] * 1 pound [[Cookbook:Pasta|penne pasta]] cooked al dente and drained
==Procedure==
# Heat olive oil in a large pot over high heat. # Add garlic, and [[Cookbook:Sautéing|sauté]] until it just begins to brown (be careful not to burn garlic), about 1 minute. # Add cream and sun-dried tomatoes, and bring to a [[Cookbook:Boiling|boil]]. # Add marinara sauce. # Cook, stirring occasionally, until sauce thickens and is reduced by one-fourth. # Season with salt, pepper and granulated garlic. # Fold in spinach and Romano, and heat just until spinach is wilted and cheese melted. # Toss with pasta and serve hot.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Italian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sauce recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pasta recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|8|12 hours|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
==Ingredients==
* 5 medium [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]], [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] * 3 medium [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], diced * 5 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]] * 1 stalk [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]], diced * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * [[Cookbook:Pepper|Black pepper]], to taste * 4 cups [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * 4 to 5 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 1 (13-ounce) can [[Cookbook:Condensed milk|evaporated milk]]
==Directions==
# In a slow cooker, combine potatoes, onions, water, parsley, celery, salt, pepper, chicken broth and butter. # Cook until done -- on low heat, 10 to 12 hours, or on high heat, 3 to 4 hours. # When done, add milk and reheat. # Serve plain or put mixture in [[Cookbook:Blender|blender]] for a smoother soup. # Reheat if necessary.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* [[Cookbook:Garnish|Garnish]] each serving with a dollop of [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] and [[Cookbook:Chive|chives]], if desired.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Slow cooker recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Celery recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Milk recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Onion recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Potato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Potato recipes|5 or 6 persons|90 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetables|vegetables]]
=Twice-Baked Potatoes= ''see also'' [[Cookbook:Twice-Baked Potatoes II|Twice-Baked Potatoes II]]
==Ingredients==
* 4 medium Russet [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]] (7 to 9 [[Cookbook:ounce|ounces]]) * [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] to rub on potato skins * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] * 4 ounces shredded [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar cheese]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * [[Cookbook:Pinch|Pinch]] [[Cookbook:Black Pepper|ground black pepper]]
==Directions==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|400°F]]. # Rub potato skins with vegetable oil to ensure crispness. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] potatoes for 1 hour until done. # Carefully remove potatoes from oven and cool for 10 minutes. # Cut potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop out pulp with a small spoon. # Mash potato pulp with a fork until smooth. # Add remaining ingredients until well combined. # Spoon the mixture into the empty potato shells. # Increase oven setting to [[Cookbook:Broil|broil]]. # Broil potatoes 10 or 15 minutes until spotty brown and crisp.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|Potatoes, Twice-Baked]] [[Category:American recipes|Potatoes, Twice-Baked]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Potatoes, Twice-Baked]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|Potatoes, Twice-Baked]] [[Category:Potato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sour Cream recipes|Potatoes, Twice-Baked]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|Potatoes, Twice-Baked]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|Potatoes, Twice-Baked]]

{{recipesummary|Salad recipes|8|What? 10 minutes?|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 (15-ounce) can [[Cookbook:Pinto Bean|pinto beans]], rinsed and drained * 1 (15-ounce) can [[Cookbook:Kidney Bean|red kidney beans]], rinsed and drained * 1 (12-ounce) can [[Cookbook:Black Bean|black beans]], rinsed and drained * 1 (8¾-ounce) can [[Cookbook:Corn|whole kernel corn]], drained * 1 (14½-ounce) can diced [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] with roasted [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], undrained * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] fat-free Italian salad dressing * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] Italian seasoning * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]]
==Procedure==
# In a bowl, mix together beans, corn, tomatoes, Italian salad dressing, Italian seasoning and pepper. # Serve chilled or at room temperature.
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Salad recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bean recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Corn recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian]] | [[Cookbook:Vegan cuisine|Vegan Cuisine]]
==Author's note== This recipe originated when I tried to adapt my [[Cookbook:Mike's Saffron Rice and Beans|saffron rice and beans]] for a barbecue. I planned on heating saffron rice and beans over a wood fire at the barbecue as a vegetarian main course, but didn't make enough rice, and added some raw ingredients at the last minute before slow-cooking over the fire. Later I liked it so much that I made it in the oven.
==Ingredients== * 2 [[Cookbook:Onion|Onions]] cut into chunks * 3 [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]], cut into large chunks * several [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrots]], cut into large chunks * One can [[Cookbook:Garbanzo|Canned chickpeas]] or [[Cookbook:Black Bean|black beans]] * Other vegetables, [[Cookbook:Zucchini|zucchini]], [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|bell pepper]], etc, cut into chunks * 1/3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] of [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Curry Powder|curry powder]] * 5-10 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * Misc spices, good ones include [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]], [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]], ground [[Cookbook:Chili|chili]] or [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]], [[Cookbook:Oregano|ground oregano]] , etc * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Basmati rice|basmati rice]] * 750 ml [[Cookbook:Wine|red wine]] -- the cheapest you can stand to drink -- I use Charles Shaw merlot, although any of the equivalently priced box-wines will work, so long as you get the red.
==Procedure== # Put one tablespoon of olive oil in saucepan, heat. # Stir in curry powder # Stir in rice, fry rice briefly (5 minutes or so -- although the dish works if the rice is raw too) while stirring # Pre-heat oven to 250 # Turn off heat, put vegetables, spices, and garlic, followed by rice with curry oil, followed with the can of beans and half the bottle of wine in a casserole dish with a cover. Stir briefly to mix, and make sure some at least some rice is on top. # add rest of olive oil to casserole dish, fill with either water or remainder of wine until all vegetables, beans and rice are submerged in fluid # Place casserole dish (covered) in oven, drink any remaining wine # Wait for a couple hours, periodically checking to see if rice is soft. # Once rice is soft its ready to eat.
==Variations==
# If you turn the oven hotter it'll cook faster. The whole point of the low heat is you can start this saturday afternoon, forget about it for most of the day, and then have dinner ready.
# Also works over a campfire.
[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegan recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rice recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bean recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: [[Cookbook:New England Style Clam Chowder]] moved to [[Cookbook:New England Clam Chowder]]: proper name
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Clam recipes|6|1-2 hours|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Seafood|Seafood]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] canned [[Cookbook:Clam|clams]], minced, or 12 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] frozen, thawed * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] plain white [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1 medium [[Cookbook:Potato|potato]], [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] * 1 medium [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], diced * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Boiling|boiling]] [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 3 ounces salt [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]], diced * 1½ [[Cookbook:Quart|quarts]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]], [[Cookbook:Scald|scalded]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste
==Procedure==
# If using frozen clams, drain and reserve liquid. # Cut hard parts away and keep them separate. # [[Cookbook:Sautéing|Sauté]] salt pork in a heavy iron pot until brown and crisp. # Remove pork and sauté hard part of clam and onions in hot fat until onion is light brown. # Stir in flour, then slowly add boiling water, salt, pepper, and diced potato. # Cover and [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] gently 10 minutes or until potato is tender. # Add soft parts of clams and liquid. # Just before serving, stir in scalded milk and butter. # Heat thoroughly, but not to boiling. # Serve piping hot with oyster or soda [[Cookbook:Hard Tack|crackers]].
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Clam recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Milk recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Onion recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Pork recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Potato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

page.title: Cookbook:Cherry Cobbler in a Crock Pot

revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Cobbler recipes|You think I'm gonna share??|3 hours|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 can (16 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]]) [[Cookbook:Cherry|cherry]] pie filling * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] yellow cake mix * ⅛ cup softened [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Nuts and seeds|nuts]] * [[Cookbook:Ice Cream|Ice cream]], as desired
==Procedure==
# Pour cherry pie filling into a [[Cookbook:Slow Cooker|slow cooker]], spreading it evenly across the bottom of the crock. # In a medium-size bowl, combine cake mix and butter until the mixture is crumbly. # Sprinkle evenly over cherries. # Sprinkle nuts evenly over cake mix. # Set slow cooker on LOW, cover and allow to cook for 3 hours. # Serve hot, right from the slow cooker, or serve over ice cream, if desired.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Any fruit pie filling will do. * Refrigerate extra portions of this cobbler (''Like that's going to happen!'') and mix it into hot oatmeal or yogurt for a breakfast treat.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Confection recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cobbler recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Slow cooker recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cherry recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Nut recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{cookwork|Needs to be edited to remove POV stuff}} {{recipesummary|Vegan recipes|1 bowl and 1 blender|10 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegan_cuisine|Vegan Cuisine]]
==Original authors note==
Every vegan should know about aioli and related sauces. They add a creaminess which can be otherwise rare in vegan cooking.
The key to the not-vegan-tasting deliciousness of an aioli is the garlic / olive oil emulsion. The same principle is at work in hummus (and marinara the way I sometimes make it). Other common emulsifiers are glycerin (which tastes awful), soy lecithin (present in soymilk, tofu etc) and egg yolk (which is, obviously, not vegan).
I don't know how strict Europeans are about what they call "aioli", but in California it is not uncommon to see a wide variety of homemade garlic-oil emulsions described as such (particularly if the water-based component of the emulsion is a vinegar of one sort or another -- in this case we use citric acid instead). A common use of these sauces is as an artichoke marinade or dip.
==Note on carrots==
Carrots can damage some blending equipment. I cut them really small so they're easier to blend. Be warned.
==Ingredients== * One [[Cookbook:Carrot|Carrot]] * [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|Olive Oil]] * 1 pinch [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 5 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|Serrano Chile]] * [[Cookbook:Orange|Orange]] or [[Cookbook:Orange Juice|Orange Juice]] (any other citrus works) Optional **French-style or [[Cookbook:Dijon Mustard|Dijon mustard]] (i.e. one that does not contain "turmeric" in the list of ingredients)
==Procedure== # Cut carrot extremely fine (1 mm slivers) so that blender can handle it. # Place all ingredients (start with 2 tablespoon olive oil) (Squeeze juice of 1 or more oranges, but don't add any orange peel) into blender-safe dish # blend # continue adding olive oil blending and tasting until it reaches desired creaminess.
==See also== [[Cookbook:Creamy Aioli Salsa|Creamy Aioli Salsa]]
{{DEFAULTSORT:{{PAGENAME}}}} [[Category:Vegan recipes]] [[Category:Aioli recipes]] [[Category:Garlic recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Vietnam|Cuisine of Vietnam]]
==Ingredients== ===For soup=== * 1 whole Cat fish or firm white fish * 1 quart (950ml) Water * Freshly ground black pepper * 2 teaspoons salt * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Fish Sauce|Nước mắm]] * ½ cup (120g) sour bamboo * ¼ fresh pineapple – core removed, cut lengthwise and sliced
===For marinade=== * 2 [[Cookbook:Scallion|scallions]], remove green part and reserve for garnish – crush white part * 4 teaspoons Nước mắm * 1 teaspoons salt
===Garnish=== * 2 tablespoons fresh [[Cookbook:Coriander|coriander]] – chopped * Green part of scallions - chopped
==Procedure== Traditionally, the fish head is not removed, but if you prefer, it’s not necessary for this dish. Marinate the fish for 15 minutes with the crushed scallions, black pepper, 1 tsp salt, and 4 tsp Nước mắm.
Bring water to the boil. Add the sour bamboo and pineapple slices. Boil for 5 minutes. Add marinated fish and continue to boil for a total of 10 minutes. While the fish is boiling, add 2 tablespoons Nước mắm, and 1 teaspoon salt.
For serving, the soup can be garnished with coriander and the green part of scallions.
[[Category:Vietnamese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Vegan recipes|1 bowl and 1 blender|10 minutes|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegan_cuisine|Vegan Cuisine]]
==Original authors note==
This is a cross between an aioli (a [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]]-like sauce which uses [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] instead of [[Cookbook:Egg yolk|egg yolk]] as an emulsifier) and a [[Cookbook:Pico de Gallo|pico de gallo]] style [[Cookbook:Salsa|salsa]]
==Ingredients== * Several [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 1 pinch [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 5 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * 1 or more [[Cookbook:Jalapeño|jalapeño chiles]] or [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|serrano chiles]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Lime|lime]]
===Optional=== * 1 bunch [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]]
==Procedure== # chop tomatoes, chiles, cilantro # Squeeze the lime juice into a blender-safe dish, add two teaspoons of olive oil and all other ingredients, blend # blend # continue adding olive oil blending and tasting until it reaches desired creaminess.
==See also== [[Cookbook:Spicy Carrot Aioli|Spicy Citrus Carrot Aioli]]
{{DEFAULTSORT:{{PAGENAME}}}} [[Category:Vegan recipes]] [[Category:Aioli recipes]] [[Category:Garlic recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Confection recipes|Makes 16|1 hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
==Ingredients==
* 4 firm, ripe [[Cookbook:Pear|pears]] peeled, cored, and sliced (2½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]]) * 12 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] [[Cookbook:Cranberry|cranberries]] * ⅓ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]], divided * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Oats|rolled oats]] * ⅔ cup sliced [[Cookbook:Almond|almonds]] * ⅔ cup [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]], firmly packed * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] cut into pieces * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]]
==Procedure==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|375°F]]. # Toss pears, cranberries, sugar, and ¼ teaspoon cinnamon in 9x9 baking dish until blended. # Combine oats, almonds, brown sugar, butter, flour, and remaining ¼ teaspoon cinnamon in large bowl. # Blend with fingertips. # Sprinkle over fruit and pat down lightly. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] until pears are tender and topping is golden, about 45 minutes. # Serve hot or warm.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* In a 15 inch [[Cookbook:Dutch Oven|Dutch Oven]]: top briquettes - 19; bottom briquettes - 12. Bake 35 to 45 minutes, check crisp after 30 minutes.
[[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Confection recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Almond recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cranberry recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Oat recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Crab recipes|4|20 minutes|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine (USA)]] | [[Cookbook:Seafood|Seafood recipes]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] or one 7½-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] (200g) can [[Cookbook:Crab|crab meat]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] * ½ cup dairy [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] * 3 teaspoons dry [[Cookbook:Wine|sherry]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] and freshly ground [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste
==Procedure==
# Drain, rinse, and pick over crab meat to remove shell and cartilage. # Combine all ingredients, blending well. # Refrigerate until ready to serve.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Serve before dinner with chips and crackers. * For color and variety, mixed nuts and colorful vegetables can be laid out.
[[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Crab recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sour Cream recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Breakfast recipes|6|20 minutes
or 40 minutes if you have to peel the shrimp|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Breakfast Recipes|Breakfast Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Seafood|Seafood]] ==Ingredients== * 3 or 4 strips thickened smoked [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]], [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] large [[Cookbook:Shrimp|shrimp]] * 6 servings of [[Cookbook:Grits|grits]], follow directions on box * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] shredded [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|sharp cheddar cheese]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * ½ large sweet [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], cut into thin strips * ½ yellow [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|bell pepper]], cut into strips * ½ red bell pepper, cut into strips * 2 to 3 [[Cookbook:Garlic|cloves garlic]], minced * ¼ to ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] hot sauce, or to taste, optional * [[Cookbook:Lime|juice of one lime]] ==Procedure== # [[Cookbook:Frying|Fry]] bacon until crisp, remove and set aside. # [[Cookbook:Sautéing|Sauté]] onions, garlic, and peppers in bacon grease, add lime juice and hot sauce and set aside. # Prepare grits and add cheese and butter when done cooking to allow for them to melt, then set aside. # Stir when done melting. # Sauté the shrimp until they turn pink, about 2 to 3 minutes.
''If you are planning to use unpeeled shrimp, plan an extra 20 minutes to peel the shrimp!'' # Place the grits and cheese in large serving container and place the shrimp down the center of the container. ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * If served on individual dish/platter, slice limes on the side. * In preparing the grits, you may want to use [[Cookbook:Milk|condensed milk]] instead of [[Cookbook:Water|water]] to make the grits for an extra creamy texture! * As an alternative, add garden peas to grits and serve steamed peppers, zucchini, yellow squash, and mushrooms on the side. Adds a great taste texture with the peas! [[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Fried recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bacon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Onion recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Shrimp recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Bean recipes|4 to 6|Soak: overnight
Prep: 15 to 20 minutes
Cooking time: 1½ hours|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italian cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Legumes|Beans]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]] ==Ingredients== * 3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] cranberry or [[Cookbook:Pinto Beans|pinto beans]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Spelt|spelt]] or [[Cookbook:Wheat|wheat berries]] (available at gourmet-food shops) * ¼ cup extra-virgin [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]], plus more for drizzling * ½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] sweet Italian [[Cookbook:Sausage|sausage]], casings removed * 1 pound [[Cookbook:Kale|kale]], preferably Tuscan, coarse stems removed, cut into thick ribbons * 1 medium-large [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrot]], peeled and diced * 1 large rib [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]], trimmed and diced * 3 [[Cookbook:Garlic|cloves garlic]], thinly sliced * 5 cups homemade [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Stock|stock]], or canned low-sodium stock, plus more if needed * 1 cup peeled, seeded, and diced [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]], or drained canned diced tomatoes * 1 sprig fresh [[Cookbook:Rosemary|rosemary]] * 1 sprig fresh [[Cookbook:Sage|sage]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|Sea salt]] and freshly ground [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * ½ cup freshly grated [[Cookbook:Cheese|Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese]] ==Procedure== # [[Cookbook:Soak|Soak]] beans and spelt overnight in separate bowls of cold water. # Drain, set aside. # Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. # Add sausage. # Cook stirring occasionally, until meat begins to separate and brown (3 to 5 minutes). # Stir in kale, onion, carrot, celery, and garlic. # Cook until softened (about 10 minutes). # Add beans, spelt, chicken stock, and tomatoes. # Bring to [[Cookbook:Boiling|boil]]. # Stir in rosemary and sage. # Reduce heat. # [[Cookbook:Simmering|Simmer]] mixture for 60 or 70 minutes, until beans are tender, (If soup is too thick, add chicken stock.) # Season to taste with salt and pepper. # [[Cookbook:Ladle|Ladle]] soup into bowls. # Drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle on cheese. # Serve immediately. ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * Have this soup first with bread, like [[Cookbook:Ciabatta|ciabatta]], then finish with some cold cuts, like [[Cookbook:Salami|salami]] and prosciutto. * Instead of using spelt, you can substitute [[Cookbook:Barley|barley]]. * If you can't find Tuscan kale, you can put in regular kale, mustard greens, or Swiss chard. * This soup tastes even better the next day. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Italian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bean recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Carrot recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Celery recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Onion recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sausage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]
