{{recipe}}
''This is a wonderful dish that is very easy to do. It does call for the use of raw eggs, which is not to everyone's taste, but to the best of my knowledge, no one has died from Carbonara sauce poisoning!.''
I came across a website which provides an interesting description as to the origins of this sauce. It is supposed to have been popular with Italian coalminers, as the ingredients were simple to transport and, presumably, cook down a coalmine! Personally I think it is just a nice story as I have never heard of stoves and their inherent dangerous flames being allowed down a coalmine, but hey, I'm just a cook, not a miner !! (NB: carbonara is more likely named after the charcoal makers in the region, not coalminers)
{{see also|Cookbook:Spaghetti alla Carbonara}}
==Ingredients==
* 4 free-range [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] with large yolks (double yolkers are particularly suitable!) The use of "cheap" eggs will have a marked effect on the sauce. Yolks as fresh and as yellow as possible please! * 3oz [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italian]] [[Cookbook:Pancetta|pancetta]]. PLEASE don't buy the ready cubed stuff, but the fresh, Italian version, with a little cracked pepper on the rind. If you really can't find it, smoked bacon will do * 1 sprig of fresh [[Cookbook:Thyme|thyme]], finely chopped * the chopped [[Cookbook:Zest|zest]] of ½ [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemon]] * 3oz [[Cookbook:Crème Fraîche|crème fraîche]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste
==Procedure==
# Put on the desired quantity of Pasta to cook. This complete dish is often referred to as "Spaghetti Carbonara" but using small Penne Rigate is, in my humble opinion, better. # Split the eggs carefully and separate the yolks from the whites (a good - and rather sensuous - way of doing this is to run the egg through the almost closed fingers of your upturned palm, so as the white runs away through the fingers, and the yolk remains in your hand!) Keep the yolks in a large bowl (and use the whites for something useful, like [[Cookbook:Meringue|meringues]], if you must!) remembering to pick out that pesky little white bit which always remains behind when you split an egg. # Fry the pancetta on a lowish heat in a dry frying pan until it is crispy. Always make sure you have more than enough for your sauce, as the temptation to snaffle a few bits of the pancetta whilst it is cooking is irresistible ! # When the pancetta is cooked, allow it to cool for a few minutes, before adding it to the yolks (allowing it to cool precludes you scrambling the eggs in the process of adding the piping hot fried pancetta) # Add a pinch of rock-salt and a very generous amount indeed of ground pepper to the bowl. # Add the crème frâiche to the bowl, as well as the lemon zest and the chopped thyme. Also add a small amount of the Parmigiano cheese to the bowl. # Once the pasta is cooked, the '''MOST''' important thing is to get your guests to sit down at the table ...!! This dish waits for NO man, woman or child !! It '''HAS''' to be served as soon as it is ready. No ifs or buts here ! # Drain the pasta through a [[Cookbook:Colander|colander]], count to 10, which seems to allow the pasta to cool just a tad, so again it does not scramble the sauce, and add it to the carbonara mixture. # Mix it through with a wooden spoon and serve immediately, sprinkling the remaining Parmigiano cheese over the top!!
''If you want to add a little chopped flat leaf parsley (not the curly stuff) to add colour go ahead.''
Served with a simple green salad, it's delicious.
Buon Appetito, Wikipedies
--[[User:Peterkirchem|Peterkirchem]] 11:13, 3 July 2007 (UTC)
[[Category:Italian recipes]] [[Category:Pasta recipes]] [[Category:Pasta sauces]] [[Category:Bacon recipes]] [[Category:Egg recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Colombian recipes|3-4|Cook 30 Minutes|2|Image=[[Image:Mazorca_Desgranada.jpg|300px]]}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Colombia|Cuisine of Colombia]]
'''La mazorca desgranada''' is typical northern coast fast food recipe. Is is made of sweet corn, beef, cheese, crushed potato chips and tartar sauce.
==Ingredients==
* ½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] (250[[Cookbook:Gram|g]]) [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] loin steak, cut into thin strips * ½ "Summer Crisp" (Batavian) small [[Cookbook:Lettuce|lettuce]], thinly sliced * ¼ pound (125g) shredded white [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]] ("Costeño" or [[Cookbook:Monterey Jack Cheese|Monterey Jack]]) * 1 15[[Cookbook:Ounce|oz]] (425g) can whole kernel corn. * crushed [[Cookbook:Potato Crisp|potato chips]] (crisps) * [[Cookbook:Tartar Sauce|tartar sauce]] * ground [[Cookbook:Allspice|allspice]] * ground [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * [[Cookbook:Worcestershire Sauce|Worcestershire sauce]]
==Procedure==
# Fry beef in a medium skillet pan. Season with allspice, pepper, salt and Worcestershire sauce. # Heat corn in water. # Place lettuce into serving dish. # Place corn over the lettuce. # Add shredded cheese on top of the corn. # Add beef. # Cover all with crushed potato chips. # Pour tartar sauce all over the dish, and enjoy.
==Notes, tips, and variations== This recipe is similar to KFC bowls. You can eliminate beef, or replace it with chicken, bacon, pork, sausage, hot dog, and others. You can also mix tartar sauce with [[Cookbook:Ketchup|ketchup]] and/or [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]]. LGVU.
[[Category:Colombian recipes]] [[Category:Corn recipes]] [[Category:Beef recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Sauce recipes|8 (1/4 cup each)|20 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Sauce|Sauce]]
'''Barbecue Sauce''' is a [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]] or [[Cookbook:Ketchup|ketchup]] based [[Cookbook:Sauce|sauce]] used on [[Cookbook:Meat|meats]]. Kansas City-style barbecue sauce is the most common version used in the [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|United States]]. It is tomato or ketchup based with sweet, sour and smoky elements. Barbecue sauce can be added to the meat before, during or after cooking. This version contains quite a bit of [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]], so it should be added near the end or after cooking the meat to avoid burning the sauce.
==Ingredients== *1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (235 [[Cookbook:mL|mL]]) [[Cookbook:Ketchup|ketchup]] *6 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] (90 mL) [[Cookbook:Worcestershire Sauce|Worcestershire sauce]] *4 tablespoons (60 mL) [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] or [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] *3 tablespoons (45 mL) white [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]] *1 tablespoon (15 mL) plain prepared [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]] *3 tablespoons (45 mL) finely minced yellow [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] *4 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] (20 mL) bottled [[Cookbook:Liquid Smoke|liquid smoke]] flavor (hickory) *1/4 teaspoon (1 mL) Louisiana-style [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|red pepper]] [[Cookbook:Sauce|sauce]] *1/2 cup (120 mL) [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] *1 tablespoon (15 mL) [[Cookbook:Granulated Sugar|granulated sugar]] *1 teaspoon (5 mL) [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
Makes 2 cups (470 mL) of sauce.
==Procedure== #Combine all ingredients in a sauce pan. #Mix well. #[[Cookbook:Simmer|Simmer]] over low heat for 20-minutes, stirring occasionally.
==Notes, tips and variations==
#This sauce tastes very close to commercial barbecue sauces such as Masterpiece and Bullseye.
==Warnings== * Keep refregerated * Add to meat near end or after cooking to avoid burning sauce because of sugar content.
[[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sauce recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Midwestern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Sauces|Sauces]] | [[Cookbook:Meat Recipes|Meat Recipes]] [[Image:CookbookBarbequeSauce.jpg|thumb|130px|barbecue sauce on beef]] This is a simple barbecue [[Cookbook:Sauce|sauce]] that works well for everyday meals, even with leftover [[Cookbook:Meat|meat]] and picky eaters. It is best served with soda (pop) and [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]], and perhaps also [[Cookbook:Steaming|steamed]] [[Cookbook:Vegetable|vegetables]].
The ideal meat to use would be thin slices of eye-of-round [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] roast. The sauce also goes well with [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]], [[Cookbook:Turkey|turkey]], and [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]].
Note that the measurements are very rough, in part because molassas is too sticky to properly measure, and in part because liquid smoke flavoring strength will vary by supplier. You may need to adjust things a bit for the proper taste.
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Ketchup|ketchup]] (catsup) * 1/2 cup [[Cookbook:Molasses|molasses]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] "concentrated" [[Cookbook:Liquid Smoke|liquid smoke]] flavoring
==Procedure==
#Mix everything in a pot.
That's it. You'll want to heat the sauce with some pre-cooked [[Cookbook:Meat|meat]] in it of course.
[[Category:Beef recipes|Barbecue Sauce]] [[Category:Sauce recipes|Barbecue Sauce]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|Barbecue Sauce]] [[Category:Pork recipes|Barbecue Sauce]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: added some of Peter Kirchem's comments from another copy of his recipe here
revision.text:
{{recipe}}
This is the recipe we all have dreamed of cooking. Everyone who has ever been to Italy has eaten this. It is one of the iconic recipes from the land of Pasta !! It's so simple - though the ending a little excruciating - and so long as you can obtain fresh clams (or carpet clams as they are sometimes called) you are sure of a real feast for your guests !
{{see also|Cookbook:Linguine Vongole}}
== Ingredients ==
* [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 8 [[Cookbook:Ounce|oz]] [[Cookbook:Clam|clams]] or carpet clams as they are sometimes known * 2 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * large or very large pinch of [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|red peppers]] (dried is fine) depending on taste * ½ cup of white [[Cookbook:Wine|wine]] * The [[Cookbook:Zest|zest]] or the juice of 1 [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemon]] * The zest of ½ [[Cookbook:Lime|lime]] * [[Cookbook:Pasta|spaghetti]], enough for the number of people to be served * a handful of flat leaf [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]] * 1 oz salted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]]
== Procedure ==
# Put a large saucepan of water on, and when at a rolling boil, put in the spaghetti, keeping an eye on the cooking time to ensure that the spaghetti is NEVER overcooked # Put the clams into a separate small saucepan with the white wine and poach gently for about 2 minutes. Take off the heat and set aside # Pour a generous quantity of olive oil into a small frying pan and heat # Add the garlic cloves which have been either chopped or put through a garlic crush # Add the chillies and the chopped parsley and the lemon zest # Heat everything for about 3 minutes. # Now add about ½ of the white wine the clams were cooked in. # Continue to heat for a few minutes on a high heat to induce a slight reduction. # Add the cooked clams to the sauce and turn the heat off completely. # Once the pasta is cooked drain it through sieve or colander and return to the saucepan. # Add the Salted butter to the pasta and mix through thoroughly. This will induce the sauce to thicken a little. # Add the cooked clams to the sauce and the the pasta. # Mix up thoroughly ensuring you do not damage the clams # Serve in a high-sided bowl, ensuring that each guest gets his fair share of clams
==Notes, tips and variations== * ''Optional Extras to this recipe is that you can add some cream to the sauce before serving, but DO remember it is regarded as bad form to add [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|Parmesan cheese]] to any fish-based pasta dish !!
Boun appetito, Wikipedies !!
[[Category:Italian recipes]] [[Category:Clam recipes]] [[Category:Pasta recipes]]

{{recipe}}
''Why should the [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italians]] have all the luck when it comes to meatballs, delicious as they may be ? I say let others get a look in, and here we have a recipe from Germany which is easy and utterly delicious. And not a tomato in sight!! These are known in Germany as Konigsberge Klopse, or sometimes as Konigsberger Klopsies !!
''Konigsberg, also now known as Kaliningrad is, somewhat disappointingly, not in Germany at all but is in the Russian exclave (whatever that is!!) between Lithuania and Poland, but was formerly a part of the German province of East Prussia.''
''Whether the meatballs should thus be renamed "''Russian Exclave meatballs''" is a subject for those more qualified than I to discuss !! My view is that "Konigsberger Kloepse" or even German Meatballs sound rather more palatable.''
== Ingredients ==
* 8 [[Cookbook:Ounce|oz]] (225[[Cookbook:Gram|g]]) of low fat [[Cookbook:Mincing|minced]] [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] * 8 oz (225g) of minced [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] (peeled and chopped) * 5 [[Cookbook:Anchovy|anchovy]] fillets chopped finely * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Caper|capers]] * ¼ bottle of Riesling white [[Cookbook:Wine|wine]] * 6 fl oz of [[Cookbook:Crème Fraîche|crème fraîche]] * 1 tablespoon of [[Cookbook:Mixed Herbs|mixed herbs]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * 2 - 3 slices of brown [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]] or a roll, soaked in [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * juice of 2 [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemons]] * [[Cookbook:Zest|zest]] of 2 [[Cookbook:Lime|limes]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Clove|cloves]] * ½ tablespoon of [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 2 tablespoon of [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] mixed with water to form a [[Cookbook:Roux|roux]]
== Procedure ==
# Finely chop the onion and fry it until translucent making sure it does not brown in any way, and then add to the minced beef and pork mixture. # Soak the brown bread or roll in water, and then also add to the minced meat. # Add Pepper, salt, chopped anchovy fillets, egg and mixed herbs to the mince, mix everything together by hand - ''a wonderfully messy operation. Get someone you dislike, or maybe even a favoured child, to do it for you if you can't face the prospect of getting covered up to your fetlocks in mince !!'' - and start forming little meatballs about ¾ inch in diameter. # To make them, take a quantity of the mince mixture in your hands and form it into a round shape. Then gently roll them between your palms so they (yes, the meatballs, stoopid!) become as round as possible. Don't become obsessed with shape here, it doesn't matter if they are neither symmetrical or the same size as each other !! # Lay side by side on a flat surface (otherwise they will roll off and fall on the floor, ha ha!) # Bring at least 2 pints of water to a rolling simmer, and add the lemon juice, the cloves, the olive oil to it, and gently drop in the meatballs. Don't overcrowd the pan, if need be drop the meatballs in in 2 goes. # As soon as the meatballs rise to the surface, remove them with a slotted spoon and set aside keeping warm (them, not you !) # Now add the wine, the crème fraîche and the flour mixture (called a roux) to the water and reduce a little and thicken. There should be plenty of sauce for this dish, so rather than rely on reducing the sauce to thicken it, don't be afraid of adding more roux to achieve this. # As the sauce begins to thicken, return the meatballs to the sauce and continue to cook for another 10 minutes or so. # At the last moment add the capers and the zest of the limes. # Adjust your seasoning to suit your taste. # Pour the entire contents of the pan through a semi-fine sieve (''for goodness sake remember to put another saucepan underneath the sieve to catch the sieved sauce, or else your entire sauce will slip down the plug'' !!) which will get rid of the "bits". # Heat up the sauce again if needed, add the meatballs in the sieve, and a handful of capers (they don't actually need cooking) according to your taste and you are ready to go.
This version of meatballs are best served with boiled, waxy [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]] which can be ''scrunshed'' into the sauce to make it all the more delicious !!
[[Category:German recipes]] [[Category:Beef recipes]] [[Category:Pork recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|4|1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Mexico|Cuisine of Mexico]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Sesame Oil|sesame oil]] * 1 tablespoon minced [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * ½ tablespoon [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|crushed red pepper]] * 1 medium yellow [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], [[Cookbook:Julienne|julienne]] * 1 red [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|bell pepper]], julienne * 1 green bell pepper, julienne * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Sesame Seed|sesame seeds]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Teriyaki|teriyaki]] marinade/sauce * 4 boneless skinless [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] breasts (about 6 ounces each), grilled and cut into ½-inch strips * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste * 4 (10-inch diameter) [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] [[Cookbook:Tortilla|tortillas]] * 8 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] (about 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]]) shredded Colby Jack [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]] * About 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]]
==Procedure==
# Heat sesame oil in a large [[Cookbook:Sautéing|sauté]] pan over medium-high heat. # Add the garlic, crushed red pepper, and onion and sauté for a minute. # Add the red and green bell peppers and sauté just barely until soft, around 3 minutes. # Add the sesame seeds, teriyaki sauce,and grilled chicken strips . # Lower heat to medium and cook, stirring often, until flavors are mixed, about 5 minutes. # Stir in the chopped cilantro, and season to taste with salt and pepper. # Divide the chicken mixture into fourths, putting the portion only on one-half of each tortilla. # Top with the shredded cheese, dividing equally among the tortillas. # Fold tortillas over, forming a semicircle, to cover the mixture. # Heat a large sauté pan or [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] over medium-high heat. # Add just enough butter to make a very thin layer on the bottom of the pan. # Cook the quesadillas in the butter until cheese is melted and tortillas are browned on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. # Cut each tortilla into four or so triangles and serve immediately.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Good with [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] and your favorite [[Cookbook:Salsa|salsa]] as toppings.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Mexican recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]] [[Category:Chicken recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
''Summer Pudding is a quintessentially British dessert made from wonderful fresh ingredients only available in the summer months.
''It is redolent of a private dinner at a smart country house, maybe somewhere in the Surrey hills near Shere, with the taste of an exquisite first course still lingering, a bottle of chilled champagne still half full, and the prospect of more enticing conversation to come as the evening turns into night !! (That's enough gloopy stuff, thanks! Ed.) Once you make it once, you'll make it again and again !''''
== Ingredients ==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Punnet|punnet]] [[Cookbook:Strawberry|strawberries]] * 1 punnet [[Cookbook:Raspberry|raspberries]] * ½ punnet [[Cookbook:Currant|blackcurrants]] * ½ punnet [[Cookbook:Currant|redcurrants]] * 1 loaf of white, sliced, pappy sort of [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]] or, for a special treat, a large slab of Brioche * 2 Tbsp [[Cookbook:Caster sugar|caster sugar]] * the [[Cookbook:Zest|zest]] of a [[Cookbook:Lime|lime]] chopped finely * 2 or 3 [[Cookbook:Mint|mint]] leaves again, finely chopped * a bottle of the best quality blackcurrant cordial you can find, in reserve
== Procedure ==
First you will need to find yourself a pudding bowl about 5 inches in diameter which you will need to butter well on the inside. It should preferably however NOT be greater in diameter that the size of your (assumedly square) pieces of sliced white bread or brioche.
If you are worried about getting the whole thing out of the bowl in one piece, line the bowl first with some cling film. It's a fiddly job, but ensures you get a perfect shape at the end !!
Take the Blackcurrants and redcurrants, mint leaves and Lime zest and turn them into a saucepan. Add the sugar and about 3 Tbsp Water, and on the lowest possible heat setting of your cooker, poach them for about 5 minutes. Add the strawberries - having cut any large ones in half - and poach for another minute.
Turn the heat OFF and add the raspberries. Leave to cool
''Now for the fun part !!''
Take your bowl and using it as a cutter, cut a circle out of the white bread the same diameter as the ''top'' of the bowl itself.
Now find a cup or glass that is roughly the same diameter as the ''bottom'' of your bowl and do the same.
Next, using a sharp knife for both cutting and as a measuring implement, slice the white bread (''no crusts allowed''!!) into squares or oblongs, roughly the same ''height'' as the bowl which will be used to line the inside of the bowl. This does not have to be an exact science, but close is good !!
In simple terms what we are trying to do is to line the bowl with the white bread.
Now, lay the small circle of white bread on the bottom of the bowl. Put the oblongs of white bread up the side of the bowl, overlapping slightly, and pour the fruit mixture into the void right up to the top. don't be mean with the juice either. The bread should become well soaked in the juice from the cooked fruit.
Indeed if there is not enough juice to soak the bread so it turns very red, use the cordial as a top-up.
Now, complete the mould, and place the large circle, or disc, of bread on the top and press it down well.
It's now necessary to press the whole thing down, so that the sauce sort of glues the bread together and so please find a weight or something that fits into the top of the bowl so it squashes everything down tight, and place it in the fridge for at least 40 minutes.
When you are ready to serve the pudding, carefully using a knife, release the bread mould from the side of the bowl, and invert the whole thing onto a plate.
If things become a little fraught and wobbly at this point, don't panic, and sort of whack everything back into shape using a wooden spoon.
Decorate your plate with some more summer fruit, maybe a couple of mint leaves and an artistic dollop of fresh whipped cream or crème fraîche and serve with a flourish.
Bon Appetit, Wikipedies !!
--[[User:Peterkirchem|Peterkirchem]] 08:14, 3 July 2007 (UTC)
[[Category:English recipes]] [[Category:Dessert recipes]] [[Category:Fruit recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Venison recipes|4|Soaking: 1 to 3 hours
Cooking: ½ hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|Cuisine of the USA]] | [[Cookbook:Game|Game]] ==Ingredients== * 1¼ [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] [[Cookbook:Venison|deer]] loin * 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * ½ cup all-purpose [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * ¾ cup dry [[Cookbook:Wine|white wine]] * ¼ cup butter * 2½ [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] fresh [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] * 3 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Caper|capers]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Parsley|snipped parsley]] ==Procedure== # Slice loin across grain into ¼-inch or thinner slices, or pound flat between two pieces of waxed paper. # Combine with 1 cup of milk in shallow dish. # Cover dish in refrigerator for up to 3 hours, then discard milk. # Add remaining milk and temper outside refrigerator one hour. # Discard milk, then pat slices dry. # Mix flour, salt and pepper, then thoroughly coat venison slices. # In large [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]], melt butter over medium heat, then brown venison on both sides. # Add wine and [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] two minutes more. # Transfer venison slices to heated platter with slotted spoon. # Add lemon juice, capers, and parsley to skillet, and cook on medium two minutes, constantly scraping bottom and sides of skillet. # Serve venison slices with sauce over it. [[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Venison recipes]] [[Category:Milk recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]]

{{recipe}} {{recipesummary |Category = Turkey recipes |Servings = 2-4 |Time = soaking: 6 hours
cooking: 1 hour-ish |Rating = 2 }} '''Turkey and Lima beans''' is a simple dish with a rich flavour. The turkey mince, simmered in the same water used to cook the Lima beans, produces a flavoursome broth, and the sage really sets off the dish nicely. Great when served over [[Cookbook:Rice|steamed rice]]. ==Ingredients== * 500 [[Cookbook:Gram|g]] (1 [[Cookbook:Pound|lb]]) [[Cookbook:Turkey|turkey]] [[Cookbook:Mincing|mince]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] dried [[Cookbook:Lima Bean|Lima beans]] * 1-2 [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], sliced * 2-3 sticks of [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]] * a handful of fresh [[Cookbook:Sage|sage]], chopped (or 1-2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] of dried sage) * 2 tsp ground [[Cookbook:Coriander|coriander seed]] * 1 tsp ground [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] * 1-2 tsp [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chili]] flakes or powder (or hot [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]]) * 2-3 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|Tbs]] [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]], to taste * [[Cookbook:Water|water]] ==Procedure== # Soak the dried beans overnight, or at least 6 hours. # Drain the soaked beans, discarding the water. Cover the beans with water in a small pot, bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Stir periodically, and start testing for tenderness after 10 minutes. Alternatively, cook in a [[Cookbook:Pressure Cooking|pressure cooker]] at 15 PSI for 3 minutes, and set aside to depressurise. # While the beans are cooking, add olive oil to a large pan and heat. When hot, add the onion and celery, and [[Cookbook:Sautéing|sauté]] until translucent. # Add the cumin, coriander, chili, and pepper to the pan and stir in. Allow to sauté for another couple of minutes. # Add the turkey mince to the pan, and turn up the heat. Stir while browning the mince, breaking up large pieces. Ensure that all the mince is browned. # Tip the beans, with their cooking water, into the pan and stir in the salt and sage. Simmer for 15 minutes (e.g. while cooking some rice!) Serve over steamed [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]] - it goes very nicely with arborio rice! ==Notes, tips and variations== * Canned Lima beans may be used, to short-cut the preparation of this meal. Rinse well before use. * Lima beans work wonderfully well with turkey or [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]], but other beans may be used instead if more convenient - I've found that [[Cookbook:Black-Eyed Pea|black-eyed peas]] are almost as good. * If a thicker sauce is desired, stir in some [[Cookbook:Manioc Flour|manioc flour]], a tablespoon at a time until almost thick enough, while still hot. Alternatively, don't add all of the liquid from cooking the beans. [[Category:Turkey recipes]] [[Category:Bean recipes]] [[Category:Gluten-free recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Stew recipes |4|abut an hour and a half|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Beans|Beans]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 1 medium red [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] * 1 red [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|bell pepper]], peeled, cored and chopped * 2 [[Cookbook:Garlic|cloves garlic]], minced * [[Cookbook:Pinch|Pinch]] [[Cookbook:Saffron|saffron]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] new or boiling [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]], unpeeled and cut into bite-sized chunks * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] smoked sweet [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]] (such as Piment-n de la Vera) * ¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Wine|sherry]] * 2 cups cooked [[Cookbook:Chickpea|chickpeas]] (garbanzo beans), drained or 1 (15-ounce) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained * 1 (14½-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]]) can diced [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] plus their liquid * 2½ cups vegetable [[Cookbook:Stock|stock]] or [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|freshly ground pepper]] to taste * 2 cups hot cooked [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]] * Chopped [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]], optional [[Cookbook:Garnish|garnish]]
==Procedure==
# In a [[Cookbook:Dutch Oven|Dutch Oven]] or large soup pot, heat oil over medium heat. # [[Cookbook:Sautéing|Sauté]] onion, red pepper, garlic, saffron, and potatoes, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes start to soften, about 15 minutes. # Stir in paprika, then sherry and cook about a minute. # Add chickpeas, tomatoes, stock (or water), salt and pepper. # Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and cook partially covered until potatoes are tender and stew thickens, 30 to 40 minutes. # Remove from heat and let stand about 15 minutes to meld flavors and thicken slightly. # To serve, make a pyramid of rice in the center of each of 4 bowls, then ladle hot stew around rice. # [[Cookbook:Garnish|Garnish]] with parsley, if desired.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* If you prefer a spicier dish, add a pinch of [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|red pepper]] flakes or a dash of hot sauce to the pot while the stew is cooking.
[[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Stew recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]] [[Category:Chickpea recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]] [[Category:Rice recipes]] [[Category:Tomato recipes]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Fish recipes|4|⅛ hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Fish|Fish]]
==Ingredients==
* 4 boneless, skinless [[Cookbook:Fish|fish]] fillets (about 6 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] each, 1 to 1¼ inches at thickest), such as tilapia, catfish or trout (see notes) * [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste * ⅓ cup bottled [[Cookbook:Italian dressing|Italian dressing]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Cornmeal|corn muffin]], or ⅔ cup coarse crumbs * 1 [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemon]], or 3 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] lemon juice
==Procedure==
# Preheat the [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|400°F]]()204°C). # Spray an glass baking dish with [[Cookbook:Cooking Spray|cooking-oil spray]]. # Season each fish piece with salt and pepper and place in the dish. (see notes) # Pour the dressing evenly over the fish. # Crumble the corn muffin, and sprinkle the crumbs over the fish. # Place the dish in the preheated oven, and [[Cookbook:Baking|bake]] until the dressing is bubbling at the edges, the crumbs lightly brown and the thickest part of the fillets are opaque and flake easily with a fork, about 15 to 20 minutes. # While fish is baking, cut the lemon into 4 parts and set aside. # When the fish is done, remove it from the oven, squeeze the juice from the lemon quarters over the fish and serve immediately.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Note: If the only available fillets are large, cut two of them in half to make four servings. * When placing the fish in the baking dish, the thick parts should not be layered.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Southern recipes]] [[Category:Corn recipes]] [[Category:Fish recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Salad Dressing recipes|¾ cup|5 minutes|1}}
==Ingredients==
* ¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] drained [[Cookbook:Caper|capers]] * 1 clove [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], pressed * 1 [[Cookbook:Shallot|shallot]], minced * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]] * 1 small dried red [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chile]], sliced * ½ teaspoon crushed [[Cookbook:Fennel|fennel seed]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] white Chianti or dry [[Cookbook:Wine|white wine]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]]
==Procedure==
# Combine all ingredients in a jar with tight-fitting top. # Shake well.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Best if used fresh.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Salad Dressing recipes]] [[Category:Garlic recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Seafood|Seafood]]
''This is going to be a contentious one !! There are SO many ways of doing this recipe that no one person can provide the definitive recipe. But, on the basis that the generous readers of Wikipedia recipes will accept that this is only one man's interpretation of a well-loved and delicious recipe... here goes !! Please do feel free to add suggestions on how YOU do this perennial favourite !''
== Ingredients ==
* 200 [[Cookbook:Gram|g]] of fresh [[Cookbook:Salmon|salmon]] * 200 g of smoked [[Cookbook:Haddock|haddock]] * 100 g [[Cookbook:Shrimp|prawns]] * 100 g [[Cookbook:Mussel|mussels]] * 5 [[Cookbook:Scallop|scallops]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Pound|lb]] (1 [[Cookbook:Kg|kg]]) [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]] <!-- commented out because the peas aren't used in the recipe * 1 bag frozen [[Cookbook:Pea|peas]] (how big?) --> * [[Cookbook:Nutmeg|nutmeg]] * [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:Pint|Pt]] (150 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]]) fresh single [[Cookbook:Cream|cream]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaves]] * [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 50 g Ementhaler or Appenzeller cheese, grated.
== Procedure ==
# Take all the fish and place it all in a saucepan with sufficient milk so that the fish is submerged. # Add the bay leaf and a pinch of salt # Poach on a low heat for about 5 minutes # Remove the fish from the pan, skin the haddock and the salmon, and flake, using a fork, into pieces. # Return to the milk and set aside. # Peel and boil the potatoes until they are soft enough to mash. This will take at least 20 minutes of boiling, otherwise the mash may remain lumpy (''and who wants lumpy mash !!??'') # The potato needs to be mashed very well indeed, and for this I personally recommend an electric whisk after the initial crushing of the potatoes. # Pour some of the milk into the potatoes so that the taste of fish infuses into it. # The mash should not get too runny, but add some of the cream and grate some nutmeg into the potato as well. # Now put the cooked fish into the bottom of an oven-proof dish, with any remaining milk sauce. The dish should not be too large as it is nice to build a couple of layers of the fish, rather than lay it out in one layer. Once you have done this, pat the fish gently down a little so that it is slightly compacted. # Now spread the mashed potato over the top of the fish to a height of about 1½ inches (38mm) making sure it is flat, and not piled up in the middle. Using a fork, ridge the top of the potato as this will make it colour up nicely in the oven. # At this stage, if you want, add the grated cheese over the potato, and if you are feeling artistic, decorate the top of the pie with some large peeled prawns around the edge of the fish, and maybe a decoration in the middle. # Place the pie in the oven at 220°C and leave for about 30 minutes or so, until the top of the potato/grated cheese is nicely coloured and the potato is bubbling nicely. # Remove from the oven and serve immediately.
A good accompaniment to fish pie is [[Cookbook:samphire|samphire]] if you can get it (boil it for 10 minutes, add butter and maybe a little grated Parmesan cheese) or a lovely, fresh green salad.
Bon Appetit, Wikipedies
[[Category:Pie recipes]] [[Category:Seafood recipes]] [[Category:Potato recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Pasta|Pasta]]
''If you have the misfortune to suffer any serious ailment, such as hypochondria, or are of a nervous disposition, or are worried sick about your carbon footprint and think that sending a cheque to some "offset company" in Mongolia will do the trick, please keep away from this recipe !!''
''It is dynamite and will give you a guilty conscience for the next month !! If you are none of the above, and all you want to do in the years to come is die with a smile on your face, enjoy it, remembering though to check your blood pressure in the morning !!''
== Ingredients ==
* 500 [[Cookbook:Gram|g]] of the strongest Mountain or Valley [[Cookbook:Gorgonzola Cheese|Gorgonzola cheese]] you can buy. (''I don't care what anyone else says, an alternative cheese will NOT do!!'') * a few drops of [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 150 g [[Cookbook:Ricotta Cheese|ricotta cheese]] * a pinch of [[Cookbook:Mixed Herbs|mixed Herbs]] * grated [[Cookbook:Nutmeg|nutmeg]] * [[Cookbook:Zest|zest]] of one [[Cookbook:Lemon|lemon]] * on standby - 1 glass of fresh [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * penne or your favourite [[Cookbook:Pasta|pasta]] (though a "ridged" pasta is the best for this recipe!) * water
== Procedure ==
# Put on the pasta to cook in plenty of salted water. # Add the drops of olive oil to a preferably cast-iron saucepan, and crumble the pieces of Gorgonzola into it, on a VERY low heat. The cheese will melt and become runny, at which point add the ricotta cheese and continue to melt until the whole lot becomes a sauce. # If the sauce remains too thick, add a little of the milk and heat up once again. # Grate in plenty of nutmeg and add the mixed herbs and leave to stand for a little while. # Once the pasta is cooked, drain well and tip into a mixing bowl. # Add the Gorgonzola sauce, and using a wooden spoon, mix well.
Serve, as with ALL Pasta sauces, immediately.
Buon Appetito, Wikipedies !!
--[[User:Peterkirchem|Peterkirchem]] 08:29, 3 July 2007 (UTC)
[[Category:Pasta recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]]

page.title: Cookbook:Pork Burritos with Green Pepper Sauce

revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Meat recipes|12 Burritos|Prep time 15 minutes
Cook time 8 to 10 hours
Stand time 10 minutes|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|Cuisine of the USA]] | [[Cookbook:Chili|Chili]] ==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] * 4 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], minced * 1 large [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] (~1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]]) * 1 16-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] jar medium chunky [[Cookbook:Salsa|salsa]] * 1 16-ounce jar mild chunky salsa * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Lime|lime juice]] * 1 bunch fresh [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]], chopped (~1 cup) * 8 scallions, chopped (~1 cup) * 1 medium [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|red pepper]], chopped (~1 cup) * ¼ cup lemon pepper seasoning * ¼ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] ground [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]] * 1 4-[[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] boneless [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]] loin roast, tied or netted * 1 4-ounce can [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|green chiles]] * 12 10-inch [[Cookbook:Flour Tortilla|flour tortillas]] * 8 ounces shredded Monterey Jack [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]] (~2 cups) ==Procedure== # Heat oil in 12-inch [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] over medium heat. # Add garlic and onion and cook until tender. # Stir the next 10 ingredients into the skillet. # Put the pork roast into 5-[[Cookbook:Quart|quart]] slow cooker. # Cover roast with salsa mixture. # Cover and cook on low 8 to 10 hours or until meat is fork-tender. # Remove roast and let stand 10 minutes on [[Cookbook:Cutting Board|cutting board]]. # Shred pork with forks. # Transfer 5 cups salsa mixture from cooker into 2-quart [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]]. # Stir in chiles. # Cook over medium heat to a [[Cookbook:Boiling|boil]]. # Reduce heat to medium-low. # Cook and stir 15 minutes to thicken mixture. # Spoon a cup of shredded pork down center of each tortilla. # Top with 2 tablespoons green chile sauce. # Roll sides of tortilla over and then fold up ends to hold filling. # Cover burritos with rest of green chile sauce and cheese. [[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Slow cooker recipes]] [[Category:Sauce recipes]] [[Category:Pork recipes]] [[Category:Tomato recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Seafood recipes|5 crab cakes|1 hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Seafood|Seafood recipes]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] Florida Bay seasoning (see Note) * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Dijon Mustard|Dijon mustard]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cayenne pepper|cayenne]] * 1 tablespoon thinly sliced [[Cookbook:Chive|chives]] * 1 tablespoon finely [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Coriander|ground coriander]] * [[Cookbook:Lime|juice of ½ lime]] * [[Cookbook:Pepper|white pepper]], to taste * [[Cookbook:Kosher|kosher]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]], to taste * ⅓ cup Italian [[Cookbook:Bread Crumb|bread crumbs]] * 2 pounds [[Cookbook:Crab|lump crabmeat]], picked over to remove shell bits and cartilage * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]]
==Procedure==
# Combine Florida Bay seasoning, mayonnaise, egg, mustard, cayenne, chives, cilantro, coriander, and lime juice in a large mixing bowl. # Season to taste with white pepper and kosher salt. # Fold in the bread crumbs and crabmeat as gently as possible, trying to avoid breaking up the lumps. # Rest mixture in the refrigerator ½ to 2 hours. # Divide and shape into 5 patties. # Heat butter in a large heavy-bottomed [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] or [[Cookbook:Sautéing|sauté]] pan over medium-high heat. # Cook the crab cakes in the butter about 2 minutes per side, until golden brown on both sides. # Lower heat to medium and cook until the cakes are hot but still moist on the inside, about an additional 3 to 5 minutes per side.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Note: Florida Bay seasoning, also known as Old Florida Bay seasoning and Florida seasoning, may be difficult to find locally. It is available through several Internet-based merchants (Google "Florida Bay seasoning"). * Alternatively, you could substitute Old Bay seasoning.
[[Category:Southern recipes]] [[Category:Fried recipes]] [[Category:Crab recipes]] [[Category:Egg recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Caribbean cuisines|Caribbean cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Salad recipes|6 cups|2½ hours|2}}
==Ingredients==
* ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] minced red [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], scalded (see note) * 4 small, ripe [[Cookbook:Avocado|avocados]], peeled and [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] (save the pits) * 1 to 2 small serrano chilis (2½ inches long, or ½ small [[Cookbook:Jalapeño|jalapeño]] chili, seeded and very finely minced) * 3 tablespoons minced fresh [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]] * ½ teaspoon ground [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Garlic|minced garlic]] * 1½ cups minced [[Cookbook:Jicama|jicama]] * 5 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Lime|fresh lime juice]] * 1 ripe [[Cookbook:Mango|mango]], small, diced * 3 tablespoons minced fresh [[Cookbook:Mint|mint]] * 1½ cups minced fresh [[Cookbook:Pineapple|pineapple]] (half a small pineapple) * ½ to ¾ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
==Procedure==
# Combine the avocados, minced chilis, cilantro, cumin, garlic, jicama, lime juice, mango, mint, pineapple, and salt in a medium-sized bowl then add the onion. # Mix everything together thoroughly but gently. # Put the avocado pits in the salad, to help the avocados retain color. # Chill for about 2 hours, tightly covered. # Take out the pits and serve.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* To scald the minced onion, pour about a quart of [[Cookbook:Boiling|boiling]] [[Cookbook:Water|water]] over the onion in a [[Cookbook:Colander|colander]] or [[Cookbook:Sieve|strainer]] inside a bowl and let stand while preparing rest of recipe.
[[Category:Salsa recipes]] [[Category:Avocado recipes]] [[Category:Mango recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]] [[category:Gluten-free recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|6|½ hour|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Pasta|Pasta]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Quart|quart]] vegetable [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrots]], in tiny cubes (the size of small peas) * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] [[Cookbook:Zucchini|zucchini]] * ½ cup diced yellow crooked-neck [[Cookbook:Squash|squash]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Corn|baby corn]], ¼-inch pieces (or ¼ cup frozen corn [see Notes]) * ½ cup small [[Cookbook:Pea|peas]] (frozen [see Notes]) * ½ cup minced firm [[Cookbook:Tofu|tofu]] * 1 to 1½ cups cooked small [[Cookbook:Pasta|pasta]] [see Notes]
==Procedure==
# Bring broth to [[Cookbook:Boiling|boil]] in a medium-sized saucepan. # Add carrots, and lower the heat to a [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]]. # Cook for 5 minutes, or until carrots are just tender. # Add zucchini, squash, and corn. # Simmer for 5 minutes, then stir in peas, tofu, and cooked pasta. # Simmer just a couple of minutes longer. # Serve hot (or very warm) in small bowl with small spoons.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Small pasta: alphabets, little circles, little stars, or orzo, or a combination to delight kids! * Cook pasta and store in water, covered, in the refrigerator until use. Drain well to add to the hot broth. * Frozen Vegetables can be added to the broth frozen.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Soup recipes]] [[Category:Pasta recipes]] [[Category:Carrot recipes]] [[Category:Corn recipes]] [[Category:Tofu recipes]] [[Category:Zucchini recipes]] [[Category:Vegan recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Legumes|Legumes]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]] {{recipesummary|Soup recipes|4|20 minutes|2}}
==Ingredients==
* 2 16-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] cans [[Cookbook:Chickpea|chickpeas]], drained * 1 14-ounce can light [[Cookbook:Coconut|coconut milk]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] low-sodium [[Cookbook:Broth|chicken broth]] * ½ cup prepared [[Cookbook:Salsa|salsa]] * 1½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Garam Masala|garam masala]] * 1 teaspoon ground [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] frozen [[Cookbook:Apple|apple]] juice concentrate * ¼ cup packed [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro leaves]]
==Procedure==
# [[Cookbook:Purée|Purée]] above ingredients in a blender until smooth. # Heat in a large [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]] or [[Cookbook:Dutch Oven|Dutch oven]], and bring to a [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]]. # Simmer, stirring often, 4 to 5 minutes, to blend flavors.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* [[Cookbook:Garnish|Garnishes]]: ¼ cup plain [[Cookbook:Yogurt|yogurt]] and ¼ cup thinly sliced [[Cookbook:Green onion|green onions]].
[[Category:Soup recipes]] [[Category:Chickpea recipes]] [[Category:Coconut recipes]] [[Category:Ginger recipes]]

{{recipe}}
''I invented this recipe for children as it combines ingredients that they seem to love. It is also excruciatingly easy to make, and it very tasty. The ingredients, all "good" ingredients, can normally be obtained in any food outlet - not necessarily a supermarket, so it is good for "last minute" and, lastly, it needs only one pan to cook.''
== Ingredients ==
''It is always difficult to provide exact quantities when suggesting a recipe, as it all rather depends on how many people you are cooking for. Let us however assume you are cooking for 4 people.''
* 1 mugful of your favourite dried [[Cookbook:Pasta|pasta]] per person * 1 400 gr container of plain Philadelphia [[Cookbook:Cream Cheese|cream cheese]] * 1 410 gr tin of [[Cookbook:Corn|sweetcorn]] * 1 tin of [[Cookbook:Tuna|tuna]] of equal size to the sweet corn * 3 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] of [[Cookbook:Pesto|pesto]] * A little ground [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]]
== Procedure ==
# Put the pasta on to boil in copious amounts of water with a little salt and a drop of olive oil added. # In a mixing bowl combine all the rest of the ingredients. # When the pasta is cooked, drain through a colander and add to the bowl. # Stir through, so that everything becomes well coated.
''Please bear in mind that a REAL Italian will always thoroughly mix up the pasta and the sauce in a large bowl before serving. Serving the "naked" pasta on the plate, and plonk the sauce on top of it is both lazy and defeats the object of a pasta sauce!''
Serve immediately
A further thing about this dish is that it is equally delicious as a cold pasta salad, so make plenty of it for lunch, and have it cold for dinner.
''Buon Appetito, Wikipedies !!''
[[Category:Pasta recipes]] [[Category:Tuna recipes]] [[Category:Corn recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Cuisine of Italy]] | [[Cookbook:Pizza|Pizza]] {{recipesummary|Pizza recipes|4-6 (2 medium pizzas: 8 slices each)|90 minutes|3|Image=[[Image:PeperonniPizza.jpg|300px]]}}
==Ingredients== ;Pizza dough: * 1 [[Cookbook:cup|cup]] of warm [[Cookbook:water|water]] * 3 [[Cookbook:tablespoon|tbsp]] of [[Cookbook:Yeast|yeast]] * 1 tbsp of [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:pound|lb]] of [[Cookbook:flour|all purpose flour]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:cup|cup]] of [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]]
;Toppings: * [[Cookbook:Pepperoni|pepperoni]] * 8 [[Cookbook:Ounce|oz]]. of [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|mozzarella cheese]] * ½ 15[[Cookbook:Ounce|oz]]. can of Hunt's Family Favorites Pizza sauce * 1 small [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] finely diced * 1 small [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|red pepper]] finely diced * 3 ½ [[Cookbook:Ounce|oz]]. of sliced [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushrooms]] * [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]], [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]], and [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]]
==Procedure== # Dissolve yeast and sugar in one cup or warm water. # Mix 3 cups of flour, olive oil, one [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] of salt and water & yeast mix. # Knead for 15 minutes, adding more flour until dough gets "non-sticky". # Cover dough with little oil (1 tsp) and place it into a large bowl. Let rest 45 minutes until the dough is twice its original size, covering bowl with plastic wrap. # Meanwhile, preheat oven at 350°F / 175°C (at least 30 minutes). # Hit / knead dough in order to eliminate air bubbles. # Cut dough into two pieces (you can freeze dough to bake later - up to a month). # Roll out dough to form a rounded pizza crust. # Add pizza sauce (½ can per pizza), and sprinkle onion, red pepper, salt, oregano and black pepper. # Bake 10 minutes. # Take out of the oven, add mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, and mushrooms. # Take back to the oven and bake until cheese melts. # Cut into eight slices, and enjoy!!!
==Variations, Tips== # Water must be warm in order to activate yeast, but not boiling. Boiling water will spoil yeast. # You can replace ¼ of water cup with milk, white or red wine. # You can also replace sugar with 1 tbsp of honey. # If you like a stronger cheese flavor, you can add on top of ingredients, little chunks of [[Cookbook:Blue Cheese|Blue Cheese]]. # Never wash the mushrooms with water, in order to make pizza. Mushrooms are like sponges, and will lose unwanted water to your pizza. You can clean it with dry paper towels. # You can try different toppings to basic pizza dough, and even add cheese borders. To do so, you should roll out pizza into a larger size, adding cheese one [[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] from the border, and little pizza sauce. Roll dough over the cheese and press firmly to close.
[[Category:Pizza recipes]]

revision.comment: red pepper flakes = crushed red peppers [that's what it says on the jar]
revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Pork recipes|¾ gallon|20 minutes|2}}
==Ingredients==
* ¾ [[Cookbook:Gallon|gallons]] [[Cookbook:Cider vinegar|apple cider vinegar]] * ⅛ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Pepper|ground black pepper]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|red pepper flakes]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Molasses|molasses]] * 2 cups [[Cookbook:Honey|honey]]
==Procedure==
# Start with apple cider vinegar in [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]] over medium heat. # Add salt, ground black pepper, crushed red pepper, molasses, and honey. # Let mixture heat up, but not quite [[Cookbook:Boiling|boil]]. # Mix well. # Return sauce to the jug that the vinegar came in to cool.
==Notes, tips and variations==
* This is the sauce used for authentic [[Cookbook:Eastern North Carolina Barbecue|barbecue]]. * Recipe from my friend and Brother Chip Crumpler.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Southern recipes]] [[Category:Sauce recipes]] [[Category:Molasses recipes]]

{{Recipe}}|[[Cookbook:Asian Cuisine|South Asian cuisines]] {{recipesummary|Bengali recipes|2|50 minutes|3}} '''Khichuri''' is a Bengali cuisine once considered [[w:en:Comfort food|comfort food]] for the poor, now is a delicacy served warm in [[w:en:Monsoon|Monsoon]] rain. Like similar [[Cookbook:Khichdi|Khichdi]], core ingredients are [[Cookbook:rice|rice]] and [[Cookbook:lentil|lentil]]s, but different variations exist, some adding vegetables, poultry or meat and named accordingly (e. g. ''Sabji khichuri'' for vegetable). Here is the recipe for the popular ''Bhuna Khichuri''.
== Ingredients == [[Image:Khichuri-edit.jpg|thumb|Khichuri before garnish. Note the yellow colour is from Turmeric powder, lentils never give such vibrant colur.]] *1 [[Cookbook:cup|cup]] white fragrant [[Cookbook:rice|rice]] (e.g Bashmati rice or short grained Pilau rice) *1 cup green gram or red split [[Cookbook:lentil|lentil]]s (rice : lentil should be 1:1) *½ cup split [[Cookbook:chickpea|chickpea]]s (preferably dried Bengal variety) (optional) *½ cup [[Cookbook:Pea|garden peas]] (optional) *2 [[Cookbook:tablespoon|tablespoon]]s [[Cookbook:butter|butter]] preferably [[Cookbook:ghee|ghee]] *½ [[Cookbook:teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Turmeric|turmeric powder]] (to give the dish a vibrant yellow colour) *2 whole green [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chili]]s slit in the middle, de-seeded if heat is not desired *[[Cookbook:salt|salt]] according to taste *4 cups of water for boiling '''Spices for seasoning''' *2 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaves]] *4 [[Cookbook:Cardamom|green cardamom pods]] *4 whole [[Cookbook:Clove|cloves]] *2 sticks of [[Cookbook:cinnamon|cinnamon]] 1 inch long *¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin seeds]] *2 cm piece of [[Cookbook:ginger|ginger]], finely chopped '''For garnish''' *1 medium or 2 small [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], thinly sliced *2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:butter|butter]] preferably [[Cookbook:ghee|ghee]] *1 bunch coarsely chopped fresh [[Cookbook:Coriander|coriander]] leaves
== Procedure ==
==== Step 1 ==== *Rinse rice, lentils and chickpeas ( if using dried chickpeas) in cold water separately. *Dry rice in a [[w:en:Colander|colander]] or on a flat surface. *Leave lentils and chickpeas to soak in water for 30 minutes. ==== Step 2 ==== *Drain lentils and chickpeas; then roast them briefly until they emit an aroma, set aside to cool *Heat water in a kettle to use later. Add it to the cooking before it boils thoroughly. *Semi-crush cardamom, cinnamon and cloves ==== Step 3 ==== *Heat 2 tbsp butter in a heavy based pan in medium flame. Throw in bay leaf and semi-crushed spices in the hot melted butter, once they start to sputter (in less than a minute) add sliced ginger and cumin. Stir in 1-2 minutes until ginger yields a nutty flavour. Put green chili and garden pea and stir once or twice. *Then add rice to the mixture and stir gently for 2-3 minutes making sure the oil coats it thoroughly. Add lentils, chickpeas and salt; stir again for 1-2 more minutes *Add hot water to the pan. The level of water should be approx 1 inch above the mixture. Lower the heat slightly, cover and [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] until done. Check regularly to make sure rice does not burn at the bottom. Rice and lentils are done when there is no hard part in rice, it is medium firm, each one is easily separable, but not very soft or sticky. This should take around 10 minutes.
==== Step 4 ==== *When the rice is simmering take a separate frying pan and heat the remaining butter. Fry the onion on a medium heat until it starts to brown. *When rice mixture is done put onion with accompanying oil on top. Garnish with coriander *Turn down the heat to the lowest and cover until served which should not take long.
== Ritual Eating! == ''Bhuna khichuri'' is a romantic dish especially suited for a rainy day. Serve warm with Bengal fish curry and [[w:en:Chutney|Chutney]] as a [[w:en:condiment|condiment]].
== Tips, Notes, and Variations == Weight watchers may replace butter with a low fat vegetable oil or it can be omitted altogether. For oil free alternative dry toast the spices. Pour hot water over rice and lentil mix, then add onion, ginger and spices.
== Warnings == Slicing onions may irritate eyes. This can be avoided by cutting under water, not very convenient though! Ethnic ingredient shops often sell fried onion pack. == See also == *[[Cookbook:Khichdi|Khichdi]] *[[Cookbook:Khara pongal|Khara pongal]] *[[Cookbook:Paella|Paella]] [[Category:Medium Difficulty recipes]] [[Category:Indian recipes|Khichuri]] [[Category:Rice recipes|Khichuri]] [[Category:Lentil recipes|Khichuri]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Khichuri]] [[Category:Bengali recipes|Khichuri]]

{{recipesummary|Dumpling recipes||75-90 minutes|3|Image=[[Image:Ruskie.jpg|300px]]}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Poland|Cuisine of Poland]]
'''Pierogi''' are Polish dumplings that are typically filled with potatoes, cheese, meat, sauerkraut and mushrooms or wild fruits (strawberries, blueberries, etc.).
== Ingredients == * 1 tbs. [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ½ cup cold water * 1-2 eggs large [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 3½ cups [[Cookbook:Flour|Flour]], plus extra for rolling dough * ~1 cups water * 1½ tbs. unsalted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], melted * 1 recipe [[Cookbook:Pierogie Filling:Saurkraut Filling|sauerkraut filling]] or [[Cookbook:Pierogie Filling:Cheese Filling|cheese filling]].
== Procedure == === Dough === # Place flour in a large bowl. # In a measuring cup, combine the salt, eggs, and the ½ cup cold water, and beat well with a fork. Add those ingredients to flour and mix with your hands until blended. Slowly mix in the remaining water (you do not have to add the entire cup, just keep adding until the dough feels wet). Add the butter and knead until there are no lumps and it feels very smooth. This should take 15 minutes. # Cover and refrigerate the dough for at least 1 hour, but for best results let it sit in the refrigerator for at least 24 hours.
=== Assembly ===
# Divide the dough into thirds and roll out each on a lightly floured surface until the dough is approximately ⅛ inch thick. # With a cup or glass, cut as many circles as possible out of the dough, but do not lift them off the work surface. # Remove the excess dough from the work surface, and roll the circles until they become completely flattened. This might require the additional sprinkling of flour on the dough. # Carefully lift each circle of dough from the table (a spatula helps) and put between 1 tsp. and 1 tbs. of filling in its center. The amount would vary depending on the size of the glass that was used to cut the dough. For each circle, fold dough over to form a half-moon shape, and pinch edges closed, making sure there are no air pockets. # Repeat for the remaining dough.
=== Boiling === # Place no more than ⅓ of the pierogi at a time in boiling salted water for 5-10 minutes. # Drain in colander and lightly rinse with cold water-- this will prevent them from sticking together. # Serve immediately or fry in butter.
== Notes == {{Wikipedia|Pierogi}} * These will freeze well for up to 6 weeks. Prior to boiling them, place each pieróg on a floured sheet of wax paper, being careful not to have them touching. Stack sheets on top of each other and place in an airtight freezer bag. * A standard recipe for mashed potatoes can also be used as filling.
[[Category:Polish recipes]] [[Category:Dumpling recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Puerto Rico|Cuisine of Puerto Rico]]
By Brenda Ortiz
==Ingredients== ;For the flan
* 1 8[[Cookbook:Ounce|oz]] package of [[Cookbook:Cream Cheese|cream cheese]] * 1 can of ''leche condensada'' ([[Cookbook:Condensed milk|sweetened condensed milk]] - available in the Hispanic food section of any supermarket) * 1 can of [[Cookbook:Condensed milk|evaporated milk]] * 4 large [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 1 tsp of [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla extract]]
;For the caramel * 1 cup of sugar
==Procedure== # Preheat oven @ 350°F (175°C) # Add cream cheese, leche condensada, leche evaporada, eggs and vanilla extract into a mixing bowl. Mix ingredients thoroughly at medium speed. # Place cup of sugar to bottom of a small circular [[Cookbook:Cookie Sheet|baking sheet]] and add flan mixture # Fill a large baking sheet with about 1.5 inch of water. This is called ''baño de Maria'' ([[Cookbook:Bain-Marie|bain-marie]]). # Place carefully, baking sheet with flan mixture over the ''baño de Maria''. # Cook flan for 45-50 minutes. Flan is ready when you insert a tooth pick and comes out clean. # Put flan upside down into a serving plate and refrigerate for 5 hours. # Use fresh [[Cookbook:Mint|mint]] leaves for garnish
[[Category:Puerto Rican recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]] [[Category:Egg recipes]] [[Category:Milk recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]] [[Category:Gluten-free recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Puerto Rico|Cuisine of Puerto Rico]] {{recipesummary |Category = Puerto Rican recipes |Time = 5 hours |Level = 4 }}
By: Brenda Ortiz Valle
This recipe is my mom's, Aida E Valle, special Turkey recipe. The best I have tasted in my life!!
==Ingredients==
* 1 whole [[Cookbook:Turkey|turkey]] (15 [[Cookbook:Pound|lbs]])
; For Turkey Seasoning
* ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] of [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * ¼ cup of [[Cookbook:Wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbsp]] of [[Cookbook:Adobo (spice mix)|adobo]] * 2 tbsp of [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]] * 1 tbsp [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 tbsp of ground [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 2 packages of ground "cubitos" (Cubitos en polvo - [[Cookbook:Bouillon Cubes|stock cubes]]) * 2 packages of uncolored [[Cookbook:Sazon|sazon]] (sazon sin color - uncolored seasoned salt) * 4 large cloves of [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], [[Cookbook:Mincing|minced]]
; For Turkey Filling
* 3 [[Cookbook:Plantain|plantains]] * 2 cups of [[Cookbook:Canola Oil|canola oil]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]], diced * 1 red [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|bell pepper]], cut into ½ inch squares * 1 green bell pepper, cut into ½ inch squares * 2 cloves of garlic, minced * ¼ cup of olive oil * 2 tbsp of adobo
==Procedure==
;To season turkey
#In a small bowl mix olive oil, red wine vinegar, adobo, oregano, salt, ground pepper, cubitos, sazon and garlic. #With a sharp knife make incisions in different places of the Turkey. #Use seasoning mixture to season whole turkey. If you need more seasoning mix, repeat first step. #Cover turkey with [[Cookbook:Aluminium foil|aluminum foil]] and set aside. Preferable, leave turkey overnight so it absorbs the seasoning. #Preheat oven at 350°F (175°C).
; To prepare filling
#Peel plantains. Slice plantains into 1-inch chunks. #Add 2 cups of canola oil to a medium size frying pan. Set stove to medium high and place frying pan for about 5 minutes. #Add plantains and fry until they look golden yellow. As they are ready drain them using kitchen towel paper. #Squash plantains one by one using a mortar and place into a medium size bowl. #Add, tomato, red and green pepper, garlic, olive oil and adobo to the bowl containing the squashed plantains and mix.
; To prepare Turkey
#Fill turkey with plantain filling. Cover, the turkey filling opening with kitchen thread. #Cover turkey with aluminum foil and place turkey in preheated oven. #Leave turkey within the first two hours w/o removing aluminum foil. After two hours, remove aluminum foil and turn in ½ hour intervals for two hours. Use the turkey drippings to to moist turkey while cooking. #Set oven to broil for 20 minutes each side.
[[Category:Puerto Rican recipes]] [[Category:Turkey recipes]] [[Category:Gluten-free recipes]]

revision.comment: Undo revision 968446 by [[Special:Contributions/Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]] ([[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|Talk]]) nm. that image has license info
revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Colombia|Cuisine of Colombia]] {{recipesummary|Colombian recipes|6|Cook 1 hour|4|Image=[[Image:Pastel_Arroz.jpg|300px]]}}
El '''Pastel de Arroz''' (Rice Tamale) is typical dish from Cartagena, [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Colombia|Colombia]]. It is very common to find it on Sundays at the beach or as a Christmas Eve favourite.
==Ingredients== ;To prepare rice (Oreado rice): * 1½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] of [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]] * ½ cup of white [[Cookbook:Vinegar|vinegar]] * 6 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|Tbs]] of [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] * 1 Tbs of [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 2 Tbs of [[Cookbook:Annatto|onoto]] seeds * ½ cup of [[Cookbook:Corn Oil|corn oil]] / [[Cookbook:Sunflower Oil|sunflower oil]] * 1 Tbs of [[Cookbook:Garlic Powder|garlic powder]]
;To fill the "pasteles": * "Oreado" rice * 6 chunks of tender [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]] * 6 pieces of [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] (I recommend drumsticks or cutlets) * 6 small [[w:Vienna sausage|Vienna sausages]] * 6 small [[Cookbook:Chorizo|chorizos]] * 6 slices of [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]] * Assorted [[Cookbook:Pickle|pickles]] ([[Cookbook:Carrot|carrot]], [[Cookbook:Green Bean|green beans]], [[Cookbook:Cauliflower|cauliflower]], [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|red pepper]], [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]]) * One 16[[Cookbook:Ounce|oz]]. can of Goya [[Cookbook:Chickpea|chickpeas]] * 3 medium [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]] * 3 red [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * 12 large [[Cookbook:Cabbage|cabbage]] leaves * 24 large "[[w:Heliconia bihai|lobster claw]]" leaves (can be replaced with [[Cookbook:Banana|banana]] plant leaves) * [[Cookbook:Caper|capers]], [[Cookbook:Olive|olives]] and pickled onions
==Procedure:== ;To prepare rice: # Mix well all ingredients listed in this subsection into a large [[Cookbook:Pyrex|Pyrex]] baking dish. # Let stand one day long under the sun (this is called "Orear").
;Building the "Pasteles": # Place one leaf of cabbage in top of a clean working area. # Spread ⅛ cup of "Oreado Rice" over the cabbage leaf. # Place one unit of each meat evenly through the pastel. # Place pickles, chickpeas, capers, pickled onions on top of the meats. # Place two slices of potato and two slices of tomato. Cover with another 1/8 cup of "Oreado Rice". # Cover with one leaf of cabbage. # Place one washed Lobster Claw / Banana leaf in a plain working area. Carefully put the pastel over the leaf and roll firmly. Cover with a second leaf and roll firmly. Tie with thread. # Cook in a large pan cover with water, vinegar and salt for two hours.
==Notes, tips, and variations== # Onoto substitutes: pinch of paprika (for color not flavor); an equal amount of saffron; yellow food coloring; hot paprika; or equal parts turmeric and paprika. # You can prepare your own pickles: For "6 "pasteles" boil 1½ cup or water, ½ cup of vinegar, 4 Tbs of brown sugar and 1 large carrot cut into 6 sticks, 2 celery sticks cut in three pieces each, 6 green beans cut in half, one large red bell pepper cut into 12 sticks, and one small cauliflower. Let cool down and keep refrigerated overnight, before using it.
[[Category:Colombian recipes]] [[Category:Rice recipes]]

revision.comment: recipe for pizza with cheese stuffed in the crust edge
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Bread recipes|1 12-inch pizza|40 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Pizza|pizza]] | [[Cookbook:Meat|meats]]
=Cheese Stuffed Crust Pizza=
===Ingredients===
* [[Cookbook:Cooking Spray|Cooking spray]] * [[Cookbook:Cornmeal|Corn meal]] * 1 can refrigerated pizza crust * 7 1-[[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] pieces of [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|string cheese]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Pizza Sauce|pizza sauce]] * 24 slices [[Cookbook:Pepperoni|pepperoni]] * 1 cup cooked [[Cookbook:Sausage|Italian sausage]] * 2 cups Italian blend shredded [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]]
===Directions===
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|425°F]]. # Spray 12 inch [[Cookbook:Pizza Pan|pizza pan]] with cooking spray. # Sprinkle lightly with cornmeal, if desired. # Starting in the center, press pizza dough in pan beyond the sides of the pan by an inch. # Fold the hanging edge of the dough back toward the middle, placing the sticks of string cheese in the pouch, all the way around the circle. # Pinch the dough to seal in the cheese. # [[Cookbook:Bake|Bake]] the crust 8 or 10 minutes, or until the edges are light golden and the dough has started to set. # Remove from oven and spread the sauce over the crust with the back of a spoon. # Scatter on the sauce the pepperoni, sausage, and shredded Italian cheese. # Replace in oven and bake until crust is deeply golden brown and the (topping) cheese is melted. # Cut into 8 slices, or if you're not hungry enough to eat 8 pieces, cut into 6.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cheese recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Sausage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Tomato recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Pizza|Pizza]] {{recipesummary|American recipes|16|40 minutes|2}}
==Ingredients==
* [[Cookbook:Cooking Spray|Cooking spray]] * [[Cookbook:Cornmeal|Corn meal]] * 1 can refrigerated pizza crust * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (2 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]]) shredded [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar cheese]] * 1½ cups (6 ounces) shredded [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|mozzarella cheese]]
===Barbecue chicken pizza corner===
* 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Onion|red onion]] * ½ cup BBQ sauce with shredded chicken
===Pizza Margherita corner===
* 1 tablespoon shredded (fresh) [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|Parmesan cheese]] * 4 or 5 ¼[[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] slices Roma (aka plum) [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * 1 tablespoon thin strips of [[Cookbook:Basil|fresh basil]]
===Hawaiian pizza corner===
* 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Pizza Sauce|pizza sauce]] * 2 slices [[Cookbook:Ham|Canadian bacon]], cut in quarters * ¼ cup drained [[Cookbook:Pineapple|chopped pineapple]]
===Pepperoni pizza corner===
* 2 tablespoons pizza sauce * 8 or 10 slices [[Cookbook:Pepperoni|pepperoni]]
==Procedure==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|425°F]]. # Spray [[Cookbook:Cookie Sheet|cookie sheet]] with cooking spray. # Sprinkle lightly with cornmeal, if desired. # Unroll pizza dough and press out on cookie sheet into a 12 by 14 inch shape. # Brush with olive oil. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] crust 6 or 8 minutes. # Sprinkle shredded Cheddar cheese in a cross shape to divide crust in fourths. # In each corner, spread one of the above toppings (or one of your own!). # Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the top of all. # Bake another 10 to 14 minutes,until cheese is bubbly but not burned. # Cut each corner into 4 squares.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]] [[Category:Chicken recipes]] [[Category:Ham recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]] [[Category:Pineapple recipes]] [[Category:Tomato recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Vegetable recipes|2|10 minutes|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]]
=Beer Batter=
===Ingredients===
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Cornstarch|cornstarch]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * ⅓ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ⅓ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]] * 1/6 teaspoon (½ of ⅓ teaspoon) salt * 1/6 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 8 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] [[Cookbook:Beer|beer]]
===Directions===
# Stir together dry ingredients. # Stir in beer. # Mix together thoroughly.
===Uses===
* Use in preparation of [[Cookbook:Onion blooms|Onion Blooms]].

{{recipesummary|Vegetable recipes|6|½ hour|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]]
=Spiced Flour=
===Ingredients===
* ⅔ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1⅛ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]] * ⅔ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] powder * 1/6 teaspoon (½ of ⅓ teaspoon) [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * ⅛ teaspoon (or less) [[Cookbook:Cayenne Pepper|cayenne pepper]]
===Directions===
# Mix together ingredients thoroughly.
===Uses===
* Use in preparation of [[Cookbook:Onion blooms|Onion Blooms]].

{{recipesummary|Vegetable recipes|2|5 minutes|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]]
=Sour Cream Chili Sauce=
===Ingredients===
* 6 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] * 6 ounces [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] * 1½-2 ounces chili sauce * 1/6 teaspoon (½ of ⅓ teaspoon) [[Cookbook:Cayenne Pepper|cayenne pepper]]
===Directions===
# Stir well together all ingredients. # Divide into 2 small cups.
===Uses===
* Put 1 small cup into center of each [[Cookbook:Onion blooms|Onion Bloom]] for dipping.

revision.comment: Breaded spiced fried onion. No calories, no fat. Really...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Vegetable recipes|2 blooms|½ hour|3}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Appetizers|appetizers]]
=Onion Blooms=
===Ingredients===
* 2 huge [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], at least 4 [[Cookbook:Inch|inches]] across * [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] for [[Cookbook:Fry|frying]] * [[Cookbook:Beer batter|Beer Batter]] * [[Cookbook:Seasoned flour|Seasoned Flour]] * [[Cookbook:Sour cream chili sauce|Sour Cream Chili Sauce]]
===Directions===
# Preheat deep fryer to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|375°F]]. # Put each onion on cutting board root end down and cut ¾ inch off the top. # Peel onion. # Cut vertically through the center, from the top to the root, without cutting through. # Repeat cuts radially (across the center, like a clock face) for a total of 6 or 8 cuts. # Remove about 1 inch of the onion center. # Soak in ice water 15 minutes. # Cut a little deeper if an onion isn't bloomed enough. # Dip in Seasoned Flour and shake gently to remove excess. # Dip in Beer Batter and shake gently to remove excess. ''You may have to separate fronds to get a good coating.'' # Handling carefully, lower into fryer using a fryer basket. # Fry about a minute and a half. # Remove basket from fryer, turn onions over, and return to fryer. # Fry until golden, about another minute and a half. # Drain on towel. # Serve hot.
===Tips, Notes, and Variations===
* Good with Creamy Chili Sauce, put a small cup in the center of the onion, where you took out the center. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Onion recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|4-6|4-8 hours|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Meat|meats]] | [[Cookbook:Game|game]] | [[Cookbook:Poultry|poultry]]
=Whole cut up chicken in a crock pot=
===Ingredients===
* 1 whole [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]], cut up * 1 10 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] can condensed cream of chicken soup * 1 10 ounce can condensed cream of celery soup
===Directions===
# Put chicken in crock pot. # Mix together cream of chicken soup and cream of celery soup. # Pour soups mixture over chicken in crock pot. # Cook on High for 4 hours or on Low for 8 hours.
===Tips, Notes, and Variations===
* May substitute game birds. * May substitute chicken breasts for the whole chicken parts. * For camping, may cook in a [[Cookbook:Dutch Oven|Dutch oven]] or in a [[Cookbook:Bean pot|bean pot]] in a hole lined with coals and left all day.
===Uses===
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Midwestern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Slow cooker recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Bread recipes|¾ cup|20 minutes|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Bread|Bread]] | [[Cookbook:Salad|Salads]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
=Quick Garlic Croutons=
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] ½-[[Cookbook:Inch|inches]] [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]] cubes from good-quality French or Italian loaf * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive oil]] * [[Cookbook:Pinch|Pinch]] of [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ⅛ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic powder]]
==Directions==
# Warm an 8-inch [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] over low heat while preparing bread. # A minute before you are ready to cook, turn heat up to medium. # Toss bread in a bowl with oil, salt, and garlic powder. # Cook, stirring often, until crisp and golden brown, about 7 minutes.
==Uses==
* Great in soups and salads.
