{{recipesummary|Soup recipes|4|30 minutes|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italian cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:beans|Beans]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]]
=White Bean Soup with Basil, Rosemary, and Garlic Croutons=
==Ingredients==
* 2 16-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] cans [[Cookbook:Beans|white beans]], such as cannellini, drained * 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Low-sodium Cooking|low-sodium]] [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * 1 cup of your favorite [[Cookbook:Marinara|marinara pasta sauce]] * 2 large [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic cloves]], minced * ¼ cup packed fresh [[Cookbook:Basil|basil]] leaves, or 1 teaspoon dried basil leaves * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] minced fresh [[Cookbook:Rosemary|rosemary]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|red pepper flakes]]
==Directions==
# [[Cookbook:Purée|Purée]] ingredients in a [[Cookbook:Blender|blender]] until smooth. # Pour into a large [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]] or [[Cookbook:Dutch Oven|Dutch Oven]], and bring to a [[Cookbook:Simmer|simmer]]. # Simmer, partially covered and stirring frequently, to blend flavors, 4 or 5 minutes. # Serve, garnished with croutons.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Garnish: [[Cookbook:Quick garlic croutons|Quick Garlic Croutons]]
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Italian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Soup recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bean recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Basil recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Garlic recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Rosemary recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: Reverted edit of [[Special:Contributions/131.123.177.152|131.123.177.152]], changed back to last version by Mike.lifeguard
revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Colombia|Colombia]] | [[Cookbook:Cereal Grain|Cereal Grain]] | [[Cookbook:Legumes|Legumes]] {{recipesummary|Stew recipes|6|1 Day (Cooking: 1 Hour)|3|Image=[[Image:Frijoles_Vanegas.jpg|300px]]}}
'''Antioqueño Beans''' is an icon of [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Colombia|Colombian Typical Food]]. Are main ingredient of what I consider the National dish: [[Cookbook:Bandeja Paisa|Bandeja Paisa (Paisa's Tray)]], and generally used in the [[Cookbook:Calentao|Calentao]].
==Ingredients== * 1 [[Cookbook:pound|lb]] of [[Cookbook:Kidney Bean|Red]] or [[Cookbook:Cargamanto|Cargamanto]] [[Cookbook:Bean|beans]] * 2 red [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] of chopped [[Cookbook:Scallion|scallions]] * ¼ cup of [[Cookbook:Oil|Oil]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|Tbs]] of [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] * 1 Tbs of [[Cookbook:Allspice|allspice]] * 6 cups of [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Bouillon Cubes|cube]] of [[Cookbook:Stock|chicken broth]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Plantain|plantain]] (I like to use it very ripe, it gives a sweet taste to the beans) * optional: add ½ [[Cookbook:pound|lb]] of [[w:Flank steak|flank steak]]], [[Cookbook:Pork|pork]] legs, or [[w:Chicharrones|pork rinds]]
==Procedure== # Wash beans and let hydrate overnight by covering with twice its amount in water. # Next day, remove floating beans. # I strongly recommend to use a [[Cookbook:Pressure Cooking|pressure cooker]], which will save you plenty of time when cooking the beans. # Heat the oil in the pressure cooker. Add scallions and let fry until it starts getting brown. Add tomato, cumin, cubed chicken broth and allspice. This is called "Hogao", a basic sauce for many Colombian dishes. # Add 6 cups of water, the beans, and plantain. Cook in medium heat until it boils. # Cover the pressure cooker, and let cook for 30 minutes. # Let cool, and open pressure cooker (I use to pull up the pressure valve with a knife, to let steam get out faster, but do so only if used to work with this type or pan). # Check water amount, and add optional beef / pork and close back. Cook for additional 30 minutes. # Check salt. If you wish them thicker, you can cook uncovered at low heat.
==Variations, Tips== * When serving, you can put additional hogao, on top of it. * You can serve it with white rice, avocado, ground beef, roasted beef, fried plantain, roasted chicken, corn "arepa" and many other combinations. * "Trasnochado Beans" (or eaten one day after being cooked) are a great option to eat beans with a delicious concentrated flavor. * If you want to build a Paisa's Tray (Bandeja Paisa), you should serve a portion of Antioqueño beans, a portion of white rice, a portion of ground beef, a slice of avocado, one fried sausage (Chorizo), fried ripe plantain, one fried blood sausage, pork rind, and one fried egg on top of the rice. Enjoy it!!!. * Another delicious option for Antioqueño Beans, are the "Cazuelitas" (Small Casserole). You serve half of a casserole with Antioqueño Beans, and add to it corn, shredded beef ("Ropa Vieja"), avocado (cubed), and ground pork rind.
[[Category:Colombian recipes]] [[Category:Bean recipes]] [[Category:Stew recipes]] [[Category:Soup recipes]]

page.title: Cookbook:Black Bean Soup and Salsa Verde

revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Mexico|Mexican cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Soup recipes|4|30 minutes|2}}
==Ingredients==
* 2 15.5-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] cans [[Cookbook:Black Bean|black beans]], drained * 1½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Low-sodium Cooking|low-sodium]] [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Salsa Verde|salsa verde]] (vary amount for less or more spicy) * ¼ cup packed [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro leaves]], plus extra sprigs for garnish (optional) * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Cumin|ground cumin]]
==Procedure==
# [[Cookbook:Purée|Purée]] all ingredients in a [[Cookbook:Blender|blender]] until smooth. # Pour into a large [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]] or [[Cookbook:Dutch Oven|Dutch Oven]], and bring to a [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]]. # Simmer, partially covered and stirring frequently, to blend flavors, 5 or 7 minutes. # Serve, [[Cookbook:Garnish|garnishing]] each portion with 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] of tortilla chips, 1 tablespoon of [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] and optional cilantro sprigs.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Garnishes: ¼ cup crumbled tortilla chips and ¼ cup sour cream
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Southwestern recipes]] [[Category:Mexican recipes]] [[Category:Camping recipes]] [[Category:Soup recipes]] [[Category:Bean recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Fish|Fish]] {{recipesummary|Fish recipes|8|1 hour+|2}}
==Ingredients==
* 1 8-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] package [[Cookbook:Macaroni|macaroni]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] grated [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar cheese]] * ⅔ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Mustard|dry mustard]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * 1 10¾-ounce can cream of [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]] soup * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 14¾-ounce can [[Cookbook:Salmon|salmon]] * 1 8-ounce bag frozen [[Cookbook:Pea|peas]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Bread Crumb|bread crumbs]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], melted
==Procedure==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|350°F]] (175°C). # Cook macaroni according to package directions; drain. # In a large bowl, combine cheese, macaroni, milk, dry mustard, onion, soup, and salt. # Add salmon and frozen peas. # Place in a greased 9- by 13-inch pan. # Cover mixture with bread crumbs; drizzle with melted butter. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] for 45 minutes.
[[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Casserole recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]] [[Category:Milk recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]] [[Category:Pasta recipes]] [[Category:Salmon recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Colombian recipes|2|15 Min|1|Image=[[Image:x.jpg|300px]]}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Colombia|Cuisine of Colombia]]
'''Hogao''' is criollo sauce, used in many colombian dishes.
==Ingredients==
* 2 large [[Cookbook:Tomato|Red Tomatoes]], finely diced. * 2 [[Cookbook:Scallion|scallions]], finery chopped. * ¼ Cup of [[Cookbook:Oil|Oil]] * Allspice, Cubed Chicken Broth, Salt, Pepper.
==Procedure:==
# Heat oil in a medium frying pan. # Add scallions, fry 5 minutes in medium heat. # Add tomato, and spices. Let cook in low heat for 10 minutes.
[[Category:Colombian recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Bread Recipes|Bread recipes]] {{recipesummary|Bread recipes|5|1 hour|2}}
{{Nutrition Summary| |ServingSize=3½ inches square |Servings=5 |Cals=284 |FatCals=88 (31%) |TotalFat=10 g |SatFat=5g |Cholesterol=189 mg |Sodium=400 mg |Carbs=34 g |Fiber=2 g |Sugars=9 g |Protein=14 g |VitaminA=?% |VitaminC=?% |Calcium=?% |Iron=?% }}
==Ingredients==
* 3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Cornmeal|corn meal]], white or yellow * ¼ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]] * ⅛-1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Red Pepper|red pepper flakes]], to taste * 1 cup minced [[Cookbook:Green onion|scallions]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 4 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]], separated * ⅓ cup grated [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]], mild or sharp to taste (if used, reduce salt)
==Procedure==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|400°F]] (205°C). # Thickly coat 8 x 8 [[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] [[Cookbook:Pots and Pans|baking pan]] with [[Cookbook:Cooking Spray|cooking spray]]. # [[Cookbook:Beat|Beat]] [[Cookbook:Egg White|egg whites]] until stiff, then set aside. # Heat milk in medium [[Cookbook:Saucepan|saucepan]] over medium heat until just barely bubbling at the edges. # Reduce heat and [[Cookbook:Whisk|whisk]] while slowly adding cornmeal. # Whisk constantly over low heat for 5 minutes. # Take off heat and stir in black pepper, red pepper flakes, salt, and scallions. # Stir in egg yolks and cheese. # Fold in whipped egg whites. # Pour into pan. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] about 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Southern recipes]] [[Category:Camping recipes]] [[Category:Bread recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]] [[Category:Corn recipes]] [[Category:Egg recipes]] [[Category:Milk recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]

{{recipe}} [[Image:Steinpilzrisotto.jpg|right|thumb|300px]]
'''''Risotto ai funghi''' is probably the most renowned of all risotto dishes, and should ideally be cooked with porcini mushrooms when they begin to come into season in July in Italy. However, dried porcini (or indeed any other mushroom) is fine.''
''Unfortunately an awful lot of pretentious b****ocks is written by highfalutin chefs on how to cook risotto, but being originally a peasant's dish it's dead easy, and very tasty !!''
== Ingredients ==
* '''''Arborio, Viale Nano''''' or '''''Carnaroli''''' risotto rice, enough for your guests * 25[[Cookbook:Gram|g]] salted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 1 small white [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Liter|litre]] of [[Cookbook:Stock|chicken stock]] (fresh if possible, or from a good quality [[Cookbook:Bouillon Cubes|cube]]) * 200g of porcini [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushrooms]], fresh or dried * a small bunch of flat-leaved [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]] * 1 cupful of white, dry [[Cookbook:Wine|wine]] * 100 g freshly grated [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|Parmesan Reggiano cheese]] * optional: 1 large [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] clove, crushed
== Procedure ==
# Soak the mushrooms for at least 20 minutes in 200 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]] of warm water. If the instructions on the packet say they should be soaked for less time, ignore them. Once they have reconstituted properly, chop about ½ of them into small pieces and roughly chop the rest. # Melt half the butter in preferably a medium sized frying pan, or saucepan, on a medium heat. # Chop the onion very finely and "sweat" in the butter until they turn translucent. ''Under no circumstances should they burn. If they do burn, have a good swear and chuck them away. Start over !'' # Now add the rice and swirl it around in the pan until it is also coated in the butter. Leave for about 30 seconds. Again it should not even come close to burning. # Now splash in the wine - it should fizz and steam dramatically - and wait for it to evaporate. # Add about half the stock (''Forget this nonsense of adding it one ladle at a time! It invites trouble by risking the rice "catching" and burning whilst you are off doing something else, and makes no discernible difference whatsoever to the taste!)'' # Stir the rice about every 2 minutes to release the starch and add more stock if there is the slightest chance of the rice drying out. # After about 5 minutes of cooking add the Mushrooms and their juice (or ''liquor'' as it is called) #:The secret of Risotto is that the rice should be cooked to a point the Italians call ''al dente'' - which means the rice should have a bit of bite left, rather than be squashy and flaccid. This takes anywhere between 15 and 20 minutes, but be sure to start testing small spoonfuls after about 15 minutes cooking. #:The rice should be fairly glutinous and no TOO runny. Ideally is should spread out on its own across the plate when served, not remaining in a lump in the middle. # When you feel the rice is cooked, take it off the heat and add the chopped parsley, the remaining butter and about 2 Tbsp of the Parmesan cheese and mix it all in together. Adjust the seasoning as well. The Italians call this ''The Mantecatura period'' ! # Now let it stand for about 2 minutes and serve.
''Personally (and many will disagree) I feel this is a dish that stands best on its own, and should not be served with anything other than a green salad or maybe a cold Green Bean Salad.''
==Notes, tips and variations== * A good indication is a large CUPFUL of rice per person - although that makes TWO cupfuls of cooked rice, which is a lot of rice to eat ''without'' adding mushrooms, onion, cheese and a nibble of salad! * Dried porcini mushrooms are almost better than fresh, as they flavour the water they are being reconstituted in with a wonderful mushroom flavour which adds to the taste ! * People have differing views on adding garlic. Mushrooms and garlic ARE a nice combination, but the garlic should never overpower the taste of the mushrooms.
''Buon Appetito Wikipedies !!''
[[Category:Italian recipes]] [[Category:Rice recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom recipes]]

{{recipe}} [[Image:Pesto being processed.jpg|right|thumb|300px|Pesto in a [[Cookbook:Food Processor|food processor]]]]
'''Pesto''' is a sauce which is added mainly, but by no means exclusively to [[Cookbook:Pasta|pasta]]. Pesto is purely the [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italian]] version of this delicious sauce, with other names for the same (or similar) sauce from other countries. Another famous national variant to pesto is ''pistou'', which is the [[Cookbook:Cuisine of France|French]] equivalent.
{{see also|Cookbook:Pesto}}
== Ingredients ==
* the best quality [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] you can find. I believe that Greek olive oil is actually better for this recipe than either French or Italian as it has a stronger taste. * a packet of either [[Cookbook:Pine Nut|pine nuts]] or [[Cookbook:Walnut|walnuts]] (pine nuts give the pesto a blander flavour, walnuts a more robust flavour) * at least 2 large plants of fresh [[Cookbook:Basil|basil]] * 7 [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] cloves * freshly grated [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|Parmesan cheese]] (not Pecorino please)
== Procedure ==
# Whatever you may have been told, use a electric [[Cookbook:Blender|blender]] or a liquidiser to make pesto. Faffing about with a [[Cookbook:Mortar and Pestle|pestle and mortar]] is for the birds !! # Again, whatever you have been told, put a good quantity of olive oil in the blender ''first'' and start it running, otherwise the blades will gum up and you risk burning the basil. # Drop basil leaves through the top into the olive oil so that they are mulched up by the blades. # Add some pine nuts (or walnuts) so they are also mulched up. # When the developing Pesto sticks and becomes too thick, simply add more olive oil until the whole lot starts to mulch again. Continue adding basil leaves, pine nuts (walnuts) and the garlic cloves, always making sure the mixture remains fluid. # Once you begin to run out of basil leaves and nuts add a handful of Parmesan cheese (though not too much; remember the taste should be predominantly of basil).
The end result should be a wondrous smelling, glutinous mass of green which should be then emptied out of the blender into its own container.
==Notes, tips and variations== * If you like your pesto a little rough, add a small extra quantity of pine nuts and some grated Parmesan cheese to the finished pesto and mix in well. You're ready to go. * Fresh pesto can be stirred into pasta (penne in my opinion being the best), added as a topping to crostini, or eaten, with eyes closed and a smile on your face, off a spoon, entirely on its own. *
''Buon appetito, Wikipedies''
[[Category:Italian recipes]] [[Category:Sauce recipes]] [[Category:Nut recipes]] [[Category:Basil recipes]] [[Category:Garlic recipes]]

{{recipe}} {{recipesummary|Beef recipes|20|20 minutes|2}}
{{Nutrition Summary| |ServingSize=1 cup |Servings=4 |Cals=428 |FatCals=56 (13%) |TotalFat=24 g |SatFat=5 g |Cholesterol=65 mg |Sodium=1000 mg |Carbs=60 g |Fiber=6 g |Sugars=? g |Protein=31 g |VitaminA=?% |VitaminC=?% |Calcium=?% |Iron=?% }}
==Ingredients==
* 8 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] wide [[Cookbook:Pasta|egg noodles]] (figures are for yolk-free noodles) * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 1 8-ounce package sliced [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushrooms]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], peeled and coarsely [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] (about a cup) * 1 17-ounce package prepared [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] tips with gravy * ¼ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Milk|skim milk]] * 1 10.75-ounce can condensed cream of mushroom soup (figures are for fat-free) * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste * 1 teaspoon bottled minced [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] * ¼ teaspoon (or more to taste) mild or hot [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] (figures are for reduced-fat) * ¼ cup finely chopped [[Cookbook:Parsley|fresh parsley]]
==Procedure==
# Prepare noodles according to package directions and drain. # As the noodles are boiling, warm oil in very deep [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]] or [[Cookbook:Dutch Oven|Dutch oven]] over medium heat. # Add mushrooms and onions and cook until onion is soft, about 3 minutes. # Add beef tips, milk, and mushroom soup. # Add salt and pepper to taste and stir well. # Reduce heat to [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] and stir in garlic, paprika, and sour cream. # Simmer lightly, without letting it [[Cookbook:Boil|boil]] (that will curdle it). # When noodles are finished and drained, serve with noodles on serving plate or individual plates, with sauce over it. # [[Cookbook:Garnish|Garnish]] with parsley.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Prepared beef tips with gravy is typically found in the market's refrigerated meat case.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Southern recipes]] [[Category:Beef recipes]] [[Category:Garlic recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]] [[Category:Paprika recipes]] [[Category:Pasta recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Beans|Beans]] {{recipesummary|Bean recipes|8|Soak: overnight
Cook:2½ hours|1}} ==Ingredients== * 2 [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] Navy, Great Northern, or Pea [[Cookbook:Beans|beans]], though black, kidney, or lima beans may be used for a different taste. * 1 pound [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]], [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] * 2 large [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] * 1½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * ¾ cup [[Cookbook:Molasses|molasses]] ==Procedure== # [[Cookbook:Soak|Soak]] dry beans overnight, or use 4 cans cooked beans. # Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|350°F]] (175°C). # Stir all ingredients together, then pour into casserole dish, [[Cookbook:Bean pot|bean pot]] or [[Cookbook:Dutch Oven|Dutch oven]]. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] 2½ hours. ==Tips, Notes, and Variations== * A [[Cookbook:Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] may be used: cook 2½ hours on High, or 5 hours on Low. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Camping recipes]] [[Category:Slow cooker recipes]] [[Category:Bean recipes]] [[Category:Bacon recipes]] [[Category:Molasses recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Soups|Soups]] {{recipesummary|Soup recipes|12|Soak: Overnight
Cook: 2 hours|2}} {{Nutrition Summary| |ServingSize=2 cups |Servings=about 12 |Cals=390 |FatCals=47 (12%) |TotalFat=6 g |SatFat=3 g |Cholesterol=8 mg |Sodium=214 mg |Carbs=65 g |Fiber=16 g |Sugars=4 g |Protein=22 g |VitaminA=?% |VitaminC=?% |Calcium=% |Iron=?% }} ==Ingredients== * 6 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] dried [[Cookbook:Black Bean|black beans]] * 5 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaves]] * 1 red [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|bell pepper]], [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] * 1 green bell pepper, diced * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] * 7 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], minced * 1 or 2 [[Cookbook:Jalapeño|jalapeños]], finely [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] (to taste) * 1½ large [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]], diced * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste * ½ cup chopped [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Sour Cream|sour cream]] for [[Cookbook:Garnish|garnish]] ==Procedure== # Pick over the beans. # Place in large [[Cookbook:Bean pot|bean pot]] and add [[Cookbook:Water|water]] to cover by at least 2 [[Cookbook:Inch|inches]]. # [[Cookbook:Soak|Soak]] overnight, then change water. # [[Cookbook:Boiling|boil]]. # Reduce heat, then [[Cookbook:Simmering|simmer]] until beans start to soften, around ½ hour. # Add bay leaves, bell peppers (both), chili powder, cumin, garlic, jalapeños, onions, and red wine vinegar. # Add salt and pepper to taste. # Simmer ½ to 1 hour, until beans are soft. # Take out bay leaves. # Stir in cilantro. # Add some sour cream. # Serve. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Southern recipes]] [[Category:Camping recipes]] [[Category:Soup recipes]] [[Category:Slow cooker recipes]] [[Category:Bean recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Meat recipes|8|2 hours|2}}
{{Nutrition Summary| |ServingSize=1 slice |Servings=about 8 |Cals=215 |FatCals=85 (40%) |TotalFat=9 g |SatFat=4 g |Cholesterol=109 mg |Sodium=563 mg |Carbs=10 g |Fiber=1 g |Sugars=0 g |Protein=23 g |VitaminA=?% |VitaminC=?% |Calcium=?% |Iron=?% }}
==Ingredients==
* 2 slices [[Cookbook:Whole Wheat|whole-wheat]] [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]], [[Cookbook:Toast|toasted]] and [[Cookbook:Cube|cubed]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Beat|beaten]] [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Chopping|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * ½ cup grated [[Cookbook:Parmesan Cheese|Parmesan cheese]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] fresh [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]], finely chopped * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Dijon Mustard|Dijon mustard]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Worcestershire Sauce|Worcestershire Sauce]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 1½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] [[Cookbook:Ground Beef|ground beef]] * [[Cookbook:Cooking Spray|cooking spray]] * ½ cup (or more) [[Cookbook:Ketchup|ketchup]]
==Procedure==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|325°F]]. # To beaten eggs, add milk, mustard, onion, Parmesan cheese, parsley, pepper, and salt, then bread cubes. # Crumble beef into mixture. # Fold meat and sauce mixture together. # Thickly spray 9 X 13 [[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] [[Cookbook:Pots and Pans|glass baking pan]] or [[Cookbook:Dutch Oven|Dutch oven]] with cooking spray. # Form meat into loaf in pan no more than 3 inches high. # Cover with ketchup, even if it takes more than ½ cup. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] 75 minutes or more, if desired.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* If Dutch oven is used, it should not be as hot as for breads. * Great in leftovers for sandwiches.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Midwestern recipes]] [[Category:Southern recipes]] [[Category:Casserole recipes]] [[Category:Beef recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]] [[Category:Egg recipes]] [[Category:Meat recipes]] [[Category:Milk recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Cheese recipes|12|20 minutes|1}}
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] sharp [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar cheese]], grated * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Cider vinegar|apple cider vinegar]] * 3 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] [[Cookbook:Pimento|pimentos]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * [[Cookbook:Salt|Salt]] and [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste * ¼-2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] finely diced [[Cookbook:Jalapeño|jalapeños]], to taste
==Procedure==
# Mix ingredients thoroughly. # Store in well sealed container in refrigerator.
===Tips, Notes, and Variations===
* Jalapeños are definitely optional.
==Alternate recipe:==
===Ingredients===
* 1 7-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] jar roasted red peppers or pimentos * 1 pound sharp or extra sharp cheddar cheese, coarsely grated * 2 teaspoons freshly squeezed [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] * ⅝ cup mayonnaise
===Procedure===
# Drain and chop red peppers (or pimentos). # Toss peppers with grated cheese. # In a separate bowl, [[Cookbook:Whisk|whisk]] lemon juice and mayonnaise together. # Pour liquid mix over cheese mixture and mix until well blended.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Southern recipes]] [[Category:Breakfast recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Pizza|Pizza]] {{recipesummary|Sandwich recipes|4|40 minutes
(including preheating oven)|1}} ==Ingredients== * 8-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] package [[Cookbook:Pastry|croissant]] rolls * 24 slices of [[Cookbook:Pepperoni|pepperoni]] * 4 slices of [[Cookbook:Provolone Cheese|provolone cheese]] * Pizza spices as desired: [[Cookbook:Anise|anise]], [[Cookbook:Basil|basil]], [[Cookbook:Fennel|fennel]], [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]], etc. ==Procedure== # Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|350°F]]. # Unroll two croissant rolls and place together on ungreased [[Cookbook:Cookie Sheet|cookie sheet]], pointing in opposite directions, forming a rectangle by pinching sides together. # Lay six slices of pepperoni on top of each dough rectangle. # Lay a slice of provolone cheese on top of pepperoni slices. # Roll each into a tube. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] 12 or 15 minutes. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Sandwich recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]] [[Category:Sausage recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American recipes]] {{recipesummary|Corn recipes|7 ears|20 minutes|2}}
==Ingredients==
* ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]], softened * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] minced [[Cookbook:Parsley|fresh parsley]] * 2 tablespoons minced [[Cookbook:Chive|fresh chives]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Thyme|dried thyme]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]] * 7 ears [[Cookbook:Corn|sweet corn]], husks and silks carefully removed
==Procedure==
# Combine all ingredients except corn in small bowl, mix well. # Measure about 1 tablespoon and spread over each ear of corn. # Wrap each ear of corn in heavy [[Cookbook:Aluminium foil|foil]]. # Grill over medium heat 10 or 15 minutes, or until tender.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Camping recipes]] [[Category:Corn recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Sandwich recipes|6|20 minutes|2}}
==Ingredients==
* 1½ [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] [[Cookbook:Ground Beef|ground beef]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Chopping|finely chopped]] [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * 6 strips of [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]], cooked well done and crumbled * 4 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] (1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]]) shredded [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar cheese]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] * ⅓ cup canned sliced [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushrooms]] * 6 split [[Cookbook:Bread|hamburger buns]]
==Procedure==
# Mix beef, garlic salt, onion, and pepper thoroughly in a bowl. # Shape [[Cookbook:Hamburger|hamburger]] mixture into 6 patties, about ¾-[[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] thick. # Mix bacon, cheese, mayonnaise, and mushrooms together and store in the refrigerator or cooler. # Cook burgers on the grill, covered, for 5 or 7 minutes on each side. # During the last 3 minutes, put ¼ cup cheese mixture on top of each burger.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Serve on buns, if desired. * And of course, [[Cookbook:Garnish|garnish]] with [[Cookbook:Lettuce|lettuce]] and [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato slices]]. * Have available the usual: [[Cookbook:Ketchup|ketchup]], [[Cookbook:Mustard|mustard]], and [[Cookbook:Pickle|pickle relish]].
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Camping recipes]] [[Category:Sandwich recipes]] [[Category:Bacon recipes]] [[Category:Beef recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]] [[Category:Garlic recipes]] [[Category:Mushroom recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United Kingdom|Cuisine of the UK]] {{recipesummary|Pastry recipes|4|1 hour|3}}
''Just like what Rick Steves ate on his 'Travels in Europe' show, when he visited Cornwall.''
==Ingredients==
* 2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Cube|cubed]] cooking roast [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]], in ¼-[[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] pieces * 1½ cup cubed cooked [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]] * 1 cup beef [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] cooked [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrots]] * ½ cup diced cooked [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Parsley|parsley]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Thyme|thyme]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ⅛ to ¼ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] * [[Cookbook:Pastry|Pastry]] for double crust [[Cookbook:Pie|pie]] (9-inch) * [[Cookbook:Cream|Half and half cream]]
==Procedure==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|450°F]]. # Combine first 9 ingredients and set aside. # On a lightly [[Cookbook:Flour|floured]] surface, roll out ¼ of the pastry into an 8-inch circle. # Mound 1 cup of filling on half of circle. # Moisten edge of pastry with [[Cookbook:Water|water]]. # Fold dough over filling. # Crimp edges with fork to seal. # Place on ungreased [[Cookbook:Cookie Sheet|baking sheet]]. # Repeat with remaining pastry and filling. # Cut slits in top of each completed pastry. # Brush tops with cream. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Cornish recipes]] [[Category:Casserole recipes]] [[Category:Pastry recipes]] [[Category:Beef recipes]] [[Category:Carrot recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]] [[Category:Potato recipes]] [[Category:Thyme recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Italy|Italian cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Pastry recipes|4 or 5|45 minutes|2|Image=[[Image:20000227--calzone.jpg|300px]]}}
(Pronounced "cal-ZOH-knee"))
''I first had calzone in Spilimbergo, Italy on a military deployment. It was the freshest and most amazing pizza I'd ever eaten. When I got back to the States, I found it in a mall pizza restaurant...and it was like a ROCK! Turned out it was batch made, and sat for several hours until I ordered it, and was just sitting there drying out until they baked it for me.''
==Ingredients==
* 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (240 mL) [[Cookbook:Ricotta Cheese|ricotta cheese]] * 4 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]] (115 g) shredded [[Cookbook:Mozzarella Cheese|mozzarella cheese]] * 4 ounces (115 g) cooked [[Cookbook:Ham|ham]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] (10 mL) [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]] * 4 or 5 canned [[Cookbook:Biscuit|biscuits]]
==Procedure==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|400°F]] (200°C). # Combine first 4 ingredients. # Roll each biscuit between 2 pieces of waxed paper into 6 [[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] (15 cm) circles. # Spoon ¼ to 1/5 of cheese mixture onto center of each circle. # Moisten edges of dough slightly. # Fold each dough circle over. # Seal edges by pressing with a fork. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] until golden brown, about 10 or 12 minutes. # Serve with spaghetti ([[Cookbook:Marinara Sauce|marinara]]) sauce.
{{Wikipedia|Calzone}}
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Italian recipes]] [[Category:Cheese recipes]] [[Category:Ham recipes]] [[Category:Pastry recipes]]

{{cookwork|Needs quantities}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Japan|Cuisine of Japan]] [[Image:Tonkatsu by yoppy in Shibuya, Tokyo.jpg|thumb|right|300px]]
== Ingredients ==
*[[Cookbook:Pork|pork]] *[[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] (beaten) *[[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] *[[Cookbook:Panko|panko]] (Japanese [[Cookbook:Bread Crumb|bread crumbs]]) *[[Cookbook:Oil|oil]] for frying
;Sauce: Equal parts *[[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] *[[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *[[Cookbook:Worcestershire Sauce|Worcestershire sauce]] *[[Cookbook:Ketchup|ketchup]]
== Procedure ==
# Pound pork with meat mallet until thin, perhaps ¼ inch. To reduce splatter you should put the meat in a open Zip-loc bag. # Put eggs, flour, and bread crumbs in separate shallow bowls. # Place pork in the flour, then egg, then crumbs (in that order) so that it is completely coated with each. # Heat oil in a frying pan (about a half-inch deep), drop in crumbs to test when ready. # Fry pork until deep golden or golden brown, most likely a for a few minutes on either side. # With a sharp knife cut pork into strips.
Serve with Japanese short grain [[Cookbook:Rice|rice]].
;Sauce: # Combine the soy sauce, sugar, Worcestershire, and ketchup. Beat with fork until consistent. # If desired, chill sauce for a half hour to thicken. # Serve as a dipping sauce or dribbled over the meal.
==Notes, tips and variations== {{Wikipedia|Tonkatsu}} * Pork can be substituted with [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] or [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]].
==See also== * [[Cookbook:Wiener schnitzel|Wiener schnitzel]]
[[Category:Japanese recipes]] [[Category:Pork recipes]] [[Category:Fried recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Greece|Cuisine of Greece]] [[Image:Tzatziki01.jpg|thumb|right|300px]]
== Ingredients ==
* 1½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Yogurt|yogurt]] * 4 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], [[Cookbook:Mincing|minced]] * 1 [[Cookbook:tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Dill|dill]] (sub. ¼ tablespoon of [[Cookbook:Tarragon|tarragon]] if no dill available) * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] * 4 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] * 2 small [[Cookbook:Cucumber|cucumbers]], diced * kosher [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]], to dry cucumber * [[Cookbook:Pepper|white pepper]], to taste * salt, to taste
==Procedure==
# Drain yogurt in a sieve or a cheesecloth for about 3 hours prior to using it, along with draining the Cucumber and salting it to further remove moisture. # Combine yogurt, garlic, olive oil, and lemon juice in a bowl and cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or more. # After refrigerating, add dill and cucumber into bowl and mix with a whip until smooth. # Add pepper and salt to taste.
Great over gyros, pitas, salads, lamb, as a dip, or for anything you'd like a cool, but tasty sauce on.
[[Category:Greek recipes]] [[Category:Sauce recipes]] [[Category:Yogurt recipes]] [[Category:Garlic recipes]] [[Category:Cucumber recipes]] [[Category:Dill recipes]]

{{recipe}}
== Ingredients == * 1½ [[Cookbook:Cup|c]]. finely crushed [[Cookbook:Chocolate|chocolate]] * [[Cookbook:Wafer|wafers]] * 1/3 c. melted [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 3 (8 oz.) packages softened [[Cookbook:Cream|cream]] * [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]] * 1½ c. [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 4 oz. semi-sweet chocolate, melted and cooled * 2 tbs. [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1 tsp. [[Cookbook:Vanilla|vanilla essense]] * 4 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * ¼ c. [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * ¼ c. vanilla-flavored pieces, melted
== Procedure ==
;Crust: # Stir together crushed wafers and butter. # Press mixture evenly over the bottom and 1¾ inch up sides of 9 inch springform pan.
;Filling: # In large bowl beat cream cheese, sugar, chocolate, flour and vanilla until well mixed. # Add eggs all at once. Beat with electric mixer on low speed until just mixed. Do not overbeat. # Stir in milk.
;Baking: # Pour filling into crust. # Bake in 350°F (175°C) oven about 50 minutes or until center appears nearly set when gently shaken. # Cool on wire rack 5-10 minutes. # Loosen sides of cheesecake from pan. Cool 30 minutes. # Remove sides of pan. Cover and chill for 4-24 hours. # Pipe melted vanilla flavored pieces decoratively atop cheesecake.
[[Category:Cheesecake recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] {{recipesummary|Cheesecake recipes|8|1 hour|2}}
'''Lime and Mascarpone Cheesecake''' - A very creamy and delightfully simple dessert. Can be prepared ahead of time and stored in the fridge. No cooking required.
==Ingredients== *500 g [[Cookbook:Mascarpone Cheese|mascarpone cheese]] (or plain cream cheese) *4 [[Cookbook:Lime|limes]] (preferably unwaxed) *200 g ginger nut biscuits, crushed or ground in a food processor *50 g [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] *a little icing sugar
Serves ~8.
==Procedure== #Melt the butter in a saucepan and add the biscuit crumbs. Press firmly into a 20cm diameter loose-bottomed dish and put aside. #Put the mascarpone in a bowl and beat until firm. #Add the juice of three limes and the grated or [[Cookbook:Zest|zested]] rind of all four into the cheese. #Stir, adding a little icing sugar if the mixture seems too sloppy. #Spread the cheese mixture over the biscuit base and chill for an hour or so before serving.
==Notes, tips, and variations== *Feel free to serve with grated chocolate.
[[Category:Cheesecake recipes]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units]]

{{cookwork|Needs procedure; alternatively, merge this recipe into an existing cheesecake recipe, and make this page a description about cheesecakes in general}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]]
{{see also|:Category:Cheesecake recipes}}
==Ingredients==
* 2 375g condensed milk * 2 270g cream cheese softened * 125ml lemon juice * 200g tennis biscuits crushed * 75g butter method mix butter with crushed biscuit and press into a pie dish. beat lemon juice and condensed milk together. pour into beaten cream cheese and mix thoroughly. pour into pie dish.refridgerate for minimum of 24hrs
[[Category:Cheesecake recipes]]

{{recipe}}
'''Tortilla Soup''' is a traditional southwestern dish and an excellent way to finish tortillas that have begun to go stale. It works well as a soup before a meal or as the meal itself. Turkey or pork may be used in place of chicken. Alternative garnishes, such as avocado and green onions, also work well.
==Ingredients==
* 3 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Olive Oil|olive oil]] (optional) * 1 [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], chopped * 1 clove [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], minced * 1 15 ounce can of diced [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * 6 cups chicken stock, [[Cookbook:Broth|broth]], or bullion * 1 tablespoon chopped fresh [[Cookbook:Cilantro|cilantro]] or 1 teaspoon dried cilantro * 2-3 pieces of boneless, skinless [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]], raw or frozen * ½ tsp [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] (optional) * ½ teaspoon freshly ground [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Jalapeno|jalapeno]], seeded and diced, or ½ teaspoon dried [[Cookbook: Cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]] (optional, Tabasco sauce can be added to individual bowls to adjust heat to taste) * crunchy [[Cookbook:Tortilla|tortillas]] or [[Cookbook:Tortilla Chip|tortilla chips]] * grated [[Cookbook:Monterey Jack Cheese|Monterey Jack]] or other Mexican cheeses * sliced [[Cookbook:Olive|black olives]]
==Slow Cooker Procedure== # Place oil, chopped onion, minced garlic, tomatoes, cilantro, chicken, stock, salt, pepper, and jalapeno/red pepper in the crock pot and cook on low for 6-9 hours. # When chicken is cooked, remove from soup, finely chop, and return to soup. # Serve soup in individual bowls with chips, cheese and olives to garnish.
==Alternate Procedure== # Soup can be made without crock pot/slow cooker on stove. Simply sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil prior to adding other ingredients. Simmer on medium heat until chicken is cooked thoroughly and otherwise follow slow cooker directions.
[[Category:Soup recipes|Tortilla Soup]] [[Category:Chicken recipes|Tortilla Soup]] [[Category:Southwestern recipes|Tortilla Soup ]] [[Category:Slowcooker recipes|Tortilla Soup ]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Japan|Cuisine of Japan]] {{recipesummary |Category = Japanese recipes |Servings = 4 }}
'''Daigakuimo''' is a Japanese candied sweet potato.
==Ingredients== *1 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] (½[[Cookbook:Kg|kg]]) [[Cookbook:Sweet Potato|sweet potatoes]] *⅓ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *1 tsp [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] *2 tbsp [[Cookbook:Water|water]] *1 tsp [[Cookbook:Sesame Seed|sesame seeds]] *[[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] for [[Cookbook:Frying|frying]]
==Procedure== # Cut sweet potatoes into bite-sized pieces. # Heat the oil and fry the sweet potatoes at 350°F (175°C) until brown. # Mix water, sugar, and soy sauce in a pan. Put the pan on low heat. # When the liquid turns sticky, remove from the heat and add fried sweet potatoes. Quickly mix the potatoes with the sticky sugar. # Sprinkle sesame seeds over the coated sweet potatoes.
[[Category:Japanese recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]] [[Category:Gluten-free recipes]] [[Category:Sweet potato recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Spice Mix recipes|4|varies|1}}
==Ingredients==
* 2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]] * 2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]] * 2 teaspoons ground [[Cookbook:Celery|celery seed]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Garlic Powder|garlic powder]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]] * 2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Kosher|kosher]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Thyme|dried thyme]]
==Procedure==
# Mix together spices in a bowl. # Rub on chicken, inside and outside. # Let stand for a few minutes before cooking per your usual directions.
[[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Spice Mix recipes]]

revision.comment: Reverted edit of [[Special:Contributions/130.184.83.233|130.184.83.233]], changed back to last version by Webaware
revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Chicken recipes|4|1⅛-2 hours|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]]
==Ingredients==
* 1 recipe [[Cookbook:Spice Rub for Chicken|spice rub]] (or use your own recipe) * 2 [[Cookbook:Bay Leaf|bay leaves]], crumbled * 1 12-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] can of [[Cookbook:Beer|beer]] * 3-4 [[Cookbook:Pound|pound]] [[Cookbook:Chicken|chicken]] (dressed)
==Procedure==
# Poke holes all over chicken to let fat run out during cooking. # Rub chicken thoroughly with spice rub: inside and out, and then under skin as far as you can reach # Set aside chicken. # Remove upper racks from oven. # Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|350°F]]. # When oven preheated, take a healthy drink of the beer, leaving about 9 or 10 ounces. # Crumble bay leaves into beer, in beer can. # Insert beer can '''firmly''' into chicken cavity. # Place chicken upright in shallow heatproof pan. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] chicken upright until thickest part is 165°F, an hour or an hour and a half. # When removing chicken from oven, keep upright. # Rest chicken upright 15 minutes before removing beer can.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* A disposable drip pan will save you a lot of cleanup (and a lot of flares on the outdoor grill). * This is really best on a charcoal grill, on medium heat.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Southern recipes]] [[Category:Camping recipes]] [[Category:Chicken recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Japan|Cuisine of Japan]]
'''Niku jaga''' (肉じゃが ''nikujaga'') is a common Japanese household dish served at dinnertime.
== Ingredients ==
* 200g sliced [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] * 4 small [[Cookbook:Potato|potatoes]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Onion|white onion]] * 1½ cups [[Cookbook:Water|water]] * 2 tbsp [[Cookbook:Mirin|mirin]] * 3 tbsp [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] * 2 tbsp [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] * 1 slice of [[Cookbook:Ginger|ginger]]
== Procedure ==
# Cut potatoes into bite-sized pieces. Set aside in cold water. # Slice the onion. # Combine mirin, soy sauce, sugar, ginger, and beef in sauce pan. Boil for 2 to 3 minutes. # Remove beef from pan. Add potatoes, sliced onion, and water. Bring to a boil. # Reduce broth to about ⅓. # Replace beef in pan and return to boil. # Remove from heat and serve.
== Notes == * Pork can be substituted. Vary the amount of potatoes to taste.
[[Category:Japanese recipes]] [[Category:Beef recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Dessert]] {{recipesummary|Pie recipes|10|2½ hours|3}}
==Ingredients==
* 6 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Half and Half|half-and-half]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] loosely packed [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Corn Syrup|dark corn syrup]] * ½ cup good bourbon * 1⅓ cups [[Cookbook:Chocolate Chips|chocolate chips]] * 2½ cups [[Cookbook:Pecan|pecan pieces]] * [[Cookbook:Pastry Dough|pastry dough]] for 9-[[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] pie (commercial or your own)
==Procedure==
# Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|350°F]] (175°C). # [[Cookbook:Beat|Beat]] eggs until yellow and creamy, in a large bowl. # [[Cookbook:Whisk|Whisk]] in half-and-half, sugar, and syrup, until smooth. # Stir in bourbon, chocolate chips, and pecans. # [[Cookbook:Oil|Oil]] a [[Cookbook:Springform Pan|springform pan]] lightly. # Roll out the pastry dough and press it into a pan, pressing out any air bubbles. # Pour mixture into oiled springform pan. # Put pie on a [[Cookbook:Cookie Sheet|baking sheet]] with a raised edge or border. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] until only the center is sightly jiggly, about 2 hours. # Do '''NOT''' unmold pie until absolutely cooled, at least an hour.
==Tips, Notes, and Variations==
* Cool on a wire grid or rack for even cooling. * Serve slightly warmed, or at room temperature. * Very good with a dollop of [[Cookbook:Whipped cream|whipped cream]] or ice cream.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:Southern recipes]] [[Category:Pie recipes]] [[Category:Chocolate recipes]] [[Category:Egg recipes]] [[Category:Pecan recipes]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Casserole recipes|8|prep 10 minutes
bake 10 minutes|1}} ==Ingredients== * 1 10-12 [[Cookbook:Ounce|ounce]] (medium) [[Cookbook:Potato|potato]] * 6 strips [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]], cooked crisp, or [[Cookbook:Microwave Oven|microwave]] ready fully cooked bacon * 1 (28-ounce) can [[Cookbook:Green Bean|green beans]] * ½ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Onion|onion powder]] * ⅛ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] sliced [[Cookbook:Almond|almonds]] ==Procedure== # Peel and [[Cookbook:Dice|dice]] the potato. # Crumble crisp bacon into small pieces. # Drain green beans, keeping ½ cup of the liquid. # Put beans, bean juice, bacon, and potato in a microwave-safe baking dish. # Sprinkle onion powder and salt on top. # Cover with clear wrap. # Cook in microwave oven 5 minutes, stir, cook another 5 minutes. # Let stand 5 minutes. # [[Cookbook:Garnish|Garnish]] with sliced almonds. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Casserole recipes]] [[Category:Almond recipes]] [[Category:Bacon recipes]] [[Category:Bean recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]] [[Category:Potato recipes]]

page.title: Cookbook:Asparagus with Sesame Seeds and Soy Sauce

revision.text:
{{recipe}} {{recipesummary|Vegetable recipes|Four|Fifteen minutes|2}}
'''Asparagus with Sesame Seeds and Soy Sauce''' pairs very well with grilled beef, lamb or salmon. It can also be served chilled as part of a brunch menu. Asparagus is high in folic acid and fibre. Using organic ingredients enhances taste, health and the environment.
Serves 4.
==Ingredients== *20 to 32 [[Cookbook:Asparagus|asparagus]] spears, preferably thin *2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbsp]] (30 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]]) [[Cookbook:Soy Sauce|soy sauce]] *1 tbsp (15 ml) sesame seed oil *2 tbsp (30 ml) [[Cookbook:Sesame Seed|sesame seed]] (If available, use Gomasio instead, and omit the salt. (see tips below)) *Kosher [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
==Equipment== *Steaming pot, bamboo steamer or asparagus steamer
==Procedure== #Prepare steamer and bring water to a boil. #Trim asparagus spears in half, discarding (or composting) the thicker ends. #Steam the asparagus for 8-10 minutes, until tender, but still crisp. #Heat a small skillet or frying pan on medium heat. Add the sesame seeds and shake or stir. They are done when they just begin to darken and give off a pleasant toasted aroma. Be careful not to leave unattended as they can easily burn. #Remove asparagus from steamer, shake to drain water, and arrange on serving plate. #Drizzle the soy sauce and the sesame oil over the asparagus. #Sprinkle with the sesame seeds and give a very light sprinkle with the Kosher salt.
==Notes, tips, and variations== One way to gauge the best place to cut an asparagus spear is to gently grasp each end and bend the spear. The point at which is begins to break is where the stem begins to become tougher.
Gomasio is a Japanese seasoning made with sesame seeds and salt. I obtain mine at a local health food store. It can also be spelled Gomashio.
[[Category:Asparagus recipes]] [[Category:Vegetable recipes]] [[Category:Sesame recipes]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units]]

{{recipesummary|Beef recipes|Four|One hour|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat_Recipes|Meat recipes]]
'''Hamburger Deluxe''' turns a hamburger into a whole new experience. This recipe evolved over a couple of decades with ingredients being added or deleted as tastes changed. Using organic ingredients enhances taste, health and the environment.
Serves 4.
==Ingredients== ;For the Hamburgers: *¾ [[Cookbook:Pound|lb]]. (350 [[Cookbook:Gram|g]]) lean ground beef *¼ lb. (110 g) ground lamb *1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] *½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (125 ml) [[Cookbook:Oat|rolled oats]] *2 cloves [[Cookbook:Garlic|garlic]], [[Cookbook:Mincing|minced]] *1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] (15 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]]) [[Cookbook:Grape Seed Oil|grapeseed oil]] (or other lightly flavoured [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]]) *1 tablespoon (15 ml) [[Cookbook:Dijon Mustard|Dijon mustard]] *1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] (5 g) ground cumin *½ teaspoon (2 ml) [[Cookbook:Worcestershire Sauce|Worcestershire Sauce]] *1 tablespoon (15 ml) chipotle BBQ Sauce, or a healthy pinch of [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chipotle powder]] *½ teaspoon (2-3 g) Kosher [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
;For the topping: *[[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]], smoked [[Cookbook:Cheddar Cheese|cheddar]] is best, but any cheddar or your favourite cheese will do *[[Cookbook:Sour Cream|Sour cream]] *plain [[Cookbook:Cream Cheese|cream cheese]], sliced thinly *1 Vidalia [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]], coarsely chopped (Spanish onion will do) *¼ pound (110 g) button [[Cookbook:Mushroom|mushrooms]], sliced thin *1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * fresh ground [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]] to taste *favourite hamburger condiments *4 [[Cookbook:Bun|hamburger buns]]
==Equipment== *barbecue
==Procedure== #Sauté onions and mushrooms in butter until lightly brown, set aside. #Mix all of the Hamburger ingredients together until well mixed, and let rest for 15 minutes. #Heat BBQ to medium-high. #Divide hamburger mix into 4 equal balls. #Form patties by slapping the burgers back and forth from one palm to the other until they are about an inch thick (this technique is displayed in the film: Return of the Seacaucus Seven!) #Grill burgers to desired doneness, turning every few minutes and adding cheese after the last flipping of the burgers #Serve on the buns, with the onion/mushroom mixture, a dollop of sour cream, and a thin slice of cream cheese.
==Notes, tips, and variations== * The suggestion to flip the meat a number of times comes from a book concerning the science of cooking, which I cannot remember the title of at time of writing. The theory, however, is that the juices in meat rise to the surface of the meat and are then lost during grilling. By turning the meat regularly, you reduce the capacity of the juices to rise out of, and run off, the meat. * The egg and oats combine to bind the hamburgers and help prevent them from falling apart on the grill.
[[Category:Hamburger recipes]] [[Category:Beef recipes]] [[Category:Lamb recipes]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Fish|Fish]] {{recipesummary|Salmon recipes|Four|Forty-five minutes plus soaking plank|2}}
'''Maple-Syrup Planked Salmon''' mixes the hint of sweetness from the maple syrup with the rich smoky flavour imparted from the cedar plank. Using organic ingredients enhances taste, health and the environment.
Serves 4.
==Ingredients== *4 salmon steaks or individual fillets (preferably wild caught) *4 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbsp]] (60 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]]) fresh [[Cookbook:Lemon Juice|lemon juice]] (2 for the marinade and 2 for the sauce) *2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp]] (10 ml) pure [[Cookbook:Maple Syrup|maple syrup]] *2 tbsp (30 ml) [[Cookbook:Grape Seed Oil|grapeseed oil]] (or other clean tasting and light-flavoured [[Cookbook:Oil|oil]]) *1½ tsp (7 [[Cookbook:Gram|g]]) [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chipotle powder]] (chipotle barbecue sauce may be substituted for this) *1 tsp (5 g) crushed dried [[Cookbook:Rosemary|rosemary]] *2 [[Cookbook:Green onion|scallions]], thinly sliced for garnish *Kosher [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
==Equipment== *Cedar plank(s) large enough to hold salmon without crowding (these must be untreated cedar planks with no preservatives or chemicals) *Barbecue *Spray bottle for controlling flare-ups
==Procedure== #Completely immerse cedar planks in water for several hours or overnight. #Heat barbecue to medium-high. #Mix 2 tablespoons (30 ml) lemon juice, the oil, rosemary, maple syrup and half of the chipotle powder in a small bowl. Coat the Salmon with the mixture and let rest at room temperature for 20 minutes. #Mix the remaining lemon juice with the remaining chipotle powder with a fork and set aside as a garnish. #Place plank(s) on grill and close lid. Allow plank to heat for a couple minutes. #Lightly sprinkle Kosher salt on plank(s). #Put Salmon on plank, keeping fish at least an inch from the edge of the plank (in the case of fillets, place skin-side down). Reduce heat to low and close lid. #Grill for roughly 15 minutes until desired doneness reached without turning or moving Salmon. Generally, salmon should be cooked until the flesh loses its transparency and the meat can easily be broken with a fork. #Spray water to douse any flames that light on the sides of the plank. #When cooked, place the Salmon on a serving platter and sprinkle with the scallions. #Immerse the cedar plank in water as a safety precaution. #Serve the Salmon with the optional lemon juice/chipotle sauce.
==Notes, tips, and variations==
[[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Salmon recipes]] [[Category:Maple Syrup recipes]] [[Category:Smoked recipes]] [[Category:Recipes with metric units]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Casserole recipes|6|prep ½ hour
total 45 minutes|2}} ==The Chili== ===Ingredients=== * 4 strips [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]], cut in small pieces * 1½ [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * 1¼ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoons]] [[Cookbook:Chili Powder|chili powder]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Coffee|instant coffee]] * 2 teaspoons [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Dice|diced]] [[Cookbook:Jalapeño|jalapeños]] (canned) * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Oregano|oregano]] * 1½ teaspoons [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]] * 1 large [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] * 1¼ [[Cookbook:Pound|pounds]] [[Cookbook:Hamburger|hamburger]] * 1 pound [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] * [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]] * 1 can (15-[[Cookbook:Ounce|ounces]]) diced [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] ===Procedure=== # Preheat [[Cookbook:Oven|oven]] to [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|425°F]]. # Dice onion and cut beef into small pieces. # [[Cookbook:Fry|Fry]] bacon at medium-high heat in big [[Cookbook:Skillet|skillet]]. # Lower heat to medium and put in brown sugar, chili powder, coffee, cumin, jalapeños, oregano, and paprika. # Cook 3 minutes, stirring constantly. # Add onion and cook until soft, about 5 minutes, stirring frequently. # Add beef pieces and hamburger and cook until lightly done, maybe 8 or 10 minutes. # While beef is cooking, start on cornbread. # Add tomatoes to skillet and cook 1 minute, stirring deeply to keep anything from sticking to the bottom. ==The cornbread== ===Ingredients=== * 2 tablespoons (¼ stick) butter * ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Cornmeal|corn meal]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] * 1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Egg|egg]] * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] ===Procedure=== # Melt, then cool butter. # [[Cookbook:Whisk|Whisk]] butter, egg, and milk together. # Combine corn meal, flour, and salt, then add baking powder and baking soda. # Stir in liquid mixture (butter, egg, and milk). # Set aside and go back to chili recipe above. ==The Casserole== ===Ingredients=== * Chili mix * Cornbread mix ===Procedure=== # Spray a 9x12 [[Cookbook:Inch|inch]] [[Cookbook:Pots and Pans|baking pan]] with [[Cookbook:Cooking Spray|cooking spray]]. # Put entire chili recipe in baking pan and smooth surface. # Spoon cornbread mixture over chili mixture and smooth with a large spoon. # [[Cookbook:Baking|Bake]] about 20 minutes, or until cornbread pulls away from the sides of the pan. # Serve in bowls, making sure every large spoonful has both textures. ===Tips, Notes, and Variations=== * Beans in the chili would probably be too much starch. * Finish seasoning the chili before assembling with cornbread. [[Category:Inexpensive recipes]] [[Category:American recipes]] [[Category:Casserole recipes]] [[Category:Bacon recipes]] [[Category:Beef recipes]] [[Category:Bread recipes]] [[Category:Corn recipes]] [[Category:Onion recipes]] [[Category:Paprika recipes]] [[Category:Tomato recipes]]

{{cookwork|Identify unlinked ingredients}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of India|Cuisine of India]]
==Ingredients==
* 10 - flat [[Cookbook:Puri|puris]] (crisp) * 1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] fine sev * ½ cup chopped [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] (Pyaj) * ½ cup [[Cookbook:Curd|curd]] (Dahi - or plain [[Cookbook:Yogurt|yoghurt]]) * 3 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tblsp]] [[Cookbook:Tamarind|tamarind]] (Imli) [[Cookbook:Chutney|chutney]] * 3 tblsp [[Cookbook:Cilantro|coriander leaves]] (Dhania Patta) chutney * ½ cup boiled [[Cookbook:Potato|potato]] (Aloo) * 1 tblsp Chaat Masala * ½ tsp Red [[Cookbook:Chili Pepper|chili pepper]] (Lal Mirchi) * ½ tsp [[Cookbook:Cumin|cumin seed]] (Jeera)
==Procedure== # Arrange the puris on a plate make a hole in each puri in the centre. # Fill with a few chopped boiled potato cubes. # Add about ¼ tsp of tamarind and green chutneys in each. # Sprinkle cumin powder, salt, red chilli powder. # Sprinkle finely chopped onions. # Then generously sprinkle sev all over the puris. # Garnish with finely chopped coriander.
Serve fresh
[[Category:Indian recipes]]

revision.comment: cups helps prevent confusion between american and imperial pints
revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Turkey|Cuisine of Turkey]] {{recipesummary|Turkish recipes|8|ca. 3 weeks|4|| }} '''Tarhana Çorbası''' is a Turkish soup made from a [[Cookbook:Fermentation|fermented]] and dehydrated mix of flour, yogurt, onions, tomatoes and green peppers. The exact composition of ''tarhana'' differs from region to region in Turkey. ==Ingredients== ===for the Tarhana=== *3 [[Cookbook:Tomato|ripe tomatoes]] *3 [[Cookbook:Green Pepper|green peppers]] *3 [[Cookbook:Onion|onions]] *2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] / 500 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]] [[Cookbook:Yogurt|live yogurt]] *1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp.]] [[Cookbook:Yeast|dried active yeast]] *½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Water|tepid water]] (ca. [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|100ºF / 40ºC]]) *1 tsp. [[Cookbook:Sugar|sugar]] *⅛ tsp. [[Cookbook:Cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]] *1 tsp. [[Cookbook:Paprika|paprika]] *[[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *[[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] ===for the Soup=== *1 cup dry tarhana mix *7 - 8 cups [[Cookbook:Stock|meat stock]] *2 tablespoons [[Cookbook:Tomato paste|tomato paste]] ==Procedure== *Always follow all [[w:en:Food safety|FOOD SAFETY]] precautions when preparing food.
# Dissolve the sugar in the tepid water and sprinkle the dried yeast on top. Allow to soften 5 minutes or so and stir. # Blanche, peel and seed the tomatoes. Peel, dice and roughly chop the onions. Remove the stem, seeds and membrane from the green peppers and cut roughly. # In a blender or food processor, purée the tomatoes, onion, green pepper and yogurt in batches. # Combine all the ingredients except the flour and mix well. Gradually add enough flour to make a stiff dough. Knead for 5 to 10 minutes until smooth and elastic then place in a large non-reactive bowl and cover with waxed paper (don't use plastic wrap). Let stand at room temperature for 10 to 12 days. Punch down the dough once a day. If the dough becomes watery, knead in some more flour. Let stand until the dough no longer rises and has lost its stretch. Rub the dough between your hands onto a tray covered with parchment paper so that it forms small pieces. Cover the tray with cheesecloth or other protective mesh and leave to dry in a cool, well ventilated place. As it dries, break the dough into smaller pieces eventually crumbling it as small as you can. When it is completely dry (a week or more) pulverize in a blender, a little at a time. Store in freezer bags or large jars. Store in a cool place or refrigerate. May be kept up to twelve months. # To make tarhana soup, mix 1 cup of the dried dough mix with 3 cups of water or meat stock. Mix with a wooden spoon until softened. Add more water or stock to make a thickish soup with a creamy consistency. Add 2 tablespoons of tomato paste and cook for 15 to 20 minutes. Pour into bowls and garnish with croutons, parsley, or paprika-infused butter or olive oil, if desired. Serve with Turkish bread or a crisp baguette. ==Notes, tips and variations== * Do not use pasteurized yogurt. The live yogurt culture helps prevent contamination by harmful organisms. * The yogurt and yeast may be replaced with 1 pint of [[Cookbook:Kefir|kefir]], which supplies both the bacteria and yeasts for the fermentation. Some traditional recipes for tarhana refer to kefir as "soured milk". * All utensils, and containers should be sterilized with boiling water before use. Wash your hands each time before handling the dough directly. [[Category:Turkish recipes]] [[Category:Fermented food recipes]]

{{recipe}} {{recipesummary|Tomato recipes|4 ½-pint jars|ca. 16 hours|3|| }} '''Tomato Paste''' is a basic ingredient used in innumerable dishes in the cuisines of many countries. It is prepared by reducing tomato purée on low heat for several hours. While commercially produced tomato paste is the usual source, it can be prepared at home by the following method. ==Ingredients== *1 gallon / 1.5 litres [[Cookbook:Tomato Concassé|tomato pulp]] *1 cup sweet red [[Cookbook:Bell Pepper|peppers]], chopped *1½ teaspoons [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] ==Procedure==
*Always follow all [[w:en:Food safety|FOOD SAFETY]] precautions when preparing food.
# Cook the ingredients over low heat in a large wide covered stockpot for an hour. # Pass the mixture through a food mill several times starting with the coarsest grid and progressing to the finest''This will actually be faster than trying to force it through a fine sieve in a single pass.'' # Return the pot to the stove and heat uncovered over very low heat for 3 hours or more until very thick, stirring frequently to avoid burning. # Pour into new sterilized ½-pint preserving jars''Always check well for chips or cracks and discard if found.'' leaving ¼-inch of space at the top. Cover with new seals and screw on the lids securely but not too tightly. Process in a boiling water bath for 45 minutes. Remove from the water bath with tongs and allow to cool on an inverted oven rack for 12 hours. Test the seal by pressing the centre of each lid with your forefinger. If the inner lid does not move, remove the outer ring. Store in a cool, dry, dark place. ==Notes== [[Category:Ingredients]] [[Category:Tomato recipes]] [[Category:Sauce recipes]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Meat_Recipes|Meat recipes]] {{recipesummary|Italian recipes|Four|Two hours|3|Image=[[Image:Spaghetti Bolognese.jpg|300px]]}}
This northern Italian meat sauce, or Ragu Bolognese is wonderful on [[Cookbook:Pasta|pasta]] with freshly grated [[Cookbook:Cheese|Parmesan cheese]], or as filling for lasagne. Using organic ingredients enhances taste, health and the environment.
==Ingredients== *¼ [[Cookbook:Pound|lb]] (125 [[Cookbook:Gram|g]]) [[Cookbook:Ham|ham]], cut into cubes *1 lb. (450 g) [[Cookbook:Beef|beef]] lean or medium ground *1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] (15 [[Cookbook:ML|ml]]) [[Cookbook:Olive oil|olive oil]] *1 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (225 ml) coarsely chopped [[Cookbook:Onion|onion]] *¼ cup (50 ml) coarsely chopped [[Cookbook:Celery|celery]] *¼ cup (50 ml) coarsely chopped [[Cookbook:Carrot|carrot]] *¼ cup (50 ml) coarsely chopped [[Cookbook:Fennel|fennel]] bulb, if available *¼ cup (50 ml) [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] *1 cup (225 ml) canned plum [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomato]] *½ cup (125 ml) dry white [[Cookbook:Wine|wine]] *2 cups (500 ml) beef stock (preferably fresh, but canned beef stock will do) *¼ cup (50 ml) [[Cookbook:Tomato paste|tomato paste]] *1 lb. (450 g) spaghetti pasta, preferably made from durum wheat *1 cup Parmesan cheese for garnish, preferably freshly grated Reggiano Parmesan *[[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] and fresh ground [[Cookbook:Pepper|pepper]] to taste
==Procedure== #Mix the coarsely chopped onion, carrot, celery and fennel (optional) together and finely chop them (this is called a battuto in Italian, or a finely chopped mixture of vegetables and herbs to flavour a dish) #Melt the butter in a heavy saucepan or skillet over medium-high heat and add the battuto #Cook, stirring occasionally until very lightly browned #Add this mixture to a heavy pot #Heat the olive oil in the skillet the battuto was browned in and when the oil is hot, add the beef and stir to break up lumps, cooking until well browned #Add to the battuto in the pot #Add the wine to the skillet the beef was in and stir on high heat, scraping any brown bits stuck to the pan #Add the tomato paste and stock and stir until well mixed and add this mixture to the pot #Drain and coarsely chop the plum tomatoes and add them to the pot #Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer, with bubbles barely breaking the surface #Simmer, stirring occasionally for an hour (or more), until thick #Add pepper to taste, and salt if necessary to taste #When the sauce is ready, bring a gallon (4 litres) of water to a full boil over high heat in a large pot #Add the pasta, give it a brisk stir to ensure it is all covered by water and not clumped together. Cook for about 10-12 minutes, or until [[Cookbook:al dente|al dente]] (firm but not hard, there should still be a bit of 'bite' when chewing pasta, rather than soggy and mushy) #Drain the pasta well and serve immediately #Spoon the Bolognese sauce over the pasta and have guests garnish with the grated Parmesan cheese.
==Notes, tips, and variations== * This is a great recipe for making in large quantities and freezing. I have made up to 20 times the recipe and frozen in four-cup (1 litre) servings for our family so we can enjoy the pasta sauce over and over without having to start from scratch each time. If making bulk recipes, be sure to simmer for hours, or even a full day, occasionally stirring up from the bottom of the large pot to ensure the contents at the bottom does not burn, adding stock as needed to keep the right consistency. The goal is to have the flavours mix and make the home smell delicious! *Never rinse pasta with water. To ensure there is no excess starch from the pasta, choose a high quality durum wheat pasta and boil it in lots of water.
[[Category:Italian recipes]] [[Category:Beef recipes]] [[Category:Pasta sauces]] [[Category:Sauce recipes]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units]]

revision.comment: New page: {{recipesummary| |8|45 minutes|1}} {{recipe}} '''Bean and Green Chili Soup''' - An easy, surprising soup from easily stored ingredients ==Ingredients== *2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (480 [[Co...
revision.text:
{{recipesummary| |8|45 minutes|1}}
{{recipe}}
'''Bean and Green Chili Soup''' - An easy, surprising soup from easily stored ingredients
==Ingredients== *2 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (480 [[Cookbook:mL|mL]]) [[Cookbook:rice|cooked rice]] *1 can (16 oz, 450g) refried beans *1 can (16 oz, 450g) black beans *1 small can (4 oz, 110g) green salsa *1 1/3 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] (300 [[Cookbook:mL|mL]]) dried, bulk black bean soup mix *(optional) sour cream
==Procedure== # Bring 1 cup (240 ml) dry rice and 2 cups (480 ml) water to a boil # Turn heat to low and steam rice for 25-30 min (or prepare rice using rice cooker) # Prepare soup mix by combining with 3 cups (720 ml) boiling water, simmer about 5 min # Add remaining ingredients and rice to soup # Heat through, stirring occasionally # (optional) just before serving, spoon a teaspoon of sour cream in to the middle of the bowl
==Notes, tips, and variations== This recipe is surprisingly flavorful for being prepared form preserved ingredients. With a dollop of sour cream for garnish, it is even better.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

'''Börek''' is a general term in Turkish cuisine that applies to a family of pastries with about fifty different members. They have in common the fact that they are all pastry layers of some type enclosing a filling. There are two basic methods, one consists of rolling out very thin sheets of dough, called [[w:en:yufka|yufka]] in Turkish and [[w:en:phyllo|phyllo]] in Greek. The other main type of börek uses a dough very similar to ''[[Cookbook:Puff pastry|pâte feuilletée]]'' in which the dough is layered with butter, folded, and rolled out several times, called ''[[w:en:nemse börek|nemse börek]]'' in Turkish.Algar, Ayla Esen (1985) ''The Complete Book of Turkish Cooking'' ISBN 0-710-30334-3 The following recipe describes the procedure required to prepare triangular shaped börek from commercially produced phyllo. Links to recipes for fillings are listed at the end of the recipe. ==Ingredients== * 2 cups    prepared filling * 1 box      yufka/phyllo pastry sheetsAvailable from Turkish, Greek, Armenian and Middle-Eastern grocers, among others, as well as some supermarkets. * Melted butter or high quality vegetable oil.e.g. peanut, hazelnut, walnut, almond, grapeseed. Avoid anything with a greasy taste such as corn oil. ==Procedure==
*Always follow all [[w:en:Food safety|FOOD SAFETY]] precautions when preparing food.
[[Image:Wrapping börek.jpg|thumbnail|right|250px|Making börek triangles.]] #Remove the phyllo sheets from the container. Unfold carefully so as not to break them. Lay them flat and cover with a clean, damp tea towel to prevent them from drying out. This is important. # Working quickly, cut the phyllo into lengthwise thirds. (Step 1. in the diagram.) Lay one of these out and cover the other two with the damp tea towel. # Brush the strip of phyllo with the melted butter. Place a heaped teaspoonful of filling on one end of the strip. (Step 2. in the diagram.) #Fold the right lower corner upward over the filling to form a triangle. (Step 3. in the diagram.) #Now fold the right upper corner over to the left (Step 4. in the diagram.) #Continue folding in this manner until you reach the end of the strip. #Trim of any excess dough and seal the edges by rubbing a damp finger over the dough and pressing the edge of the triangle where the strip ends. #Fry in oil at [[Cookbook:Oven temperatures|340ºF]] until golden brown or bake at 350ºF for 15 minutes.Prewrapped, uncooked börek freezes well. To cook, bake at 325ºF for 30 minutes. Do not deep-fry frozen foods. Splattering oil can cause burns and fires. You may sautée them in a covered pan 2 or 3 at a time. Hold the cover in front of your face as you place each börek in the pan. ===Fillings=== *[[Cookbook:Peynirli Börek|Peynirli Börek]] - White cheese filling *[[Cookbook:Kıymalı Börek|Kıymalı Börek]] - Minced meat filling *[[Cookbook:Tavuklu Börek|Tavuklu Börek]] - Chicken filling *[[Cookbook:Ispanaklı Börek|Ispanaklı Börek]] - Spinach filling ==Notes== {{DEFAULTSORT:{{PAGENAME}}}} [[Category:Cuisines|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Turkish recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cookbook|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Middle Eastern recipes||{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cuisines|Cuisine of Turkey]] [[Category:Recipes_with_metric_units|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of Turkey|Cuisine of Turkey]] {{recipesummary|Turkish recipes|10|1 hour|2|| }}
'''Muhallebi''', (also Muhallabia, Mihallabiya) is a milk pudding thickened with [[Cookbook:Rice flour|rice flour]] and optionally perfumed with [[Cookbook:Rose water|rose water]] or [[Cookbook:Orange flower water|orange flower water]].
===Ingredients=== *3/4 cup rice flour<ref>If you don't have rice flour, cornstarch may be substituted.</ref> *1/4 cup cornstarch *1 cup water *7 cups milk *1/2 - 1 cup sugar (or to taste) *1/2 cup rose water or orange flower water (optional) *1/2 cup pistachios, chopped
===Procedure=== #Mix the milk and sugar in a large saucepan and heating slowly, so as not to burn the milk, bring to a simmer. #Make a [[Cookbook:Slurry|slurry]] by dissolving the rice flour and cornstarch in the water and, stirring constantly, slowly add this mixture to the simmering milk. #Simmer gently for 30 to 40 minutes, stirring frequently, until the mixture has thickened sufficiently to coat a spoon. Remove from the heat. #Stir in the rose water or orange flower water. #Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking pan and refrigerate until chilled and set. #Cut into pieces about 4 inches square. #Place the squares on individual dessert plates and garnish with the chopped pistachios.
===Notes=== <references/>
[[Category:Turkish recipes]] [[Category:Middle Eastern recipes]] [[Category:Dessert recipes]]

{{recipesummary|Bread recipes|8-10|5-7 minutes per batch|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Southern cuisine|Southern cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Vegetarian cuisine|Vegetarian Cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Bread Recipes|Bread recipes]]
=Hush puppies=
===Ingredients===
* [[Cookbook:Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] for [[Cookbook:Fry|frying]] * 1½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cups]] [[Cookbook:Cornmeal|yellow corn meal]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Flour|all-purpose flour]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Baking Powder|baking powder]] * ½ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Baking Soda|baking soda]] * 1¾ teapoons [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 3 [[Cookbook:Egg|eggs]] [[Cookbook:Beat|lightly beaten]] * ⅛ teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cayenne Pepper|cayenne pepper]] * ¼ cup [[Cookbook:Chop|chopped]] [[Cookbook:Green Onion|green onions]] * 1 cup [[Cookbook:Milk|milk]] * ¼ cup vegetable oil
===Directions===
# Pour oil 3 to 4 inches in pan and preheat to [[Cookbook:Oven_temperatures|370°F]]. # In bowl mix cornmeal, flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cayenne. # In same bowl or in other mix eggs, green onions, milk and ¼ cup vegetable oil. # If in separate bowl mix two bowls together. # Spoon 6 or 7 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoons]] of the batter into preheated oil. # Fry, stirring constantly for over all browning, til golden brown. # Remove from heat and drain on paper towel.
===Tips, Notes, and Variations===
* ⅓ cup minced green onions may be substitued for fresh onions.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Camping recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Bread recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Corn recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Egg recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Milk recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Onion recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{recipesummary|Beverage recipes|10|15 minutes|1}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Cuisine of the United States|American cuisine]] | [[Cookbook:Holiday Recipes|Holiday Recipes]] | [[Cookbook:Beverages|Beverages]]
=Percolator Punch=
===Ingredients===
====Top of Percolator====
* ½ [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] * 1 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tablespoon]] [[Cookbook:Clove|cloves]] * 1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Allspice|allspice]] * 3 sticks [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] * ¼ [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|teaspoon]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]]
====Bottom of percolator====
* 2¼ cups [[Cookbook:Pineapple|pineapple juice]] * 2 cups [[Cookbook:Cranberry|cranberry]] * 1¾ cups [[Cookbook:Water|water]]
===Directions===
# Percolate for 10 minutes. # Serve hot.
[[Category:Inexpensive recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:American recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Southern recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Beverage recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Cinnamon recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Vegetarian recipes|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{cookwork|Needs categorising, linking}} {{recipe}}
Yields approx. 48 quarter wedges
==Ingredients== * 2 c All-purpose flour * 2 tsp. salt * 2 tsp. baking powder * ¼ c shortening * 1½ c warm water
Deep Fryer with hot oil
==Procedure== # Combine ingredients and knead into a round ball. # Cover with a towel and let set for 10-20 min. # Break dough into 2-3 inch balls. Roll out each ball so that it is 8-12 inches in diameter. Cut into quarters. # Deep fry in hot oil until golden brown.
